hebrew_text: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין בִּרְאִיָּיה, חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, וְטוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס, וְנָשִׁים, וַעֲבָדִים שֶׁאֵינָם מְשׁוּחְרָרִים, הַחִיגֵּר וְהַסּוֹמֵא, וְהַחוֹלֶה וְהַזָּקֵן, וּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת בְּרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: All are obligated in the appearance, except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor; and a tumtum , and a hermaphrodite, and women, and slaves who are not emancipated; and the lame, and the blind, and the sick, and the old, and one who is unable to ascend on his legs.
llm_translation: All are obligated in seeing the new moon, except for a deaf-mute, imbecile, minor, one who is mentally incompetent, hermaphrodites, women, non-Jewish slaves, the blind, the deaf, the sick, the elderly, and one who cannot walk on his own feet.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ קָטָן — כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִרְכּוֹב עַל כְּתֵפָיו שֶׁל אָבִיו וְלַעֲלוֹת מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְהַר הַבַּיִת, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לֶאֱחוֹז בְּיָדוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו וְלַעֲלוֹת מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְהַר הַבַּיִת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שָׁלֹשׁ רְגָלִים״.
human_translation: Who a minor Any who is unable to ride on his father’s shoulders and ascend from Jerusalem to the Temple Mount; the statement of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel say: Any who is unable to hold his father’s hand and ascend from Jerusalem to the Temple Mount, as it is stated: “Three times [ regalim ]”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is considered a minor? — Anyone who is unable to ride on his father's shoulders and ascend from Jerusalem to the Temple Mount, the words of Beit Shammai. Beit Hillel say: Anyone who is unable to grasp his father's hand and ascend from Jerusalem to the Temple Mount, as it is stated: "Three times a year."

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הָרְאִיָּיה — שְׁתֵּי כֶסֶף, וְהַחֲגִיגָה — מָעָה כֶּסֶף. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: הָרְאִיָּיה מָעָה כֶּסֶף, וְהַחֲגִיגָה שְׁתֵּי כֶסֶף.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: The appearance two silver and the Festival peace silver ma’a And Beit Hillel say: The appearance silver ma’a and the Festival peace two silver
llm_translation: House of Shammai say: The "Re'iyah" - two silver coins, and the "Chagigah" - one silver coin. And House of Hillel say: The "Re'iyah" - one silver coin, and the "Chagigah" - two silver coins.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״הַכֹּל״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין. וּלְרָבִינָא דְּאָמַר מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין פָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּיה, ״הַכֹּל״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי חִיגֵּר בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן וְנִתְפַּשֵּׁט בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: to add what to add one who is half-slave half-freeman. And according to Ravina, who said: One who is half-slave half-freeman is exempt from the appearance All, to add what? to add lame on first day and was healed on second day
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: 'Hakol' le'etuyei mai? Le'etuyei mi shechatzoy eved ve'chatzoy ben chorin. U'l'Ravina de'amar mi shechatzoy eved ve'chatzoy ben chorin patur min ha'reiyah, 'hakol' le'etuyei mai? Le'etuyei chigger b'yom rishon ve'nitpashet b'yom sheni." English translation: Gemara: "What does 'everything' come to include? To include one who is half slave and half free. And according to Ravina who said one who is half slave and half free is exempt from the obligation of seeing the new moon, 'everything' comes to include what? To include one who was inspected on the first day and was found to be blemished on the second day."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כּוּלָּן תַּשְׁלוּמִין זֶה לָזֶה. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כּוּלָּן תַּשְׁלוּמִין דְּרִאשׁוֹן, ״הַכֹּל״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said all redress one another, However, according to the one who said all redress the first All, to add what? to add blind in one of his eyes.
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says all payments are for each other. Rather, for the one who says all the payments of the first, "all" - to include what? To include a blind person in one of his eyes.

hebrew_text: וּדְלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: יוֹחָנָן בֶּן דַּהֲבַאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו פָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּיה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִרְאֶה״, ״יֵרָאֶה״ — כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁבָּא לִרְאוֹת כָּךְ בָּא לֵירָאוֹת. מָה לִרְאוֹת בִּשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו, אַף לֵירָאוֹת בִּשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו.
human_translation: And not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Yoḥanan ben Dehavai says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: blind in one of his eyes is exempt from the appearance, as it is stated: will appear [ yera’e ] will see [ yireh ] in the manner that one comes to see, so he comes to be seen: Just as to see with both one’s eyes, so too to be seen with both his eyes.
llm_translation: And not like this Mishnah, as it was taught: Yochanan ben Dahavai says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: One who is blind in one of his eyes is exempt from seeing, as it is stated: "He shall see," "He shall be seen" - just as in the manner he came to see, so too he came to be seen. Just as to see with two eyes, so too to be seen with two eyes.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם כִּדְאָמְרִי מֵעִיקָּרָא, וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ הָא דְּרָבִינָא — לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן כְּמִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, כָּאן כְּמִשְׁנָה אַחֲרוֹנָה. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין — עוֹבֵד אֶת רַבּוֹ יוֹם אֶחָד וְאֶת עַצְמוֹ יוֹם אֶחָד, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, as we said initially, And which a difficulty to of Ravina, not difficult: Here the initial mishna, there, in accordance with the ultimate mishna. As we learned One who is half-slave half-freeman serves his master one day himself one day. the statement of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always as they say from the beginning, and this that Ravina finds difficult for you — it is not difficult: here it is like the first Mishnah, here it is like the last Mishnah. As we learned: One whose half is a slave and half is free — he works for his master one day and for himself one day, the words of Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי:
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to them:
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Shammai:

hebrew_text: תִּקַּנְתֶּם אֶת רַבּוֹ, וְאֶת עַצְמוֹ לֹא תִּקַּנְתֶּם. לִישָּׂא שִׁפְחָה אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל, בַּת חוֹרִין אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל.
human_translation: You have remedied his master, but his own you have not remedied. He is unable to marry a maidservant, He unable a free woman,
llm_translation: You have established his master, but you have not established himself. To marry a maidservant he is unable, to marry a free woman he is unable.

hebrew_text: לִיבְטֵּיל — וַהֲלֹא לֹא נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם אֶלָּא לִפְרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תֹהוּ בְרָאָהּ לָשֶׁבֶת יְצָרָהּ״. אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם, כּוֹפִין אֶת רַבּוֹ וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין, וְכוֹתֵב לוֹ שְׁטָר עַל חֲצִי דָּמָיו. וְחָזְרוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְהוֹרוֹת כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: he should be idle but isn’t it the world was created only for procreation, as it is stated: “He did not create it to be a waste; He formed it to be inhabited” Rather, for the betterment of the world we force his master to make him a freeman, and writes a bill to half his value And Beit Hillel retracted to rule in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Livteil - vahalo nivra ha'olam ela lifriyah urbiyah, shene'emar: 'Lo tohu vera'ah lashavet yetzarah.' Ela mepnei tikun ha'olam, kofin et rabo ve'oseh oto ben chorin, vekotev lo shtar al chatzi damav. Vechazru Beit Hillel lehorot kedivrei Beit Shammai." English translation: "To bear fruit - and was not the world created except for procreation, as it is said: 'He did not create it a waste, He formed it to be inhabited.' But due to the repair of the world, they compel his master and make him a free man, and write for him a document for half of his value. And the House of Hillel retraced to teach in accordance with the words of the House of Shammai."

hebrew_text: חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן כּוּ׳. קָתָנֵי חֵרֵשׁ דּוּמְיָא דְּשׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן: מָה שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן — דְּלָאו בְּנֵי דֵעָה, אַף חֵרֵשׁ — דְּלָאו בַּר דֵּעָה הוּא. וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כְּדִתְנַן: חֵרֵשׁ שֶׁדִּיבְּרוּ חֲכָמִים בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, שֶׁאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר. הָא מְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor. is teaching a deaf-mute is similar to an imbecile and a minor: Just as an imbecile and a minor who are not of sound mind, so too the deaf-mute [ ḥeresh ] who is not of sound mind. And teaches us as we learned The ḥeresh , whom the Sages discussed everywhere, who does not hear and does not speak, one who speaks but does not hear one who hears but does not speak are obligated
llm_translation: Outside of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor. The Mishnah teaches: A deaf-mute is similar to an imbecile and a minor. Just as an imbecile and a minor are not of intellectual capacity, so too a deaf-mute is not of intellectual capacity. And it is implied to us as we learned: A deaf-mute, concerning whom the Sages spoke in every place, who does not hear and does not speak. But if he speaks and does not hear, hears but does not speak - he is liable.

hebrew_text: תְּנֵינָא לְהָא, דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ — זֶהוּ חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר — זֶהוּ אִלֵּם, זֶה וָזֶה — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּפִקְחִין לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם.
human_translation: We learned this, as the Sages taught One who speaks but does not hear, this is a deaf hears but does not speak, this is a mute. this and that are as those who can see and hear to all matters.
llm_translation: We have learned in this matter, as the Rabbis taught: One who speaks but does not hear — this is a deaf person, one who hears but does not speak — this is a mute person, both this and that — they are considered as those who are capable of all their words.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דִּמְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ זֶהוּ חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר זֶהוּ אִלֵּם? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲנִי כְחֵרֵשׁ לֹא אֶשְׁמָע וּכְאִלֵּם לֹא יִפְתַּח פִּיו״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִישְׁתְּקִיל מִילּוּלֵיהּ.
human_translation: And from where that one who speaks but does not hear is a deaf hears but does not speak is a mute? As it is written: “But I am as a deaf man, I hear not; and I am as a dumb man [ illem ] who does not open his mouth” If you wish, say as people say: His speech has been taken [ Ishtakeil Milulei ];
llm_translation: And from where do we know that one who speaks but does not hear is considered a deaf person, and one who hears but does not speak is considered mute? For it is written: "But I am like a deaf man, I do not hear; like a mute man who does not open his mouth." And if you wish, say, as people say: "His words outweigh his actions."

hebrew_text: מְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר — חַיָּיב. וְהָתַנְיָא: מְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר — פָּטוּר!
human_translation: one who speaks but does not hear one who hears but does not speak obligated Isn’t it taught one who speaks but does not hear one who hears but does not speak exempt?
llm_translation: He who speaks but does not hear, hears but does not speak - is liable. And it was taught: He who speaks but does not hear, hears but does not speak - is exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רָבָא: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין בִּרְאִיָּיה וּבְשִׂמְחָה, חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ הַמְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר, שֶׁפָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּיה. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁפָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּיה, חַיָּיב בְּשִׂמְחָה. וְאֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹא שׁוֹמֵעַ וְלֹא מְדַבֵּר, וְשׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן — פָּטוּר אַף מִן הַשִּׂמְחָה, הוֹאִיל וּפְטוּרִים מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Ravina said, and some say Rava is incomplete and is teaching the following: All are obligated in appearance and rejoicing except for a deaf who speaks but does not hear who hears but does not speak, is exempt from appearance. And even though he is exempt from appearance, he is obligated in rejoicing. But one who does not hear and does not speak, and an imbecile and a minor, exempt even from rejoicing, since they are exempt from all the mitzvot mentioned in the Torah,
llm_translation: Ravina said, and it was stated by Rava: Those lacking mental capacity are exempt from the obligation of seeing and rejoicing, as it is taught: Everyone is obligated in seeing and rejoicing, except for a deaf-mute who speaks but does not hear, hears but does not speak, as he is exempt from the obligation of seeing. And even though he is exempt from the obligation of seeing, he is obligated in rejoicing. And one who neither hears nor speaks, and a fool and a minor - they are exempt even from rejoicing, since they are exempt from all the commandments stated in the Torah.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין בִּרְאִיָּיה וּבְשִׂמְחָה, חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ הַמְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ, שׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר, שֶׁפְּטוּרִין מִן הָרְאִיָּיה. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁפָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּיה —
human_translation: That is also taught All are obligated in appearance and in rejoicing, except for a deaf who speaks but does not hear one who hears but does not speak, as they are exempt from appearance. And even though they are exempt from appearance,
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: All are obligated in seeing and rejoicing, except for a deaf-mute who speaks but does not hear, hears but does not speak, they are exempt from the obligation of seeing. And even though they are exempt from the obligation of seeing —

hebrew_text: חַיָּיב בְּשִׂמְחָה. וְאֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹא שׁוֹמֵעַ וְלֹא מְדַבֵּר, וְשׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן — פְּטוּרִין אַף מִן הַשִּׂמְחָה, הוֹאִיל וּפְטוּרִין מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה. מַאי שְׁנָא לְעִנְיַן רְאִיָּה דִּפְטִירִי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְעִנְיַן שִׂמְחָה דִּמְחַיְּיבִי?
human_translation: obligated in rejoicing. And one who does not hear and does not speak, an imbecile, and a minor are exempt even from rejoicing, since they are exempt from all the mitzvot mentioned in the Torah. What is different with regard to appearance, that are exempt And what is different with regard to rejoicing, that they are obligated?
llm_translation: Obligated in joy. And one who neither hears nor speaks, and a fool and a minor - exempt even from joy, since they are exempt from all the commandments stated in the Torah. What is different regarding the matter of seeing that they are exempt, and what is different regarding the matter of joy that they are obligated?

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן רְאִיָּה גָּמַר ״רְאִיָּה״ ״רְאִיָּה״ מֵהַקְהֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַקְהֵל אֶת הָעָם הָאֲנָשִׁים וְהַנָּשִׁים וְהַטַּף״, וּכְתִיב: ״בְּבֹא כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵרָאוֹת״.
human_translation: With regard to appearance, derives appearance appearance of assembly, As it is written, “Assemble the people, the men and the women and the little ones” and it is written “When all of Israel come to appear”
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of seeing, it is derived "seeing" "seeing" from the assembly, as it is written: "Gather the people, the men, the women, and the little ones," and it is also written: "When all Israel comes to see."

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יִשְׁמְעוּ וּלְמַעַן יִלְמְדוּ״, וְתַנְיָא: ״לְמַעַן יִשְׁמְעוּ״ — פְּרָט לִמְדַבֵּר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ, ״וּלְמַעַן יִלְמְדוּ״ — פְּרָט לְשׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: And there, from where do we As it is written “That they may hear, and that they may learn” and it is taught “that they may hear” excludes one who speaks but does not hear; “and that they may learn” excludes one who hears but does not speak,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there, how do we derive it? As it is written: "So that they may hear and so that they may learn." And it was taught in a baraita: "So that they may hear" - excluding one who speaks but does not listen, "and so that they may learn" - excluding one who listens but does not speak.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּכִי לָא מִשְׁתַּעֵי לָא גָּמַר? וְהָא הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי אִילְּמֵי דַּהֲווֹ בְּשִׁבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי, בְּנֵי בְרַתֵּיה דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן גּוּדְגְּדָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּנֵי אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּכׇל אֵימַת דַּהֲוָה עָיֵיל רַבִּי לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא הֲווֹ עָיְילִי וְיָתְבִי קַמַּיְיהוּ וּמְנַיְּידִי בְּרֵישַׁיְיהוּ וּמְרַחֲשִׁין שִׂפְווֹתַיְיהוּ,
human_translation: Is that to say that one who not speak not learn? But two mute people who were in the neighborhood of Rabbi sons of the daughter of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Gudgeda, and some say sons of the sister of Rabbi Yoḥanan Whenever Rabbi would enter the study hall they would enter and sit before and they would nod their heads and move their lips.
llm_translation: In the matter that if he does not become intoxicated, has he not fulfilled his obligation? But behold, these are the two disciples who were in the neighborhood of Rabbi, the sons of the daughter of Rabbi Yochanan ben Gudgeda, and some say they were the sons of the sister of Rabbi Yochanan, that whenever Rabbi would go to the study hall, they would go and sit before him, arrange their heads, and nod their heads.

hebrew_text: וּבָעֵי רַבִּי רַחֲמֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ וְאִיתַּסּוֹ, וְאִשְׁתַּכַּח דַּהֲווֹ גְּמִירִי הִלְכְתָא וְסִפְרָא וְסִפְרֵי, וְכוּלֵּהּ תַּלְמוּדָא!
human_translation: And Rabbi prayed for mercy upon them, and they were healed. And it was discovered that they had learned halakha , Sifra , Sifrei , and the entire Talmud.
llm_translation: And the students of Rabbi Rachamei asked about them, and they found that they were proficient in Halakha, Sifra, and Sifrei, and all of it is Talmuda!

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: קְרִי בֵּיהּ ״לְמַעַן יְלַמְּדוּ״. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: וַדַּאי ״לְמַעַן יְלַמְּדוּ״ הוּא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״לְמַעַן יִלְמְדוּ״, וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא מִשְׁתַּעֵי לָא גָּמַר, וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא שָׁמַע לָא גָּמַר,
human_translation: Mar Zutra said read into That they may teach [ yelamdu ], Rav Ashi said is certainly That they may teach. As, if it enters your mind “That they may learn,” and since he is not speak he not learn, since he is not hear he is not learn,
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: It reads in it "so that they may learn." Rav Ashi said: Certainly "so that they may learn" it is, for if it were to enter your mind "so that they will teach," and since he did not succeed, he has not completed, and since he did not hear, he has not completed.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִ״לְּמַעַן יִשְׁמְעוּ״ נָפְקָא! אֶלָּא וַדַּאי ״לְמַעַן יְלַמְּדוּ״ הוּא.
human_translation: this derived from: “That they may hear,” Rather, is certainly “That they may teach,”
llm_translation: This "in order that they may hear" is derived! Rather, certainly "in order that they may learn" it is.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: חֵרֵשׁ בְּאׇזְנוֹ אַחַת פָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum said: One who is deaf in one ear is exempt from appearance as it is stated in their ears”
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum said: One who is deaf in one ear is exempt from the mitzvah of hearing, as it is stated, "in their ears."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶם״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ ״בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶם״ דְּכוּלְּהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל! הַהוּא מִ״נֶּגֶד כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל״ נָפְקָא. אִי מִ״נֶּגֶד כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא שָׁמְעִי — כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶם״, וְהוּא דְּשָׁמְעִי.
human_translation: But this “In their ears,” is necessary the ears of the entire Jewish people. That is derived from “Before all Israel” If from: “Before all Israel,” I would say even though they cannot hear; the Merciful One writes: “In their ears,” and that they hear.
llm_translation: The phrase "in their ears" he requires "in their ears" which includes all of Israel! That one from "opposite all Israel" is derived. If from "opposite all Israel," I would say: even though I did not hear — the Merciful One wrote "in their ears," and that is what I heard.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִ״לְּמַעַן יִשְׁמְעוּ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: That is derived from: “That they may hear”
llm_translation: That one from "in order that they may hear" went out.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: חִיגֵּר בְּרַגְלוֹ אַחַת — פָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רְגָלִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum said: One who is lame in one leg is exempt from appearance, as it is stated: times [ regalim ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum said: If he dragged with one foot - exempt from seeing, as it is said: "feet."

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״רְגָלִים״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, פְּרָט לְבַעֲלֵי קַבִּין! הָהוּא מִ״פְּעָמִים״ נָפְקָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״פְּעָמִים״, אֵין ״פְּעָמִים״ אֶלָּא רְגָלִים, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״תִּרְמְסֶנָּה רָגֶל רַגְלֵי עָנִי פַּעֲמֵי דַלִּים״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״מַה יָּפוּ פְעָמַיִךְ בַּנְּעָלִים בַּת נָדִיב״.
human_translation: But “ regalim ” is necessary exclude people with artificial legs. That derived from: occasions [ pe’amim ] as it is taught “ pe’amim ”: Pe’amim means nothing other legs. And so it says: “The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor and the steps [ pa’amei ] of the needy” and it says: “How beautiful are your feet [ fe’amayikh ] in sandals, daughter of the prince”
llm_translation: The Rabbi inquired about "regalim," excluding owners of kabin! That one came out from "pe'amim," as it was taught: "pe'amim," there are no "pe'amim" except regalim, and so it says: "You shall trample with your feet the poor, the steps of the needy." And it says: "How beautiful are your steps in sandals, O noble daughter."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״מַה יָּפוּ פְעָמַיִךְ בַּנְּעָלִים בַּת נָדִיב״ — כַּמָּה נָאִין רַגְלֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹלִין לָרֶגֶל. ״בַּת נָדִיב״ — בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ שֶׁנִּקְרָא נָדִיב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נְדִיבֵי עַמִּים נֶאֱסָפוּ עַם אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם״. ״אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם״, וְלֹא אֱלֹהֵי יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב? אֶלָּא: ״אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם״ — שֶׁהָיָה תְּחִילָּה לְגֵרִים.
human_translation: Rava taught: What is which is written: “How beautiful are your feet in sandals, daughter of the prince [ nadiv ]”? How pleasant are the feet [ raglehen ] of the Jewish people when they ascend to on the pilgrimage Festival [ regel ]. “Daughter of the prince”: the daughter of Abraham our father who is called a prince, as it is stated: “The princes of the peoples are gathered together, the people of the God of Abraham” “the God of Abraham,” and not the God of Isaac and Jacob? Rather, “the God of Abraham,” as was the first of the converts.
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "How beautiful are your steps in sandals, O noble daughter"? — How becoming are the feet of Israel when they ascend to the pilgrimage! "Noble daughter" — the daughter of our forefather Abraham, who was called noble, as it is stated: "The nobles of the peoples are gathered, the people of the God of Abraham." "The God of Abraham," and not the God of Isaac and Jacob? Rather, "The God of Abraham" — because He was the first to accept converts.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא, דָּרֵשׁ רַב נָתָן בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וְהַבּוֹר רֵק אֵין בּוֹ מָיִם״, מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְהַבּוֹר רֵק״ — אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מָיִם? אֶלָּא: מַיִם אֵין בּוֹ, אֲבָל נְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים יֵשׁ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said Rabbi Natan bar Manyumi taught in the name of Rabbi Tanḥum: What is that which is written and the pit was empty, there was no water in it” By inference from that which is stated: “And the pit was empty,” don’t I know that there was no water in it? Rather, there was no water in it, but there were snakes and scorpions in it.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said, Rav Natan from Minyomi expounded in the name of Rabbi Tanchum: What is the meaning of the verse, "And the pit is empty, there is no water in it"? From the fact that it says, "And the pit is empty" - am I to understand that there is no water in it? Rather, there is no water in it, but there are snakes and scorpions in it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר [בֶּן] חִסְמָא שֶׁהָלְכוּ לְהַקְבִּיל פְּנֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּפְקִיעִין. אָמַר לָהֶם: מָה חִידּוּשׁ הָיָה בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ הַיּוֹם? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: תַּלְמִידֶיךָ אָנוּ וּמֵימֶיךָ אָנוּ שׁוֹתִין. אָמַר לָהֶם: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן, אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ בְּלֹא חִידּוּשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: an incident involving Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka and Rabbi Elazar ben Ḥisma, when they went to greet Rabbi Yehoshua in Peki’in. said to them: What novel was today in the study hall? They said to him: We are your students and we drink your water, He said to them: Even so, there cannot be a study hall without a novelty.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah and Rabbi Elazar ben Chisma, who went to greet Rabbi Yehoshua in Peki'in. He said to them: "What new insight was there in the study hall today?" They replied to him: "We are your students, and from you we drink." He said to them: "Even so, it is impossible for the study hall to be without new insight."

hebrew_text: שַׁבָּת שֶׁל מִי הָיְתָה? שַׁבָּת שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה הָיְתָה. וּבַמֶּה הָיְתָה הַגָּדָה הַיּוֹם? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: בְּפָרָשַׁת הַקְהֵל. וּמָה דָּרַשׁ בָּהּ?
human_translation: Whose week was it, It was Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya’s week. And on what was the lecture today? They said to him: about the portion of assembly. And what did he interpret homiletically with regard to
llm_translation: Shabbat of whom was it? Shabbat of Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah it was. And in what was the Hagadah today? They said to him: In the portion of Vayakhel. And what did he expound in it?

hebrew_text: ״הַקְהֵל אֶת הָעָם הָאֲנָשִׁים וְהַנָּשִׁים וְהַטַּף״. אִם אֲנָשִׁים בָּאִים לִלְמוֹד, נָשִׁים בָּאוֹת לִשְׁמוֹעַ, טַף לָמָּה בָּאִין? כְּדֵי לִיתֵּן שָׂכָר לִמְבִיאֵיהֶן. אָמַר לָהֶם: מַרְגָּלִית טוֹבָה הָיְתָה בְּיַדְכֶם, וּבִקַּשְׁתֶּם לְאַבְּדָהּ מִמֶּנִּי?
human_translation: “Assemble the people, the men and the women and the little ones” If men come to learn, women, come to hear, why do the little ones come? in order give a reward to those who bring them, said to them: good pearl was in your hands, and you tried to conceal it from me?
llm_translation: "״Gather the people, the men, the women, and the little ones״. If men come to study, why do women come? To listen. Why do the little ones come? In order to give reward to those who bring them. He said to them: You had a good spy in your hands, and you sought to destroy it from me?"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד דָּרַשׁ: ״אֶת ה׳ הֶאֱמַרְתָּ הַיּוֹם״, ״וַה׳ הֶאֱמִירְךָ הַיּוֹם״,
human_translation: Additionally, interpreted homiletically: “You have affirmed, this day, the Lord And the Lord has affirmed you, this day,
llm_translation: And further expounded: "You have declared today that Hashem is your God," "and Hashem has declared you today to be His people."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: אַתֶּם עֲשִׂיתוּנִי חֲטִיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם, וַאֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה אֶתְכֶם חֲטִיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם. אַתֶּם עֲשִׂיתוּנִי חֲטִיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״, וַאֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה אֶתְכֶם חֲטִיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Jewish people: You have made Me a single entity in the world, And I will make you a single entity in the world, You have made Me a single entity in the world, as it is written: “Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is One” And I will make you a single entity in the world, as it is stated:
llm_translation: He said to them, the Holy One, blessed be He, to Israel: You have made Me one division in the world, and I will make you one division in the world. You have made Me one division in the world, as it is written: "Hear, O Israel: the Lord our God, the Lord is one," and I will make you one division in the world, as it is said:

hebrew_text: ״וּמִי כְּעַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹי אֶחָד בָּאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: “And who is like Your people, Israel, one nation in the land?”
llm_translation: "And who is like Your people Israel, one nation on the earth."

hebrew_text: וְאַף הוּא פָּתַח וְדָרַשׁ: ״דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים כַּדָּרְבֹנוֹת וּכְמַשְׂמְרוֹת נְטוּעִים בַּעֲלֵי אֲסֻפּוֹת נִתְּנוּ מֵרוֹעֶה אֶחָד״, לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה לְדָרְבָן? לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה דָּרְבָן זֶה מְכַוֵּין אֶת הַפָּרָה לִתְלָמֶיהָ לְהוֹצִיא חַיִּים לְעוֹלָם — אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מְכַוְּונִין אֶת לוֹמְדֵיהֶן מִדַּרְכֵי מִיתָה לְדַרְכֵי חַיִּים. אִי מָה דָּרְבָן זֶה מִטַּלְטֵל — אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִטַּלְטְלִין, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַשְׂמְרוֹת״.
human_translation: And also commenced and taught: “The words of the wise are as goads, and as nails well fastened are those that are composed in collections; they are given from one shepherd” Why are matters of Torah compared to a goad? To tell you just as this goad directs the cow to her furrow to bring forth life to the world, so too the words of Torah direct those who study them from the paths of death to the paths of life. If so, Just as this goad is movable so too matters of Torah are movable the verse states: “Nails,”
llm_translation: He also began and expounded: "The words of the sages are like nails and like well-driven nails, given by one shepherd." Why are the words of Torah compared to nails? To tell you: Just as this nail directs the heifer to its yoke to bring forth life for the world, so too the words of Torah direct their learners from the ways of death to the ways of life. Just as this nail is movable, so too the words of Torah are movable. The Talmud says: "well-driven nails."

hebrew_text: אִי מָה מַסְמֵר זֶה חָסֵר וְלֹא יָתֵר — אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה חֲסֵירִין וְלֹא יְתֵירִין, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״נְטוּעִים״, מָה נְטִיעָה זוֹ פָּרָה וְרָבָה — אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה פָּרִין וְרָבִין. ״בַּעֲלֵי אֲסֻפּוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין אֲסוּפּוֹת אֲסוּפּוֹת וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה. הַלָּלוּ מְטַמְּאִין וְהַלָּלוּ מְטַהֲרִין, הַלָּלוּ אוֹסְרִין וְהַלָּלוּ מַתִּירִין, הַלָּלוּ פּוֹסְלִין וְהַלָּלוּ מַכְשִׁירִין,
human_translation: If so, Just as this nail is diminished and does not expand, so too matters of Torah are diminished and do not expand. the verse states: “Well fastened [ netuim ].” Just as this plant [ neti’a ] flourishes and multiplies, so too matters of Torah flourish and multiply. “Those that are composed in collections [ ba’alei asufot ]”: These are Torah scholars who sit in many groups [ asupot ] and engage in Torah these render ritually impure and these render it pure; these prohibit and these permit these deem invalid and these deem it valid.
llm_translation: If a nail is lacking and not in excess - so too the words of Torah are lacking and not in excess, as it is stated: "planted." Just as this planting bears fruit and multiplies, so too the words of Torah bear fruit and multiply. "Those who gather in groups" - these are the students of the sages, who sit in groups and engage in Torah study. Some of them render impure and some render pure, some prohibit and some permit, some disqualify and some validate.

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר אָדָם: הֵיאַךְ אֲנִי לָמֵד תּוֹרָה מֵעַתָּה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כּוּלָּם נִתְּנוּ מֵרוֹעֶה אֶחָד״. אֵל אֶחָד נְתָנָן, פַּרְנָס אֶחָד אֲמָרָן, מִפִּי אֲדוֹן כׇּל הַמַּעֲשִׂים בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְדַבֵּר אֱלֹהִים אֶת כׇּל הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״.
human_translation: Lest a person say: Now, how can I study Torah The verse states they are all “given from one shepherd.” One God gave them; one leader, said them from the mouth of the Master of all creation, Blessed be He, as it is written: “And God spoke all these words”
llm_translation: Perhaps one might say: How can I learn Torah from now on? The Talmud teaches us to say: "All of them were given from one shepherd." One God gave them, one provider said them, from the mouth of the Master of all deeds, blessed be He, as it is written: "And God spoke all these words."

hebrew_text: אַף אַתָּה, עֲשֵׂה אׇזְנֶיךָ כַּאֲפַרְכֶּסֶת, וּקְנֵה לְךָ לֵב מֵבִין לִשְׁמוֹעַ אֶת דִּבְרֵי מְטַמְּאִים וְאֶת דִּבְרֵי מְטַהֲרִים, אֶת דִּבְרֵי אוֹסְרִין וְאֶת דִּבְרֵי מַתִּירִין, אֶת דִּבְרֵי פוֹסְלִין וְאֶת דִּבְרֵי מַכְשִׁירִין. בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה אָמַר לָהֶם: אֵין דּוֹר יָתוֹם שֶׁרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה שָׁרוּי בְּתוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: So too you, make your ears like a funnel and acquire for yourself an understanding heart to hear the statements of who render ritually impure and the statements of who render pure; the statements of who prohibit and the statements of who permit the statements of who deem invalid and the statements of who deem valid. he said to them in these words: No generation orphaned, if Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya dwells among it.
llm_translation: You too, make your ear like a funnel, and acquire for yourself an understanding heart to hear both the words of those who render impure and the words of those who render pure, the words of those who prohibit and the words of those who permit, the words of those who disqualify and the words of those who validate. In this language he said to them: "There is no generation that Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah is not among them."

hebrew_text: וְלֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ בְּהֶדְיָא? מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה. דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן דּוֹרְמַסְקִית שֶׁהָלַךְ לְהַקְבִּיל פְּנֵי רַבִּי (אֶלְעָזָר) [אֱלִיעֶזֶר] בְּלוֹד, אָמַר לוֹ: מָה חִידּוּשׁ הָיָה בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ הַיּוֹם?
human_translation: But should have told directly, due to an incident that occurred. As it is taught an incident involving Rabbi Yosei ben Durmaskit, who went to greet Rabbi Eliezer in Lod. said to him: What novel was today in the study hall?
llm_translation: And they should say to him with witnesses? Because of an incident that occurred. As it was taught: There was an incident with Rabbi Yosei ben Dormaskit who went to greet Rabbi (Elazar) Eliezer in Lod, he said to him: What new insight was there in the study hall today?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, נִמְנוּ וְגָמְרוּ: עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב מְעַשְּׂרִין מַעְשַׂר עָנִי בַּשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: said to him: counted and concluded Ammon and Moab one separates the poor man’s tithe in the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: He said to him, "They counted and finished: Ammon and Moab tithe tithe poor in the seventh."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹסֵי, פְּשׁוֹט יָדֶיךָ וְקַבֵּל עֵינֶיךָ. פָּשַׁט יָדָיו וְקִבֵּל עֵינָיו. בָּכָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְאָמַר: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו וּבְרִיתוֹ לְהוֹדִיעָם״.
human_translation: said to him Yosei, extend your hands and catch your eyes, He extended his hands and caught his eyes. Rabbi Elazar wept and said “The counsel of the Lord is with them who fear Him; and His covenant, to make them know it”
llm_translation: He said to him: Yosei, stretch out your hand and receive your eyes. He stretched out his hand and received his eyes. Rabbi Elazar wept and said: "The secret of the Lord is for those who fear Him, and His covenant is to make it known to them."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ, לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם: אַל תָּחוּשׁוּ לְמִנְיַינְכֶם, כָּךְ מְקּוּבְּלַנִי מֵרַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, שֶׁשָּׁמַע מֵרַבּוֹ וְרַבּוֹ מֵרַבּוֹ: הִלְכְתָא לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי, עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב מְעַשְּׂרִין מַעְשַׂר עָנִי בַּשְּׁבִיעִית. מָה טַעַם — הַרְבֵּה כְּרַכִּים כָּבְשׁוּ עוֹלֵי מִצְרַיִם וְלֹא כְּבָשׁוּם עוֹלֵי בָּבֶל,
human_translation: said to go say to Do not be concerned to your counting, This is I received from Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, who heard from his teacher, and his teacher from his teacher: a halakha to Moses from Sinai Ammon and Moab one separates the poor man’s tithe in the Sabbatical Year. What is the reason? Those who ascended from Egypt conquered many cities, and those who ascended from Babylonia did not conquer them
llm_translation: He said to him, "Go tell them: Do not be concerned about your counting, for thus I have received from Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, who heard it from his teacher, and his teacher from his teacher: The halakha is according to the opinion of Moses from Sinai, that the people of Ammon and Moab tithe the poor tithe in the seventh year. What is the reason? The Israelites in Egypt accumulated many riches, while the Israelites in Babylon did not accumulate riches."

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקְּדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִדְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְלֹא קִדְּשָׁה לְעָתִיד לָבֹא, וְהִנִּיחוּם כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּסְמְכוּ עֲלֵיהֶן עֲנִיִּים בַּשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: because the first consecration it sanctified for its time and it not sanctified forever, And left those so that the poor could rely upon in the Sabbatical Year,
llm_translation: Because the first sanctity sanctified for its time and did not sanctify for the future to come, and they left them so that the poor may rely on them in the seventh year.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּתְיַישְּׁבָה דַּעְתּוֹ, אָמַר: יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁיַּחְזְרוּ עֵינֵי יוֹסֵי לִמְקוֹמָן, וְחָזְרוּ.
human_translation: taught after mind was put at ease, he said: May it be will that Rabbi Yosei’s eyes should return to their place. And returned.
llm_translation: Mishnah: After his mind settled, he said: May it be the will that the eyes of Yosei return to their place, and they returned.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ שׁוֹטֶה? הַיּוֹצֵא יְחִידִי בַּלַּיְלָה, וְהַלָּן בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, וְהַמְקָרֵעַ אֶת כְּסוּתוֹ. אִיתְּמַר, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ כּוּלָּן בְּבַת אַחַת, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Who is an imbecile? One who goes out alone at night, and one who sleeps in a cemetery, and one who rends his garment. It was stated Rav Huna said: until there are all at the same time. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even of one of
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Who is considered a fool? One who goes out alone at night, and sleeps in the cemetery, and tears his garment. It was stated: Rav Huna said: Until they are all in one place, Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if it is just one of them.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּעָבֵיד לְהוּ דֶּרֶךְ שְׁטוּת — אֲפִילּוּ בַּחֲדָא נָמֵי, אִי דְּלָא עָבֵיד לְהוּ דֶּרֶךְ שְׁטוּת — אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי לָא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If he performs them in a deranged manner, even of one If does not perform these in a deranged manner, even all of them not
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If he does it in a foolish way - even with one, yes; if he does not do it in a foolish way - even with all, no."

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּקָא עָבֵיד לְהוּ דֶּרֶךְ שְׁטוּת, וְהַלָּן בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת — אֵימוֹר כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה עָלָיו רוּחַ טוּמְאָה הוּא דְּקָא עָבֵיד. וְהַיּוֹצֵא יְחִידִי בַּלַּיְלָה — אֵימוֹר גַּנְדְּרִיפַס אַחְדֵּיהּ, וְהַמְקָרֵעַ אֶת כְּסוּתוֹ — אֵימוֹר בַּעַל מַחְשָׁבוֹת הוּא, כֵּיוָן דְּעַבְדִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ, הָוֵה לְהוּ
human_translation: Actually, who performs these in a deranged manner, but one who sleeps in the cemetery, say that he is doing in order that an impure spirit should settle upon him. And one who goes out alone at night, say a fever took hold of him And one who tears his garments, say he is a man thought, since one performed all of these they are
llm_translation: Forever, he is doing to them the way of foolishness, and there in the cemetery - say, in order that the spirit of impurity may rest upon him, he is doing. And one who goes out alone at night - say, a gandarifas is upon him, and one who tears his garment - say, he is a baal machshavot, since he does it to all, it is for him.

hebrew_text: כְּמִי שֶׁנָּגַח שׁוֹר חֲמוֹר וְגָמָל, וְנַעֲשָׂה מוּעָד לַכֹּל. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: אֵי זֶהוּ שׁוֹטֶה — זֶה הַמְאַבֵּד כׇּל מַה שֶּׁנּוֹתְנִים לוֹ, הֲוָה הָדַר בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: like that gored an ox, a donkey, and a camel. and becomes forewarned for every Rav Pappa said: If Rav Huna had heard that which is taught Who is an imbecile? This is one who destroys whatever is given to him, he would have retracted
llm_translation: As one who gores an ox, a donkey, and a camel, and becomes liable to pay damages to all. Rav Papa said: If Rav Huna would only listen, for it was taught: Who is considered a fool? One who destroys everything given to him, he is repudiated.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כִּי הֲוָה הָדַר בֵּיהּ — מִמְּקָרֵע כְּסוּתוֹ הוּא דַּהֲוָה הָדַר בֵּיהּ, דְּדָמְיָא לְהָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא: מִכּוּלְּהוּ הֲוָה הָדַר? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before When would have retracted would he have retracted from one who tears his garments, as is similar Or perhaps he would have retracted all of shall stand
llm_translation: He asked them: When he was adorned with it - from the tearing of his garment he was adorned with it, for it is similar to this, or perhaps: was he adorned with all of them? It shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: וְטוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זְכוּר״ לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנָּשִׁים. ״זְכוּרְךָ״, לְהוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס. ״כָּל זְכוּרְךָ״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַקְּטַנִּים.
human_translation: And a tumtum and a hermaphrodite The Sages taught, “males,” to exclude women “your males,” to exclude a tumtum and a hermaphrodite “all your males,” to include minors.
llm_translation: "And Tumtum and Androgynos, etc." The Rabbis taught: "'Zachur' to exclude women. 'Zechurecha' to exclude Tumtum and Androgynos. 'Kol zachurecha' to include minors."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״זְכוּר״, לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנָּשִׁים. הָא לְמָה לִי קְרָא? מִכְּדִי מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא הוּא, וְכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת!
human_translation: The Master said “Males” to exclude women. Why do I a verse this After all, is a positive, time-bound mitzva, and women are exempt from any positive, time-bound mitzva.
llm_translation: Master said: "Remember," to exclude women. Why do I need the verse? Because it is a positive commandment dependent on time, and all positive commandments dependent on time, women are exempt!

hebrew_text: אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: נֵילַף ״רְאִיָּיה״ ״רְאִיָּיה״ מֵהַקְהֵל; מָה לְהַלָּן נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת, אַף כָּאן נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary, it could enter your mind to say: Let us derive Appearance, Appearance, with assembly Just as there, women are obligated so too here, women are obligated teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, it is required, according to your opinion, I say: We derive "reiyah" "reiyah" from the congregation; just as there women are obligated, so too here women are obligated, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״זְכוּרְךָ״, לְהוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס. בִּשְׁלָמָא אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִית לֵיהּ צַד זַכְרוּת — לִיחַיַּיב, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דִּבְרִיָּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: The Master said “Your males” to exclude a tumtum and a hermaphrodite. Granted, a hermaphrodite was necessary, it could enter your mind to say since he possesses an aspect of masculinity, he should be obligated teaches us is a being unto itself,
llm_translation: Master said: "Your memory," to exclude hermaphrodites and tumtum. With regard to androgynos, it is understandable, for I would say: Since there is a side of masculinity - he is liable, as it implies that it is a distinct entity in its own right.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא טוּמְטוּם, סְפֵיקָא הוּא — מִי אִצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי סְפֵיקָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁבֵּיצָיו מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: However, a tumtum , is uncertainty, is a verse necessary to exclude an uncertainty? Abaye said: when testicles are on the outside,
llm_translation: Rather, Tumtum, it is a doubt - who needs a verse to exclude doubts? Abaye said: When his eggs are outside.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״כׇּל זְכוּרְךָ״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַקְּטַנִּים. וְהָתְנַן: חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּקָטָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְחִינּוּךְ, כָּאן בְּקָטָן שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְחִינּוּךְ. קָטָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְחִינּוּךְ — דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: The Master said “All your males” to include minors. Didn’t we learn except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor? Abaye said: not difficult. Here, to a minor who has reached training There, to a minor who has not reached training a minor who has reached training is by rabbinic law. Yes, it is indeed so, and the verse is a mere support
llm_translation: Master said: "All your males," to include minors. And we learned: Except for a deaf-mute, imbecile, and minor! Abaye said, it is not difficult: here regarding a minor who has reached the age of education, here regarding a minor who has not reached the age of education. A minor who has reached the age of education - it is Rabbinic law! So it is indeed, and the verse is merely a support in general.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא קְרָא לְמַאי אֲתָא? לִכְדַאֲחֵרִים. דִּתְנַן, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: הַמְקַמֵּץ, וְהַמְצָרֵף נְחֹשֶׁת, וְהַבּוּרְסִי — פְּטוּרִין מִן הָרְאִיָּיה, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל זְכוּרְךָ״, מִי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת עִם כׇּל זְכוּרְךָ. יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ, שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיִין לַעֲלוֹת עִם כׇּל זְכוּרְךָ.
human_translation: Rather, for what does verse: come? that which Aḥerim As it is taught Aḥerim say a scrimper, and a melder of copper, and a tanner are exempt from appearance, because it is stated: “All your males,” one who is able to ascend with all your males excluding those who are not suited to ascend with all your males,
llm_translation: And rather what does the verse come to teach? In accordance with the opinion of others. For it was taught: Others say, one who gathers, and one who smelts copper, and the bursi - they are exempt from the pilgrimage, because it is stated: "All who are able to go up with all your males." These mentioned occupations are excluded, as they are not fit to go up with all your males.

hebrew_text: נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים שֶׁאֵינָן מְשׁוּחְרָרִים וְכוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא נָשִׁים כְּדַאֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא עֲבָדִים מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֶל פְּנֵי הָאָדוֹן ה׳״ — מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא אָדוֹן אֶחָד, יָצָא זֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אָדוֹן אַחֵר.
human_translation: women and slaves who are not emancipated Granted, women as we said However, slaves, from where do we Rav Huna said the verse states: “Before the Lord God” one who has only one Master excludes this who has another master.
llm_translation: Women and slaves who are not free, etc. Granted regarding women as we said, but slaves, from where do we derive? Rav Huna said, the verse says: "Before the Lord God" - one who has only one master, this excludes one who has another master.

hebrew_text: הָא לְמָה לִי קְרָא? מִכְּדֵי כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה חַיֶּיבֶת בָּהּ — עֶבֶד חַיָּיב בָּהּ, כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה חַיֶּיבֶת בָּהּ — אֵין הָעֶבֶד חַיָּיב בָּהּ, דְּגָמַר ״לָהּ״ ״לָהּ״ מֵאִשָּׁה!
human_translation: Why do I a verse After all, every mitzva in which a woman is obligated, a slave is obligated in that every mitzva in which a woman is not obligated, a slave is not obligated in it that it is derived “To her” “To her” to a woman.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Why do I need a verse? For any commandment that a woman is obligated in, a slave is also obligated in it. Any commandment that a woman is not obligated in, a slave is not obligated in it, as it is derived "for her" "for her" from a woman!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: נָשִׁים וַעֲבָדִים שֶׁאֵינָן מְשׁוּחְרָרִין. מַאי שֶׁאֵינָן מְשׁוּחְרָרִין? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁאֵינָן מְשׁוּחְרָרִין כְּלָל — לִיתְנֵי ״עֲבָדִים״ סְתָמָא! אֶלָּא לָאו, שֶׁאֵינָן מְשׁוּחְרָרִין לִגְמָרֵי, וּמַאי נִינְהוּ — מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: is necessary only of one who is half-slave half-freeman. is also precise, as it teaches: Women and slaves who are not emancipated. What is Who are not emancipated? If we say that they are not emancipated at all, let it teach: Slaves, without description. Rather, is it not that who are not entirely emancipated? And who are these One who is half-slave half-freeman. Learn from this
llm_translation: Ravina said: It is necessary only for one whose half is a slave and half is free. This is precisely what is taught: women and slaves who are not free. What does it mean that they are not free? If you say that they are not free at all, it should have stated simply "slaves"! Rather, it means that they are not completely free. And who are they? One whose half is a slave and half is free. This is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: וְהַחִיגֵּר וְהַסּוֹמֵא וְחוֹלֶה וְהַזָּקֵן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״רְגָלִים״, פְּרָט לְבַעֲלֵי קַבִּין! דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״רְגָלִים״, פְּרָט לְחִיגֵּר וּלְחוֹלֶה וּלְסוֹמֵא וּלְזָקֵן וּלְשֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת בְּרַגְלָיו. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת בְּרַגְלָיו לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? אָמַר רָבָא: לְאֵתוֹיֵי
human_translation: And the lame, and the blind, and the sick, and the old The Sages taught: “Times [ regalim ]” excludes people with artificial legs. Alternatively, “ regalim ” exclude the lame, the sick, the blind, the old, and one who is unable to ascend on his feet. one who is unable to ascend on his feet, to add what? Rava said: to add
llm_translation: The Higgeir, the Soma, the Holeh, and the Zaken. The Rabbis taught: "Regalim," excluding owners of Kabbin! Another explanation: "Regalim," excluding the Higgeir, the Holeh, the Soma, the Zaken, and one who cannot ascend on his feet. And one who cannot ascend on his feet, for what purpose? Rava said: for what purpose.

hebrew_text: מְפַנְּקִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי תָבֹאוּ לֵרָאוֹת פָּנָי מִי בִקֵּשׁ זֹאת מִיֶּדְכֶם רְמוֹס חֲצֵרָי״.
human_translation: a delicate As it is written: “When you come to appear before Me, who has required this at your hand, to trample My courts?”
llm_translation: The text reads: "Mefanneki, dikhtiv: 'Ki tavou le'ra'ot panai mi bikeish zot miyedkhem remos chatzrai.'" Translation: "He who pampers, as it is written: 'When you come to appear before Me, who has required this of you, to trample My courtyards?'"

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הֶעָרֵל וְהַטָּמֵא פְּטוּרִין מִן הָרְאִיָּיה. בִּשְׁלָמָא טָמֵא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבָאתָ שָּׁמָּה״ ״וַהֲבֵאתֶם שָׁמָּה״, כׇּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּבִיאָה — יֶשְׁנוֹ בַּהֲבָאָה, וְכׇל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּבִיאָה — אֵינוֹ בַּהֲבָאָה
human_translation: taught: The uncircumcised and the ritually impure are exempt from appearance. Granted, a ritually impure as it is written: “And there you shall come” “And there you shall bring” Anyone included in coming, is in bringing and anyone not in coming is not in bringing
llm_translation: Mishnah: The uncircumcised and the ritually impure are exempt from seeing the pilgrimage offering. Regarding the impure — it is understandable, as it is written: "And you shall come there" and "And you shall bring there," anything that is involved in coming is involved in bringing, and anything that is not involved in coming is not involved in bringing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עָרֵל מְנָלַן? הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דִּמְרַבֵּי לְעָרֵל כְּטָמֵא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הֶעָרֵל.
human_translation: However, the uncircumcised, from where do we whose is this It is Rabbi Akiva, who amplifies that the uncircumcised as the ritually impure. As it is taught Rabbi Akiva says, “Any man [ ish ish ] to include the uncircumcised.
llm_translation: Rather, how do we know that an uncircumcised person is considered impure? This is derived from the teaching of Rabbi Akiva, who compares an uncircumcised person to one who is impure. As it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says, "Each man," to include the uncircumcised.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: טָמֵא פָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּיה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבָאתָ שָּׁמָּה״ ״וַהֲבֵאתֶם שָׁמָּה״. כׇּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּבִיאָה — יֶשְׁנוֹ בַּהֲבָאָה, וְכׇל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּבִיאָה — אֵינוֹ בַּהֲבָאָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A ritually impure is exempt from appearance, as it is written: “And there shall you come,” “and there you shall bring.” Anyone in coming is included in bringing and anyone not in coming is not in bringing
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who is impure is exempt from seeing the pilgrimage festival in Jerusalem, as it is written: "And you shall come there" and "And you shall bring there." Whoever is included in coming is included in bringing, and whoever is not included in coming is not included in bringing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן דַּהֲבַאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו פָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּיה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִרְאֶה״ ״יֵרָאֶה״, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁבָּא לִרְאוֹת כָּךְ בָּא לֵירָאוֹת. מַה בָּא לִרְאוֹת — בִּשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו, אַף לֵירָאוֹת — בִּשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Dehavai says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: One who is blind in one of his eyes is exempt from appearance, as it is stated: shall appear [ yera’e ] will see [ yireh ] in the manner that one comes to see, so he comes to be seen: Just as one comes to see with both his eyes, so too to be seen with both his eyes.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Dahavai says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: One who is blind in one of his eyes is exempt from seeing, as it is stated: "He shall see" "He shall be seen," just as in the manner in which he comes to see, so too he comes to be seen. Just as he comes to see with two eyes, so too he comes to be seen with two eyes.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא ״יִרְאֶה״ ״יֵרָאֶה״, בָּכֵי. אָמַר: עֶבֶד שֶׁרַבּוֹ מְצַפֶּה לוֹ לִרְאוֹתוֹ יִתְרַחֵק מִמֶּנּוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי תָבוֹאוּ לֵרָאוֹת פָּנָי מִי בִקֵּשׁ זֹאת מִיֶּדְכֶם רְמוֹס חֲצֵרָי״.
human_translation: when Rav Huna reached this verse, “Will see” [ yireh ] “shall appear” [ yera’e ], he cried. He said: a slave whose master expects to see him, will distance himself from him As it is written: “When you come to appear before Me, who has required this at your hand, to trample My courts?”
llm_translation: Rav Huna, when he came to this verse "yireh" "yera'eh," he cried. He said: A servant whose master increases his expectations to see him, should distance himself from him, as it is written: "When you come to see My face, who has required this of you, trample My courtyards."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״וְזָבַחְתָּ שְׁלָמִים וְאָכַלְתָּ שָּׁם״, עֶבֶד שֶׁרַבּוֹ מְצַפֶּה לֶאֱכוֹל עַל שֻׁלְחָנוֹ יִתְרַחֵק מִמֶּנּוּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה לִּי רוֹב זִבְחֵיכֶם יֹאמַר ה׳״.
human_translation: Similarly, when Rav Huna reached this verse, he cried: “And you shall sacrifice peace and you shall eat there” a slave whose master expects to eat at his table, will distance himself from him? As it is written: “To what purpose is the multitude of your offerings to Me? says the Lord”
llm_translation: Rav Huna, when he came to this verse, cried: "And you shall sacrifice peace offerings and eat there," should a slave whose master has prepared food for him to eat at his table distance himself from it? As it is written: "Why do I need your many sacrifices?" says the Lord.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״וְלֹא יָכְלוּ אֶחָיו לַעֲנוֹת אֹתוֹ כִּי נִבְהֲלוּ מִפָּנָיו״, וּמָה תּוֹכֵחָה שֶׁל בָּשָׂר וָדָם כָּךְ, תּוֹכֵחָה שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶל שָׁאוּל לָמָּה הִרְגַּזְתַּנִי לְהַעֲלוֹת אוֹתִי״, וּמָה שְׁמוּאֵל הַצַּדִּיק הָיָה מִתְיָירֵא מִן הַדִּין, אָנוּ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה!
human_translation: When Rabbi Elazar reached this verse, he cried: “And his brethren could not answer him, for they were affrighted at his presence” If the rebuke of flesh and blood such the rebuke of the Holy One, Blessed be He, all the more so. When Rabbi Elazar reached this verse, he cried: “And Samuel said to Saul: Why have you disquieted me, to bring me up” If Samuel the righteous was afraid of judgment all the more so we
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, when he came to this verse, cried: "And his brothers could not answer him, for they were dismayed before him." And if the rebuke of flesh and blood is so, how much more so is the rebuke of the Holy One, blessed be He - all the more so. Rabbi Elazar, when he came to this verse, cried: "And Samuel said to Saul, 'Why have you disturbed me to bring me up?'" And if Samuel the righteous was afraid of judgment, how much more so are we - all the more so!

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל מַאי הִיא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה אֶל שָׁאוּל אֱלֹהִים רָאִיתִי עוֹלִים״. ״עוֹלִים״ — תְּרֵי מַשְׁמַע: חַד שְׁמוּאֵל, וְאִידָּךְ — דַּאֲזַל שְׁמוּאֵל וְאַתְיֵיהּ לְמֹשֶׁה בַּהֲדֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם לְדִינָא מִתְבְּעֵינָא, קוּם בַּהֲדַאי, דְּלֵיכָּא מִילְּתָא דִּכְתַבְתְּ בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא דְּלָא קַיֵּימְתַּיהּ.
human_translation: Samuel, what is it As it is written: “And the woman said to Saul, I see a godlike being coming up [ olim ] “ Olim ,” indicates two One Samuel, but the other, that Samuel went and brought Moses with him. He said to Perhaps, Heaven forbid, I was summoned for judgment stand with me that there is nothing that you wrote in the Torah that I did not fulfill.
llm_translation: Samuel, what is it? As it is written: "And the woman said to Saul, 'I saw gods ascending.'" "Ascending" implies two things: one, Samuel, and the other, that Samuel went and came to Moses with it. He said to him: Perhaps there is peace in your judgment, arise with this, for the matter that you wrote in the Torah is not established.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״יִתֵּן בֶּעָפָר פִּיהוּ אוּלַי יֵשׁ תִּקְוָה״, אָמַר: כּוּלֵּי הַאי וְ״אוּלַי״?! רַבִּי אַמֵּי כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״בַּקְּשׁוּ צֶדֶק בַּקְּשׁוּ עֲנָוָה אוּלַי תִּסָּתְרוּ בְּיוֹם אַף ה׳״, אָמַר: כּוּלֵּי הַאי וְ״אוּלַי״?! רַבִּי אַסִּי כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״שִׂנְאוּ רָע וְאֶהֱבוּ טוֹב וְהַצִּיגוּ בַשַּׁעַר מִשְׁפָּט אוּלַי יֶחֱנַן ה׳ [אֱלֹהֵי] צְבָאוֹת״, כּוּלֵּי הַאי וְ״אוּלַי״?!
human_translation: When Rabbi Ami reached this verse, he cried: “Let him put his mouth in the dust, perhaps there may be hope” He said: all this and perhaps When Rabbi Ami reached this verse, he cried: “Seek righteousness, seek humility; perhaps you shall be hidden on the day of the Lord’s anger” He said: All of this and perhaps when Rabbi Asi reached this verse, he cried: “Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish justice in the gate; perhaps the Lord, the God of hosts, will be gracious” He said: All of this, and perhaps?
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi, when he reached this verse, cried: "Let him put his mouth in the dust; perhaps there is hope." He said: All of this and "perhaps"?! Rabbi Ammi, when he reached this verse, cried: "Seek righteousness, seek humility; perhaps you will be hidden on the day of the Lord's anger." He said: All of this and "perhaps"?! Rabbi Assi, when he reached this verse, cried: "Hate evil, love good, and establish justice in the gate; perhaps the Lord, the God of hosts, will be gracious." All of this and "perhaps"?!

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״וְיֵשׁ נִסְפֶּה בְּלֹא מִשְׁפָּט״, אָמַר: מִי אִיכָּא דְּאָזֵיל בְּלָא זִמְנֵיהּ? אִין, כִּי הָא דְּרַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ גַּבֵּיהּ מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לִשְׁלוּחֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי מִרְיָם מְגַדְּלָא שְׂיעַר נַשְׁיָיא. אֲזַל, אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ מִרְיָם מְגַדְּלָא דַּרְדְּקֵי.
human_translation: When Rav Yosef reached this verse, he cried: “But there are those swept away without justice” He said: Is there one who goes before his time Yes, like this Rav Beivai bar Abaye, who would be frequented the Angel of Death said to his agent: Go bring me, Miriam raiser, women’s hair. He went, brought him Miriam, raiser of babies.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, when he came to this verse, cried: "And there is one who perishes without justice." He said: Is there anyone who goes without his time? No, for this that Rav Bibi bar Abbaye was often visited by the Angel of Death. He said to him: Go bring me Miriam the hairdresser. He went and brought him Miriam the hairdresser of women.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא מִרְיָם מְגַדְּלָא שֵׂיעָר נְשַׁיָּיא אֲמַרִי לָךְ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, אַהְדְּרַהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוֹאִיל וְאַיְיתִיתַהּ — לֶיהֱוֵי לְמִנְיָינָא! אֶלָּא הֵיכִי יְכֵלְתְּ לַהּ? הֲוָת נְקִיטָא מְתָארָא בִּידַהּ וַהֲוָת קָא שָׁגְרָא
human_translation: said to him: I told you Miriam, raiser women’s hair. said to him: If so, return her He said to him: Since you brought her, let her be counted But how were you able her? she was holding a shovel in her hand and was lighting
llm_translation: He said to her: "I am Miriam from the tower of Seir, the women say to you!" He said to her: "If so, return it!" He said to her: "Since you have brought it - let it be counted!" Rather, how could you have done this? She took a mirror in her hand and was combing her hair.

hebrew_text: וּמְחָרְיָא תַּנּוּרָא, שְׁקַלְתָּא וְאַנַּחְתָּא אַגַּבֵּהּ דְּכַרְעַהּ, קְדַחָא וְאִיתְּרַע מַזָּלַהּ, וְאַיְיתִיתַהּ.
human_translation: and sweeping the oven. She took and set it on her foot; she was scalded and her luck suffered, and I brought her.
llm_translation: And the next day, the oven, you lifted and you sighed over it, due to its base, you scraped and you removed its dung, and you brought it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: אִית לְכוּ רְשׁוּתָא לְמִיעְבַּד הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְלָא כְּתִיב: ״וְיֵשׁ נִסְפֶּה בְּלֹא מִשְׁפָּט״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְהָכְתִיב: ״דּוֹר הוֹלֵךְ וְדוֹר בָּא״!
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye said to you have the right to act in this said to him: And not written: “But there are those swept away without justice” said to him: And isn’t it written: “One generation passes away, and another generation comes”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Bibi son of Abbaye: Is there permission to do so? He said to him, but is it not written: "And there is a miscarriage without justice"? He said to him, but it is written: "A generation goes, and a generation comes"!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: דְּרָעֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא עַד דְּמָלוּ לְהוּ לְדָרָא, וַהֲדַר מַשְׁלֵימְנָא לֵיהּ לְדוּמָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סוֹף סוֹף, שְׁנֵיהּ מַאי עָבְדַתְּ? אֲמַר: אִי אִיכָּא צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּמַעְבֵּיר בְּמִילֵּיהּ — מוֹסֵיפְנָא לְהוּ לֵיהּ, וְהָוְיָא חִלּוּפֵיהּ.
human_translation: He said I shepherd them, until the generation are completed, and then I pass them on to Duma said to him: Ultimately, what do you do his years, said If there is a Torah scholar who disregards his matters, I add those to him and he becomes replacement
llm_translation: He said: I will go and stay with them until they finish the meal, and then I will return to the inn. He said to him: In the end, what did you do with the second one? He said: If there is a student who surpasses his teacher in wisdom - we add to him, and it will be a reversal.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״וַתְּסִיתֵנִי בוֹ לְבַלְּעוֹ חִנָּם״. עֶבֶד שֶׁרַבּוֹ מְסִיתִין לוֹ וְנִיסָת, תַּקָּנָה יֵשׁ לוֹ?! רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״הֵן בִּקְדֹשָׁיו לֹא יַאֲמִין״, אִי בִּקְדוֹשָׁיו לֹא יַאֲמִין — בְּמַאן יַאֲמִין?
human_translation: When Rabbi Yoḥanan reached this verse, he cried, “Although you did incite Me against him, to destroy him without cause” a slave whose master incite and is incited is there a remedy for when Rabbi Yoḥanan reached this verse, he cried: “Behold He puts no trust in His sacred ones” If He does not place trust in His sacred ones, in whom He place trust?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, when he came to this verse, cried: "And she enticed me with it to make me sin for nothing." If a slave whose master entices him and he falls, does he have any legal claim? Rabbi Yochanan, when he came to this verse, cried: "Behold, in His holy ones He will not believe." If in His holy ones He will not believe, in whom will He believe?

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא, חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה מְנַקֵּיט תֵּאנֵי, שָׁבֵיק הָנָךְ דִּמְטוֹ וְשָׁקֵיל הָנָךְ דְּלָא מְטוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו הָנֵי מְעַלָּן טְפֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי לְאוֹרְחָא בָּעֵינַן לְהוּ, הָנֵי נָטְרָן וְהָנֵי לָא נָטְרָן. אֲמַר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״הֵן בִּקְדוֹשָׁיו לֹא יַאֲמִין״.
human_translation: One day was walking along the road, he saw a certain man who was picking figs He left the ones that had reached and took those that had not reached said to him: Aren’t these much better? He said to him: I need these for the road; these will be preserved, and these will not be preserved. said: This is as is written: “Behold He puts no trust in His sacred ones”;
llm_translation: One day he was walking on the road, he saw that man who was picking figs, he left those that were ripe and took those that were not ripe. He said to him: Are these not spoiling more? He said to him: These we need for the road, these are guarded and these are not guarded. He said, that is what is written: "Behold, he does not trust in his holy ones."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא הָהוּא תַּלְמִידָא דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי וּשְׁכֵיב אַדְּזוּטַר, וַאֲמַר: אִי בָּעֵי הַאי מֵרַבָּנַן, הֲוָה חָיֵי. וְאִם אִיתָא, דִּלְמָא מֵ״הֵן בִּקְדוֹשָׁיו לֹא יַאֲמִין״ הֲוָה? הָהוּא מְבַעֵט בְּרַבּוֹתָיו הֲוָה.
human_translation: Is that so? But there was a certain student in the neighborhood of Rabbi Alexandri, and he died while young. And said: If this Sage had wanted, he would have lived, And if it is so, perhaps from “Behold he puts no trust in his sacred ones,” That was irreverently toward his teachers,
llm_translation: I? But that disciple who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Alexanderi and was lying in his bed, said: If this matter is from the Rabbis, it is alive. And if it comes, perhaps he will not believe in His holy ones? That one was seeking among his colleagues.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״וְקָרַבְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶם לַמִּשְׁפָּט וְהָיִיתִי עֵד מְמַהֵר בַּמְכַשְּׁפִים וּבַמְנָאֲפִים וּבַנִּשְׁבָּעִים לַשָּׁקֶר וּבְעוֹשְׁקֵי שְׂכַר שָׂכִיר״. עֶבֶד שֶׁרַבּוֹ מְקָרְבוֹ לְדוּנוֹ, וּמְמַהֵר לַהֲעִידוֹ — תַּקָּנָה יֵשׁ לוֹ?!
human_translation: When Rabbi Yoḥanan reached this verse, he cried: “And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false witnesses, and against those who oppress the hireling in his wages, a slave whose master comes near to him to judge him and is swift to testify him, there a remedy for him?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, when he came to this verse, cried: "And I will draw near to you for judgment, and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers and against the adulterers and against those who swear falsely, and against those who oppress the hired worker in his wages." If a slave whose master brings him close for judgment, and he quickly testifies - does he have any legal claim?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: אוֹי לָנוּ שֶׁשָּׁקַל עָלֵינוּ הַכָּתוּב קַלּוֹת כַּחֲמוּרוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said: Woe to us, as the verse weighs lenient for us like stringent
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai said: Woe to us, for the Scripture has weighed upon us light as heavy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כׇּל הַמַּטֶּה דִּינוֹ שֶׁל גֵּר — כְּאִילּוּ מַטֶּה דִּינוֹ שֶׁל מַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמַטֵּי גֵר״, ״וּמַטִּי״ כְּתִיב. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה דָּבָר וּמִתְחָרֵט בּוֹ — מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ מִיָּד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יְרֵאוּנִי״. הָא ״יְרֵאוּנִי״ — מוֹחֲלִין לָהֶם מִיָּד.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: Anyone who distorts the judgment of a convert, it is as if he distorted the judgment of above, as it is stated: “And who turn aside [ umattei ] the convert” is written Umatti , Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa said: Anyone who does something and regrets it, he is forgiven immediately, as it is stated: “And do not fear Me” they fear Me they are forgiven immediately.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Anyone who judges the case of a convert - it is as if he judges the case of the Supreme One, as it is stated: "And the staff of a convert," "and the staff" is written. Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: Anyone who does something and regrets it - forgiveness is granted to him immediately, as it is stated: "And they do not fear Me." If they do "fear Me" - forgiveness is granted to them immediately.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״כִּי אֶת כׇּל מַעֲשֶׂה הָאֱלֹהִים יָבִיא בְמִשְׁפָּט עַל כׇּל נֶעְלָם״. עֶבֶד שֶׁרַבּוֹ שׁוֹקֵל לוֹ שְׁגָגוֹת כִּזְדוֹנוֹת, תַּקָּנָה יֵשׁ לוֹ?!
human_translation: when Rabbi Yoḥanan reached this verse, he cried: “For God shall bring every work into the judgment concerning every hidden thing” a slave whose master weighs his unwitting like intentional is there a remedy for him?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, when he came to this verse, cried: "For God will bring every deed to judgment, including every hidden thing." A slave whose accidental transgressions outweigh his intentional ones, does he have a remedy?!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״עַל כׇּל נֶעְלָם״? אָמַר רַב: זֶה הַהוֹרֵג כִּינָּה בִּפְנֵי חֲבֵרוֹ וְנִמְאָס בָּהּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: זֶה הָרָק בִּפְנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ וְנִמְאָס.
human_translation: What “Concerning every hidden thing”? Rav said: This one who kills a louse in the presence of another and is disgusted by it. And Shmuel said: This one who spits in the presence of another is disgusted
llm_translation: What is "over all hidden"? Rav said: This is one who kills with a nickname in front of his friend and is despised by it. And Shmuel said: This is one who spits in front of his friend and is despised.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִם טוֹב וְאִם רָע״? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: זֶה הַנּוֹתֵן צְדָקָה לְעָנִי בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא. כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָא יָהֵיב זוּזָא לְעָנִי בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוּטָב דְּלָא יְהַבְתְּ לֵיהּ, מֵהַשְׁתָּא דִּיהַבְתְּ לֵיהּ וְכַסֵּפְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: What “Whether it be good, or whether it be evil” from the school of Rabbi Yannai say: This one who gives charity to a poor person in public. as in this of Rabbi Yannai, saw a certain man who was giving a dinar to a poor person in public. He said to him: better had you not given to him than now you gave him and embarrassed him.
llm_translation: What is "good and evil"? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: This is one who gives charity to a poor person openly. For this that Rabbi Yannai saw that man who was giving money to a poor person openly, he said to him: It would have been better if you had not given it to him, rather than now that you have given it and embarrassed him.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרִי, זֶה הַנּוֹתֵן צְדָקָה לְאִשָּׁה בַּסֵּתֶר, דְּקָא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ לִידֵי חֲשָׁדָא. רָבָא אָמַר: זֶה הַמְשַׁגֵּר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ בָּשָׂר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּתָּךְ בְּעַרְבֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Sheila say: This one who gives charity to a woman in private, as he subjects her to suspicion, Rava said: This one who sends his wife meat that is not sliced, on Shabbat eve.
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Sheila said: This is one who gives charity to a woman in secret, for he brings her into suspicion. Rava said: This is one who sends meat to his wife on Erev Shabbat that is not to her liking.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבָא מְשַׁגַּר! שָׁאנֵי בַּת רַב חִסְדָּא, דְּקִים לֵיהּ בְּגַוַּוהּ דִּבְקִיאָה.
human_translation: But Rava send The daughter of Rav Ḥisda, is different, as he was certain about her that she was an expert
llm_translation: And behold, Rava sent a message! It is different with the daughter of Rav Hisda, for she is established in her beauty.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כִּי מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא, בָּכֵי: ״וְהָיָה כִּי תִמְצֶאןָ אוֹתוֹ רָעוֹת רַבּוֹת וְצָרוֹת״. עֶבֶד שֶׁרַבּוֹ מַמְצִיא לוֹ רָעוֹת וְצָרוֹת, תַּקָּנָה יֵשׁ לוֹ?!
human_translation: when Rabbi Yoḥanan reached this verse, he cried: “Then it shall come to pass, when many evils and troubles are come upon them” a slave whose master brings upon him evils and troubles, is there a remedy for him?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, when he came to this verse, cried: "And it shall be, when you find him, many evils and troubles." If a slave whose master brings upon him many evils and troubles, does he have any recourse?!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״רָעוֹת וְצָרוֹת״? אָמַר רַב: רָעוֹת שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוֹת צָרוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ — כְּגוֹן זִיבּוּרָא וְעַקְרַבָּא.
human_translation: What “Evils and troubles”? Rav said: Evils that become troubles for one another, For example, hornet and a scorpion.
llm_translation: What is "ra'ot ve'tzarot"? Rav said: Ra'ot that become tzarot to each other - such as zibura and akarba.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: זֶה הַמַּמְצִיא לוֹ מָעוֹת לֶעָנִי בִּשְׁעַת דּוֹחְקוֹ. אָמַר רָבָא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: זוּזָא לְעַלְלָא לָא שְׁכִיחָא, לִתְלִיתָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: This one who provides money to a poor person during his exigent circumstances, Rava said this that people say: A dinar for produce is not found; for hanging found.
llm_translation: Samuel said: This is one who finds money for a poor person in his time of distress. Rava said: This is what people say: A coin for a child is not common, but for a hanging (execution) it is common.

hebrew_text: ״וְחָרָה אַפִּי בוֹ בַיּוֹם הַהוּא וַעֲזַבְתִּים וְהִסְתַּרְתִּי פָנַי מֵהֶם״, אָמַר רַב בַּרְדְּלָא בַּר טַבְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב: כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּהֶסְתֵּר פָּנִים — אֵינוֹ מֵהֶם, כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּ״וְהָיָה לֶאֱכוֹל״ —
human_translation: “Then My anger shall be kindled against them in that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide My face from them, Rav Bardela bar Tavyumei said Rav said: Anyone who is not subject to hiding of the face, is not from anyone is not subject to: “And they shall be devoured,”
llm_translation: "And My anger shall be kindled against them on that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide My face from them." Rav Bardela bar Tabiomi said in the name of Rav: Anyone who is not in the hiding of the face - is not from them, anyone who is not in 'and he was to eat' -

hebrew_text: אֵינוֹ מֵהֶם. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: מָר לָא בְּהֶסְתֵּר פָּנִים אִיתֵיהּ, וְלָא בִּ״וְהָיָה לֶאֱכוֹל״ אִיתֵיהּ! אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי יָדְעִיתוּ כַּמָּה מְשַׁדַּרְנָא בְּצִנְעָא בֵּי שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא? אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, יְהַבוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן עֵינַיְיהוּ. אַדְּהָכִי שַׁדּוּר דְּבֵי שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא וְגַרְבוּהוּ. אֲמַר: הַיְינוּ דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁ״נָּתְנוּ חֲכָמִים עֵינֵיהֶם״ — אוֹ מִיתָה אוֹ עוֹנִי.
human_translation: is not from them. The Sages said to Rava: Master, you are not subject to hiding face, and you are not subject to: “And they shall be devoured,” He said to them: Do you know how many I send in private to the house of King Shapur? Even so, the Sages looked upon In the meantime, from the house of King Shapur sent and imprisoned him said: This is as it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Wherever the Sages looked upon either death or poverty.
llm_translation: He is not one of them. The Rabbis said to Rava: Master, he was with hidden face, and not with "and he was to eat" with him! He said to them: Who knows how much we transmit in secret in the house of the king of Shabur? Even so, the Rabbis gave him their eyes. Meanwhile, the king of Shabur's house was destroyed and swallowed. He said: This is what was taught, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: "Wherever the sages 'gave their eyes' — either death or poverty."

hebrew_text: ״וְאָנֹכִי הַסְתֵּר אַסְתִּיר פָּנַי בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא״, אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִסְתַּרְתִּי פָּנַי מֵהֶם — ״בַּחֲלוֹם אֲדַבֶּר בּוֹ״. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה עָלֵינוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְצֵל יָדִי כִּסִּיתִיךָ״.
human_translation: “And I will hide my face in that day” Rava said the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Even though I hid my face from them “I speak with him in a dream” Rav Yosef said: His hand is outstretched, over us, as it is stated: “And I have covered you in the shadow of my hand”
llm_translation: "And I will surely hide My face on that day," Rava said, the Holy One, blessed be He, said: Even though I will hide My face from them - "I will speak to him in a dream." Rav Yosef said: His hand is extended over us, as it is stated: "And in the shadow of My hand I have covered you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה הֲוָה קָאֵי בֵּי קֵיסָר, אַחְוִי לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא: עַמָּא דְּאַהְדְּרִינְהוּ מָרֵיהּ לְאַפֵּיהּ מִינֵּיהּ. אַחְוִי לֵיהּ: יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה עָלֵינוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מַאי אַחְוִי לָךְ? עַמָּא דְּאַהְדְּרִינְהוּ מָרֵיהּ לְאַפֵּיהּ מִינֵּיהּ, וַאֲנָא מַחְוֵינָא לֵיהּ יָדוֹ נְטוּיָה עָלֵינוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya was standing in house of the Caesar. A certain heretic, gestured to him, the nation whose Master, turned His face from it. gestured to him His hand is outstretched over us The Caesar said to Rabbi Yehoshua: What did he gesture to you, the nation whose Master turned His face from it, and I gestured to him His hand is outstretched over us.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah was standing in the house of Caesar. That certain heretic said to him: The people who you serve are from your own kind. He said to him: His hand is extended over us. Caesar said to Rabbi Yehoshua: What is "ahvi" to you? The people who you serve are from your own kind, and I am serving Him whose hand is extended over us.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְהָהוּא מִינָא: מַאי אַחְוִיית לֵיהּ? עַמָּא דְּאַהְדְּרִינְהוּ מָרֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ. וּמַאי אַחְוִי לָךְ? לָא יָדַעְנָא. אֲמַרוּ: גַּבְרָא דְּלָא יָדַע מַאי מַחְווּ לֵיהּ, בְּמָחוֹג יַחְוֵי קַמֵּי מַלְכָּא?! אַפְּקוּהוּ וְקַטְלוּהוּ.
human_translation: said to that heretic: What did you gesture to him? the nation whose Master has turned from it. And what did he gesture to you? I don’t know; They said: a man who does not know what gesture to him gesture in the presence of the king? They took him out and killed him.
llm_translation: They said to him: What is your relationship to him? The one who honors his teacher honors his Creator. And what is your relationship to him? I do not know. They said: A man who does not know what to respond to his teacher, how can he respond before the king?! Take him out and kill him.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָא נִיחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: מַאי תֶּיהְוֵי עֲלַן מִמִּינָאֵי? אָמַר לָהֶם: ״אָבְדָה עֵצָה מִבָּנִים נִסְרְחָה חׇכְמָתָם״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָבְדָה עֵצָה מִבָּנִים — נִסְרְחָה חׇכְמָתָן שֶׁל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya was dying, the Sages said to him: What will become of us, from the heretics, He said to them Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom vanished?” Since counsel has perished from the prudent, wisdom of the nations of the world has vanished
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah was at ease, the sages said to him: "What will become of us from our enemies?" He said to them: "The counsel of the young has perished, their wisdom has been corrupted." Once the counsel of the young has perished, the wisdom of the nations of the world has been corrupted.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״וַיֹּאמֶר נִסְעָה וְנֵלֵכָה וְאֵלְכָה לְנֶגְדֶּךָ״.
