human_translation: And if you wish, say from here: “And he said: Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go corresponding to you”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say from here: "And he said, 'Let us journey and go, and I will go before you.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אִילָא הֲוָה סָלֵיק בְּדַרְגָּא דְּבֵי רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא. שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא דַּהֲוָה קָא קָרֵי: ״כִּי הִנֵּה יוֹצֵר הָרִים וּבוֹרֵא רוּחַ וּמַגִּיד לְאָדָם מַה שִּׂיחוֹ״. אָמַר: עֶבֶד שֶׁרַבּוֹ מַגִּיד לוֹ מַה שִּׂיחוֹ תַּקָּנָה יֵשׁ לוֹ?! מַאי ״מַה שִּׂיחוֹ״? אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ שִׂיחָה יְתֵירָה שֶׁבֵּין אִישׁ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ מַגִּידִים לוֹ לְאָדָם בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ila was ascending the stairs in the house of Rabba bar Sheila, He heard a child who was reading “For, lo, He Who forms the mountains, and creates the wind, and declares to man what is his speech” said: a servant whose master declares to him what is his speech, is there a remedy for him? What “What is his speech”? Rav said: Even frivolous speech that is between a man and his wife is declared to a person at the time of death,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ila was ascending in the steps of the house of Rabba bar Sheilah. He heard a child who was reading: "For behold, He forms mountains and creates the wind, and declares to man what is his thought." He said: If a slave whose master increases his value informs him of his thoughts, does he have any acquisition?! What is "his thought"? Rav said: Even the extra conversation between a man and his wife, they inform him at the time of death.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא רַב כָּהֲנָא הֲוָה גָּנֵי תּוּתֵי פּוּרְיֵיהּ דְּרַב, וְשַׁמְעֵיהּ דְּסָח וְצָחַק וְעָשָׂה צְרָכָיו. אֲמַר: דָּמֵי פּוּמֵּיהּ דְּרַב כְּמַאן דְּלָא טְעִים לֵיהּ תַּבְשִׁילָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כָּהֲנָא, פּוֹק! לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא!
human_translation: Is that so? Wasn’t Rav Kahana lying beneath Rav’s bed, and he heard chatting and laughing and performing his needs, said The mouth of Rav is like has never eaten a cooked dish, said to him: Kahana, leave, as not proper conduct.
llm_translation: I? But didn't Rav Kahana used to gather the figs of Rav, and his attendant would roast, laugh, and prepare his needs. He said: The taste of Rav's mouth is like one who does not taste his dish. He said to him: Kahana, go out! You are not fit for the land!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן דִּצְרִיךְ לְרַצּוֹיַהּ, הָא דְּלָא צְרִיךְ לְרַצּוֹיַהּ.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, where he must appease this where he doesn’t need to appease her.
llm_translation: Not difficult: here where it requires consent, there where it does not require consent.

hebrew_text: ״וְאִם לֹא תִשְׁמָעוּהָ בְּמִסְתָּרִים תִּבְכֶּה נַפְשִׁי מִפְּנֵי גֵוָה״, אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אִינְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: מָקוֹם יֵשׁ לוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּמִסְתָּרִים שְׁמוֹ. מַאי ״מִפְּנֵי גֵוָה״? אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: מִפְּנֵי גַּאֲווֹתָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּיטְּלָה מֵהֶם וְנִתְּנָה לַגּוֹיִם. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי גַּאֲווֹתָהּ שֶׁל מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: “But if you will not hear it, my soul shall weep in secret [ bemistarim ] for your pride” Rav Shmuel bar Inya said in the name of Rav: The Holy One, Blessed be He, has a place and its name is Mistarim. What “for your pride”? Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: due to the pride of the Jewish people, which was taken from them and given to nations. Rav Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: due to the pride of the kingdom of Heaven,
llm_translation: "And if you will not listen to it in secret, my soul will weep because of pride," said Rav Shmuel bar Inyai in the name of Rav: The Holy One, blessed be He, has a place and His name is hidden. What is 'because of pride'? Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: Because of the arrogance of the Israelites, which was taken from them and given to the nations. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Because of the arrogance of the heavenly kingdom.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא בְּכִיָּה קַמֵּיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא? וְהָאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֵין עֲצִיבוּת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹד וְהָדָר לְפָנָיו עוֹז וְחֶדְוָה בִּמְקוֹמוֹ״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּבָתֵּי גַוָּאֵי, הָא בְּבָתֵּי בַרָאֵי.
human_translation: But is there crying before the Holy One, Blessed be He? Didn’t Rav Pappa say: There is no sadness before the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “Honor and majesty are before Him; strength and gladness are in His place” not difficult. This the innermost chambers, this the outer chambers.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is there weeping before the Holy One, blessed be He? But Rav Papa said: There is no sadness before the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: "Splendor and majesty are before Him, strength and joy are in His place" (1 Chronicles 16:27)! It is not difficult: this is in the houses of arrogance, and that is in the houses of creation.

hebrew_text: וּבְבָתֵּי בַרָאֵי לָא? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֲדֹנָי ה׳ צְבָאוֹת בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא לִבְכִי וּלְמִסְפֵּד וּלְקׇרְחָה וְלַחֲגוֹר שָׂק״! שָׁאנֵי חֻרְבַּן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, דַּאֲפִילּוּ מַלְאֲכֵי שָׁלוֹם בְּכוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֵן אֶרְאֶלָּם צָעֲקוּ חוּצָה מַלְאֲכֵי שָׁלוֹם מַר יִבְכָּיוּן״.
human_translation: And doesn’t in the outer chambers? Isn’t it written: “And on that day the Lord, the God of hosts, called to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to girding with sackcloth” The destruction of the Temple is different, as even the angels of peace cried, as it is stated: “Behold, their valiant ones cry without; the angels of peace weep bitterly”
llm_translation: In the houses of the sons of the nobles? But isn't it written: "And the Lord God of hosts called in that day for weeping, and for mourning, and for baldness, and for girding with sackcloth!" This is different from the destruction of the Temple, for even the angels of peace weep over it, as it is said: "Behold, Ariel cried without, the angels of peace weep bitterly."

hebrew_text: ״וְדָמֹעַ תִּדְמַע וְתֵרַד עֵינִי דִּמְעָה כִּי נִשְׁבָּה עֵדֶר ה׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שָׁלֹשׁ דְּמָעוֹת הַלָּלוּ לָמָּה? אַחַת עַל מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, וְאַחַת עַל מִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, וְאַחַת עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁגָּלוּ מִמְּקוֹמָן. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אַחַת עַל בִּיטּוּל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: “And my eye shall weep sore, and run down with tears, because the Lord’s flock is carried away captive” Rabbi Elazar said: Why these three tears One for the First Temple; one for the Second Temple; and one for the Jewish people who were exiled from their place. And there are who say: one for dereliction Torah
llm_translation: "And 'you shall weep blood and your eyes shall flow with tears, for the flock of the Lord has been taken captive,'" Rabbi Elazar said: Why are these three tears? One for the First Temple, and one for the Second Temple, and one for the Jewish people who were exiled from their place. And there are those who say: One for the neglect of Torah."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁגָּלוּ, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי נִשְׁבָּה עֵדֶר ה׳״, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עַל בִּיטּוּל תּוֹרָה — מַאי ״כִּי נִשְׁבָּה עֵדֶר ה׳״? כֵּיוָן שֶׁגָּלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמְּקוֹמָן — אֵין לְךָ בִּיטּוּל תּוֹרָה גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said for the Jewish people who were exiled, this is as it is written: “Because the Lord’s flock is carried away captive.” However, according to the one who said for the dereliction Torah, what “Because the Lord’s flock is carried away captive”? Since the Jewish people were exiled from their place, there is no greater dereliction Torah than this.
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says that concerning Israel who were exiled, this is as it is written: "For the flock of the Lord has been taken captive." However, according to the one who says concerning the nullification of the Torah - what is the meaning of "For the flock of the Lord has been taken captive"? Once Israel were exiled from their place - you have no greater nullification of the Torah than this.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, שְׁלֹשָׁה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בּוֹכֶה עֲלֵיהֶן בְּכׇל יוֹם: עַל שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה וְאֵינוֹ עוֹסֵק, וְעַל שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲסוֹק בְּתוֹרָה וְעוֹסֵק, וְעַל פַּרְנָס הַמִּתְגָּאֶה עַל הַצִּבּוּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught three for whom the Holy One, Blessed be He, cries every day: For who is able to engage in Torah and does not engage and for who is unable to engage in Torah engages and for a leader who lords over the community.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three things the Holy One, blessed be He, weeps over every day: Over one who has the opportunity to engage in Torah study but does not do so, over one who is engaged in Torah study when it is not possible for him to do so, and over a communal leader who is haughty towards the community.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי הֲוָה נָקֵיט סֵפֶר קִינוֹת וְקָא קָרֵי בְּגַוֵּיהּ, כִּי מְטָא לְהַאי פְּסוּקָא ״הִשְׁלִיךְ מִשָּׁמַיִם אֶרֶץ״ — נְפַל מִן יְדֵיהּ, אֲמַר: מֵאִיגָּרָא רָם לְבֵירָא עַמִּיקְתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi was holding book of Lamentations and was reading from it. When he reached the verse: “He has cast down from heaven to earth fell from his hand. He said: From a high roof to a deep pit,
llm_translation: Rabbi Hava took a book of Lamentations and was reading it, when he came to the verse, "He has cast down from heaven to earth" (Lamentations 2:1), he dropped it from his hands and said: "From the roof to the depth of the pit."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא הֲווֹ שָׁקְלִי וְאָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא, כִּי מְטוֹ לְהָהוּא מָתָא, אָמְרִי: אִיכָּא צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן הָכָא? נֵזִיל וְנַיקְבֵּיל אַפֵּיהּ. אָמְרִי: אִיכָּא צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן הָכָא, וּמְאוֹר עֵינַיִם הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְרַבִּי: תִּיב אַתְּ, לָא תְּזַלְזֵל בִּנְשִׂיאוּתָךְ. אֵיזִיל אֲנָא וְאַקְבֵּיל אַפֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi and Rabbi Ḥiyya were walking along the road. When they arrived at a certain city, they said: Is there a Torah scholar here whom we go and greet? said: There is a Torah scholar here but he is blind. Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Rabbi You sit do not demean your Nasi I will go and greet him.
llm_translation: Rabbi and Rabbi Chiya were walking on the road, when they reached a certain place, they said: Is there a rock from the Sages here? Let us go and kiss it. They said: Is there a rock from the Sages here, and it is the light of the eyes. Rabbi Chiya said to Rabbi: Sit, do not belittle your leadership. I will go and kiss it.

hebrew_text: תַּקְפֵיהּ וַאֲזַל בַּהֲדֵיהּ. כִּי הֲווֹ מִיפַּטְרִי מִינֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַתֶּם הִקְבַּלְתֶּם פָּנִים הַנִּרְאִים וְאֵינָן רוֹאִין — תִּזְכּוּ לְהַקְבִּיל פָּנִים הָרוֹאִים וְאֵינָן נִרְאִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיכוּ הַשְׁתָּא מְנַעְתַּן מֵהַאי בִּירְכְּתָא.
human_translation: grabbed him and went with him When they were leaving him, he said to them: You greeted seen and does not see; may you be worthy to greet sees and is not seen. said to Now, if you would have prevented me from receiving this blessing.
llm_translation: His heels and went with him. When they were about to part from him, he said to them: "You have accepted the visible face and not the unseen — may you merit to accept the unseen face and not the visible." He said to him: "How do you now withhold from this in the thigh?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מִמַּאן שְׁמִיעָא לָךְ? מִפִּרְקֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב שְׁמִיעַ לִי, דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אִישׁ כְּפַר חִיטַּיָּיא הֲוָה מְקַבֵּיל אַפֵּיהּ דְּרַבֵּיהּ כׇּל יוֹמָא. כִּי קַשׁ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא נִצְטַעַר מָר, דְּלָא יָכֵיל מָר.
human_translation: They said to From whom did you hear I heard from the instruction of Rabbi Ya’akov, as Rabbi Ya’akov of the village of Ḥitiyya would greet his teacher every day. When grew elderly, said to him: Do not despair, my Master, that my Master is unable
llm_translation: They said to him: From whom do you hear? From the teachings of Rabbi Yaakov I hear, for Rabbi Yaakov, a man of Kfar Chittai, would greet his teacher every day. When he was in distress, he would say to him: Master, you are not pained, for you cannot be pained.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, מִי זוּטַר מַאי דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ בְּרַבָּנַן: ״וִיחִי עוֹד לָנֶצַח לֹא יִרְאֶה הַשָּׁחַת כִּי יִרְאֶה חֲכָמִים יָמוּתוּ״. וּמָה הָרוֹאֶה חֲכָמִים בְּמִיתָתָן יִחְיֶה — בְּחַיֵּיהֶן עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: said to him: Is it minor that which is written about the Sages: “That he should still live always, that he should not see the pit. For he sees that wise men die” Just as one who sees Sages in their death will live, all the more so in their lifetime.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Who is Zutar? What is written about him in the words of the sages: 'And he shall still live forever, he shall not see the Pit, for he shall see wise men die.' And if one who sees wise men die will live, how much more so those who cause their death."

hebrew_text: רַב אִידִי אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי הֲוָה רְגִיל דַּהֲוָה אָזֵיל תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי בְּאוֹרְחָא וְחַד יוֹמָא בְּבֵי רַב, וַהֲווֹ קָרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן ״בַּר בֵּי רַב דְּחַד יוֹמָא״. חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, קָרֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ: ״שְׂחוֹק לְרֵעֵהוּ אֶהְיֶה וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּמָטוּתָא מִינָּךְ, לָא תַּעְנֵישׁ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Idi, father of Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi, would regularly travel three months on the road and one day in the school of Rav. And the Sages would call him: A student for one day. He was offended read about himself: “I am as one that is a laughingstock to his neighbor, Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Please do not punish the Sages,
llm_translation: Rav Idi, the father of Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi, used to go out for three months on the road, and one day he was in the house of Rav. The Rabbis called him "Bar Bei Rav" for one day. His mind weakened, he called out to himself: "I will be a laughingstock to my friends, etc." Rabbi Yochanan said to him: With your staff, do not punish the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: נְפַק רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא וּדְרַשׁ: ״וְאוֹתִי יוֹם יוֹם יִדְרֹשׁוּן וְדַעַת דְּרָכַי יֶחְפָּצוּן״. וְכִי בַּיּוֹם דּוֹרְשִׁין אוֹתוֹ וּבַלַּיְלָה אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין אוֹתוֹ?! אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד בַּשָּׁנָה — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ עָסַק כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan left to the study hall and taught: “Yet they seek Me daily, and delight to know My ways” But is during the day they seek Him and at night they do not seek Him? Rather, to say to you anyone who engages in Torah even one day a year, the verse ascribes him as though he engaged the entire year.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan went out to the study hall and expounded: "And they seek me day by day and desire to know my ways." Do they seek Him only during the day and not at night?! Rather, to tell you: Anyone who engages in Torah study, even one day in the year, the Scripture credits it to him as if he had engaged in it the entire year.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּמִדַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּמִסְפַּר הַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר תַּרְתֶּם אֶת הָאָרֶץ״. וְכִי אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה חָטְאוּ? וַהֲלֹא אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם חָטְאוּ! אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד בַּשָּׁנָה — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ עָבַר כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: And the same to the attribute of punishment, as it is written: “After the number of the days in which you spied out the land, But did they sin forty years? Didn’t they sin forty days? Rather, to say to you anyone who transgresses a sin even one day a year, the verse ascribes him as though he transgressed the entire year.
llm_translation: And so too in the attribute of punishment, as it is written: "In the number of days that you spied out the land." And did they sin for forty years? Was it not for forty days that they sinned! Rather, to tell you: Anyone who commits a transgression, even for one day in the year, the Scripture accounts it to him as if he had transgressed the entire year.

hebrew_text: אֵי זֶהוּ קָטָן — כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִרְכּוֹב עַל כְּתֵפוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא:
human_translation: Who is a minor Any who is unable to ride on his father’s shoulders Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ei zehu katan - kol she'eino yachol lirkov al k'tevo shel aviv." Matkeif lah Rabbi Zeira:

hebrew_text: עַד הָכָא, מַאן אַתְיֵיהּ?
human_translation: Who brought him to here,
llm_translation: Until here, who is coming?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: עַד הָכָא דְּמִיחַיְּיבָא אִימֵּיהּ בְּשִׂמְחָה — אַיְיתִיתֵיהּ אִימֵּיהּ. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, אִם יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת וְלֶאֱחוֹז בְּיָדוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְהַר הַבַּיִת — חַיָּיב, וְאִי לָא — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: to here, as his mother is obligated in rejoicing his mother brought him From this forward, if he is able to ascend and hold his father’s hand from Jerusalem to the Temple Mount, he is obligated, and if not, he is exempt.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Until here that he obligated his mother with joy - he brought her. From here and onwards, if he is able to go up and take hold of his father's hand from Jerusalem to the Temple Mount - he is obligated, and if not - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: הֵשִׁיב רַבִּי תַּחַת בֵּית הִלֵּל: לְדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, ״וְחַנָּה לֹא עָלָתָה כִּי אָמְרָה לְאִישָׁהּ עַד יִגָּמֵל הַנַּעַר וַהֲבִיאוֹתִיו״ — וְהָא שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּיָכוֹל לִרְכּוֹב עַל כְּתֵיפוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi responded in place of Beit Hillel, according to the statement of Beit Shammai “But Hanna did not ascend, for she said to her husband: Until the child is weaned, when I will bring him” But Samuel was able to ride on his father’s shoulders.
llm_translation: Rabbi replaced Beit Hillel: According to the words of Beit Shammai, "And Hannah did not go up, for she said to her husband, 'I will not go up until the child is weaned, and then I will bring him.'" — But Samuel, who could ride on his father's shoulder, was there.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ, חַנָּה גּוּפַהּ מִי לָא מִיחַיְּיבָא בְּשִׂמְחָה? אֶלָּא חַנָּה, מְפַנְּקוּתָא יַתִּירְתָּא חַזְיָיא בֵּיהּ בִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְחַשָּׁא בֵּיהּ בִּשְׁמוּאֵל לְחוּלְשָׁא דְאוֹרְחָא.
human_translation: father said to him: According to your reasoning, ask about Hanna herself: Wasn’t she obligated in rejoicing? Rather, Hanna saw in Samuel extra pampering, and she was concerned about Samuel weakness from the journey.
llm_translation: He said to him, his father: And according to your reasoning, will it be difficult for you, Chanah herself, who was not obligated in joy? Rather, Chanah, from her excessive indulgence, see in her in the Book of Samuel, and see in her in the Book of Samuel for weakness of the way.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: קָטָן חִיגֵּר לְדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וְסוֹמֵא לְדִבְרֵי שְׁנֵיהֶם, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon raises a dilemma: a minor lame according to the statement of Beit Shammai, and blind according to the statements of both what is
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Shimon: A minor invalidates according to the words of Beit Shammai, and a blind person according to the words of both, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בְּחִיגֵּר שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהִתְפַּשֵּׁט, וְסוֹמֵא שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהִתְפַּתֵּחַ? הַשְׁתָּא גָּדוֹל — פָּטוּר, קָטָן — מִיבַּעְיָא?! לָא צְרִיכָא: בְּחִיגֵּר שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהִתְפַּשֵּׁט, וְסוֹמֵא שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהִתְפַּתֵּחַ, מַאי?
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say to a lame who cannot be healed, and a blind who cannot develop Now, an adult is exempt, is necessary a minor? No; necessary to a lame who can be healed and a blind who can develop What
llm_translation: How are they similar? If you say in a case of a fetus that cannot be delivered and a blind person who cannot see, in the case of an adult - he is exempt, but in the case of a minor - what is the law? It is not necessary: in a case of a fetus that can be delivered and a blind person who can see, what is the law?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּגָדוֹל מִיחַיַּיב מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — קָטָן נָמֵי מְחַנְּכִינַן לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבָּנַן, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּגָדוֹל פָּטוּר מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — מִדְּרַבָּנַן קָטָן נָמֵי פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Abaye said: Anywhere that an adult is obligated by Torah law, one also train a minor by rabbinic law. Anywhere that an adult is exempt by Torah law, a minor is also exempt by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Wherever an adult is obligated by Torah law, we also educate a minor from Rabbinic law. Wherever an adult is exempt from Torah law, a minor is also exempt from Rabbinic law."

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הָרְאִיָּיה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: appearance, two silver
llm_translation: House of Shammai say: The betrothal is two silver coins.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הָרְאִיָּיה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף, וְהַחֲגִיגָה מָעָה כֶּסֶף. שֶׁהָרְאִיָּיה עוֹלָה כּוּלָּהּ לַגָּבוֹהַּ, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּחֲגִיגָה, וְעוֹד: מָצִינוּ בָּעֲצֶרֶת שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶן הַכָּתוּב בְּעוֹלוֹת יוֹתֵר מִבִּשְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught Beit Shammai say: appearance two silver and the Festival peace silver ma’a . that appearance up entirely to God, which is not so with regard to the Festival peace a peace And furthermore, we find with regard to Assembly, that the verse includes more burnt than peace
llm_translation: The sages taught: Beit Shammai say, the 'eriyah costs two silver coins, and the chagigah costs one silver coin. For the 'eriyah is entirely burnt on the altar, which is not the case with the chagigah. Furthermore, we find in the assembly that the Scripture mentions more burnt offerings than peace offerings.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: הָרְאִיָּיה מָעָה כֶּסֶף וַחֲגִיגָה שְׁתֵּי כֶסֶף. שֶׁחֲגִיגָה יֶשְׁנָהּ לִפְנֵי הַדִּיבּוּר, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בִּרְאִיָּיה. וְעוֹד: מָצִינוּ בַּנְּשִׂיאִים שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶן הַכָּתוּב בִּשְׁלָמִים יוֹתֵר מִבְּעוֹלוֹת.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: appearance one silver ma’a and the Festival peace two silver that the Festival peace existed before the speech which is not so with regard to appearance. And furthermore, we find with regard to that the verse includes more peace than burnt
llm_translation: The House of Hillel says: The burnt offering is one silver and the festival offering is two silver. For the festival offering, its age is before the speaking, which is not the case for the burnt offering. And furthermore: We found with the princes that the Scripture emphasized peace offerings more than burnt offerings.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמְרִי כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? דְּקָא אָמְרַתְּ: רְאִיָּיה עֲדִיפָא — דְּעוֹלָה כּוּלָּהּ לַגָּבוֹהַּ, אַדְּרַבָּה: חֲגִיגָה עֲדִיפָא — דְּאִית בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי אֲכִילוֹת. וּדְקָא אָמְרַתְּ: נֵילַף מֵעֲצֶרֶת — דָּנִין קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד מִקׇּרְבַּן יָחִיד, וְאֵין דָּנִין קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד מִקׇּרְבַּן צִבּוּר.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel, what is the reason they do not say in accordance with Beit Shammai? that which you said, appearance is superior because it up entirely to God, on the contrary, the Festival peace is superior, as it has two consumptions, And that which you said we derive from Assembly, one derive the offering of an individual from offering of an individual, and one does not derive of the offering of an individual from the communal offering
llm_translation: House of Hillel, what is the reason they did not say like House of Shammai? Because you say: "Sight is preferable" - for it is all ascending, on the contrary: "Festive offering is preferable" - for it contains two eatings. And because you say: "We derive from the festival" - they judge an individual offering separately from an individual offering, and they do not judge an individual offering from a communal offering.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמְרִי כְּבֵית הִלֵּל? דְּקָאָמְרַתְּ: חֲגִיגָה עֲדִיפָא — דְּיֶשְׁנָהּ לִפְנֵי הַדִּיבּוּר, רְאִיָּיה נָמֵי יֶשְׁנָהּ לִפְנֵי הַדִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: And what is the reason Beit Shammai do not say in accordance with Beit Hillel? With regard to that which you said, the Festival peace is superior, as it existed before the speech appearance also existed before the speech.
llm_translation: House of Shammai, what is the reason they do not say like House of Hillel? Because they say: The festival offering is preferable - for it existed before the utterance, and seeing is also preferable - for it existed before the utterance.

hebrew_text: וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: נֵילַף מִנְּשִׂיאִים — דָּנִין דָּבָר הַנּוֹהֵג לְדוֹרוֹת מִדָּבָר הַנּוֹהֵג לְדוֹרוֹת, וְאֵין דָּנִין דָּבָר הַנּוֹהֵג לְדוֹרוֹת מִדָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: And with regard to that which you said, one derives from the princes, one derives of a matter that is performed in generations, from matter that is performed in generations, one does not derive of a matter that is performed in generations from a matter that is not performed in generations,
llm_translation: And she said: We derive the following principle from princes - that one judges a matter that is customary for generations from a matter that is customary for generations, and one does not judge a matter that is customary for generations from a matter that is not customary for generations.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל, מַאי שְׁנָא חֲגִיגָה דְּיֶשְׁנָהּ לִפְנֵי הַדִּיבּוּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּזְבְּחוּ זְבָחִים שְׁלָמִים״, רְאִיָּיה נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעֲלוּ עוֹלוֹת״!
human_translation: And Beit Hillel, what is different the Festival peace that it existed before the speech as it is written: “And they sacrificed peace-offerings appearance also isn’t it written “And they sacrificed burnt
llm_translation: House of Hillel, what is the difference of the festival offering that it is repeated before the speaking, as it is written: "And they sacrificed peace offerings," another proof, it is written: "And they offered burnt offerings!"

hebrew_text: קָסָבְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל: עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר — עוֹלַת תָּמִיד הֲוַאי. וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר — עוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Beit Hillel hold the burnt that the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert was the daily burnt And Beit Shammai hold the burnt that the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert was a burnt of appearance,
llm_translation: The House of Hillel holds: The burnt offering that the Israelites brought in the wilderness - it was a continual burnt offering. And the House of Shammai holds: The burnt offering that the Israelites brought in the wilderness - it was a burnt offering of appearance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ: עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר — עוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה הֲוַאי. וּבֵית הִלֵּל, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ: עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר — עוֹלַת תָּמִיד הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Abaye said: Beit Shammai, Rabbi Elazar, and Rabbi Yishmael all hold the burnt that the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert was a burnt of appearance. And Beit Hillel, Rabbi Akiva, and Rabbi Yosei HaGelili all hold the burnt that the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert was a daily burnt
llm_translation: Abaye said: Beit Shammai, and Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Yishmael, all of them hold: the burnt offering that the Israelites offered in the wilderness was a burnt offering of appeasement. And Beit Hillel, and Rabbi Akiva, and Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, all of them hold: the burnt offering that the Israelites offered in the wilderness was a burnt offering of regularity.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: כְּלָלוֹת נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּסִינַי,
human_translation: Beit Shammai that which we said. Rabbi Yishmael, as it is taught Rabbi Yishmael says: General statements were said at Sinai,
llm_translation: House of Shammai - this that we said. Rabbi Yishmael - as it was taught, Rabbi Yishmael says: General principles were stated at Sinai,

hebrew_text: וּפְרָטוֹת בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כְּלָלוֹת וּפְרָטוֹת נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּסִינַי, וְנִשְׁנוּ בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, וְנִשְׁתַּלְּשׁוּ בְּעַרְבוֹת מוֹאָב. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר — עוֹלַת תָּמִיד הֲוַאי,
human_translation: And the details in the Tent of Meeting. And Rabbi Akiva says: general statements and the details were said at Sinai and repeated in the Tent of Meeting, and a third time in the plains of Moab, And if it enters your mind the burnt that the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert was the daily burnt
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And details in the Tent of Meeting. And Rabbi Akiva says: Generalizations and details were stated at Sinai, and repeated in the Tent of Meeting, and were detached in the plains of Moab. And if you were to suggest that the burnt offering that the Israelites brought in the wilderness was a continual burnt offering, it is not so.

hebrew_text: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָא בָּעֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ, וּלְבַסּוֹף בָּעֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ?!
human_translation: Is there any that initially did not require skinning and cutting and ultimately, required skinning and cutting?
llm_translation: Who has it from the beginning that does not require explanation and analysis, and in the end requires explanation and analysis?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר — דְּתַנְיָא: ״עוֹלַת תָּמִיד הָעֲשׂוּיָה בְּהַר סִינַי״, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מַעֲשֶׂיהָ נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּסִינַי, וְהִיא עַצְמָהּ לֹא קָרְבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar. As it is taught “It is a daily burnt- which was performed on Mount Sinai” Rabbi Elazar says: its performance were said at Sinai, but it itself was not sacrificed
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar — as it was taught: "The continual burnt offering that was performed on Mount Sinai," Rabbi Elazar says: Its actions were stated at Sinai, but it itself was not brought near.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: קָרְבָה, וְשׁוּב לֹא פָּסְקָה. אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״הַזְּבָחִים וּמִנְחָה הִגַּשְׁתֶּם לִי בַמִּדְבָּר אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל״ —
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It was sacrificed and never ceased. But how do I uphold, “Did you bring to Me sacrifices and offerings for forty years in the wilderness, house of Israel?”
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "She approached, yet did not cease." Rather, how do I fulfill "You brought Me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness for forty years, O house of Israel" —

hebrew_text: שִׁבְטוֹ שֶׁל לֵוִי שֶׁלֹּא עָבְדוּ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, הֵן הִקְרִיבוּ אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: The tribe of Levi, which did not commit idol worship, sacrificed it
llm_translation: The tribe of Levi did not serve in foreign service, rather they offered it.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הִלֵּל — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — הָא נָמֵי דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי — דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ מִצְוֹת נִצְטַוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּעֲלוֹתָם לָרֶגֶל: רְאִיָּיה, וַחֲגִיגָה, וְשִׂמְחָה.
human_translation: Beit Hillel: That which we said. Rabbi Akiva: Also that which we said, Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: As it is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: The Jewish people were commanded three mitzvot when they ascended for Festivals: appearance, and the Festival peace and the rejoicing.
llm_translation: House of Hillel - this that we say. Rabbi Akiva - this that we say. Rabbi Yosei the Galilean - as it was taught, Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: Three commandments were commanded to the children of Israel upon their pilgrimage: Sight, festival offering, and joy.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בָּרְאִיָּיה שֶׁאֵין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן; וְיֵשׁ בַּחֲגִיגָה שֶׁאֵין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן; יֵשׁ בַּשִּׂמְחָה שֶׁאֵין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן. יֵשׁ בָּרְאִיָּיה שֶׁאֵין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן — שֶׁהָרְאִיָּיה עוֹלָה כּוּלָּהּ לַגָּבוֹהַּ, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: There is of the appearance that is not in two; there is of the Festival peace that is not in two; there is of the rejoicing that is not in two. There is of the appearance that is not in two, as the appearance up entirely to God, which is not so with regard to two,
llm_translation: There is in the creation that is not in both of them; and there is in the festival offering that is not in both of them; there is in the joy that is not in both of them. There is in the creation that is not in both of them - for the creation ascends entirely upwards, which is not the case with both of them.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בַּחֲגִיגָה מַה שֶּׁאֵין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן, שֶׁחֲגִיגָה יֶשְׁנָהּ לִפְנֵי הַדִּיבּוּר, מַה שֶּׁאֵין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן. יֵשׁ בַּשִּׂמְחָה מַה שֶּׁאֵין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן, שֶׁהַשִּׂמְחָה נוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וּבְנָשִׁים, מַה שֶּׁאֵין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: There is of the Festival peace that is not in two, as the Festival peace existed before the speech which is not so with regard to two. there is of the rejoicing that is not in two, as the rejoicing is performed by men and by women, which is not so with regard to two.
llm_translation: There is in the festival offering what is not in both of them, that the festival offering is old before the speaking, what is not in both of them. There is in the joy what is not in both of them, that the joy is practiced by men and women, what is not in both of them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, מַאי טַעְמָא קָא מוֹקְמַתְּ לֵיהּ כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? אִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר עוֹלַת תָּמִיד הֲוַאי, מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָא בָּעֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ, וּלְבַסּוֹף בָּעֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ?!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael, what is the reason you established in accordance with Beit Shammai If it enters your mind burnt the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert was a daily burnt is there any that initially did not require skinning and cutting and ultimately required skinning and cutting
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, what is the reason that he establishes it like Beit Shammai? If according to your opinion, the burnt offering that the Israelites offered in the desert was a continual burnt offering, why did it not require initial clarification and analysis, and ultimately require clarification and analysis?!

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר: עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר — עוֹלַת תָּמִיד הֲוַאי: מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא בָּעֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ, וּלְבַסּוֹף בָּעֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ.
human_translation: But wasn’t Rabbi Yosei HaGelili who said: The burnt that the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert was the daily burnt initially did not require skinning and cutting and ultimately required skinning and cutting
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said: The burnt offering that the children of Israel brought in the wilderness - it was a continual burnt offering: initially it did not require interpretation and analysis, but ultimately it did require interpretation and analysis.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר אֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ אֶלָּא מֵאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד וְאֵילָךְ! סְמִי מִכָּאן רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: The burnt- that the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert did not require skinning and cutting because skinning and cutting only from the Tent of Meeting and onward. delete Rabbi Yishmael from here,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: The burnt offering that the Israelites brought in the wilderness does not require skinning and dismembering, because skinning and dismembering are only done from the Tent of Meeting and onwards! This is a support for Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב חִסְדָּא: הַאי קְרָא הֵיכִי כְּתִיב? ״וַיִּשְׁלַח אֶת נַעֲרֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וַיַּעֲלוּ עוֹלוֹת״ — כְּבָשִׂים, ״וַיִּזְבְּחוּ זְבָחִים שְׁלָמִים לַה׳״ — ״פָּרִים״. אוֹ דִּלְמָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי פָּרִים הֲווֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raises a dilemma: This verse, how is it written, “And he sent the young men of the children of Israel, and they sacrificed burnt- ” sheep; “And they sacrificed peace- of bulls to the Lord,” Or perhaps both of these bulls,
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Chisda: How is this verse written? "And he sent the youth of the children of Israel, and they brought burnt offerings" — lambs, "and they sacrificed peace offerings to the Lord" — bulls. Or perhaps: Both lambs and bulls were offered.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: לְפִיסּוּק טְעָמִים.
human_translation: What is the practical difference Mar Zutra said: to the punctuation of notes,
llm_translation: Regarding what does this matter come out? Mar Zutra said: For the determination of flavors.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: לָאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי עוֹלָה כָּעוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר״, מַאי? פָּרִים הֲווֹ, אוֹ כְּבָשִׂים הֲווֹ?! תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said for one who says upon me a burnt like the burnt that the Jewish people sacrificed in the desert What Were they bulls were they sheep? shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rava, said: Does one say, "Behold, upon me is an elevation offering like the elevation offering that the children of Israel brought in the wilderness"? What is it? Were they bulls or were they sheep? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם, אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם שִׁיעוּר:
human_translation: We learned there These are that have no measure:
llm_translation: We learned there: these are the things that have no measure:

hebrew_text: הַפֵּאָה, וְהַבִּכּוּרִים, וְהָרֵאָיוֹן, וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Produce in the corner of the field which is given to the poor pe’a and the first fruits, and the appearance and acts of loving-kindness; and Torah study.
llm_translation: The corner, and the first fruits, and the appearance, and acts of loving-kindness, and the study of Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כִּסְבוּרִין אָנוּ לוֹמַר, הָרֵאָיוֹן אֵין לוֹ שִׁיעוּר — לְמַעְלָה, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ שִׁיעוּר — לְמַטָּה, עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרַבִּי, וְלִימֵּד: הָרֵאָיוֹן אֵין לוֹ שִׁיעוּר לֹא לְמַעְלָה וְלֹא לְמַטָּה. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הָרְאִיָּיה מָעָה כֶּסֶף, וְהַחֲגִיגָה שְׁתֵּי כֶסֶף.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: We thought to say that the appearance does not have a maximum measure, but it does have a minimum measure; until Rabbi Oshaya the Distinguished came and taught: The appearance has neither a maximum nor a minimum measure. However, the Rabbis say: appearance silver ma’a and the Festival peace two silver
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: We might think to say, if the "re'ayon" has no measurement - above, but if it has a measurement - below, until Rabbi Oshaya son of Rabbi came and taught: the "re'ayon" has no measurement neither above nor below. But the sages say: the "re'iyyah" is worth one silver coin, and the "chagigah" is worth two silver coins.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָרֵאָיוֹן? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: רְאִיַּית פָּנִים בַּעֲזָרָה, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: רְאִיַּית פָּנִים בְּקׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: What is the appearance Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the appearance of face in courtyard. And Reish Lakish said: the appearance of face with an offering.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "הָרֵאָיוֹן"? Rabbi Yochanan said: Seeing the face in the Temple courtyard, and Reish Lakish said: Seeing the face in the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: בָּעִיקָּר הָרֶגֶל, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּרְאִיַּית פָּנִים בְּקׇרְבָּן. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הָרֶגֶל: כׇּל הֵיכָא דַּאֲתָא וְאַיְיתִי — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּמְקַבְּלִינַן מִינֵּיהּ, כִּי פְּלִיגִי דַּאֲתָא וְלָא אַיְיתִי.
human_translation: On the main the pilgrimage Festival, everyone agrees that the appearance of face by an offering. When they disagree, to the rest of the days of the pilgrimage Festival, anywhere, that one comes and brings everyone agrees that we accept it from him. When they disagree, when he comes and does not bring
llm_translation: In the main, everyone agrees that the appearance of the face in the offering is not significant. For they disagree regarding the rest of the days of the festival: wherever one comes and brings — everyone agrees that we do not accept from him, for they disagree that one comes and does not bring.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר: רְאִיַּית פָּנִים בָּעֲזָרָה, דְּכׇל אֵימַת דְּאָתֵי לָא צָרִיךְ לְאֵתוֹיֵי, רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: רְאִיַּית פָּנִים בְּקׇרְבָּן, דְּכׇל אֵימַת דְּאָתֵי צָרִיךְ לְאֵתוֹיֵי.
human_translation: that Rabbi Yoḥanan holds the appearance of face in the courtyard. doesn’t need to bring whenever he comes Reish Lakish said the appearance of face with an offering, whenever one comes he must bring
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan holds: viewing the face in the Temple, whenever it comes, does not require a blessing. Reish Lakish said: viewing the face in the offering, whenever it comes, requires a blessing.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״וְלֹא יֵרָאוּ פָנַי רֵיקָם״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּעִיקַּר הָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan. and none shall appear before Me empty-handed” said to him: on the main the pilgrimage Festival,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: "And they shall not appear before Me empty-handed!" He said to him: Primarily the pilgrimage.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: ״וְלֹא יֵרָאוּ פָנַי רֵיקָם״ — בִּזְבָחִים. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּזְבָחִים, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּעוֹפוֹת וּמְנָחוֹת? וְדִין הוּא: נֶאֶמְרָה חֲגִיגָה לַהֶדְיוֹט, וְנֶאֶמְרָה רְאִיָּיה לַגָּבוֹהַּ. מָה חֲגִיגָה הָאֲמוּרָה לַהֶדְיוֹט — זְבָחִים, אַף רְאִיָּיה הָאֲמוּרָה לַגָּבוֹהַּ — זְבָחִים.
human_translation: raised an objection to “And none shall appear before Me empty-handed.” with animal offerings. you say with animal offerings, or it is only with bird or meal And it is by logical derivation: is stated a Festival peace for a commoner and is stated appearance, for God. Just as the Festival peace that is stated for a commoner animal offerings, so too, appearance that is stated for God animal offerings.
llm_translation: He raised an objection: "And they shall not appear before Me empty-handed" — regarding sacrifices. Do you say regarding sacrifices, or is it only with regards to birds and meal offerings? And the law is: The festival offering was stated for the commoner, and the appearance offering was stated for the distinguished. Just as the festival offering mentioned for the commoner is sacrifices, so too the appearance offering mentioned for the distinguished is sacrifices.

hebrew_text: וּמָה הֵן זְבָחִים — עוֹלוֹת. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר עוֹלוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁלָמִים? וְדִין הוּא: נֶאֶמְרָה חֲגִיגָה לַהֶדְיוֹט, וְנֶאֶמְרָה רְאִיָּיה לַגָּבוֹהַּ. מָה חֲגִיגָה הָאֲמוּרָה לַהֶדְיוֹט — בְּרָאוּי לוֹ, אַף רְאִיָּיה הָאֲמוּרָה לַגָּבוֹהַּ — בְּרָאוּי לוֹ.
human_translation: And what are animal offerings Burnt you say burnt or it is only peace And it is by logical derivation: is stated Festival peace for a commoner, and is stated appearance, for God. Just as the Festival peace that is stated for a commoner fitting for him so too, appearance that is stated for God fitting for Him,
llm_translation: And what are the sacrifices? — Burnt offerings. You say burnt offerings, or is it only peace offerings? And it is a law: The festival offering was stated for the commoner, and the appearance offering was stated for the distinguished. Just as the festival offering that is stated for the commoner — fitting for him, so too the appearance offering that is stated for the distinguished — fitting for him.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּדִין: שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא שׁוּלְחָנְךָ מָלֵא, וְשׁוּלְחַן רַבְּךָ רֵיקָם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּעִיקַּר הָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: And similarly, by logical derivation that your table should not be full while your Master’s table, is empty. said to him: on the main the pilgrimage Festival.
llm_translation: And so in judgment: that your table not be full, and your master's table empty. He said to him: Essentially, the foot.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ רְגָלִים בַּשָּׁנָה נִצְטַוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לַעֲלוֹת בָּרֶגֶל: בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת וּבְחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת וּבְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת. וְאֵין נִרְאִין חֲצָאִין, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל זְכוּרְךָ״, וְאֵין נִרְאִין רֵיקָנִים, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יֵרָאוּ פָנַי רֵיקָם״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּעִיקַּר הָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: raised objection to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Three times a year the Jewish people were commanded to ascend on the pilgrimage Festival: On Passover, on Shavuot , and on Sukkot . They may not appear partially, because it is stated: “All your males” And they may not appear empty-handed, because it is stated: “And none shall appear before Me empty-handed” said to him: the main the pilgrimage Festival.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: "Three pilgrimage festivals in the year Israel was commanded to ascend by foot: on the Festival of Matzot, on the Festival of Weeks, and on the Festival of Sukkot. And they do not appear half-empty, because it is stated: 'All your males,' and they do not appear empty-handed, because it is stated: 'They shall not appear before Me empty-handed'!" He said to him: "At the essence of the pilgrimage festival."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״יֵרָאֶה״ ״יִרְאֶה״ — מָה אֲנִי בְּחִנָּם, אַף אַתֶּם בְּחִנָּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish “Will see [ yireh ],” “Shall be seen [ yera’e ].” just as I, for free, so too, you for free,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "Yera'eh" "Yireh" - just as I am interpreting gratuitously, so too you should interpret gratuitously.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דַּאֲתָא וְלָא אַיְיתִי — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּעָיֵיל וּמִתְחֲזֵי וְנָפֵיק, כִּי פְּלִיגִי דַּאֲתָא וְאַיְיתִי.
human_translation: Rather, anywhere that one comes and he does not bring everyone agrees that one enters, appears, and exits When they disagree where one comes and brings
llm_translation: Rather: all where that comes and not brings — all the world not argue that comes and brings, for argue that comes and brings.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר: רְאִיַּית פָּנִים בָּעֲזָרָה — רְאִיַּית פָּנִים הוּא דְּאֵין לָהּ שִׁיעוּר, הָא לְקׇרְבָּן — יֵשׁ לָהּ שִׁיעוּר. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: רְאִיַּית פָּנִים — בְּקׇרְבָּן, דַּאֲפִילּוּ קׇרְבָּן נָמֵי אֵין לוֹ שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says the appearance of face in the courtyard, it is appearance that has no measure, there is measure, of offerings, And Reish Lakish said: The appearance of face with an offering, as even offerings have no measure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The inspection of the face in the Temple — the inspection of the face does not have a measure, but for the offering — it has a measure. And Reish Lakish said: The inspection of the face — in the offering, for even a non-sacred offering does not have a measure.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: ״הֹקַר רַגְלְךָ מִבֵּית רֵעֶךָ״. הָתָם בְּחַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת.
human_translation: raised an objection to “Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor’s house, There, to sin and guilt
llm_translation: He raised your foot from the house of your friend. There, in sins and guilt offerings.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי לֵוִי. דְּרַבִּי לֵוִי רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״הֹקַר רַגְלְךָ מִבֵּית רֵעֶךָ״, וּכְתִיב: ״אָבוֹא בֵיתְךָ בְעוֹלוֹת״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּחַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת, כָּאן בְּעוֹלוֹת וּשְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Levi, as Rabbi Levi raised a contradiction It is written: “Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor’s house,” and it is written: “I will come into Your house with burnt not difficult; here, to sin- and guilt and there, to burnt and peace
llm_translation: As Rabbi Levi said, Rabbi Levi raised a contradiction: It is written, "The honor of your foot from the house of your friend," and it is written, "I will come into your house with burnt offerings"! This is not difficult: here it is referring to sin offerings and guilt offerings, and here it is referring to burnt offerings and peace offerings.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״הֹקַר רַגְלְךָ מִבֵּית רֵעֶךָ״ — בְּחַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּחַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּעוֹלוֹת וּשְׁלָמִים? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אָבוֹא בֵיתְךָ בְעוֹלוֹת אֲשַׁלֵּם לְךָ נְדָרָי״ — הֲרֵי עוֹלוֹת וּשְׁלָמִים אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״הֹקַר רַגְלְךָ מִבֵּית רֵעֶךָ״ — בְּחַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: That is also taught “Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor’s house.” The verse is speaking of sin and guilt you say to sin and guilt or it is only to burnt and peace When it says: “I will come into Your house with burnt I will perform for You my vows,” burnt and peace are mentioned, How do I uphold “Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor’s house”? The verse is speaking of sin and guilt
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: "He who honors his friend with his feet" — the verse is speaking about sins and guilt offerings. Do you say it is referring to sins and guilt offerings, or perhaps only to burnt offerings and peace offerings? When it says, "I will come into Your house with burnt offerings; I will pay You my vows" — it is indeed referring to burnt offerings and peace offerings. So how do I fulfill "He who honors his friend with his feet" — in sins and guilt offerings the verse is speaking.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נִרְאִין חֲצָאִין כּוּ׳. סָבַר רַב יוֹסֵף לְמֵימַר: מַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ עֲשָׂרָה בָּנִים, לָא לִיסְּקוּ הָאִידָּנָא חַמְשָׁה וּלְמָחָר חַמְשָׁה.
human_translation: may not appear partially, Rav Yosef thought to say: One who has ten sons not let five ascend now and five tomorrow.
llm_translation: "And not seen half. Thought Rav Yosef to say: Who has ten sons, not to give them now five and tomorrow five."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: פְּשִׁיטָא, הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ מְשַׁוֵּית לְהוּ פּוֹשְׁעִים, וְהֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ מְשַׁוֵּית לְהוּ זְרִיזִין!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: is obvious; which of he render sinners, and which of them he render vigilant,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: It is obvious, let them be inclined towards being lenient with regard to sinners, and let them be inclined towards being diligent with regard to the zealous ones!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא קְרָא לְמַאי אֲתָא? לִכְדַאֲחֵרִים. דְּתַנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: הַמְקַמֵּץ, וְהַמְצָרֵף נְחֹשֶׁת, וְהַבּוּרְסִי — פְּטוּרִין מִן הָרְאִיָּיה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל זְכוּרְךָ״, מִי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת עִם כׇּל זְכוּרְךָ. יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ, שֶׁאֵין יְכוֹלִין לַעֲלוֹת עִם כׇּל זְכוּרְךָ.
human_translation: Rather, for what does verse: come? that which Aḥerim As it is taught Aḥerim say a scrimper, a melder of copper, and a tanner are exempt from appearance, As it is stated: “All your males,” one who is able to ascend with all your males excluding these. As they cannot ascend with all your males.
llm_translation: Rather, for what purpose does the verse come? In accordance with others. For it was taught: Others say, one who gathers, and one who smelts copper, and the bursi - they are exempt from the pilgrimage, as it is stated: "All who are able to go up with all your males." These mentioned occupations are excluded, as they are not able to go up with all your males.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עוֹלוֹת בַּמּוֹעֵד בָּאוֹת מִן הַחוּלִּין, וְהַשְּׁלָמִים מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִן הַחוּלִּין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: Burnt on the Festival come from non-sacred But the peace- from the tithe, the first day of the festival of Passover, Beit Shammai say: from non-sacred and Beit Hillel say: from the tithe.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Burnt offerings on a festival come from ordinary funds, and peace offerings from the tithe. On the first day of Passover, Beit Shammai say: from ordinary funds, and Beit Hillel say: from the tithe.

hebrew_text: יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹצְאִין יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן בִּנְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת וּבְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה. וְהַכֹּהֲנִים בְּחַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת וּבִבְכוֹר, וּבְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. אֲבָל לֹא בְּעוֹפוֹת, וְלֹא בִּמְנָחוֹת.
human_translation: Israelites fulfill their obligation with vows and gift and with animal tithes. And the priests with sin and guilt and with firstborn and with the breast and thigh However, not with birds, nor with meal
llm_translation: The children of Israel fulfill their obligations through vows, freewill offerings, and tithes of animals. And the priests through sin offerings, guilt offerings, and the firstborn, and through the breast and the thigh. But not through birds, and not through meal offerings.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֶלָּא: עוֹלוֹת — בַּמּוֹעֵד הוּא דְּבָאוֹת מִן הַחוּלִּין, הָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר? אַמַּאי, דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה, הִיא! וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה, אֵינוֹ בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין.
human_translation: burnt- during the the Festival may come from non-sacred on the Festival from the tithe. Why is an obligatory matter, and any obligatory matter may come only from non-sacred
llm_translation: Gemara: Rather, regarding burnt offerings — they are brought on a festival day when they come from the mundane property, but on a festival day — they are brought from the tithe? Why? Because it is a matter of obligation! And anything that is a matter of obligation only comes from the mundane property.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּעוֹלוֹת בַּמּוֹעֵד בָּאוֹת, בְּיוֹם טוֹב אֵינָן בָּאוֹת, כְּמַאן — כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?!
human_translation: And if you would say this teaches us that burnt- may come, on the Festival, on the Festival they may not come in accordance with whose in accordance with Beit Shammai.
llm_translation: And if you will say: But this implies to us that the Olot offerings come on the festival, they do not come on the festival, according to whom - according to Beit Shammai?!

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן, אֲבָל לֹא עוֹלוֹת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים וְעוֹלוֹת, וְסוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: As we learned Beit Shammai say: One brings peace- but one does not place on them, However, not burnt- And Beit Hillel say: One brings peace- and burnt- and one does place on them.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One may bring peace offerings on the festival, but one may not lean on them. However, burnt offerings may not be brought. Beit Hillel say: One may bring peace offerings and burnt offerings, and one may lean on them.

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: עוֹלוֹת נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת — בַּמּוֹעֵד בָּאוֹת, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — אֵינָן בָּאוֹת. וְעוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה בָּאָה אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וּכְשֶׁהִיא בָּאָה — אֵינָהּ בָּאָה אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין. וְשַׁלְמֵי שִׂמְחָה בָּאִין אַף מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. וַחֲגִיגַת יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִן הַחוּלִּין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: is incomplete, and this it is teaching: Burnt- vow or as gift may come on the Festival. on the Festival they may not come. And the burnt- of appearance comes even on the Festival, but when it comes, it may come only from non-sacred And peace- of rejoicing may come even from the tithe. And the Festival peace- the first day of Passover, Beit Shammai say: from non-sacred and Beit Hillel say: from the tithe.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hasorei miChasra ve'hakhi katanei: Olot nedarim u'nedavot - baMoed ba'ot, beYom Tov - einan ba'ot. Ve'olat re'iyah ba'ah afilu beYom Tov, u'kesh'hi ba'ah - einah ba'ah ela min haChulin. Ve'shalmei simchah ba'in af min haMaaser. Vachagigat Yom Tov harishon shel Pesach, Beit Shammai omerim: Min haChulin, u'Beit Hillel omerim: Min haMaaser."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: עוֹלוֹת, נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת — בַּמּוֹעֵד בָּאוֹת, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — אֵינָן בָּאוֹת. וְעוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה בָּאָה אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וּכְשֶׁהִיא בָּאָה — אֵינָהּ בָּאָה אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין. וְשַׁלְמֵי שִׂמְחָה בָּאִין אַף מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. וַחֲגִיגַת יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִן הַחוּלִּין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: That is also taught Burnt- vow or gift may come on the Festival. on itself they may not come. And the burnt of appearance comes even on the Festival, but when it comes it may come only from non-sacred And peace- of rejoicing may come even from the tithe. And the Festival peace- the first day of the festival of Passover, Beit Shammai say: from non-sacred and Beit Hillel say: from the tithe.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Olah offerings, vows, and freewill offerings that were meant to be brought on a festival, on the day of the festival — they are not brought. But an Olah of appearance may be brought even on a festival. And when it is brought, it is only brought from non-sacred funds. And the peace offerings of rejoicing come even from the tithe. And the festival offering of the first day of Passover, Beit Shammai says: from non-sacred funds, and Beit Hillel says: from the tithe.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא חֲגִיגַת יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, חֲגִיגַת חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר — אִין, חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — לָא.
human_translation: What is different the Festival peace- the first day of the festival of Passover? Rav Ashi said: This teaches us the Festival peace- of the fifteenth, yes, the Festival peace- of the fourteenth, no,
llm_translation: What is the difference between the festival offering of the first day of Passover? Rav Ashe said: This teaches us that the festival offering of the fifteenth day - yes, the festival offering of the fourteenth day - no.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר — חֲגִיגַת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Apparently, he holds the Festival peace- of the fourteenth not by Torah law,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma kasavra - chagigat arba'ah asar lavo de'orayta." English translation: "The Gemara concludes - the festival offering of the fourteenth is not a biblical obligation."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. אַמַּאי? דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה הוּא, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה אֵינוֹ בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין? אָמַר עוּלָּא: בְּטוֹפֵל.
human_translation: The Master said Beit Hillel say: from the tithe. Why? It is an obligatory matter, and any obligatory matter may come only from non-sacred Ulla said: where combines,
llm_translation: Master said, Beit Hillel say: from the tithe. Why? It is a matter of obligation, and anything that is an obligation only comes from the non-sacred. Ulla said: in a secondary manner.

hebrew_text: חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר, טוֹפְלִין בְּהֵמָה לִבְהֵמָה, וְאֵין טוֹפְלִין מָעוֹת לְמָעוֹת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: טוֹפְלִין מָעוֹת לְמָעוֹת, וְאֵין טוֹפְלִין בְּהֵמָה לִבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: Ḥizkiya said: One may combine animal with animal. But one may not combine money with money, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One combine money with money, but one may not combine animal with animal.
llm_translation: Hezekiah said, "One may tithe an animal for another animal, but one may not tithe coins for other coins." And Rabbi Yohanan said, "One may tithe coins for other coins, but one may not tithe an animal for another animal."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״מִסַּת״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָדָם מֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִן הַחוּלִּין. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם רָצָה לְעָרֵב מְעָרֵב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר יְבָרֶכְךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Ḥizkiya, it is taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan. It is taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: After the measure teaches that a person brings his obligatory from non-sacred And from where that if one wishes to mix he mix? The verse states: “As the Lord your God blesses you”
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Ḥizkiyah, it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yoḥanan. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "From a gift" — teaches that a person brings his obligation from the profane. And from where do we derive that if he wishes to combine, he may combine? The Torah teaches us: "As the Lord your God has blessed you."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה: ״מִסַּת״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָדָם מֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִן הַחוּלִּין, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן מִן הַחוּלִּין, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֲכִילָה רִאשׁוֹנָה מִן הַחוּלִּין, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Ḥizkiya: “After the measure” teaches that a person brings his obligatory from non-sacred Beit Shammai say: the first day from non-sacred From this forward from the tithe And Beit Hillel say: The first eating from non-sacred From this forward from the tithe
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Hezekiah: "From produce" — teaches that a person brings his obligation from non-tithed produce. Beit Shammai say: On the first day from non-tithed produce, from then on from the tithe. And Beit Hillel say: The first eating from non-tithed produce, from then on from the tithe.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל יְמוֹת הַפֶּסַח, אָדָם יוֹצֵא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּמַעֲשֵׂר בְּהֵמָה. בְּיוֹם טוֹב מַאי טַעְמָא לָא?
human_translation: But all the other days of Passover, a person fulfills his obligation with animal tithes, What is the reason that one does not on the Festival?
llm_translation: And the rest of all the days of Passover, a person fulfills his obligation of tithing with livestock. On a festival, what is the reason that he does not?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְעַשּׂוֹרֵי בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לְעַשֵּׂר בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִשּׁוּם סְקַרְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: perhaps he may come to separate tithes on the Festival and one may not separate tithes on the Festival due to the red dye [ sikrata ].
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Perhaps one will come to tithe on a festival day, and it is impossible to tithe on a festival day due to the prohibition of sifting.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי מִסַּת לִישָּׁנָא דְחוּלִּין הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשֶׂם הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ מַס עַל הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: From where may it be inferred that this: “After the measure [ missat ],” is a term for non-sacred As it is written: “And the king Ahasuerus laid a tribute [ mas ] upon the land”
llm_translation: What is the implication that this feast is of secular nature? As it is written: "And the king Ahasuerus imposed a tax upon the land."

hebrew_text: יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹצְאִין יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן בִּנְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ בְּחַגֶּךָ״ — לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל מִינֵי שְׂמָחוֹת לְשִׂמְחָה. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹצְאִין יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן בִּנְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת וּבְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה,
human_translation: Israelites fulfill their obligation with vow and gift The Sages taught “And you shall rejoice in your feast” to include all types of rejoicing as rejoicing. From here the Sages stated: Israelites fulfill their obligation with vow and gift and with animal tithes.
llm_translation: Israel fulfill their obligations through vows and voluntary offerings. The Rabbis taught: "And you shall rejoice in your feast" — to include all types of rejoicing for joy. From here the sages said: Israel fulfill their obligations through vows and voluntary offerings, and with tithes of animals.

hebrew_text: וְהַכֹּהֲנִים בְּחַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם וּבִבְכוֹר, וּבְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. יָכוֹל אַף בָּעוֹפוֹת וּבִמְנָחוֹת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ בְּחַגֶּךָ״,
human_translation: And the priests with sin- and guilt- and with firstborn and with the breast and thigh might even by bird- and meal- the verse states: “And you shall rejoice in your feast.”
llm_translation: The priests in sin offering and guilt offering and in firstborn, and in breast and thigh. Can also in birds and in meal offerings — Scripture states: "And you shall rejoice in your festival."

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁחֲגִיגָה בָּאָה מֵהֶם, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין חֲגִיגָה בָּאָה מֵהֶם.
human_translation: those from which the Festival peace- may come, excludes these, from which the Festival peace- may not come.
llm_translation: One who celebrates the festival of Passover among them, they have fulfilled their obligation; these are the ones for whom the festival of Passover does not come from them.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מִ״וְּשָׂמַחְתָּ״ נָפְקָא. יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן שִׂמְחָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: is derived from “And you shall rejoice.” excludes those that do not have rejoicing,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "From 'when you rejoice' they departed." These are the ones that do not have joy.

hebrew_text: וְרַב אָשֵׁי, הַאי ״בְּחַגֶּךָ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַהוּא, לְכִדְרַב דָּנִיאֵל בַּר קַטִּינָא. דְּאָמַר רַב דָּנִיאֵל בַּר קַטִּינָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים בַּמּוֹעֵד — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ בְּחַגֶּךָ״, וְלֹא בְּאִשְׁתֶּךָ.
human_translation: And what does Rav Ashi do with “In your feast”? That in accordance with of Rav Daniel bar Ketina. As Rav Daniel bar Ketina said Rav said: From where that one may not marry a woman on intermediate days of the Festival? As it is stated: “And you shall rejoice in your feast,” and not with your wife.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, what does the phrase "in your festival" teach him? That, according to Rav Daniel bar Katina. For Rav Daniel bar Katina said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that women do not carry on a festival? As it is stated: "And you shall rejoice in your festival," and not in your wife.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אוֹכְלִים מְרוּבִּים וּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִים — מֵבִיא שְׁלָמִים מְרוּבִּים וְעוֹלוֹת מוּעָטוֹת. נְכָסִים מְרוּבִּים וְאוֹכְלִין מוּעָטִין — מֵבִיא עוֹלוֹת מְרוּבּוֹת וּשְׁלָמִים מוּעָטִין.
human_translation: One who has many eaters, and a small property, may bring many peace- and few burnt- much property and few eaters, he bring many burnt- and few peace-
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who has more animals for eating than for sacrifices brings many peace offerings and few burnt offerings. If one has more possessions than animals for eating, he brings many burnt offerings and few peace offerings.

hebrew_text: זֶה וָזֶה מוּעָט — עַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: מָעָה כֶּסֶף, שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף. זֶה וָזֶה מְרוּבִּים — עַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ כְּמַתְּנַת יָדוֹ כְּבִרְכַּת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֲשֶׁר נָתַן לָךְ״.
human_translation: If these and those, are few, with regard to this it is stated silver ma’a two silver If both are many, with regard to this it is stated: “Every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of the Lord your God, which He has given you”
llm_translation: This and this is a small amount - regarding this it is said: a hundred silver, two silver. This and this are abundant - regarding this it is said: "Each man according to what is in his hand, according to the blessing of the Lord your God that He has given you."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁלָמִים מְרוּבִּים. מֵהֵיכָא מַיְיתֵי? הָא לֵית לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: טוֹפֵל וּמֵבִיא פַּר גָּדוֹל. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ טוֹפְלִין בְּהֵמָה לִבְהֵמָה!
human_translation: From where can he bring many peace- He does not have Rav Ḥisda said: He combines and brings a large bull. Rav Sheshet said to him: said one may combine an animal with animal.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar shelamim merubim. Meheikha maytei? Ha leit lei! Amar Rav Ḥisda: Tofel u'mevi par gadol. Amar lei Rav Sheshet: Harei amru tofelin beheima libheima! English translation: A completed peace offering is more numerous. From where does it come? This one does not have it! Rav Ḥisda said: One who mixes and brings a large bull. Rav Sheshet said to him: Behold, they said mixing is permissible between animals of the same species!

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ? אִילֵּימָא הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ טוֹפְלִין בְּהֵמָה לִבְהֵמָה אֲבָל לֹא מָעוֹת לְמָעוֹת, וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: אֵין טוֹפְלִין מָעוֹת לְמָעוֹת! אֶלָּא הָכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ אַף טוֹפְלִין בְּהֵמָה לִבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: What is he saying to If we say he was saying to him as follows: They said one may combine an animal with animal, but one not money with money let him say: One may not combine money with money. Rather, this is what he said to him: said one may even combine an animal with animal.
llm_translation: What is he saying to him? If you say he is saying this: Behold, they said that one may join an animal to another animal, but not coins to coins, and do not say to him: One may not join coins to coins! Rather, he said to him: Behold, they also said that one may join coins to coins.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּחִזְקִיָּה וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן!
human_translation: In accordance with whose not in accordance with Ḥizkiya, and not in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: As whom? That not like Hezekiah and not like Rabbi Yochanan!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אָמוֹרָאֵי הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי, מַתְנְיָיתָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. וְהָא קָתָנֵי: אֲכִילָה רִאשׁוֹנָה מִן הַחוּלִּין.
human_translation: And if you would say: It is the amora’im who disagree, the baraitot do not disagree and teaches: The first eating from non-sacred
llm_translation: And if you will say: It is the Amoraim who disputed, they did not dispute in the Mishnah. But it is taught: The first eating is from the ordinary.

hebrew_text: מַאי אֲכִילָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — שִׁיעוּר דְּמֵי אֲכִילָה רִאשׁוֹנָה מִן הַחוּלִּין.
human_translation: What is The first eating? the monetary of measure first eating from non-sacred
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the "first eating"? — The measure of the cost of the "first eating" is from non-consecrated funds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הִפְרִישׁ עֶשֶׂר בְּהֵמוֹת לַחֲגִיגָתוֹ, הִקְרִיב חָמֵשׁ בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן — חוֹזֵר וּמַקְרִיב חָמֵשׁ בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁפָּסַק, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ מַקְרִיב.
human_translation: Ulla said Reish Lakish said: separated ten animals for his Festival peace- he sacrificed five on the first the Festival, he may return and sacrifice five on the second day of the Festival, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Since he stopped he may no longer sacrifice
llm_translation: Ulla said, Resh Lakish said: If one set aside ten animals for his festival offering, and he brought five on the first day of the festival, he may go back and bring five on the second day of the festival. Rabbi Yochanan said: Once he stopped, he may not continue to bring them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא, וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: כָּאן בִּסְתָם, כָּאן בִּמְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: And do not disagree, Here, where one did not specify There, where one explicitly
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba, and do not dispute: here in general, here in detail.

hebrew_text: הַאי סְתָם הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁהוּת בַּיּוֹם לִקְרַב, הַאי דְּלָא אַקְרְבִינְהוּ — דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁהוּת בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: this did not specify, what are the circumstances? If we say that there was no time in the day to sacrifice, that he did not bring them is that there was no time in the day.
llm_translation: This anonymous case, how is it similar? If you say it is because there is no fixed time during the day for its offering, this one that we do not offer - it is because there is no fixed time during the day.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אוֹכְלִין, הַאי דְּלָא אַקְרְבִינְהוּ — דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אוֹכְלִין.
human_translation: But rather, where he does not have eaters that he did not sacrifice them is because he does not have eaters.
llm_translation: And rather, that it does not have food, this one that we do not bring close - that it does not have food.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיכָּא שְׁהוּת בַּיּוֹם וְאִית לֵיהּ אוֹכְלִין, מִדִּבְקַמָּא לָא אַקְרְבִינְהוּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ שַׁיּוֹרֵי שַׁיְּירִינְהוּ.
human_translation: No, necessary only where there is time in the day and he has eaters From that he did not sacrifice them on the first conclude from he left them
llm_translation: Not necessary, for there is a situation during the day and there are foods for it, from the beginning I will not bring them close, perhaps they will become spoiled.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּכִי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִפְרִישׁ עֶשֶׂר בְּהֵמוֹת לַחֲגִיגָתוֹ, הִקְרִיב חָמֵשׁ בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן — חוֹזֵר וּמַקְרִיב חָמֵשׁ בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי. קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one separated ten animals for his Festival peace- he sacrificed five on the first day the Festival, he may return and sacrifice five on the second Festival. contradict each other.
llm_translation: And thus it is fittingly reasoned, for when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: If one set aside ten animals for his festival offering, and he brought five on the first day of the festival - he goes back and brings five on the second day of the festival. They challenge each other.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כָּאן בִּסְתָם, כָּאן בִּמְפָרֵשׁ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t it conclude from here where did not specify, there where explicitly? Indeed, conclude from
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a valid deduction. Here, when it is stated explicitly, here, when it is inferred. A valid deduction.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: was also stated Rav Shemen bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said:
llm_translation: It was stated: Naḥmei said, Rav Shemen bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan:

hebrew_text: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא גָּמַר, אֲבָל גָּמַר — חוֹזֵר וּמַקְרִיב.
human_translation: They taught only where he did not finish. However, he finished, he may go back and sacrifice.
llm_translation: They did not teach except that if he did not complete, but if he completed - he goes back and offers.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״גָּמַר״? אִילֵּימָא גָּמַר קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו — מַאי מַקְרִיב? אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא גָּמַר הַיּוֹם, אֲבָל גָּמַר הַיּוֹם — חוֹזֵר וּמַקְרִיב.
human_translation: What is Finish, If we say finished his offerings, what he sacrifice? Rather, that the day did not end However, if the day ended he may go back and sacrifice
llm_translation: What is "finished"? Perhaps it means he finished his sacrifices - what does he offer? Rather, it means that he did not finish today, but if he finished today, he goes back and offers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁלֹּא חָג בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג — חוֹגֵג אֶת כָּל הָרֶגֶל וְיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג.
human_translation: one who did not celebrate the Festival on the first day of the festival may celebrate the entire the pilgrimage Festival, and on the final day of the Festival,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who did not celebrate on the first day of the festival - he celebrates the entire festival and the last day of the festival.

hebrew_text: עָבַר הָרֶגֶל וְלֹא חָג — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, עַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר ״מְעֻוָּות לֹא יוּכַל לִתְקוֹן וְחֶסְרוֹן לֹא יוּכַל לְהִמָּנוֹת״.
human_translation: the pilgrimage Festival passed and one did not celebrate the Festival he is not obligated restitution it. about this it is stated: “That which is crooked cannot be made straight; and that which is wanting cannot be numbered”
llm_translation: If one passed by and did not celebrate the festival - he is not obligated in making it up, regarding this it is said, "Crooked cannot be straightened, and what is lacking cannot be counted."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְּיָיא אוֹמֵר: אֵיזֶהוּ מְעֻוָּות שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהִתָּקֵן? זֶה הַבָּא עַל הָעֶרְוָה וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה מַמְזֵר. אִם תֹּאמַר בְּגוֹנֵב וְגוֹזֵל — יָכוֹל הוּא לְהַחְזִירוֹ, וִיתַקֵּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Who is crooked that cannot be made straight? This one who engaged in intercourse with a woman forbidden to him and fathered a mamzer with her. if you say to one who steals or robs, he can return and will be rectified.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: What are the deformities that cannot be rectified? This refers to one who engages in forbidden relations and begets a mamzer from it. If you were to say in the case of a thief or a robber - he can return the stolen item, and rectify his actions.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: אֵין קוֹרִין מְעֻוָּות אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁהָיָה מְתוּקָּן בַּתְּחִילָּה וְנִתְעַוֵּות, וְאֵי זֶה? זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הַפּוֹרֵשׁ מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: One calls crooked only someone who was initially straight and became crooked. And who is this? This is a Torah scholar who leaves Torah
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: One does not read "corrections" except for one who was originally corrected and became corrupted. And who is this? This is a Torah scholar who has separated from the Torah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: נֶאֱמַר ״עֲצֶרֶת״ בִּשְׁבִיעִי שֶׁל פֶּסַח, וְנֶאֱמַר ״עֲצֶרֶת״ בִּשְׁמִינִי שֶׁל חַג. מָה לְהַלָּן לְתַשְׁלוּמִין — אַף כָּאן לְתַשְׁלוּמִין.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael It is stated: “Assembly” to the seventh day of Passover, and it is stated: “Assembly” to the eighth day of the festival Just as there, for redress, so too here, for redress.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar menahanei milei? Amar Rabbi Yochanan mi'shum Rabbi Yishmael: Ne'emar "Atzeret" bishvi'i shel Pesach, v'ne'emar "Atzeret" bishmini shel Chag. Mah lehalan letashlumin - af kan letashlumin. English translation: Is it complete with its matters? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: It is stated "Atzeret" on the seventh day of Passover, and it is stated "Atzeret" on the eighth day of the festival. Just as there for additional offerings - so too here for additional offerings.

hebrew_text: מוּפְנֶה. דְּאִי לָאו מוּפְנֶה, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לִשְׁבִיעִי שֶׁל פֶּסַח שֶׁכֵּן אֵינוֹ חָלוּק מִשֶּׁלְּפָנָיו, תֹּאמַר בִּשְׁמִינִי שֶׁל חַג שֶׁחָלוּק מִשֶּׁלְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: free As, if it is not free can be refuted, What about the seventh of Passover? That it is not distinct from preceding it you say with regard to the eighth of the festival which is distinct from preceding it,
llm_translation: Turned. Because if not turned, there is to differentiate: what about the seventh of Passover that similarly is not distinct from what precedes it, you would say about the eighth of the festival that is distinct from what precedes it.

hebrew_text: לָאיֵי אִפְּנוֹיֵי מוּפְנֶה. מִכְּדֵי מַאי ״עֲצֶרֶת״ — עָצוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, הָכְתִיב: ״לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה מְלָאכָה״, ״עֲצֶרֶת״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
