human_translation: not so [ la’ei ], as free. Now, what is “assembly [ atzeret ]”? stopped [ atzur ], from performing labor. But isn’t it written: “You shall not perform labor” Why do I atzeret that the Merciful One writes? Rather, learn from here free
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Laiyei ifnei mufneh. Mikdei mai 'atzaret' - atzur ba'asiyat melakhah, hakhtiv: 'Lo ta'aseh melakhah', 'atzaret' dikhtav rachamana lemaha li? Ella shema minah le'afneyei." Translation: "To where should one turn oneself? From the fact that 'atzaret' - it is prohibited to perform labor, as it is written: 'You shall not do any work,' why did the Merciful One write 'atzaret'? Rather, learn from it for turning oneself."

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מֵהָכָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְחַגּוֹתֶם אוֹתוֹ חַג לַה׳ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״, יָכוֹל יְהֵא חוֹגֵג וְהוֹלֵךְ כָּל שִׁבְעָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹתוֹ״ — אוֹתוֹ אַתָּה חוֹגֵג, וְאִי אַתָּה חוֹגֵג כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. אִם כֵּן לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״שִׁבְעָה״ — לְתַשְׁלוּמִין.
human_translation: And a tanna cites from here, as it is taught “And you shall keep it a feast to the Lord seven days” might may continue to celebrate all seven the verse states: “It,” It, you shall celebrate and you may not celebrate all seven If so, why is “seven” stated? For redress,
llm_translation: And it was taught to her from here, as it was taught: "And you shall celebrate it as a festival to the Lord for seven days." One might have thought that one should celebrate and walk all seven days - the Talmud teaches: "it" - you shall celebrate that, and if you do not celebrate that, you do not celebrate all seven. If so, why is it stated "seven" - for the additional offerings.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם לֹא חָג יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג שֶׁחוֹגֵג וְהוֹלֵךְ אֶת כָּל הָרֶגֶל וְיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי תָּחֹגּוּ אוֹתוֹ״, אִי ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, יָכוֹל יְהֵא חוֹגֵג וְהוֹלֵךְ הַחֹדֶשׁ כּוּלּוֹ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹתוֹ״ — אוֹתוֹ אַתָּה חוֹגֵג, וְאִי אַתָּה חוֹגֵג חוּצָה לוֹ.
human_translation: And from where that if one did not celebrate on the first day of the festival that he may continue to celebrate throughout the pilgrimage Festival and the last festival day The verse states: “You shall keep it in the seventh month” If “In the seventh month,” might one continue to celebrate the entire month. the verse states: “It,” you celebrate it, and you may not celebrate outside of
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that if one did not celebrate the first day of the festival, which is a day of rejoicing, and proceeded to observe the entire pilgrimage and the last day of the festival - the Torah states: "In the seventh month, you shall celebrate it." If it had just said "in the seventh month," one might have thought that one should rejoice and observe the entire month - therefore the Torah states: "it," meaning you shall celebrate that day, but if you do not celebrate it, you have forfeited it.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי תַּשְׁלוּמִין? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: תַּשְׁלוּמִין לָרִאשׁוֹן, וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: תַּשְׁלוּמִין זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: What is redress Rabbi Yoḥanan said: redress for the first And Rabbi Oshaya said: redress for one another.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And what is the compensation? Rabbi Yochanan said: Compensation for the first, and Rabbi Oshaya said: Compensation for this to that."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: חִיגֵּר בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן וְנִתְפַּשֵּׁט בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: תַּשְׁלוּמִין לָרִאשׁוֹן, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא חֲזֵי בָּרִאשׁוֹן — לָא חֲזֵי בַּשֵּׁנִי. וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: תַּשְׁלוּמִין זֶה לָזֶה, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא חֲזֵי בָּרִאשׁוֹן — חֲזֵי בִּשְׁנֵי.
human_translation: What is between Rabbi Zeira said: between them lame on the first day and was healed on the second day. Rabbi Yoḥanan said redress for the first since he was not fit, on the first he is not fit on the second, And Rabbi Oshaya said redress for one another. even though he was not fit on the first fit on the second.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Zeira said: A leper on the first day and he spread out on the second day, there is a difference between them. Rabbi Yochanan said: Payment for the first, since if he does not see in the first, he will not see in the second. And Rabbi Oshaya said: Payment from one to the other, even though if he does not see in the first, he will see in the second.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי?
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this?
llm_translation: And who said, Rabbi Yochanan thus?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: נִטְמָא בַּיּוֹם — מֵבִיא, בַּלַּיְלָה — אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא.
human_translation: Didn’t Ḥizkiya say became ritually impure on day he brings on the night he does not bring
llm_translation: And he said, Hezekiah: If he became impure during the day - he brings a sacrifice, if at night - he does not bring a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף בַּלַּיְלָה נָמֵי מֵבִיא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even on the night he also brings
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even at night one may bring.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: שָׁאנֵי טוּמְאָה, דְּיֵשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין בְּפֶסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: ritual impurity is different. as there is redress for of the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: The impurity is different, as it has a payment in the second Passover.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פֶּסַח
human_translation: Rav Pappa strongly objects to this This works out well according to the one who said the second Pesaḥ
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to her: Let it suffice for the one who says Pesach.

hebrew_text: שֵׁנִי — תַּשְׁלוּמִין דְּרִאשׁוֹן הוּא. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֵׁנִי רֶגֶל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: is redress for the first However, according to the one who said the second is a separate pilgrimage Festival, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Second - the compensation of the first is. Rather, according to the one who says "second is a separate category on its own," what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לַיְלָה אֵינוֹ מְחוּסַּר זְמַן. וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי?
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: Rabbi Yoḥanan holds night not whose time has not yet And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said: Rabbi Yochanan holds that at night it is not time-bound. But did Rabbi Yochanan actually say this?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רָאָה אַחַת בַּלַּיְלָה וּשְׁתַּיִם בַּיּוֹם — מֵבִיא.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan saw one at night and two in the day brings
llm_translation: And he said Rabbi Yochanan: Saw one at night and two during the day - brings.

hebrew_text: שְׁתַּיִם בַּלַּיְלָה וְאַחַת בַּיּוֹם — אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לַיְלָה אֵינוֹ מְחוּסַּר זְמַן, אֲפִילּוּ שְׁתַּיִם בַּלַּיְלָה וְאַחַת בַּיּוֹם — מֵבִיא!
human_translation: two at night and one in the day, he does not bring And if it enters your mind Rabbi Yoḥanan holds night not whose time has not yet even two at night and one in the day he bring
llm_translation: Two at night and one during the day - he does not bring. And if it enters your mind that Rabbi Yochanan holds that at night is not a limited time, even two at night and one during the day - he brings!

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר לַיְלָה מְחוּסַּר זְמַן, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר — פְּשִׁיטָא! שְׁתַּיִם בַּיּוֹם וְאַחַת בַּלַּיְלָה אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yoḥanan said according to the one who says night whose time has not yet according to the one who says is obvious it was necessary for him two in the day and one at night.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Yochanan said, according to the opinion of one who says "at night is a deficient time," according to the opinion of one who says - it is obvious! Two during the day and one at night are necessary for him.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא כְּאַתְקַפְתָּא דְּרַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְרַב יוֹסֵף.
human_translation: enter your mind to say of the strong objection of Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi teaches us in accordance with of Rav Yosef,
llm_translation: I will say what I think: as the crown of Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, you have heard us as Rav Yosef.

hebrew_text: עָבַר הָרֶגֶל וְלֹא חָג אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, וְעַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: ״מְעֻוָּת לֹא יוּכַל לִתְקוֹן וְחֶסְרוֹן לֹא יוּכַל לְהִימָּנוֹת״.
human_translation: the pilgrimage Festival passed and one did not celebrate a Festival he is not obligated restitution it. And about this it is stated: “That which is crooked cannot be made straight; and that which is wanting cannot be numbered”
llm_translation: If one passed by and did not celebrate the festival, he is not obligated in subsequent observance, and regarding this it is said: "That which is crooked cannot be made straight, and that which is lacking cannot be counted."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר הֵי הֵי לְהִלֵּל: הַאי ״לְהִימָּנוֹת״, לְהִמָּלאוֹת מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא, זֶה (שֶׁמִּנּוּהוּ) [שֶׁנִּמְנוּ] חֲבֵירָיו לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, וְהוּא לֹא נִמְנָה עִמָּהֶן.
human_translation: bar Hei Hei said to Hillel this “Be numbered [ lehimanot ]” It should have Be filled. Rather, this whose friends reached a consensus [ manuhu ] to a matter of a mitzva and he was not part of their consensus,
llm_translation: He said to him, "Bar Hei Hei, to Hillel: This 'to believe,' to fulfill from where it requires of him. Rather, this (that they counted) his companions for a matter of commandment, and he was not counted with them."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״מְעֻוָּת לֹא יוּכַל לִתְקוֹן״ — זֶה שֶׁבִּיטֵּל קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שֶׁל שַׁחֲרִית, אוֹ קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שֶׁל עַרְבִית, אוֹ שֶׁבִּיטֵּל תְּפִלָּה שֶׁל שַׁחֲרִית אוֹ תְּפִלָּה שֶׁל עַרְבִית. ״וְחֶסְרוֹן לֹא יוּכַל לְהִימָּנוֹת״ — זֶה שֶׁנִּמְנוּ חֲבֵירָיו לִדְבַר מִצְוָה וְהוּא לֹא נִמְנָה עִמָּהֶן.
human_translation: This is also taught “That which is crooked cannot be made straight” one who omitted the recitation of the morning Shema or the recitation of the evening Shema , or who omitted the morning prayer or the evening prayer. “And that which is wanting cannot be numbered” one whose friends reached a consensus to a matter of a mitzva and he was not part of their consensus.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "One who is crooked cannot be straightened" — this refers to one who neglected the recitation of the morning Shema, or the recitation of the evening Shema, or one who neglected the prayer of the morning or the prayer of the evening. "And a deficit cannot be counted" — this refers to one who was counted among his companions for a mitzvah, and he was not counted with them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר הֵי הֵי לְהִלֵּל, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשַׁבְתֶּם וּרְאִיתֶם בֵּין צַדִּיק לְרָשָׁע בֵּין עוֹבֵד אֱלֹהִים לַאֲשֶׁר לֹא עֲבָדוֹ״, הַיְינוּ ״צַדִּיק״ — הַיְינוּ ״עוֹבֵד אֱלֹהִים״, הַיְינוּ ״רָשָׁע״ — הַיְינוּ ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא עֲבָדוֹ״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עֲבָדוֹ״ וְ״לֹא עֲבָדוֹ״ — תַּרְוַיְיהוּ צַדִּיקֵי גְּמוּרֵי נִינְהוּ, וְאֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה שׁוֹנֶה פִּרְקוֹ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים, לְשׁוֹנֶה פִּרְקוֹ מֵאָה וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Bar Hei Hei said to Hillel: What is which is written: “Then you shall again discern between the righteous and the wicked, between he who serves God and he who does not serve Him” “The righteous” is “he who serves God,” “the wicked” is “he who does not serve Him.” said to him: “who serves Him” “who does not serve Him” are both completely righteous people. But one who reviews his studies one hundred times is not comparable to one who reviews his studies one hundred and one
llm_translation: He said to him, "Bar Hei Hei to Hillel, what is the meaning of what is written: 'And you shall return and see the distinction between the righteous and the wicked, between one who serves God and one who does not serve Him'? 'The righteous' - that is 'one who serves God,' 'the wicked' - that is 'one who does not serve Him'!" He said to him: "Serves Him" and "does not serve Him" - both are completely righteous, and one who repeats his chapter a hundred times is not comparable to one who repeats it a hundred and one times.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמִשּׁוּם חַד זִימְנָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״לֹא עֲבָדוֹ״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, צֵא וּלְמַד מִשּׁוּק שֶׁל חֲמָרִין: עַשְׂרָה פַּרְסֵי — בְּזוּזָא, חַד עֲשַׂר פַּרְסֵי — בִּתְרֵי זוּזֵי.
human_translation: said to him: And due to one time the verse calls him “who does not serve Him”? He said to him: Yes. Go and learn from the market of donkey drivers. ten parasangs for one dinar. eleven parasangs for two dinars.
llm_translation: He said to him: And because of one time he is called "he did not do it"? He said to him: No, go and learn from the market of the donkey-drivers: ten parsangs - with a coin, eleven parsangs - with two coins.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵלִיָּהוּ לְבַר הֵי הֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנֵּה צְרַפְתִּיךָ וְלֹא בְכָסֶף בְּחַרְתִּיךָ בְּכוּר עוֹנִי״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁחָזַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַל כׇּל מִדּוֹת טוֹבוֹת לִיתֵּן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא מָצָא אֶלָּא עֲנִיּוּת. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יוֹסֵף, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: יָאָה עַנְיוּתָא לִיהוּדָאֵי כִּי בַּרְזָא סוּמָּקָא לְסוּסְיָא חִיוָּרָא.
human_translation: Elijah said to bar Hei Hei, and some say to Rabbi Elazar: What is which is written: “Behold, I have refined you, but not as silver; I have tried you in the furnace of affliction [oni]” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, sought after all good character traits to impart to the Jewish people, and He found only poverty [ aniyut ] Shmuel said, and some say Rav Yosef: This that people say: Poverty is good for the Jewish people like a red bridle [ barza ] for a white horse.
llm_translation: He said to him Elijah to Bar Hei Hei, and they say to him to Rabbi Elazar: What is it that is written: "Behold, I have refined you, but not with silver; I have chosen you in the furnace of affliction" — it teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, searched for all good qualities to give to Israel, but found nothing except poverty. Samuel said, and some say it was Rabbi Yosef, this is what people say: Poverty is good for the Jews like a red bridle for a white horse.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: אֵי זֶה הוּא ״מְעֻוָּת לֹא יוּכַל לִתְקוֹן״ — זֶה הַבָּא עַל הָעֶרְוָה וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה מַמְזֵר וְכוּ׳. הוֹלִיד — אִין, לֹא הוֹלִיד — לָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Who is crooked that cannot be made straight? This one who engaged in intercourse with a woman forbidden to him and fathered a mamzer with her. he fathers a child, yes, he does not father a child, no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: "Which is the one 'a crooked one cannot be straightened'? — This refers to one who engages in forbidden relations and begets from her a mamzer, etc. If he begot — no, if he did not beget — yes?"

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: גּוֹנֵב אָדָם — אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁיַּחֲזִיר גְּנֵבוֹ וִיתַקֵּן, גּוֹזֵל אָדָם — אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁיַּחֲזִיר גְּזֵלוֹ וִיתַקֵּן, אֲבָל הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וַאֲסָרָהּ לְבַעְלָהּ — נִטְרַד מִן הָעוֹלָם וְהָלַךְ לוֹ.
human_translation: Isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: a person steals it is possible that he return his stolen property and be made straight; a person robs from another it is possible that he return his robbed property and be made straight. However, one who has sexual relations with a married woman and renders her forbidden to her husband is banished from the world and passes away.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: One who steals from a person — it is possible for him to return his theft and rectify it, one who robs a person — it is possible for him to return his robbery and rectify it, but one who commits adultery with a married woman and causes her to be forbidden to her husband — he is driven from the world and he goes away.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: אֵין אוֹמֵר ״בַּקְּרוּ גָּמָל״ ״בַּקְּרוּ חֲזִיר״, אֶלָּא ״בַּקְּרוּ טָלֶה״. וְאֵי זֶה — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁפֵּירַשׁ מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: does not say: Inspect the camel, or: Inspect the pig, Rather, Inspect the lamb. And who is this? This is a Torah scholar who leaves Torah
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: One does not say "Inspect the camel" or "Inspect the pig," rather "Inspect the lamb." And who is this? This is a Torah scholar who has properly expounded from the Torah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁפֵּירַשׁ מִן הַתּוֹרָה, עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״כְּצִפּוֹר נוֹדֶדֶת מִן קִנָּהּ כֵּן אִישׁ נוֹדֵד מִמְּקוֹמוֹ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״מַה מָּצְאוּ אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם בִּי עָוֶל כִּי רָחֲקוּ מֵעָלָי״!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish said: Any Torah scholar who leaves the Torah, about him the verse says: “As a bird that wanders from her nest, so is a man who wanders from his place” And it says: “What unrighteousness have your fathers found in Me, that they are gone far from Me?”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish said: Every Torah scholar who properly explains from the Torah, upon him the Scripture says: "Like a bird wandering from its nest, so is a man wandering from his place," and it says: "What injustice did your ancestors find in me, that they distanced themselves from me!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ פְּנוּיָה, כָּאן בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן
human_translation: not difficult. Here, with his unmarried sister. There, with a married woman, And if you wish, say This and that to a married woman. And not difficult. Here,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here regarding his unmarried sister, here regarding a married woman. And if you wish, say: this and this regarding a married woman, and it is not difficult: here

hebrew_text: בְּאוֹנֶס, כָּאן בְּרָצוֹן. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא הָא וְהָא בְּאוֹנֶס, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּאֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן, כָּאן בְּאֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: with a rape, There, willfully, And if you wish, say this and that with a rape, and not difficult. Here, to the wife of a priest, There, to the wife of an Israelite,
llm_translation: In a case of coercion, here it is considered voluntary. And if you wish, say: Here and here it is due to coercion, and it is not difficult: here with the wife of a Kohen, here with the wife of an Israelite.

hebrew_text: ״וְלַיּוֹצֵא וְלַבָּא אֵין שָׁלוֹם״, אָמַר רַב: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיּוֹצֵא אָדָם מִדְּבַר הֲלָכָה לִדְבַר מִקְרָא — שׁוּב אֵין לוֹ שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: “Neither was there any peace to him that went out or came in Rav said: Once a person leaves of halakha , for of the Torah he will no longer have peace.
llm_translation: "And for the one who goes out and comes in there is no peace," Rav said: Once a person goes out from the realm of Halakha to the realm of Scripture - he no longer has peace.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: זֶה הַפּוֹרֵשׁ מִתַּלְמוּד לְמִשְׁנָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִתַּלְמוּד לְתַלְמוּד.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: This one who leaves of Talmud to Mishna. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even of Talmud for Talmud,
llm_translation: Samuel said: This is one who separates from Talmud to Mishnah. And Rabbi Yohanan said: Even from Talmud to Talmud.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֶיתֵּר נְדָרִים — פּוֹרְחִין בָּאֲוִיר וְאֵין לָהֶם עַל מָה שֶׁיִּסָּמֵכוּ.
human_translation: dissolution of vows, fly in the air and have nothing to support them,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Heter Nedarim" - they are floating in the air and have nothing upon which to rely.

hebrew_text: הִלְכוֹת שַׁבָּת, חֲגִיגוֹת וְהַמְּעִילוֹת — הֲרֵי הֵם כַּהֲרָרִים הַתְּלוּיִן בִּשְׂעָרָהּ, שֶׁהֵן מִקְרָא מוּעָט וַהֲלָכוֹת מְרוּבּוֹת. הַדִּינִין וְהָעֲבוֹדוֹת הַטְּהָרוֹת וְהַטְּמָאוֹת וַעֲרָיוֹת — יֵשׁ לָהֶן עַל מָה שֶׁיִּסָּמֵכוּ, וְהֵן הֵן גּוּפֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: The halakhot of Shabbat, Festival peace and misuse are like mountains suspended by a hair, as they little the Torah, and halakhot are numerous. monetary law, rites, ritual purity and impurity, and those with whom relations are forbidden have something to support them, and these are the essential parts of Torah.
llm_translation: Laws of Shabbat, Festivals, and Garments - behold they are like mountains hanging by a hair, for they have few verses and many laws. The laws, the rituals, the pure and impure, and the forbidden relationships - they have what to rely on, and they are the essence of the Torah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לָהֶם עַל מָה שֶׁיִּסָּמֵכוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יַפְלִיא״ ״כִּי יַפְלִיא״ שְׁתֵּי פְּעָמִים: אַחַת הַפְלָאָה לְאִיסּוּר, וְאַחַת הַפְלָאָה לְהֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer said: have something to support them, as it is stated: “When clearly utter “When clearly utter twice. One clear utterance is for prohibition, and one clear utterance is for dissolution,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, Tanya, Rabbi Eliezer says: They have on what to rely, as it is stated: 'For it is marvelous' 'For it is marvelous' twice: one marvel for prohibition, and one marvel for permission."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לָהֶם עַל מָה שֶׁיִּסָּמֵכוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי בְאַפִּי״ — בְּאַפִּי נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי, וְחָזַרְתִּי בִּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: have something to support them, as it is stated: “Wherefore I swore in My wrath” In my wrath I swore, and I retracted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: They have on what to rely, as it is stated: "‘As I swore in My wrath’ — ‘In My wrath I swore,’ and it shall come to pass in My time."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לָהֶם עַל מָה שֶׁיִּסָּמֵכוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּל נְדִיב לִבּוֹ״. חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן אֲחִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ לָהֶם עַל מָה שֶׁיִּסָּמֵכוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי וָאֲקַיֵּימָה לִשְׁמוֹר מִשְׁפְּטֵי צִדְקֶךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: have something to support them, as it is stated: “Whoever is of a willing heart, Ḥananya, son of Rabbi Yehoshua’s brother, says: They have something to support them, as it is stated: “I have sworn, and have fulfilled it, to observe your righteous ordinances”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak says: They have upon what to rely, as it is stated: "Everyone whose heart uplifted him." Chananya the son of Achi, Rabbi Yehoshua says: They have upon what to rely, as it is stated: "I have sworn and I will fulfill to observe Your righteous ordinances."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִי הֲוַאי הָתָם, אָמְרִי לְהוּ: דִּידִי עֲדִיפָא מִדִּידְכוּ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יַחֵל דְּבָרוֹ״ — הוּא אֵינוֹ מוֹחֵל, אֲבָל אֲחֵרִים מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ. אָמַר רָבָא: לְכוּלְּהוּ אִית לְהוּ פִּירְכָא, לְבַר מִדִּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּלֵית לֵיהּ פִּירְכָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: If I had been there, said to them: My is better than yours, as it is stated: “He shall not nullify his word” He cannot nullify his word; however, others, may nullify for him Rava said: For all of there is refutation, except for that of Shmuel, for which there is no refutation.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If he is there, they say to him: "My judgment is preferable to yours" - as it is stated: "His word shall not be annulled." He himself does not annul, but others annul for him. Rava said: For all of them there is a rebuttal, except for the son of Shmuel who has no rebuttal.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי מִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — דִּלְמָא כִּדְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: לְעוֹלָם אֵין אֶחָד מֵהֶם נָזִיר, שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה נְזִירוּת אֶלָּא לְהַפְלָאָה.
human_translation: As, if from of Rabbi Eliezer, perhaps in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said in the name of Rabbi Tarfon. As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: Actually, neither of them is a nazirite, as naziriteship is effected only by a clear utterance
llm_translation: From Rabbi Eliezer — perhaps like Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Tarfon. As it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: "One of them is never a Nazir, for the vow of Nazirite was only given for wonderment."

hebrew_text: אִי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — דִּלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: בְּאַפִּי נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי — וְלָא הָדַרְנָא בִּי. אִי מִדְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק — דִּלְמָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדִּשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: גָּמַר בְּלִבּוֹ — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיּוֹצִיא בִּשְׂפָתָיו, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא הוֹצִיא בִּשְׂפָתָיו.
human_translation: if from of Rabbi Yehoshua, perhaps this is what is saying: In my wrath I swore and I do not take it back, If from of Rabbi Yitzḥak, perhaps to exclude of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: one decided in his heart he must verbally express And this teaches us that even though he did not verbally express
llm_translation: From Rabbi Yehoshua - perhaps this is what he meant: "With my mouth I swore - but I did not follow through." From Rabbi Yitzchak - perhaps he did not want to go out because of Shmuel. For Shmuel said: "Even though he has decided in his heart, he must express it with his lips," and this is what we infer: even though he did not express it with his lips.

hebrew_text: אִי מִדַּחֲנַנְיָה בֶּן אֲחִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — דִּלְמָא כְּרַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּעִין לְקַיֵּים אֶת הַמִּצְוָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי וָאֲקַיֵּימָה לִשְׁמוֹר מִשְׁפְּטֵי צִדְקֶךָ״.
human_translation: if from of Rabbi Ḥananya, son of Rabbi Yehoshua’s brother, perhaps in accordance with Rav Giddel, Rav said As Rav Giddel said Rav said: From where that one may take an oath to fulfill a mitzva, As it is stated: “I have sworn, and have fulfilled it, to observe Your righteous ordinances”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If Midḥananya son of Aḥi, the disciple of Rabbi Yehoshua, perhaps like Rav Giddel said Rav. For Rav Giddel said Rav: From where do we derive that one must swear to fulfill a commandment? As it is stated: "I have sworn and I will fulfill it, to observe Your righteous ordinances."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל לֵית לֵיהּ פִּירְכָא. אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: טָבָא חֲדָא פִּלְפַּלְתָּא חֲרִיפְתָּא מִמְּלֵי צַנָּא דְקָרֵי.
human_translation: However, Shmuel’s there is no refutation. Rava said, some say Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak This that people say: One spicy pepper is better than a basketful of squash,
llm_translation: Instead, Shmuel does not have a beard. Rava said, and it was stated by Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: This is what people say: "One good turn deserves another, a sharp pepper from the mouth of a basket weaver."

hebrew_text: הִלְכוֹת שַׁבָּת. מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָן! לָא צְרִיכָא, לְכִדְרַבִּי אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: הַחוֹפֵר גּוּמָּא בְּשַׁבָּת וְאֵין צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא לַעֲפָרָהּ — פָּטוּר עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: the halakhot of Shabbat are written, No, necessary in accordance with Rabbi Abba. As Rabbi Abba said: One who digs a hole on Shabbat only needs its dirt is exempt from
llm_translation: Laws of Shabbat. From where is it derived? It is not necessary, according to Rabbi Abba. For Rabbi Abba said: One who digs a pit on Shabbat and only needs its dirt - he is exempt for it.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: מְלָאכָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְגוּפָהּ — פָּטוּר עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said: a labor not necessary for its own sake, exempt from for it.
llm_translation: Like whom? Like Rabbi Shimon, who said: Work that is not necessary for itself - one is exempt from it.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הָתָם מְתַקֵּן, הָכָא מְקַלְקֵל הוּא.
human_translation: even you say in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, There, creative. Here, is destructive,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is according to Rabbi Yehuda: there, he is fixing; here, he is causing damage.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כַּהֲרָרִין הַתְּלוּיִין בִּשְׂעָרָה״?
human_translation: What Like mountains suspended by a hair?
llm_translation: What is "like mountains suspended by a hair"?

hebrew_text: מְלֶאכֶת מַחְשֶׁבֶת אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה, וּמְלֶאכֶת מַחְשֶׁבֶת לָא כְּתִיבָא.
human_translation: The Torah prohibited creative labor And creative labor is not written
llm_translation: The work of thought, the Torah prohibited, and the work of thought is not written.

hebrew_text: חֲגִיגוֹת. מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָן! לָא צְרִיכָא, לִכְדַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי ״וְחַגּוֹתֶם אוֹתוֹ חַג לַה׳״ — זְבִיחָה? דִּלְמָא ״חוֹגּוּ חַגָּא״ קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא!
human_translation: Festival peace they are written No, necessary in accordance with that which Rav Pappa said to Abaye: From where that this “And you shall celebrate it as a Festival [ veḥagotem ] to the Lord” an animal offering? Perhaps the Merciful One is saying: Celebrate a Festival.
llm_translation: Festivals. From where is it written? Not necessary, as Rav Papa said to Abbaye: From where is this "And you shall celebrate it as a festival to the Lord" — for sacrifice? Perhaps it means "Celebrate a festival" the Merciful One is saying!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, דִּכְתִיב ״וְיָחוֹגּוּ לִי בַּמִּדְבָּר״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּחוֹגּוּ חַגָּא הוּא? וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמַר מֹשֶׁה גַּם אַתָּה תִּתֵּן בְּיָדֵינוּ זְבָחִים וְעוֹלוֹת״.
human_translation: However, if that is so, that it is written: that they may hold a feast [ veyaḥogu ] to Me in the wilderness” So too, is that celebrate a Festival, And if you would say that is so, but isn’t it written: “And Moses said: You must also give into our hand sacrifices and burnt-
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from now, as it is written "and they shall celebrate a festival for Me in the wilderness," is it so that they shall celebrate a festival? And if you would say so, is it so, and it is written: "And Moses said, you too shall give sacrifices and burnt offerings into our hands."

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״אִכְלוּ וּשְׁתוּ וְחוֹגּוּ חַגָּא קַמַּאי״? לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יָלִין חֵלֶב חַגִּי עַד בֹּקֶר״, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּחוֹגָּא הוּא, תַּרְבָּא לְחַגָּא אִית לֵיהּ?!
human_translation: perhaps this is what the Merciful One said: eat, drink, and celebrate a Festival before Me, cannot enter your mind, as it is written: “The fat of My Festival feast [ ḥagi ] shall not remain all night until the morning” And if it enters your mind that it is Festival feast does a Festival feast have fats?
llm_translation: Perhaps this is what the Merciful One is saying: "Eat and drink and celebrate a festival before Me"? It is not as you think, for it is written: "And the fat of my festival offering shall not remain until morning." And if it were as you think that it refers to a festival, is there not already a festival for it?!

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: חֵלֶב הַבָּא בִּזְמַן חַג — ״לֹא יָלִין״!
human_translation: But perhaps this is what the Merciful One states fats that are brought during a Festival may not remain all night.
llm_translation: And perhaps this is what the Merciful One is saying: "The fat that comes at the time of the festival - 'shall not remain'!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: הַבָּא בִּזְמַן חַג — הוּא דְּלֹא יָלִין, הָא דְּכׇל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ — יָלִין?! ״כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה עַד הַבֹּקֶר״, כְּתִיב!
human_translation: However, if that is so, that are brought during a Festival that may not remain overnight. that throughout the year may remain all night. it is written all night into the morning”
llm_translation: Rather from now: one who comes at the time of the festival — he is one who does not stay, this one who all the year entirely — stays?! "All night until morning," it is written!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא אִי מֵהָהוּא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָהוּא לַעֲשֵׂה כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא, הַאי לְלָאו!
human_translation: Perhaps if from that I would say that of a positive mitzva. the Merciful One writes this as a prohibition
llm_translation: Perhaps if not from that, would I say: that one for doing as it is written by the Merciful One, this one for not!

hebrew_text: לְלָאו כְּתַב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״וְלֹא יָלִין מִן הַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר תִּזְבַּח בָּעֶרֶב בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן לַבֹּקֶר״. וְדִלְמָא לַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בִּשְׁנֵי לָאוִין וַעֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: to the prohibition another verse was written: “Neither shall any of the flesh, which you sacrifice the first day at evening, remain all night until the morning” But perhaps violates two prohibitions and a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, another verse has written: "And do not leave any of the flesh which you sacrifice on the evening of the first day until morning." And perhaps one would transgress upon it with two negative commandments and an affirmative commandment!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אָתְיָא ״מִדְבָּר״ ״מִדְבָּר״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְיָחוֹגּוּ לִי בַּמִּדְבָּר״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״הַזְּבָחִים וּמִנְחָה הִגַּשְׁתֶּם לִי בַּמִּדְבָּר״, מָה לְהַלָּן זְבָחִים — אַף כָּאן זְבָחִים.
human_translation: Rather, comes “wilderness” “wilderness” It is written here: “They shall make an offering to Me in the wilderness” and it is written there: “Did you bring to Me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness, Just as there animal offerings, so too here, animal offerings,
llm_translation: Rather: it comes from "midbar" "midbar." It is written here: "And they shall celebrate for Me in the wilderness," and it is written there: "You have brought sacrifices and offerings to Me in the wilderness." Just as there they brought sacrifices, so too here they bring sacrifices.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״כַּהֲרָרִין הַתְּלוּיִין בִּשְׂעָרָה״ — דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִדִּבְרֵי קַבָּלָה לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: And what like mountains suspended by a hair? one does not derive Torah matters from texts of the tradition,
llm_translation: "And what is 'like mountains suspended by a hair'? — Words of Torah are not to be weighed against words of Kabbalah."

hebrew_text: מְעִילוֹת. מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָן! אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לִכְדִתְנַן: הַשָּׁלִיחַ שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ — בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל, לֹא עָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ — שָׁלִיחַ מָעַל.
human_translation: misuse they are written Rami bar Ḥama said: is necessary only for that which we learned an agent who performs his agency, the homeowner has misused did not perform his agency, the agent has misused
llm_translation: Cloaks. From where is it written? Ramei bar Hama said: It is necessary only according to what we learned: If the agent performed his mission - the homeowner is liable; if he did not perform his mission - the agent is liable.

hebrew_text: וְכִי עָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ, אַמַּאי מָעַל? וְכִי זֶה חוֹטֵא וְזֶה מִתְחַיֵּיב? הַיְינוּ כַּהֲרָרִין הַתְּלוּיִין בִּשְׂעָרָה.
human_translation: And when he performed his agency, why misused And is it that this one sins and that one is rendered liable? This is like mountains suspended by a hair.
llm_translation: "And when he performed his agency, why did he transgress? And is this one sinning and that one liable? That is like mountains suspended by a hair."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי מְעִילָה דְּיָלְפָא ״חֵטְא״ ״חֵטְא״ מִתְּרוּמָה, מָה הָתָם שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ — אַף כָּאן שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ?
human_translation: Rava said: And what is difficulty Perhaps misuse is different, as it is derived “sin” “sin” from teruma : Just as there, a person’s agent is like himself, so too here, a person’s agent is like himself,
llm_translation: Rava said: And what is the question? Perhaps the cloak of Yalfah is different, "sin" "sin" from terumah, just as there, the emissary of a person is like himself — so too here, the emissary of a person is like himself?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְכִדְתַנְיָא: נִזְכַּר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וְלֹא נִזְכַּר שָׁלִיחַ — שָׁלִיחַ מָעַל. שָׁלִיחַ עַנְיָא מַאי קָא עָבֵיד? הַיְינוּ כַּהֲרָרִין הַתְּלוּיִין בִּשְׂעָרָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: is necessary only for that which is taught the homeowner remembered and the agent did not remember, the agent has misused what did the poor agent do? This is like mountains suspended by a hair.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: It was not necessary except according to the one who taught: If the homeowner was mentioned but the agent was not mentioned - the agent is liable. What is the poor agent doing? He is like the mountains suspended by a hair.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמּוֹצִיא מְעוֹת הֶקְדֵּשׁ לְחוּלִּין!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: what is difficulty Perhaps is just as it is with one who spends consecrated money for non-sacred
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: What is the difficulty? Perhaps it is because he may inadvertently transfer funds from sacred to mundane!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לִכְדִתְנַן: נָטַל אֶבֶן אוֹ קוֹרָה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא מָעַל, נְתָנָהּ לַחֲבֵירוֹ — הוּא מָעַל וַחֲבֵירוֹ לֹא מָעַל. מִכְּדֵי מִישְׁקָל שַׁקְלַהּ, מָה לִי הוּא וּמָה לִי חֲבֵירוֹ? הַיְינוּ כַּהֲרָרִין הַתְּלוּיִין בִּשְׂעָרָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: is necessary only for that which we learned picked up a consecrated stone or beam, he has not misused gave it to another, he has misused and the other has not misused Since he picked it up, what is to me he and what is to me another? this is like mountains suspended by a hair.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: It is necessary only according to what we learned: If one takes a stone or a beam of consecrated property - he has not transgressed; if he gives it to his fellow - he has transgressed, but his fellow has not transgressed. Since his weight is weighed, what is it to me and what is it to his fellow? That is like mountains hanging by a hair.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכָא
human_translation: What is difficulty Perhaps in accordance with of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: Here,
llm_translation: And what is the question? Perhaps like Shmuel, for Shmuel said: Here.

hebrew_text: בְּגִזְבָּר הַמְּסוּרוֹת לוֹ אַבְנֵי בִנְיָן עָסְקִינַן, דְּכׇל הֵיכָא דְּמַנְּחָה — בִּרְשׁוּתָא דִּידֵיהּ מַנְּחָה.
human_translation: we are dealing with the treasurer to whom the building stones were transferred that anywhere that is resting, it is resting within his domain.
llm_translation: In the case of a treasury official who has stones designated for building, we are dealing with a situation where wherever a "minchah" is placed, it is considered as being in his possession.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִסֵּיפָא: בְּנָאָהּ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא מָעַל עַד שֶׁיָּדוּר תַּחְתֶּיהָ בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. מִכְּדֵי שַׁנּוֹיֵי שַׁנְּיַיהּ, מָה לִי דָּר וּמָה לִי לָא דָּר, הַיְינוּ כַּהֲרָרִין הַתְּלוּיִין בִּשְׂעָרָה?
human_translation: Rather, on the latter clause If he built into his house, he has not misused until he dwells under it that is worth a peruta . Since he has changed what is to me he dwelt and what is to me not dwell this is like mountains suspended by a hair.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from the latter part: if he built it within his house - this does not constitute an ascent until he resides beneath it with a shavah perutah. Since they differ, what difference does it make to me whether he resides or does not reside, meaning like mountains hanging by a hair?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא לְכִדְרַב. דְּאָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִנִּיחָהּ עַל פִּי אֲרוּבָּה. אִי דָּר בֵּיהּ — אִין, לָא דָּר בֵּיהּ — לָא.
human_translation: And what is difficulty Perhaps in accordance with of Rav. As Rav said: where he placed over a window, If he dwelt in yes, he did not dwell in it, no,
llm_translation: And what is the question? Perhaps according to Rav, for Rav said: For example, if one placed it at the entrance of the courtyard. If one resides in it - yes, if one does not reside in it - no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם כִּדְרָבָא. וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמּוֹצִיא מְעוֹת הֶקְדֵּשׁ לְחוּלִּין, הָתָם מִידָּע יָדַע דְּאִיכָּא זוּזֵי דְהֶקְדֵּשׁ, אִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לְעַיּוֹנֵי. הָכָא מִי יָדַע! הַיְינוּ כַּהֲרָרִין הַתְּלוּיִין בִּשְׂעָרָה.
human_translation: Rather, actually in accordance with of Rava, And which a difficulty for you, just as it is with one who spends consecrated money for non-sacred There, knew that he had consecrated coins he should have examined Here, did know This is like mountains suspended by a hair.
llm_translation: Rather, always like Rav. And it is difficult for you: since he is removing coins of the Temple treasury to ordinary use, there he knows that there are Temple coins, so he pays attention. But here, who knows! That is like mountains hanging by a hair.

hebrew_text: מִקְרָא מוּעָט וַהֲלָכוֹת מְרוּבּוֹת. תָּנָא: נְגָעִים וְאֹהָלוֹת, מִקְרָא מוּעָט וַהֲלָכוֹת מְרוּבּוֹת. נְגָעִים מִקְרָא מוּעָט? נְגָעִים מִקְרָא מְרוּבֶּה הוּא! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: נְגָעִים — מִקְרָא מְרוּבֶּה וַהֲלָכוֹת מוּעָטוֹת, אֹהָלוֹת — מִקְרָא מוּעָט וַהֲלָכוֹת מְרוּבּוֹת.
human_translation: little the Torah, and halakhot are numerous. taught leprosy and tents little in the Torah and halakhot are numerous. leprosy, little the Torah? Leprosy is numerous the Torah Rav Pappa said this is what is saying: Leprosy has numerous the Torah but few halakhot . tents little the Torah but numerous halakhot .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Scripture is scant, and laws are abundant. It was taught: Regarding skin diseases and tents, Scripture is scant, and laws are abundant. Are skin diseases considered scant in Scripture? Skin diseases are actually abundant in Scripture! Rav Papa said, this is what he meant: Skin diseases - Scripture is abundant, and laws are scant; tents - Scripture is scant, and laws are abundant."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? אִי מִסְתַּפְּקָא לָךְ מִילְּתָא בִּנְגָעִים — עַיֵּין בִּקְרָאֵי, וְאִי מִסְתַּפְּקָא לָךְ מִילְּתָא בְּאֹהָלוֹת — עַיֵּין בְּמַתְנִיתִין.
human_translation: And what is the practical difference If you are uncertain a matter with leprosy, delve into the verses, And if you are uncertain a matter with tents, delve into the Mishna,
llm_translation: And what is derived from it? If you are in doubt about a matter concerning afflictions - look in the Scriptures, and if you are in doubt about a matter concerning tents - look in the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: דִּינִין. מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָן! לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְכִדְרַבִּי.
human_translation: monetary law are written is necessary only of Rabbi
llm_translation: Laws. From the writing it is written! It was not necessary except according to Rabbi.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״ — מָמוֹן. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר מָמוֹן, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא נֶפֶשׁ מַמָּשׁ? נֶאֶמְרָה נְתִינָה לְמַטָּה. וְנֶאֶמְרָה נְתִינָה לְמַעְלָה. מָה לְהַלָּן — מָמוֹן, אַף כָּאן — מָמוֹן.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi says: life for life” money. you say money, or it is solely an actual life giving is stated below: and giving is stated above, Just as there, money, so too here, money.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says, "A life in place of a life" — money. Do you say money, or is it actually a literal life? It was said to mean compensation below. And it was said to mean compensation above. Just as there it is money, so too here it is money.

hebrew_text: עֲבוֹדוֹת. מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָן! לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְהוֹלָכַת הַדָּם. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהִקְרִיבוּ״, זוֹ קַבָּלַת הַדָּם.
human_translation: rites are written is necessary only with regard to carrying the blood As it is taught shall offer this is collecting the blood,
llm_translation: Tractate Avodot. It is written in their script! It is only needed for carrying the blood. As it was taught: "And they shall offer," this is the receiving of the blood.

hebrew_text: וְאַפְּקַהּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּלְשׁוֹן הוֹלָכָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִקְרִיב הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הַכֹּל וְהִקְטִיר הַמִּזְבֵּחָה״, וְאָמַר מָר: זוֹ הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ.
human_translation: And the Merciful One expressed in the language of carrying, As it is written: “And the priest shall offer the whole, and make it smoke upon the altar” And the Master said this is carrying the limbs to the ramp
llm_translation: And the Merciful One expressed in the language of walking, as it is written: "And the priest shall bring all of it and burn it upon the altar," and Mar said: This is the walking of limbs to the sheep.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּהוֹלָכָה לָא תַּפְּקַהּ מִכְּלַל קַבָּלָה.
human_translation: That is to say that carrying should not be excluded from the category of collecting.
llm_translation: In the matter of "holakha," it shall not depart from the general principle of tradition.

hebrew_text: טְהָרוֹת. מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָן! לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְשִׁיעוּר מִקְוֶה דְּלָא כְּתִיבָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְרָחַץ אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ בְּמַיִם״ — בְּמֵי מִקְוֶה. ״אֶת כׇּל בְּשָׂרוֹ״ — מַיִם שֶׁכׇּל גּוּפוֹ עוֹלֶה בָּהֶן, וְכַמָּה הֵן — אַמָּה עַל אַמָּה בְּרוּם שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת. וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים מֵי מִקְוֶה אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה.
human_translation: ritual purity is written is necessary only for measure of a ritual bath, which is not written As it is taught “And he shall bathe his flesh in water” in the water of a ritual bath. all his flesh water in which his whole body can enter. And how much is this? One cubit by one cubit with a height of three cubits. And the Sages estimated ritual bath water forty se’a .
llm_translation: Purifications. From where is it written! It is only needed for the measurement of the mikveh, which is not written, as it was taught: "And he shall wash his flesh in water" - in the water of the mikveh. "All his flesh" - water that his entire body can be immersed in, and how much is that - a cubit by a cubit by the height of three cubits. And the Sages measured the water of the mikveh to be forty se'ah.

hebrew_text: טְמָאוֹת. מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָן! לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְכַעֲדָשָׁה מִן הַשֶּׁרֶץ, דְּלָא כְּתִיבָא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״בָּהֶם״ —
human_translation: ritual impurity is written is necessary only with regard to the of a lentil-bulk from a creeping animal, which is not written. As it is taught them
llm_translation: Impure. From where is it written? It is not necessary except for the purpose of excluding a worm from the category of creeping things, as it is not written. As it was taught: "Among them" —

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל בְּכוּלָּן, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מֵהֶם״. יָכוֹל בְּמִקְצָתָן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בָּהֶם״.
human_translation: might an entire, The verse states: of them might some of them The verse states: “Them,”
llm_translation: One might have thought the law applies to all of them, therefore the Scripture states: "from them." One might have thought the law applies to some of them — therefore the Scripture states: "in them."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ בְּמִקְצָתוֹ שֶׁהוּא כְּכוּלּוֹ. שִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה, שֶׁכֵּן חוֹמֶט — תְּחִלָּתוֹ בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כִּזְנַב הַלְּטָאָה.
human_translation: How this until he touches some of it that is like the whole, the Sages estimated of a lentil-bulk. that its early the ḥomet , of a lentil-bulk. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: of a lizard’s tail,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How so? Until it reaches its tip that is like its entirety. The sages estimated it as a lentil, so too a barleycorn - its beginning is as a lentil. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Like the tail of a lizard.

hebrew_text: עֲרָיוֹת. מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָן! לֹא נִצְרְכָה
human_translation: those with whom relations are forbidden are written is necessary only
llm_translation: Ervaot. Mikhtav ketivan! Lo nitzrakha.

hebrew_text: לְבִתּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ, דְּלָא כְּתִיבָא.
human_translation: to his daughter from the woman he raped, which is not written
llm_translation: To his daughter from his betrothed, for it is not as written.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא, אֲמַר לִי רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: אָתְיָא ״הֵנָּה״ ״הֵנָּה״.
human_translation: As Rava said: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said to me derived they [ hena ], they,
llm_translation: Rava said, Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi said to me: "Hena, hena."

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא ״זִימָּה״ ״זִימָּה״.
human_translation: derived lewdness zima “lewdness”
llm_translation: The text reads: "Atya 'zimma' 'zimma'."

hebrew_text: הֵן הֵן גּוּפֵי תוֹרָה. הָנֵי — אִין, הָנָךְ לָא? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: הֵן וְהֵן גּוּפֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: These [ hen hen ] are the essential parts of the Torah. These, yes, those no, Rather, say these and those [ hen vehen ] are the essential parts of the Torah.
llm_translation: Behold, behold, the bodies of Torah. These — yes, those are not, are they? Rather say: Behold, and behold, the bodies of Torah.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין
llm_translation: The matter is established upon you, all are obligated.

hebrew_text: אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין בָּעֲרָיוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית בִּשְׁנַיִם, וְלֹא בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה בְּיָחִיד, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה חָכָם וּמֵבִין מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: One may not expound forbidden sexual relations before three nor act of Creation before two nor by oneself the Chariot, unless wise and understands on his own.
llm_translation: One does not expound on matters of forbidden relationships in a group of three, nor on the account of Creation in a pair, nor on the chariot alone, unless he is wise and understands from his own knowledge.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בְּאַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים, רָתוּי לוֹ כְּאִילּוּ לֹא בָּא לָעוֹלָם: מָה לְמַעְלָה, מָה לְמַטָּה, מָה לְפָנִים, וּמָה לְאָחוֹר. וְכׇל שֶׁלֹּא חָס עַל כְּבוֹד קוֹנוֹ, רָתוּי לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Whoever looks at four matters, it would have been better for him had he never entered the world: what above what is below what was before and what after And anyone who has no concern for the honor of his Maker, deserves to have never come to the world.
llm_translation: Whoever looks at four things, it is as if he has not come into the world: what is above, what is below, what is in front, and what is behind. And anyone who does not have regard for the honor of his Creator, it is as if he has not come into the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמְרַתְּ בְּרֵישָׁא: וְלֹא בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה בְּיָחִיד, וַהֲדַר אָמְרַתְּ: אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה חָכָם וּמֵבִין מִדַּעְתּוֹ!
human_translation: You said in the first clause Nor the Chariot by oneself, and you subsequently said: Unless is wise and understands on his own,
llm_translation: The Gemara said at first: "Not in a chariot by oneself," and then it said: "Unless one is wise and understands from his own knowledge!"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין בָּעֲרָיוֹת לִשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית לִשְׁנַיִם, וְלֹא בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה לַיָּחִיד, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה חָכָם וּמֵבִין מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: This is what the mishna is saying: One may not expound the forbidden sexual relations before three nor act of Creation before two, nor the Chariot to one, unless was wise and understands on his own.
llm_translation: Thus he said: One does not expound on matters of forbidden relationships to three people, nor on the account of Creation to two people, nor on the chariot to an individual, unless he is wise and understands from his own knowledge.

hebrew_text: אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין בָּעֲרָיוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ אֶל כׇּל שְׁאֵר בְּשָׂרוֹ״. ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״ — תְּרֵי, ״שְׁאֵר בְּשָׂרוֹ״ — חַד, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תִקְרְבוּ לְגַלּוֹת עֶרְוָה״.
human_translation: One may not expound forbidden sexual relations before three What is the reason If we say because it is written: “None of you [ ish , ish ] shall approach any near of kin “Man, man” two; “any near of kin to him” one; and the Merciful One states: “You shall not approach to uncover their nakedness,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: One does not expound on matters of forbidden relationships in a group of three. What is the reason? Perhaps because it is written: "A man, a man, to all his close relatives." "A man, a man" - two, "all his close relatives" - one. And the Merciful One said: "Do not come near to uncover nakedness."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי יְקַלֵּל אֱלֹהָיו״, ״אִישׁ אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִתֵּן מִזַּרְעוֹ לַמּוֹלֶךְ״, הָכִי נָמֵי?
human_translation: If that is so, this verse: “Any man [ ish , ish ] who curses his God” “Any man [ ish , ish ] who gives of his seed to the Molekh ” So too
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, as it is written: "A man who curses his God," "A man who gives of his seed to Molech," is it so?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָנְהוּ — מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַגּוֹיִם, שֶׁמּוּזְהָרִין עַל בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם וְעַל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rather, those are required for him, to include gentiles, who are commanded with regard to blessing, God, and with regard to idol worship just as Jews
llm_translation: Rather, they — seek to include the nations, for they are careful regarding the blessing of the Name and regarding idol worship like Israel.

hebrew_text: הַאי נָמֵי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַגּוֹיִם שֶׁמּוּזְהָרִין עַל הָעֲרָיוֹת כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: this also required for him to include gentiles, who are commanded with regard to forbidden sexual relations, as Jews
llm_translation: This matter, he asks to include the nations who are careful regarding forbidden relationships like Israel.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִדִּכְתִיב: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת מִשְׁמַרְתִּי״, ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם״ — תְּרֵי, ״מִשְׁמַרְתִּי״ — חַד, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לְבִלְתִּי עֲשׂוֹת מֵחֻקּוֹת הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת״.
human_translation: Rather, from the verse “And you shall observe My charge” “And you shall observe [ ushmartem ],” two; “My charge” one; and the Merciful One states do not perform any of these abominable customs”
llm_translation: Rather, from where is it derived? As it is written: "And you shall keep My charge," "and you shall keep" — two, "My charge" — one. And the Merciful One said: "In order not to do from the statutes of abominations."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת״, ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת הַמַּצּוֹת״, ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֵת מִשְׁמֶרֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ״, הָכִי נָמֵי?
human_translation: However, if that is so, that which is written: “And you shall observe the Shabbat” “And you shall observe the festival of matzot ” “And you shall observe the charge of the sacred things” so too,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, now that it is written: "And you shall observe the Sabbath," "And you shall observe the matzot," "And you shall observe the charge of the holy place," is it not so? English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין בָּעֲרָיוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה — אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין בְּסִתְרֵי עֲרָיוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: What One may not expound the forbidden sexual relations before three? One may not expound the concealed forbidden sexual relations before three.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: What is meant by "one does not expound on matters of forbidden relationships in a group of three"? One does not expound on hidden matters of forbidden relationships in a group of three.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — סְבָרָא הוּא. בֵּי תְרֵי כִּי יָתְבִי קַמֵּי רַבַּיְיהוּ, חַד שָׁקֵיל וְטָרֵי בַּהֲדֵי רַבֵּיהּ, וְאִידַּךְ מַצְלֵי אוּדְנֵיהּ לִגְמָרָא. תְּלָתָא, חַד שָׁקֵיל וְטָרֵי בַּהֲדֵי רַבֵּיהּ, וְהָנָךְ תְּרֵי שָׁקְלוּ וְטָרוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, וְלָא יָדְעִי מַאי קָאָמַר רַבַּיְיהוּ, וְאָתוּ לְמִישְׁרֵי אִיסּוּרָא בָּעֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: What is the reason? it is logical reasoning: When two sit before their teacher, one is involved in a discussion with his teacher, while the other lends his ear to the teaching. three one is involved in a discussion with his teacher while the two are engaged in a discussion with one another, and they do not know what their teacher is saying, and may come to permitted a forbidden relation
llm_translation: "What is the reason?" - It is a matter of reasoning. In the study hall, when they sat before their teachers, one would take and two would engage with his teacher, and the other would incline his ear to listen. Three - one would take and two would engage with his teacher, and there the two would take and engage with each other, and they did not know what their teacher was saying, and they came to the forbidden relationships.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה נָמֵי!
human_translation: If so, the entire Torah likewise
llm_translation: If so, all the Torah is trustworthy!

hebrew_text: עֲרָיוֹת שָׁאנֵי, דְּאָמַר מָר: גָּזֵל וַעֲרָיוֹת — נַפְשׁוֹ [שֶׁל אָדָם] מְחַמְּדָתָן וּמִתְאַוָּה לָהֶם.
human_translation: forbidden sexual relations is different, the Master said: Robbery and forbidden sexual relations soul covets and lusts after.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Arayot Sha'anei, de'amar mar: gazel va'arayot - nafsho shel adam mechamdataan u'mitavah lahem." Translation: "The forbidden relationships are two, as the Master said: theft and forbidden relationships - a person's soul cherishes them and desires them."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, גָּזֵל נָמֵי? עֲרָיוֹת, בֵּין בְּפָנָיו בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו נְפִישׁ יִצְרֵיהּ. גָּזֵל, בְּפָנָיו — נְפִישׁ יִצְרֵיהּ, שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — לָא נְפִישׁ יִצְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, robbery also those with whom relations are forbidden, his inclination is strong whether or not are before him. robbery, before him his inclination is strong, not before him his inclination is not strong,
llm_translation: If so, is theft also considered a grave sin? Immorality, whether in his presence or not in his presence, his inclination is strong. Theft, in his presence - his inclination is strong, not in his presence - his inclination is not strong.

hebrew_text: ״וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית בִּשְׁנַיִם״. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כִּי שְׁאַל נָא לְיָמִים רִאשׁוֹנִים״ — יָחִיד שׁוֹאֵל, וְאֵין שְׁנַיִם שׁוֹאֲלִין.
human_translation: “Nor act of Creation before two.” From where are these matters As the Sages taught “For ask now of the days past, an individual may ask but two may not ask,
llm_translation: "And not in the work of creation in pairs." From where are these matters derived? For the Rabbis taught: "Inquire, please, of the former days" - an individual inquires, and not two inquire.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִשְׁאַל אָדָם קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְמִן הַיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אָדָם עַל הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: might a person may ask preceding the creation of the world. the verse states: “Since the day that God created man upon the earth,”
llm_translation: One might have thought that a person can inquire before the world was created, Scripture teaches: "From the day that God created man upon the earth."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יִשְׁאַל אָדָם מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְרֵאשִׁית, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְיָמִים רִאשׁוֹנִים אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ לְפָנֶיךָ״.
human_translation: might a person may not ask during the six days of Creation the verse states: of the days past, which were before you,”
llm_translation: He can not ask a person from the six days of creation, Scripture teaches: "For the former days that were before you."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִשְׁאַל אָדָם מָה לְמַעְלָה וּמָה לְמַטָּה מָה לְפָנִים וּמָה לְאָחוֹר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּלְמִקְצֵה הַשָּׁמַיִם וְעַד קְצֵה הַשָּׁמָיִם״, מִלְּמִקְצֵה הַשָּׁמַיִם וְעַד קְצֵה הַשָּׁמָיִם — אַתָּה שׁוֹאֵל, וְאֵין אַתָּה שׁוֹאֵל מָה לְמַעְלָה מָה לְמַטָּה, מָה לְפָנִים מָה לְאָחוֹר.
human_translation: might a person may ask what is above, what is below, what was before, what is after the verse states: “From one end of the heavens to the other” With regard to that from one end of the heavens to the other, you may ask, but you may not ask what is above, what is below, what was before, what is after.
llm_translation: One might have thought that a person may inquire what is above and what is below, what is in front and what is behind. Therefore, the Talmud teaches: "And to the ends of the heavens," from one end of the heavens to the other end of the heavens - you may inquire, but you may not inquire what is above, what is below, what is in front, and what is behind.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״לְּמִקְצֵה הַשָּׁמַיִם וְעַד קְצֵה הַשָּׁמָיִם״, ״לְמִן הַיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אָדָם עַל הָאָרֶץ״ — לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Now that it is derived from “from one end of the heavens to the other,” why do I “since the day that God created man upon the earth”?
llm_translation: The question that arose in his mind: "From 'the edge of the sky to the edge of the sky,' 'from the day that God created man on the earth' - what do I need it for?"

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן מִן הָאָרֶץ עַד לָרָקִיעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְמִן הַיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אָדָם עַל הָאָרֶץ״. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁסָּרַח — הִנִּיחַ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יָדָיו עָלָיו וּמִיעֲטוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָחוֹר וָקֶדֶם צַרְתָּנִי וַתָּשֶׁת עָלַי כַּפֶּכָה״.
human_translation: according to Rabbi Elazar. Rabbi Elazar said: Adam the first man from the ground to the skies, as it is stated: “Since the day that God created man upon the earth, When he sinned, the Holy One, Blessed be He, placed His hand upon him and diminished him, as it is stated: “You fashioned me behind and before, and laid Your hand upon me”
llm_translation: As Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Elazar said: The first man, from the earth to the firmament, as it is said: "From the day that God created man upon the earth." And once he sinned, the Holy One, blessed be He, laid His hand upon him and diminished him, as it is said: "Behind and before You have hemmed me in, and You have laid Your hand upon me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן, מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְמִן הַיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אָדָם עַל הָאָרֶץ וּלְמִקְצֵה הַשָּׁמַיִם וְעַד קְצֵה הַשָּׁמָיִם״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁסָּרַח הִנִּיחַ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יָדוֹ עָלָיו וּמִיעֲטוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתָּשֶׁת עָלַי כַּפֶּכָה״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The Adam the first man was from one end of the world to the other, as it is stated: “Since the day that God created man upon the earth, and from one end of the heavens to the other,” Once he sinned, the Holy One, Blessed be He, placed His hand upon him and diminished him, as it states: “And laid Your hand upon me.”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Adam the first, from the end of the world until its end he was, as it is stated: "From the day that God created man upon the earth, and to the end of the heavens" (Deuteronomy 4:32). Once he became corrupt, the Holy One, blessed be He, placed His hand upon him and diminished him, as it is stated: "And You have laid Your hand upon me" (Psalms 139:5).

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי! אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חַד שִׁיעוּרָא הוּא.
human_translation: If so, the verse contradict each other, this and that are one, measure.
llm_translation: Thus, the verses of Ahadadei are difficult! Both this and that are one measure.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים נִבְרְאוּ בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, תֹּהוּ וָבֹהוּ, אוֹר וָחֹשֶׁךְ, רוּחַ וּמַיִם, מִדַּת יוֹם וּמִדַּת לַיְלָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Ten things were created on the first day and they are Heaven and earth; tohu and vohu , light and darkness; wind and water; the length of day and the length of night.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Ten things were created on the first day, and these are they: Heaven and Earth, Tohu and Bohu, Light and Darkness, Wind and Water, the measure of day and the measure of night.

hebrew_text: שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ — דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּרֵאשִׁית בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ״, תֹּהוּ וָבֹהוּ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָאָרֶץ הָיְתָה תֹהוּ וָבֹהוּ״, אוֹר וָחֹשֶׁךְ, חֹשֶׁךְ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְחֹשֶׁךְ עַל פְּנֵי תְהוֹם״, אוֹר — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים יְהִי אוֹר״, רוּחַ וּמַיִם — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרוּחַ אֱלֹהִים מְרַחֶפֶת עַל פְּנֵי הַמָּיִם״, מִדַּת יוֹם וּמִדַּת לַיְלָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי עֶרֶב וַיְהִי בֹקֶר יוֹם אֶחָד״.
human_translation: Heaven and earth, as it is written: “In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth” Tohu and vohu , as it is written: “And the earth was unformed and void [ tohu vavohu ]” Light and darkness; darkness, as it is written: “And darkness was upon the face of the deep” light, as it is written: “And God said: Let there be light” Wind and water, as it is written: “And the wind of God hovered over the face of the waters” The length of day and the length of night, as it is written: “And there was evening, and there was morning, one day”
llm_translation: Heaven and earth — as it is written: "In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth," formless and empty — as it is written: "And the earth was formless and empty," light and darkness, darkness — as it is written: "And darkness was upon the face of the deep," light — as it is written: "And God said, 'Let there be light,'" wind and water — as it is written: "And the spirit of God hovered over the face of the waters," the measure of day and the measure of night — as it is written: "And there was evening and there was morning, one day."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: תֹּהוּ — קַו יָרוֹק שֶׁמַּקִּיף אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ, שֶׁמִּמֶּנּוּ יָצָא חֹשֶׁךְ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָשֶׁת חֹשֶׁךְ סִתְרוֹ סְבִיבוֹתָיו״. בֹהוּ — אֵלּוּ אֲבָנִים הַמְפוּלָּמוֹת הַמְשׁוּקָּעוֹת בַּתְּהוֹם, שֶׁמֵּהֶן יוֹצְאִין מַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָטָה עָלֶיהָ קַו תֹהוּ וְאַבְנֵי בֹהוּ״.
human_translation: It was taught Tohu a green line that encompasses the entire world, and from which darkness emerges, as it is stated: “He made darkness His hiding place round about Him” Vohu ; these are damp stones submerged in the depths, from which water emerges, as it is stated: “And He shall stretch over it the line of tohu and stones of vohu ”
llm_translation: Mishnah: Tohu - a green line that encompasses the entire world, from which darkness emerged, as it is stated: "He made darkness His hiding place, His canopy around Him." Bohu - these are stones that fell and sank into the depths, from which water emerges, as it is stated: "And He stretched out over it a line of tohu and stones of bohu."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹר בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן אִיבְּרִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתֵּן אוֹתָם אֱלֹהִים בִּרְקִיעַ הַשָּׁמָיִם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי עֶרֶב וַיְהִי בֹקֶר יוֹם רְבִיעִי״!
human_translation: And light created on the first day? But isn’t it written: “And God set them in the firmament of the heaven” and it is written: “And there was evening, and there was morning, a fourth day”
llm_translation: "And light on the first day created? And it is written: 'And God placed them in the firmament of the heavens,' and it is written: 'And there was evening and there was morning, a fourth day!'"

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אוֹר שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, אָדָם צוֹפֶה בּוֹ מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּסְתַּכֵּל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּדוֹר הַמַּבּוּל וּבְדוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה וְרָאָה שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂיהֶם מְקוּלְקָלִים — עָמַד וּגְנָזוֹ מֵהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיִמָּנַע מֵרְשָׁעִים אוֹרָם״.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: light that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created on the first day through which man could observe from one end of the world to the other. But when the Holy One, Blessed be He, looked upon the generation of the Flood and the generation of the Dispersion and saw that their ways were corrupt He arose and concealed it from them, as it is stated: “And from the wicked their light is withheld”
llm_translation: As Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Elazar said: The light that the Holy One, blessed be He, created on the first day, a person can see from the edge of the world to its end. Once the Holy One, blessed be He, looked at the generation of the Flood and the generation of the Dispersion and saw that their deeds were corrupt, He arose and hid it from them, as it is said: "And their light is withheld from the wicked."

hebrew_text: וּלְמִי גְּנָזוֹ — לַצַּדִּיקִים לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּרְא אֱלֹהִים אֶת הָאוֹר כִּי טוֹב״, וְאֵין ״טוֹב״ אֶלָּא צַדִּיק, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִמְרוּ צַדִּיק כִּי טוֹב״.
human_translation: And for whom did He conceal it? For the righteous people in the future, as it is stated: “And God saw the light, that it was good” and “good” is referring to none righteous, as it is stated: “Say the righteous that it shall be good
llm_translation: And for whom is it stored away? — For the righteous in the future to come, as it is stated: "And God saw the light, that it was good," and "good" refers only to the righteous, as it is stated: "Say, 'The righteous is good.'"

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאָה אוֹר שֶׁגְּנָזוֹ לַצַּדִּיקִים שָׂמַח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹר צַדִּיקִים יִשְׂמָח״.
human_translation: When the light saw that it had been concealed for the righteous, it rejoiced, as it is stated: “The light for the righteous shall rejoice”
llm_translation: When he saw the light that was hidden for the righteous, he rejoiced, as it is said: "The light of the righteous will rejoice."

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: אוֹר שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, אָדָם צוֹפֶה וּמַבִּיט בּוֹ מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הֵן הֵן מְאוֹרוֹת שֶׁנִּבְרְאוּ בְּיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן, וְלֹא נִתְלוּ עַד יוֹם רְבִיעִי.
human_translation: like tanna’im : light that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created on first day man could observe through it from one end of the world to the other; the statement of Rabbi Ya’akov. And the Rabbis say: is the very same as the lights created on the first day, but they were not suspended until the fourth day.
llm_translation: Tannaite: Light that the Holy One, blessed be He, created on the first day, a person gazes and looks at it from the edge of the world to its end, the words of Rabbi Yaakov. And the sages say: These are the luminaries that were created on the first day, and they were not suspended until the fourth day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּא אָמַר רַב: בַּעֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם: בְּחׇכְמָה וּבִתְבוּנָה וּבְדַעַת, וּבְכֹחַ וּבִגְעָרָה וּבִגְבוּרָה, בְּצֶדֶק וּבְמִשְׁפָּט, בְּחֶסֶד וּבְרַחֲמִים.
human_translation: Rav Zutra bar Tuvya said Rav said: The world was created through ten attributes: Through wisdom, through understanding, through knowledge, through strength, through rebuke, through might, through righteousness, through justice, through kindness, and through mercy.
llm_translation: Rav Zutra bar Toviya said in the name of Rav: In ten things the world was created: with wisdom, understanding, and knowledge, with power, rebuke, and strength, with righteousness and justice, with kindness and mercy.

hebrew_text: בְּחׇכְמָה וּבִתְבוּנָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ בְּחׇכְמָה יָסַד אָרֶץ כּוֹנֵן שָׁמַיִם בִּתְבוּנָה״. בְּדַעַת — דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּדַעְתּוֹ תְּהוֹמוֹת נִבְקָעוּ״. בְּכֹחַ וּגְבוּרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵכִין הָרִים בְּכֹחוֹ נֶאְזָר בִּגְבוּרָה״. בִּגְעָרָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״עַמּוּדֵי שָׁמַיִם יְרוֹפָפוּ וְיִתְמְהוּ מִגַּעֲרָתוֹ״. בְּצֶדֶק וּמִשְׁפָּט — דִּכְתִיב: ״צֶדֶק וּמִשְׁפָּט מְכוֹן כִּסְאֶךָ״. בְּחֶסֶד וְרַחֲמִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״זְכֹר רַחֲמֶיךָ ה׳ וַחֲסָדֶיךָ כִּי מֵעוֹלָם הֵמָּה״.
human_translation: through wisdom and through understanding, as it is written: “The Lord founded earth with wisdom, and established the heavens with understanding” through knowledge, as it is written: “With His knowledge the depths were broken up” through strength and through might, as it is written: “Who by Your strength sets fast the mountains, who is girded about with might” through rebuke, as it is written: “The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at His rebuke” through righteousness and justice, as it is written: “Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne” through kindness and mercy, as it is written: “Remember Your mercies, O Lord, and Your kindnesses, for they are from times of old”
llm_translation: In wisdom and understanding - as it is written: "The Lord founded the earth in wisdom, He established the heavens in understanding." In knowledge - as it is written: "By His knowledge the depths were split open." In power and might - as it is written: "He prepares mountains with His power, He girds Himself with might." In rebuke - as it is written: "The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at His rebuke." In righteousness and justice - as it is written: "Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne." In kindness and compassion - as it is written: "Remember Your mercies, O Lord, and Your kindnesses, for they are from of old."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת הָעוֹלָם, הָיָה מַרְחִיב וְהוֹלֵךְ כִּשְׁתֵּי פַקְעִיּוֹת שֶׁל שְׁתִי, עַד שֶׁגָּעַר בּוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְהֶעֱמִידוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַמּוּדֵי שָׁמַיִם יְרוֹפָפוּ וְיִתְמְהוּ מִגַּעֲרָתוֹ״, וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲנִי אֵל שַׁדַּי״ — אֲנִי הוּא שֶׁאָמַרְתִּי לָעוֹלָם דַּי. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת הַיָּם הָיָה מַרְחִיב וְהוֹלֵךְ, עַד שֶׁגָּעַר בּוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְיִבְּשׁוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גּוֹעֵר בַּיָּם וַיַּבְּשֵׁהוּ וְכׇל הַנְּהָרוֹת הֶחֱרִיב״.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Rav said, When the Holy One, Blessed be He, created the world, it continued to expand like two balls of a warp, until the Holy One, Blessed be He, rebuked it and made it stand still, as it is stated: “The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at His rebuke” And this is Reish Lakish said: What is which is written: “I am the Almighty God El Shaddai I am He Who said to the world “enough [dai],” Reish Lakish said: When the Holy One, Blessed be He, created the sea, it continued to expand until the Holy One, Blessed be He, rebuked it and made it dry, as it is stated: “He rebukes the sea and makes it dry, and desiccates all the rivers”
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: At the time when the Holy One, blessed be He, created the world, it was expanding and moving like two flasks of oil, until the Holy One, blessed be He, rebuked it and made it stand, as it is stated: "The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at His rebuke." And this is what Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written: "I am God Almighty" - I am He who said to the world 'enough.' Reish Lakish said: At the time when the Holy One, blessed be He, created the sea, it was expanding and moving, until the Holy One, blessed be He, rebuked it and dried it up, as it is stated: "He rebukes the sea and makes it dry; He dries up all the rivers."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שָׁמַיִם נִבְרְאוּ תְּחִלָּה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִבְרֵאת הָאָרֶץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּרֵאשִׁית בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ״. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֶרֶץ נִבְרֵאת תְּחִלָּה וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּיוֹם עֲשׂוֹת ה׳ אֱלֹהִים אֶרֶץ וְשָׁמָיִם״.
human_translation: the Sages taught: Beit Shammai say: The heavens were created first and afterward the earth was created, as it is stated: “In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth” And Beit Hillel say: earth was created first, and heaven after it, as it is stated: “On the day that the Lord God made earth and heaven”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Beit Shammai say: The heavens were created first, and afterwards the earth, as it is stated: "In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth." And Beit Hillel say: The earth was created first, and afterwards the heavens, as it is stated: "In the day that the Lord God made the earth and the heavens."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, אָדָם בּוֹנֶה עֲלִיָּיה וְאַחַר כָּךְ בּוֹנֶה בַּיִת?! שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַבּוֹנֶה בַשָּׁמַיִם מַעֲלוֹתָיו וַאֲגוּדָּתוֹ עַל אֶרֶץ יְסָדָהּ״. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה שְׁרַפְרַף, וְאַחַר כָּךְ עוֹשֶׂה כִּסֵּא?! שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ הַשָּׁמַיִם כִּסְאִי וְהָאָרֶץ הֲדוֹם רַגְלָי״. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זֶה וָזֶה כְּאַחַת נִבְרְאוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַף יָדִי יָסְדָה אֶרֶץ וִימִינִי טִפְּחָה שָׁמָיִם קוֹרֵא אֲנִי אֲלֵיהֶם יַעַמְדוּ יַחְדָּו״.
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: According to your words, a person build a second floor and build the house afterward? As it is stated: “It is He Who builds His upper chambers in the heaven, and has founded His vault upon the earth” Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: According to your words, a person make a stool and make a seat afterward? As it is stated: “So said the Lord: The heavens are My seat, and the earth My footstool” But the Rabbis say: this and that were created as one, for it is stated: “Indeed, My hand has laid the foundation of the earth, and My right hand has spread out the heavens; when I call to them, they stand up together”
llm_translation: They said to the House of Hillel to the House of Shammai: According to your words, does a person build a roof and only afterwards build a house?! As it is stated: "He who builds his upper chambers in the heavens and founds his vault upon the earth." The House of Shammai said to the House of Hillel: According to your words, does a person make a throne and only afterwards make a footstool?! As it is stated: "Thus says the Lord: 'Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool.'" And the Sages say: Both were created simultaneously, as it is stated: "My own hand founded the earth, and my right hand spread out the heavens; when I call to them, they stand together."

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ, מַאי ״יַחְדָּו״? דְּלָא מִשְׁתַּלְּפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי. קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כְּשֶׁנִּבְרְאוּ — בָּרָא שָׁמַיִם וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּרָא הָאָרֶץ, וּכְשֶׁנָּטָה — נָטָה הָאָרֶץ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָטָה שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: And the others, what, is “together”? that they do not separate from each other. the verses contradict each other, Reish Lakish said: When they were created, He created heavens and afterward created the earth, but when He spread them He spread the earth and afterward He spread the heavens.
llm_translation: The other opinion, what is "together"? That it did not sprout from Hadadezer. The verses of Hadadezer are difficult! Reish Lakish said: When they were created - He created the heavens first, and afterwards He created the earth, and when they were spread out - the earth spread out first, and afterwards the heavens spread out.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שָׁמַיִם״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: שֶׁשָּׁם מַיִם. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: אֵשׁ וּמַיִם, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֱבִיאָן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּטְרָפָן זֶה בָּזֶה, וְעָשָׂה מֵהֶן רָקִיעַ.
