human_translation: What is “heaven” [ shamayim ]? Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: shesham mayim , It was taught in a baraita : esh umayim , teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, brought them and combined them together, and made firmament from them.
llm_translation: What is "heaven"? Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: that there is water there. In the Mishnah it was taught: fire and water, teaching that the Holy One, blessed be He, brought them close to each other, and made from them the firmament.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אֶת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כְּשֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתָּה שֶׁשִּׁימַּשְׁתָּ אֶת נַחוּם אִישׁ גַּם זוֹ עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה, שֶׁהָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ כׇּל ״אֶתִּין״ שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, ״אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ״, מָה הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ בָּהֶן? אָמַר לוֹ: אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: ״שָׁמַיִם״ — שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ״, ״שָׁמַיִם״ — שָׁמַיִם מַמָּשׁ, ״אָרֶץ״ — אֶרֶץ מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael asked Rabbi Akiva when they were walking along the way. He said to him: You who served Naḥum of Gam Zu for twenty-two years, who would expound every et in the Torah what would he expound from “The heaven and the earth” et hashamayim ve’et ha’aretz He said to him: Had it stated: I would have said: Shamayim is the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, Since it states “ et hashamayim ve’et ha’aretz ,” shamayim actual heaven aretz actual earth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael asked Rabbi Akiva while they were walking on the road, he said to him: "You who served Nahum Ish Gam Zu for twenty-two years, who used to expound every 'et' in the Torah, 'et hashamayim ve'et ha'aretz,' what did he expound in them?" He said to him: "If it had only said 'shamayim ve'aretz,' I would have said, 'shamayim' - the name of the Holy One, blessed be He. But now that it says, 'et hashamayim ve'et ha'aretz,' 'shamayim' - actual heavens, 'aretz' - actual earth."

hebrew_text: ״אֵת הָאָרֶץ״ לְמָה לִי — לְהַקְדִּים שָׁמַיִם לָאָרֶץ. ״וְהָאָרֶץ הָיְתָה תֹהוּ וָבֹהוּ״, מִכְּדִי בְּשָׁמַיִם אַתְחֵיל בְּרֵישָׁא, מַאי שְׁנָא דְּקָא חָשֵׁיב מַעֲשֵׂה אֶרֶץ? תָּנָא דְּבֵי ר׳ יִשְׁמָעֵאל: מָשָׁל לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁאָמַר לַעֲבָדָיו: הַשְׁכִּימוּ לְפִתְחִי. הִשְׁכִּים וּמָצָא נָשִׁים וַאֲנָשִׁים. לְמִי מְשַׁבֵּחַ — לְמִי שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכּוֹ לְהַשְׁכִּים וְהִשְׁכִּים.
human_translation: Why do I “and the earth” [ et ha’aretz ]? To heaven preceded earth “And the earth was unformed and void” After all, began with heaven first; what is different recount the creation of earth The Sage of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: a parable of a flesh-and-blood king who said to his servants: Rise early to my entrance. He arose and found women and men Whom does he praise? Those who are unaccustomed to rising early but rose early,
llm_translation: "The land" why to me — to prioritize heavens to earth. "And the earth was formless and void," since in the heavens you began at the outset, what is different that the work of the earth is considered? It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: A parable to a king of flesh and blood who said to his servants: Wake up at my door. He woke up and found women and men. Who does he praise — one who is not accustomed to waking up and woke up.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אוֹי לָהֶם לַבְּרִיּוֹת, שֶׁרוֹאוֹת, וְאֵינָן יוֹדְעוֹת מָה רוֹאוֹת. עוֹמְדוֹת, וְאֵין יוֹדְעוֹת עַל מָה הֵן עוֹמְדוֹת. הָאָרֶץ עַל מָה עוֹמֶדֶת — עַל הָעַמּוּדִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַמַּרְגִּיז אֶרֶץ מִמְּקוֹמָהּ וְעַמּוּדֶיהָ יִתְפַלָּצוּן״. עַמּוּדִים, עַל הַמַּיִם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְרוֹקַע הָאָרֶץ עַל הַמָּיִם״. מַיִם, עַל הֶהָרִים — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל הָרִים יַעַמְדוּ מָיִם״. הָרִים, בְּרוּחַ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הִנֵּה יוֹצֵר הָרִים וּבוֹרֵא רוּחַ״. רוּחַ, בִּסְעָרָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רוּחַ סְעָרָה עוֹשָׂה דְבָרוֹ״. סְעָרָה, תְּלוּיָה בִּזְרוֹעוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִתַּחַת זְרוֹעוֹת עוֹלָם״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Woe to them, the creations, who see and know not what they see; stand and know not upon what they stand. Upon what does the earth stand? Upon pillars, as it is stated: “Who shakes the earth out of its place, and its pillars tremble” pillars upon water, as it is stated: “To Him Who spread forth the earth over the waters” waters upon mountains, as it is stated: “The waters stood above the mountains” mountains wind, as it is stated: “For behold He forms the mountains and creates the wind” wind upon a storm, as it is stated: “Stormy wind, fulfilling His word” storm hangs upon the arm of the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “And underneath are the everlasting arms”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: Woe to the creatures who see but do not know what they see. They stand, and do not know what they are standing on. The earth stands on what? On pillars, as it is said: "He shakes the earth out of its place, and its pillars tremble." Pillars, on the water, as it is said: "He stretches out the earth over the waters." Water, on the mountains, as it is said: "At Your rebuke they flee; at the sound of Your thunder they hasten away." Mountains, with wind, as it is said: "Behold, He forms the mountains and creates the wind." Wind, in a storm, as it is said: "A stormy wind fulfills His word." A storm, dependent on the arm of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is said: "And under the everlasting arms."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר עַמּוּדִים עוֹמֶדֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יַצֵּב גְּבוּלוֹת עַמִּים לְמִסְפַּר בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: שִׁבְעָה עַמּוּדִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חָצְבָה עַמּוּדֶיהָ שִׁבְעָה״. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ אוֹמֵר: עַל עַמּוּד אֶחָד, וְצַדִּיק שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְצַדִּיק יְסוֹד עוֹלָם״.
human_translation: stands on twelve pillars, as it is stated: “He set the borders of the nations according to the number of the children of Israel” And some say: seven pillars, as it is stated: “She has hewn out her seven pillars” Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua says: on one pillar and a righteous person is its name, as it is stated: “But a righteous person is the foundation of the world”
llm_translation: The sages say: On twelve pillars the world stands, as it is said: "He established the borders of the nations according to the number of the children of Israel." And some say: On seven pillars it stands, as it is said: "She has hewn out her seven pillars." Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua says: On one pillar, and his name is righteous, as it is said: "And the righteous is the foundation of the world."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁנֵי רְקִיעִים הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֵן לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ הַשָּׁמַיִם וּשְׁמֵי הַשָּׁמָיִם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: There are two firmaments, as it is stated: “Behold, to the Lord your God belongs the heaven and the heaven of heavens”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: "There are two firmaments," as it is stated: "Behold, to the Lord your God belong the heavens and the heavens of heavens."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: שִׁבְעָה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: וִילוֹן, רָקִיעַ, שְׁחָקִים, זְבוּל, מָעוֹן, מָכוֹן, עֲרָבוֹת. וִילוֹן — אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּשׁ כְּלוּם, אֶלָּא נִכְנָס שַׁחֲרִית וְיוֹצֵא עַרְבִית, וּמְחַדֵּשׁ בְּכׇל יוֹם מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַנּוֹטֶה כַדּוֹק שָׁמַיִם וַיִּמְתָּחֵם כָּאֹהֶל לָשָׁבֶת״. רָקִיעַ — שֶׁבּוֹ חַמָּה וּלְבָנָה כּוֹכָבִים וּמַזָּלוֹת קְבוּעִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּתֵּן אוֹתָם אֱלֹהִים בִּרְקִיעַ הַשָּׁמָיִם״. שְׁחָקִים — שֶׁבּוֹ רֵחַיִים עוֹמְדוֹת וְטוֹחֲנוֹת מָן לַצַּדִּיקִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְצַו שְׁחָקִים מִמָּעַל וְדַלְתֵי שָׁמַיִם פָּתָח. וַיַּמְטֵר עֲלֵיהֶם מָן לֶאֱכוֹל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: seven and they are as follows: Vilon , Rakia , Sheḥakim , Zevul , Ma’on , Makhon , Aravot . Vilon , does not contain anything, but enters at morning and departs evening, and renews the act of Creation daily, as it is stated: “Who stretches out the heavens as a curtain [ Vilon ], and spreads them out as a tent to dwell in” Rakia , in which sun, moon, stars, and zodiac signs are fixed, as it is stated: “And God set them in the firmament [ Rakia ] of the heaven” Sheḥakim , in which mills stand and grind manna for the righteous, as it is stated: “And He commanded the heights [ Sheḥakim ] above, and opened the doors of heaven; and He caused manna to rain upon them for food,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Seven, and these are they: Vilun, Rakia, Shechakim, Zevul, Maon, Makon, Aravot. Vilun - it serves no purpose, but the morning enters and the evening exits, and it renews every day the work of creation, as it is stated: "He stretches out the north over desolation; He hangs the earth upon nothing." Rakia - in it the sun and the moon, stars and constellations are fixed, as it is stated: "And God set them in the firmament of the heaven." Shechakim - in it the storehouses stand and provide food for the righteous, as it is stated: "He commanded the skies above, and opened the doors of heaven; He rained down manna upon them to eat."

hebrew_text: זְבוּל — שֶׁבּוֹ יְרוּשָׁלַיִם וּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּמִזְבֵּחַ בָּנוּי, וּמִיכָאֵל הַשַּׂר הַגָּדוֹל עוֹמֵד וּמַקְרִיב עָלָיו קׇרְבָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּנֹה בָנִיתִי בֵּית זְבוּל לָךְ מָכוֹן לְשִׁבְתְּךָ עוֹלָמִים״. וּמְנָלַן דְּאִיקְּרִי שָׁמַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַבֵּט מִשָּׁמַיִם וּרְאֵה מִזְּבוּל קׇדְשְׁךָ וְתִפְאַרְתֶּךָ״.
human_translation: Zevul , is of Jerusalem and Temple, and altar is built, and Michael, the great minister, stands and sacrifices an offering upon it, as it is stated: “I have surely built a house of Zevul for You, a place for You to dwell forever” And from where do we that is called heaven? As it is written: “Look down from heaven and see, from Your holy and glorious abode [ Zevul ]”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Zevul - shebo Yerushalayim uveit hamikdash, umizbe'ach banu, umikhael hasar hagadol omed umakriv alav korban, shene'emar: "Banah baniti beit Zevul lakh makon leshivtekh olamim." Umenalan de'ikri shamayim, dikhtiv: "Habet mishamayim ure'eh mizbe'ul kodshkha vetif'artekha." English translation: Zebul - in which is Jerusalem and the Temple, and the built altar, and Michael the great prince stands and offers upon it a sacrifice, as it is said: "I have built a house of Zebul for You, a place for Your dwelling forever." And from where do we derive that it is called heaven? As it is written: "Look down from heaven and see from Your holy abode and Your glory."

hebrew_text: מָעוֹן — שֶׁבּוֹ כִּיתּוֹת שֶׁל מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, שֶׁאוֹמְרוֹת שִׁירָה בַּלַּיְלָה וְחָשׁוֹת בַּיּוֹם, מִפְּנֵי כְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יוֹמָם יְצַוֶּה ה׳ חַסְדּוֹ וּבַלַּיְלָה שִׁירֹה עִמִּי״.
human_translation: Ma’on , is where groups of ministering angels who recite song at night and are silent during the day out of respect for Israel, as it is stated: “By day the Lord will command His kindness, and in the night His song is with me”
llm_translation: Abode - that in it are divisions of ministering angels, who sing at night and are silent during the day, for the honor of the people of Israel, as it is said: "By day the Lord commands His steadfast love, and at night His song is with me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בְּתוֹרָה בַּלַּיְלָה — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מוֹשֵׁךְ עָלָיו חוּט שֶׁל חֶסֶד בַּיּוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יוֹמָם יְצַוֶּה ה׳ חַסְדּוֹ״. וּמָה טַעַם ״יוֹמָם יְצַוֶּה ה׳ חַסְדּוֹ״ — מִשּׁוּם ״וּבַלַּיְלָה שִׁירֹה עִמִּי״. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה שֶׁהוּא דּוֹמֶה לְלַיְלָה, הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מוֹשֵׁךְ עָלָיו חוּט שֶׁל חֶסֶד לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁהוּא דּוֹמֶה לְיוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יוֹמָם יְצַוֶּה ה׳ חַסְדּוֹ וּבַלַּיְלָה שִׁירֹה עִמִּי״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: Whoever occupies with Torah at night, the Holy One, Blessed be He, extends a thread of kindness over him by day, as it is stated: “By day, the Lord will command His kindness,” and what is the reason “by day, the Lord will command His kindness”? Because “and in the night His song,” “is with me.” And some say Reish Lakish said: Whoever occupies himself with Torah in this world, which is comparable to night, the Holy One, Blessed be He, extends a thread of kindness over him in the World-to-Come, which is comparable to day, as it is stated: “By day, the Lord will command His kindness, and in the night His song is with me.”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Anyone who engages in Torah study at night - the Holy One, blessed be He, draws upon him a thread of kindness during the day, as it is stated: "By day the Lord ordains His kindness." And what is the reason for "By day the Lord ordains His kindness" - because of "and at night His song is with me." And there are those who say, Reish Lakish said: Anyone who engages in Torah study in this world, which is likened to night, the Holy One, blessed be He, draws upon him a thread of kindness for the World to Come, which is likened to day, as it is stated: "By day the Lord ordains His kindness, and at night His song is with me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי כׇּל הַפּוֹסֵק מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה וְעוֹסֵק בְּדִבְרֵי שִׂיחָה — מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ גַּחֲלֵי רְתָמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַקּוֹטְפִים מַלּוּחַ עֲלֵי שִׂיחַ וְשֹׁרֶשׁ רְתָמִים לַחְמָם״. וּמְנָלַן דְּאִיקְּרִי שָׁמַיִם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשְׁקִיפָה מִמְּעוֹן קׇדְשְׁךָ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: Anyone who pauses from words of Torah to occupy himself with mundane conversation will be fed with the coals of the broom tree, as it is stated: “They pluck saltwort [ maluaḥ ] with wormwood [ alei siaḥ ], and the roots of the broom tree [ retamim ] are their food” And from where do we that is called heaven? As it is stated: “Look forth from Your holy Ma’on , from heaven”
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: Anyone who ceases from the words of Torah and engages in idle talk — they feed him burning coals of broom tree, as it is stated: "Those who gather broom tree have saltwort for their food and roots of broom tree for their warmth." And how do we know that they are called heavens? As it is stated: "Look down from Your holy habitation, from heaven."

hebrew_text: מְכוֹן — שֶׁבּוֹ אוֹצְרוֹת שָׁלֶג וְאוֹצְרוֹת בָּרָד, וַעֲלִיַּית טְלָלִים רָעִים, וַעֲלִיַּית אֲגָלִים, וְחַדְרָהּ שֶׁל סוּפָה [וּסְעָרָה], וּמְעָרָה שֶׁל קִיטוֹר. וְדַלְתוֹתֵיהֶן אֵשׁ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִפְתַּח ה׳ לְךָ אֶת אוֹצָרוֹ הַטּוֹב״.
human_translation: Makhon , is where there are storehouses of snow and storehouses of hail, and the upper chamber of harmful dews, and the upper chamber of drops, and the room of tempests and storms, and the cave of mist. And the doors fire. For it is stated: “The Lord will open for you His good storehouse,
llm_translation: Place - where his treasuries of snow and treasuries of hail, and the ascent of evil dews, and the ascent of locusts, and its chamber of storm and tempest, and its cave of smoke. And its doors are fire - as it is said: "The Lord will open for you His good treasury."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי בִּרְקִיעָא אִיתַנְהוּ? הָנֵי בְּאַרְעָא אִיתַנְהוּ! דִּכְתִיב: ״הַלְלוּ אֶת ה׳ מִן הָאָרֶץ תַּנִּינִים וְכׇל תְּהוֹמוֹת אֵשׁ וּבָרָד שֶׁלֶג וְקִיטוֹר רוּחַ סְעָרָה עוֹשָׂה דְבָרוֹ״! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: דָּוִד בִּיקֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶם רַחֲמִים, וְהוֹרִידָן לָאָרֶץ. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, ״לֹא אֵל חָפֵץ רֶשַׁע אָתָּה לֹא יְגוּרְךָ (בִּמְגוּרְךָ) רָע״. צַדִּיק אַתָּה ה׳, לֹא יָגוּר בִּמְגוּרְךָ רָע. וּמְנָלַן דְּאִיקְּרִי ״שָׁמַיִם״ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַתָּה תִּשְׁמַע הַשָּׁמַיִם מְכוֹן שִׁבְתֶּךָ״.
human_translation: these located in heaven? they located on the earth. As it is written: “Praise the Lord from the earth, sea monsters and all depths, fire and hail, snow and mist, stormy wind, fulfilling His word” Rav Yehuda said Rav said: David requested mercy with regard to them, and He brought them down to earth. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, “You are not a God that has pleasure in wickedness, evil shall not sojourn with You” You are righteous, O Lord. evil should sojourn in Your vicinity. And from where do we that is called “heaven”? As it is written: “And You shall hear heaven, the Makhon of Your dwelling”
llm_translation: These in the firmament, are they included? These on the earth, are they included! As it is written: "Praise the Lord from the earth, sea monsters and all deeps; fire and hail, snow and smoke, stormy wind fulfilling His word!" Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: David sought mercy for them, and brought them down to the earth. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, "You are not a God who desires wickedness; evil does not abide with You." You are righteous, Lord, evil will not dwell with You. And from where do we derive that they are called "heavens" - as it is written: "But You hear the heavens, the abode of Your dwelling."

hebrew_text: עֲרָבוֹת — שֶׁבּוֹ צֶדֶק מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה, גִּנְזֵי חַיִּים וְגִנְזֵי שָׁלוֹם וְגִנְזֵי בְרָכָה, וְנִשְׁמָתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים, וְרוּחוֹת וּנְשָׁמוֹת שֶׁעֲתִיד[וֹת] לְהִיבָּרְאוֹת, וְטַל שֶׁעָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחֲיוֹת בּוֹ מֵתִים. צֶדֶק וּמִשְׁפָּט — דִּכְתִיב: ״צֶדֶק וּמִשְׁפָּט מְכוֹן כִּסְאֶךָ״. צְדָקָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּלְבַּשׁ צְדָקָה כַּשִּׁרְיָן״. גִּנְזֵי חַיִּים — דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי עִמְּךָ מְקוֹר חַיִּים״. וְגִנְזֵי שָׁלוֹם — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרָא לוֹ ה׳ שָׁלוֹם״. וְגִנְזֵי בְרָכָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״יִשָּׂא בְרָכָה מֵאֵת ה׳״.
human_translation: Aravot , that contains righteousness; justice; righteousness, the treasuries of life; the treasuries of peace; the treasuries of blessing; the souls of the righteous; the spirits and souls that are to be created; and the dew that the Holy One, Blessed be He, will use to revive the dead. Righteousness and justice as it is written: “Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne” righteousness, as it is written: “And He donned righteousness as armor” the treasuries of life, as it is written: “For with You is the source of life” And the treasuries of peace as it is written: “And he called Him the Lord of peace” And the treasuries of blessing, as it is written: “He shall receive a blessing from the Lord”
llm_translation: Aravot - in it righteousness judgment and charity, treasuries of life and treasuries of peace and treasuries of blessing, and the souls of the righteous, and spirits and souls that are destined to be created, and dew that the Holy One, blessed be He, will use to revive the dead. Righteousness and judgment - as it is written: "Righteousness and judgment are the foundation of Your throne." Charity - as it is written: "He put on righteousness like a breastplate." Treasuries of life - as it is written: "For with You is the fountain of life." And treasuries of peace - as it is written: "And the Lord called him Peace." And treasuries of blessing - as it is written: "He shall receive blessing from the Lord."

hebrew_text: נִשְׁמָתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיְתָה נֶפֶשׁ אֲדוֹנִי צְרוּרָה בִּצְרוֹר הַחַיִּים אֵת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״. רוּחוֹת וּנְשָׁמוֹת שֶׁעֲתִיד[וֹת] לְהִיבָּרְאוֹת — דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי רוּחַ מִלְּפָנַי יַעֲטוֹף וּנְשָׁמוֹת אֲנִי עָשִׂיתִי״. וְטַל שֶׁעָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחְיוֹת בּוֹ מֵתִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״גֶּשֶׁם נְדָבוֹת תָּנִיף אֱלֹהִים נַחֲלָתְךָ וְנִלְאָה אַתָּה כוֹנַנְתָּהּ״.
human_translation: The souls of the righteous as it is written: “And the soul of my master shall be bound in the bundle of life with the Lord, your God” Spirits and souls that are to be created as it is written: “For the spirit that enwraps itself is from Me, and the souls that I have made” The dew that the Holy One, Blessed be He, will use to revive the dead as it is written: “A bountiful rain You will pour down, God; when Your inheritance was weary, You confirmed it”
llm_translation: The souls of the righteous - as it is written: "And the soul of my master shall be bound in the bundle of life with the Lord your God." The spirits and souls that are destined to be created - as it is written: "For the spirit would faint before Me, and the souls which I have made." And the dew that the Holy One, blessed be He, will revive the dead with - as it is written: "You will bring a rain of gifts, O God, Your inheritance, and it is weary, You have established it."

hebrew_text: שָׁם אוֹפַנִּים וּשְׂרָפִים וְחַיּוֹת הַקֹּדֶשׁ, וּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, וְכִסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד, מֶלֶךְ אֵל חַי רָם וְנִשָּׂא שׁוֹכֵן עֲלֵיהֶם בָּעֲרָבוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סוֹלּוּ לָרוֹכֵב בָּעֲרָבוֹת בְּיָהּ שְׁמוֹ״, וּמְנָלַן דְּאִיקְּרִי ״שָׁמַיִם״? אָתְיָא ״רְכִיבָה״ ״רְכִיבָה״, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״סוֹלּוּ לָרוֹכֵב בָּעֲרָבוֹת״ וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״רוֹכֵב שָׁמַיִם בְּעֶזְרֶךָ״.
human_translation: There, ofanim , seraphim, holy divine creatures, and the ministering angels, and the Throne of Glory. The King, God, living, lofty, exalted One dwells above them in Aravot , as it is stated: “Extol Him Who rides upon the skies [ Aravot ], Whose name is God” And from where do we that is called “heaven”? learned “rides” “rides”: Here, it is written: “Extol Him Who rides upon the skies [ Aravot ],” and there, it is written: “Who rides upon the heaven as your help”
llm_translation: There are wheels, burning coals, and holy animals, as well as ministering angels, and the Throne of Glory, the King, the Living God, exalted and uplifted, dwelling upon them in the evenings, as it is said: "Praise Him who rides upon the clouds; His name is the Lord." And where is it derived that they are called "heavens"? It is derived from the term "riding," "riding," as it is written here: "Praise Him who rides upon the clouds," and as it is written there: "He who rides the heavens in your help."

hebrew_text: וְחֹשֶׁךְ וְעָנָן וַעֲרָפֶל מַקִּיפִין אוֹתוֹ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָשֶׁת חֹשֶׁךְ סִתְרוֹ סְבִיבוֹתָיו סוּכָּתוֹ חֶשְׁכַת מַיִם עָבֵי שְׁחָקִים״. וּמִי אִיכָּא חֲשׁוֹכָא קַמֵּי שְׁמַיָּא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״הוּא גָּלֵא עַמִּיקָתָא וּמְסַתְּרָתָא יָדַע מָה בַחֲשׁוֹכָא וּנְהוֹרָא עִמֵּהּ שְׁרֵא״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא
human_translation: And darkness and clouds and fog surround Him, as it is stated: “He made darkness His hiding place, His pavilion round about Him; darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies” And is there darkness before Heaven, But isn’t it written: “He reveals deep and secret things, He knows what is in the darkness, and the light dwells with Him” not difficult. This
llm_translation: "And darkness, and cloud, and thick darkness surround Him" - as it is stated: "He made darkness His hiding place, His canopy around Him, darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies." And is there darkness before the heavens? But it is written: "He uncovers the depths and reveals the hidden things; He knows what is in the darkness, and light dwells with Him." It is not difficult: this is the explanation.

hebrew_text: בְּבָתֵּי גַוָּאֵי, הָא בְּבָתֵּי בָרָאֵי. וְאָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: עוֹד רָקִיעַ אֶחָד יֵשׁ לְמַעְלָה מֵרָאשֵׁי הַחַיּוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּדְמוּת עַל רָאשֵׁי הַחַיָּה רָקִיעַ כְּעֵין הַקֶּרַח הַנּוֹרָא״.
human_translation: to inner houses, that to outer houses. And Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: There is one more firmament above the heads of the divine creatures, as it is written: “And over the heads of the divine creatures there was the likeness of a firmament, like the color of the terrible ice”
llm_translation: In the houses of the Babylonians, this is in the houses of the Babylonians. And Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: There is only one firmament above the heads of the living creatures, as it is written: "And the likeness upon the heads of the living creature, a firmament like the appearance of awesome ice."

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן יֵשׁ לְךָ רְשׁוּת לְדַבֵּר, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — אֵין לְךָ רְשׁוּת לְדַבֵּר, שֶׁכֵּן כָּתוּב בְּסֵפֶר בֶּן סִירָא: ״בַּמּוּפְלָא מִמְּךָ אַל תִּדְרוֹשׁ, וּבַמְכוּסֶּה מִמְּךָ אַל תַּחְקוֹר. בַּמֶּה שֶׁהוֹרְשֵׁיתָ הִתְבּוֹנֵן, אֵין לְךָ עֵסֶק בַּנִּסְתָּרוֹת״. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: מָה תְּשׁוּבָה הֱשִׁיבַתּוּ בַּת קוֹל לְאוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר ״אֶעֱלֶה עַל בָּמֳתֵי עָב אֶדַּמֶּה לְעֶלְיוֹן״ — יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: רָשָׁע בֶּן רָשָׁע, בֶּן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל נִמְרוֹד הָרָשָׁע, שֶׁהִמְרִיד כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ עָלָיו בְּמַלְכוּתוֹ —
human_translation: Until here, you have permission to speak; from this forward you do not have permission to speak, as it is written in the book of Ben Sira: Seek not things concealed from you, nor search those hidden from you. Reflect on that which is permitted to you; you have no business with secret matters. It is taught Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said: What response did the Divine Voice provide to that wicked man, when he said: “I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High” A Divine Voice came and said to him: Wicked man, son of a wicked man, descendant, of Nimrod the wicked, who caused the entire world to rebel against Him during his reign.
llm_translation: Until here you have permission to speak, from here onward - you do not have permission to speak, as it is written in the book of Ben Sira: "Do not inquire about that which is too wondrous for you, and do not search out that which is hidden from you. Reflect upon that which has been permitted to you; you have no business with the secrets." It was taught: Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai said: What response did the Bat Kol give to that wicked one at the moment he said, "I will ascend to the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High"? The Bat Kol emerged and said to him: Wicked one, son of a wicked one, descendant of Nimrod the wicked, who rebelled against the entire world in his kingdom -

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם — שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְמֵי שְׁנוֹתֵינוּ בָהֶם שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה וְאִם בִּגְבוּרוֹת שְׁמוֹנִים שָׁנָה״. וַהֲלֹא מִן הָאָרֶץ עַד לָרָקִיעַ מַהֲלַךְ חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה, וְעוֹבְיוֹ שֶׁל רָקִיעַ מַהֲלַךְ חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה, וְכֵן בֵּין כׇּל רָקִיעַ וְרָקִיעַ.
human_translation: How many are the years of man? Seventy years, as it is stated: “The span of our life is seventy years, or if we are strong, eighty years” Now is not from the earth to the firmament a walking of five hundred years, and the thickness of the firmament a walking of five hundred years, and a similar between each and every one of the firmaments?
llm_translation: The years of a person - seventy years, as it is stated: "The days of our years among them are seventy years, and if with strength, eighty years." Is it not the case that from the earth to the firmament is a distance of five hundred years, and the thickness of the firmament is a distance of five hundred years, and so too between each firmament and firmament.

hebrew_text: לְמַעְלָה מֵהֶן — חַיּוֹת הַקֹּדֶשׁ. רַגְלֵי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּם, קַרְסוּלֵי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, שׁוֹקֵי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, רְכוּבֵּי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, יַרְכֵי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, גּוּפֵי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, צַוְּארֵי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, רָאשֵׁי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, קַרְנֵי הַחַיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן. לְמַעְלָה מֵהֶן — כִּסֵּא כָּבוֹד. רַגְלֵי כִּסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, כִּסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן, מֶלֶךְ אֵל חַי וְקַיָּם רָם וְנִשָּׂא שׁוֹכֵן עֲלֵיהֶם, וְאַתָּה אָמַרְתָּ: ״אֶעֱלֶה עַל בָּמֳתֵי עָב אֶדַּמֶּה לְעֶלְיוֹן״ — ״אַךְ אֶל שְׁאוֹל תּוּרָד אֶל יַרְכְּתֵי בוֹר״.
human_translation: above them, are the divine creatures. The feet of the divine creatures correspond to all the ankles of the animals correspond to all of them, the shins of the animals correspond to all of them, the knees of the animals correspond to all of them, the thighs of the animals correspond to all of them, the bodies of the animals correspond to all of them, the necks of the animals correspond to all of them, the heads of the animals correspond to all of them, the horns of the animals correspond to all of them. Above them Throne of Glory: The feet of the Throne of Glory correspond to all of them, the Throne of Glory corresponds to all of them, living, almighty, lofty, exalted King dwells above them. And you, say: “I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High” “Yet you shall be brought down to the netherworld, to the uttermost parts of the pit”
llm_translation: Above them - the living creatures of the Holy. The feet of the living creatures opposite all of them, the ankles of the living creatures opposite all of them, the legs of the living creatures opposite all of them, the bodies of the living creatures opposite all of them, the hips of the living creatures opposite all of them, the torsos of the living creatures opposite all of them, the necks of the living creatures opposite all of them, the heads of the living creatures opposite all of them, the horns of the living creatures opposite all of them. Above them - the Throne of Glory. The feet of the Throne of Glory opposite all of them, the Throne of Glory opposite all of them, the King, the Living and Eternal God, exalted and uplifted, dwelling upon them, and you said: "I will ascend above the heights of the clouds, I will be like the Most High" - "Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol, to the depths of the pit."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה בְּיָחִיד. תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֲבָל מוֹסְרִין לוֹ רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֵין מוֹסְרִין רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים אֶלָּא לְאַב בֵּית דִּין, וּלְכׇל מִי שֶׁלִּבּוֹ דּוֹאֵג בְּקִרְבּוֹ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, וְהוּא שֶׁלִּבּוֹ דּוֹאֵג בְּקִרְבּוֹ.
human_translation: Nor the Chariot to an individual. Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: But one may transmit to him, the outlines Rabbi Zeira said: One may transmit the outlines only to the president of the court, and to anyone whose heart inside him is concerned, There are who say whose heart inside him is concerned.
llm_translation: "And not in a chariot alone. Rabbi Chiya taught: But they may hand him the heads of chapters. Rabbi Zeira said: They may only hand the heads of chapters to the head of the court, and to anyone whose heart is anxious within him. Some say, and this is when his heart is anxious within him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אֵין מוֹסְרִין סִתְרֵי תוֹרָה אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה דְבָרִים: ״שַׂר חֲמִשִּׁים, וּנְשׂוּא פָנִים, וְיוֹעֵץ, וַחֲכַם חֲרָשִׁים, וּנְבוֹן לָחַשׁ״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אֵין מוֹסְרִין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה לְגוֹי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא עָשָׂה כֵן לְכׇל גּוֹי וּמִשְׁפָּטִים בַּל יְדָעוּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: The secrets of the Torah may be transmitted only to one who possesses five characteristics: “The captain of fifty, and the man of favor, and the counselor, and the cunning charmer, and the skillful enchanter” And Rabbi Ami said The words of Torah may not be transmitted to a gentile, as it is stated: “He has not dealt so with any nation, and as for His ordinances, they have not known them”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ammi: One may only teach the hidden matters of the Torah to someone who possesses five qualities: "chief of fifty, and respected, and counselor, and skilled artisan, and understanding enchanter." And Rabbi Ammi said: One may not teach the words of the Torah to a non-Jew, as it is stated: "He has not done so for any nation; and they do not know His judgments."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תָּא אַגְמְרָךְ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה הַמֶּרְכָּבָה, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא קַשַּׁאי. כִּי קַשׁ — נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי: תָּא וְאַגְמְרָךְ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה מֶרְכָּבָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי זְכַאי גְּמִירְתַּהּ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רַבָּךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Rabbi Elazar: Come and I will teach you the Design of the Chariot. said to him: not aged When he grew old, Rabbi Yoḥanan had passed away. Rabbi Asi said to him: Come and I will teach you the Design of the Chariot. He said to him: Had I merited, I would have learned from Rabbi Yoḥanan, your teacher.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yochanan to Rabbi Elazar: Come, I will teach you about the work of the Chariot. He said to him: It is not difficult. When it is difficult, the soul of Rabbi Yochanan would be at ease. Rabbi Assi said to him: Come and I will teach you about the work of the Chariot. He said to him: If you are worthy, learn it from Rabbi Yochanan your teacher.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף הֲוָה גְּמִיר מַעֲשֵׂה הַמֶּרְכָּבָה. סָבֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא הֲווֹ תָּנוּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: (לִיגְמוֹר לַן) [לַיגְמְרַן] מָר מַעֲשֵׂה מֶרְכָּבָה. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַגְמְרוּן לִי מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית. בָּתַר דְּאַגְמְרוּהּ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לַיגְמְרַון מָר בְּמַעֲשֵׂה מֶרְכָּבָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ: תְּנֵינָא בְּהוּ ״דְּבַשׁ וְחָלָב תַּחַת לְשׁוֹנֵךְ״, דְּבָרִים הַמְּתוּקִין מִדְּבַשׁ וְחָלָב — יְהוּ תַּחַת לְשׁוֹנֵךְ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef would study the Design of the Chariot the Elders of Pumbedita would study the act of Creation. They said to Let the Master teach us the Design of the Chariot. He said to them: teach me the act of Creation. After they taught him they said to him: Let the Master teach us the Design of the Chariot. He said to them: We learned with regard to them “Honey and milk are under your tongue” matters that are sweeter than honey and milk should remain under your tongue.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef was learning the work of the chariot. The elders of Pumbedita were teaching about the work of Creation. They said to him: "Complete for us the work of the chariot." He said to them: "Complete for me the work of Creation." After they completed it, they said to him: "Complete for us the work of the chariot!" He said to them: "We have learned, 'Honey and milk are under your tongue,' sweet words like honey and milk — should be under your tongue."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״כְּבָשִׁים לִלְבוּשֶׁךָ״, דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵן כִּבְשׁוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם — יִהְיוּ תַּחַת לְבוּשֶׁךָ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: תְּנֵינַן בְּהוּ עַד ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי בֶּן אָדָם״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הֵן הֵן מַעֲשֵׂה הַמֶּרְכָּבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: here, “The lambs kevasim will be for your clothing” Things that constitute the concealed matters of the world should be under your clothing; they said to him: We have learned them, up to “And He said to me, son of man” He said to them: these are Design of the Chariot,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said from here: "Lambs for your clothing," things that are the wool of the world - they shall be beneath your clothing. They said to him: We learn it until "And He said to me, son of man." He said to them: Yes, these are the work of the chariot.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: עַד הֵיכָן מַעֲשֵׂה הַמֶּרְכָּבָה? רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עַד ״וָאֵרֶא״ בָּתְרָא, רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: עַד ״הַחַשְׁמַל״. עַד ״וָאֵרֶא״ מַגְמְרִינַן, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מָסְרִינַן רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: עַד ״וָאֵרֶא״ מָסְרִינַן רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, אִם הוּא חָכָם מֵבִין מִדַּעְתּוֹ — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: raises an objection Until where is the Design of the Chariot Rabbi says: Until the latter “And I saw” Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Until “the electrum” Until “And I saw,” we teach from this forward, transmit outlines. There are who say: Until “And I saw,” we transmit the outlines; from this forward, if he is wise can understand of his own accord, yes, If not, not
llm_translation: Challenger: Until where is the account of the Merkavah? Rabbi says: Until "And I saw" afterwards. Rabbi Yitzchak says: Until "the Hashmal." Until "And I saw" we conclude, from here onward we deliver the heads of chapters. There are those who say: Until "And I saw" we deliver the heads of chapters, from here onward, if he is a wise man and understands from his own knowledge - yes, if not - no.

hebrew_text: וּמִי דָּרְשִׁינַן בְּחַשְׁמַל? וְהָא הָהוּא יָנוֹקָא דִּדְרַשׁ בְּחַשְׁמַל, וּנְפַקָא נוּרָא וַאֲכַלְתֵּיהּ! שָׁאנֵי יָנוֹקָא, דְּלָאו מָטֵי זִימְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: And may one teach about the electrum But wasn’t there a certain youth expounded the electrum, and fire came out and consumed him, youth was different, for his time had not arrived.
llm_translation: And who did we learn about regarding electricity? That young man who studied electricity, and a fire came out and consumed him! The case of that young man is different, as he did not reach his appointed time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּרַם זָכוּר אוֹתוֹ הָאִישׁ לַטּוֹב, וַחֲנַנְיָה בֶּן חִזְקִיָּה שְׁמוֹ. אִלְמָלֵא הוּא — נִגְנַז סֵפֶר יְחֶזְקֵאל, שֶׁהָיוּ דְּבָרָיו סוֹתְרִין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה. מֶה עָשָׂה? הֶעֱלוּ לוֹ שְׁלוֹשׁ מֵאוֹת גַּרְבֵי שֶׁמֶן, וְיָשַׁב בַּעֲלִיָּיה וּדְרָשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: Indeed, that man is remembered for good, and Ḥananya ben Ḥizkiya was his name, were it not for him, the book of Ezekiel would have been suppressed. that its words contradicted the words of Torah, What did he do? They brought up to him three hundred barrels of oil, and he sat in an upper chamber and expounded it,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: In truth, that man was remembered for good, and Hananiah son of Hizkiyah was his name. Were it not for him, the Book of Yehezkel would have been hidden away, for his words contradicted the words of the Torah. What did he do? They brought him three hundred barrels of oil, and he sat in his house and expounded it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתִינוֹק אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה קוֹרֵא בְּבֵית רַבּוֹ בְּסֵפֶר יְחֶזְקֵאל וְהָיָה מֵבִין בְּחַשְׁמַל, וְיָצְאָה אֵשׁ מֵחַשְׁמַל וּשְׂרָפַתּוּ, וּבִיקְשׁוּ לִגְנוֹז סֵפֶר יְחֶזְקֵאל. אָמַר לָהֶם חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן חִזְקִיָּה: אִם זֶה חָכָם — הַכֹּל חֲכָמִים הֵן?
human_translation: The Sages taught: An incident involving a youth who was reading the book of Ezekiel in the house of his teacher, and was comprehend the electrum, and fire came out of the electrum and burned him. And they sought to suppress the book of Ezekiel Ḥananya ben Ḥizkiya said to them: If this wise, all wise
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident with a certain child who was reading in his teacher's house in the book of Ezekiel and he understood in electricity, and fire came out from the electricity and burned him, and they sought to hide the book of Ezekiel. Hananiah son of Hizkiah said to them: If this is a wise person — are all wise people?

hebrew_text: מַאי חַשְׁמַל? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: What is electrum? Rav Yehuda said:
llm_translation: What is "chashmal"? Rav Yehudah said:

hebrew_text: חַיּוֹת אֵשׁ מְמַלְּלוֹת. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: עִתִּים חָשׁוֹת, עִתִּים מְמַלְּלוֹת. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַדִּיבּוּר יוֹצֵא מִפִּי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — חָשׁוֹת, וּבְשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵין הַדִּיבּוּר יוֹצֵא מִפִּי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — מְמַלְּלוֹת.
human_translation: speaking animals of fire. ḥayyot esh memallelot It was taught in a baraita : At times they are silent; at times they speak. When the divine speech emerges from the mouth of the Holy One, Blessed be He, they are silent; and when the divine speech does not emerge from the mouth of the Holy One, Blessed be He, they speak.
llm_translation: Living beings speak fire. In the Mishnah it was taught: Sometimes silent, sometimes speaking. At the moment when speech emanates from the mouth of the Holy One, blessed be He - silent, and at the moment when speech does not emanate from the mouth of the Holy One, blessed be He - speaking.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַחַיּוֹת רָצוֹא וָשׁוֹב כְּמַרְאֵה הַבָּזָק״. מַאי ״רָצוֹא וָשׁוֹב״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּאוּר הַיּוֹצֵא מִפִּי הַכִּבְשָׁן. מַאי ״כְּמַרְאֵה הַבָּזָק״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: כְּאוּר הַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּין הַחֲרָסִים.
human_translation: “And the divine creatures ran and returned like the appearance of a flash of lightning [ bazak ]” What is “ran and returned”? Rav Yehuda said: Like fire that is emitted from a furnace, What is “like the appearance of a flash of lightning”? Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: Like the fire that is emitted between earthenware
llm_translation: "And the living creatures ran and returned like the appearance of a flash of lightning." What is "ran and returned"? Rav Yehudah said: Like the light that comes out of the mouth of the furnace. What is "like the appearance of a flash of lightning"? Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: Like the light that comes out from between the shards.

hebrew_text: ״וָאֵרֶא וְהִנֵּה רוּחַ סְעָרָה בָּאָה מִן הַצָּפוֹן עָנָן גָּדוֹל וְאֵשׁ מִתְלַקַּחַת וְנוֹגַהּ לוֹ סָבִיב וּמִתּוֹכָהּ כְּעֵין הַחַשְׁמַל מִתּוֹךְ הָאֵשׁ״. לְהֵיכָן אֲזַל? אֲמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁהָלַךְ לִכְבּוֹשׁ אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ תַּחַת נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם: בְּיַד אוּמָּה שְׁפָלָה מָסַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת בָּנָיו. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מִי גָּרַם לִי שֶׁאֶהְיֶה שַׁמָּשׁ לְעוֹבְדֵי פְסִילִים — עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל הֵן גָּרְמוּ לִי.
human_translation: “And I looked and, behold, a stormy wind came out of the north, a great cloud, with a fire flashing up, so that a brightness was round about it; and out of its midst was like the color of electrum, out of the midst of the fire” Where did go? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: It went to conquer the entire world under the wicked Nebuchadnezzar. And why was all of this necessary? So that the nations of the world would not say: The Holy One, Blessed be He, delivered His children into the hands of a lowly nation. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said Who caused Me to be an attendant to worshippers of molten images, It was the sins of Israel that led Me
llm_translation: "And I saw, and behold, a storm wind was coming from the north, a great cloud and a fire taking hold and brightness around it, and from its midst like the color of amber from within the fire." Where did it go? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: that it went to subdue the entire world under Nebuchadnezzar the wicked. And why all this? So that the nations of the world will not say: by the hand of a lowly nation, the Holy One, blessed be He, delivered His children. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Who caused Me to be like a minister to idol worshippers? The sins of Israel caused Me to be so.

hebrew_text: ״וָאֵרֶא הַחַיּוֹת וְהִנֵּה אוֹפַן אֶחָד בָּאָרֶץ אֵצֶל הַחַיּוֹת״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַלְאָךְ אֶחָד שֶׁהוּא עוֹמֵד בָּאָרֶץ, וְרֹאשׁוֹ מַגִּיעַ אֵצֶל הַחַיּוֹת. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: סַנְדַּלְפוֹן שְׁמוֹ, הַגָּבוֹהַּ מֵחֲבֵרוֹ מַהֲלַךְ חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה. וְעוֹמֵד אֲחוֹרֵי הַמֶּרְכָּבָה וְקוֹשֵׁר כְּתָרִים לְקוֹנוֹ. אִינִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״בָּרוּךְ כְּבוֹד ה׳ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ״, מִכְּלָל דִּמְקוֹמוֹ לֵיכָּא דְּיָדַע לֵיהּ! דְּאָמַר שֵׁם אַתָּגָא וְאָזֵל וְיָתֵיב בְּרֵישֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: “Now as I beheld the divine creatures, behold, one wheel [ ofan ] was upon the earth near the divine creatures” Rabbi Elazar said: a certain angel who stands on the earth and its head reaches the divine creatures. It was taught in a baraita : is named Sandalfon, who is taller than his colleague by a distance of five hundred years, and he stands behind the Chariot and weaves crowns for his Maker. Is that so? But isn’t it written: “Blessed be the Lord’s glory from His place” by inference no one knows His place? by saying a name for the crown, and goes and sits on head
llm_translation: "And I saw the living creatures, and behold, one wheel on the earth beside the living creatures," Rabbi Elazar said: One angel standing on the earth, and his head reaches the living creatures. In a Baraita it was taught: His name is Sandalphon, his height is from his fellow's walk of five hundred years. And he stands behind the chariot and binds crowns for his Creator. Is it not so? But it is written: 'Blessed be the glory of the Lord from His place,' from which it is inferred that His place is not known! For it is said: He takes off his crown, goes and sits at the head."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל שֶׁרָאָה יְחֶזְקֵאל, רָאָה יְשַׁעְיָה. לְמָה יְחֶזְקֵאל דּוֹמֶה — לְבֶן כְּפָר שֶׁרָאָה אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ, וּלְמָה יְשַׁעְיָה דּוֹמֶה — לְבֶן כְּרַךְ שֶׁרָאָה אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳ כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״ — שִׁירָה לְמִי שֶׁמִּתְגָּאֶה עַל הַגֵּאִים. דְּאָמַר מָר: מֶלֶךְ שֶׁבַּחַיּוֹת — אֲרִי, מֶלֶךְ שֶׁבַּבְּהֵמוֹת — שׁוֹר, מֶלֶךְ שֶׁבָּעוֹפוֹת — נֶשֶׁר, וְאָדָם מִתְגָּאֶה עֲלֵיהֶן, וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִתְגָּאֶה עַל כּוּלָּן וְעַל כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: All that Ezekiel saw, Isaiah saw To what may Ezekiel be compared? To a villager who saw the king And to what may Isaiah be compared? To a city dweller who saw the king. Reish Lakish said: What is which is written: “I will sing to the Lord, for He is highly exalted” sing to He Who is exalted above the exalted. As the Master said: The king of the beasts the lion, the king of the domestic animals the ox, the king of the birds the eagle, and man is exalted over them, but the Holy One, Blessed be He, is exalted above all of them and above the entire world,
llm_translation: Rava said: Anyone who saw Yehezkel, saw Yeshayahu. Why is Yehezkel compared to a villager who saw the king, and why is Yeshayahu compared to a city dweller who saw the king? Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written: "I will sing to the Lord for He is highly exalted"? - A song for the One who is exalted above the exalted. As the Master said: The king of the wild beasts is a lion, the king of domestic animals is an ox, the king of birds is an eagle, and man boasts about them, and the Holy One, blessed be He, boasts about all of them and the entire world.

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״וּדְמוּת פְּנֵיהֶם פְּנֵי אָדָם וּפְנֵי אַרְיֵה אֶל הַיָּמִין לְאַרְבַּעְתָּם וּפְנֵי שׁוֹר מֵהַשְּׂמֹאל לְאַרְבַּעְתָּן וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאַרְבָּעָה פָנִים לְאֶחָד פְּנֵי הָאֶחָד פְּנֵי הַכְּרוּב וּפְנֵי הַשֵּׁנִי פְּנֵי אָדָם וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי פְּנֵי אַרְיֵה וְהָרְבִיעִי פְּנֵי נָשֶׁר״, וְאִילּוּ שׁוֹר לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב! אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: יְחֶזְקֵאל בִּיקֵּשׁ עָלָיו רַחֲמִים, וַהֲפָכוֹ לִכְרוּב. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! קָטֵיגוֹר יֵעָשֶׂה סָנֵיגוֹר?
human_translation: One verse states: “As for the likeness of their faces, they had the face of a man; and the four had the face of a lion on the right side; and the four had the face of an ox on the left side” And it is written: “And each one had four faces: The first face was the face of the cherub, and the second face was the face of a man, and the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle” but it does not include an ox Reish Lakish said: Ezekiel requested mercy it, and had it turned into a cherub. He said before Him Master of the Universe. an accuser [ kateigor ] become a defender [ saneigor ]?
llm_translation: It is written: "One says, 'And the likeness of their faces was the face of a man, and the face of a lion to the right of the four of them, and the face of an ox to the left of the four of them, etc.'" And it is written: "And each one had four faces; the face of the one was the face of a cherub, and the face of the second was the face of a man, and the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle." And as for the ox, it is not considered! Resh Lakish said: Ezekiel sought mercy for it, and it was transformed into a cherub. He said before Him: Master of the Universe! Will the prosecutor become the defender?

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כְּרוּב״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כְּרָבְיָא, שֶׁכֵּן בְּבָבֶל קוֹרִין לְיָנוֹקָא רָבְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״פְּנֵי הָאֶחָד פְּנֵי הַכְּרוּב וּפְנֵי הַשֵּׁנִי פְּנֵי אָדָם וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי פְּנֵי אַרְיֵה וְהָרְבִיעִי פְּנֵי נָשֶׁר״, הַיְינוּ פְּנֵי כְרוּב הַיְינוּ פְּנֵי אָדָם? אַפֵּי רַבְרְבֵי וְאַפֵּי זוּטְרֵי.
human_translation: What is “cherub”? Rabbi Abbahu said: Like a baby keravya for in Babylonia they call a baby ravya . Rav Pappa said to Abaye: However, if that is so, what is that which is written: “The first face was the face of the cherub, and the second face was the face of a man, and the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle”? The face of a cherub is the face of a man; a large face, small face
llm_translation: What is "keruv"? Rabbi Avahu said: Like Ravya, for in Babylonia they call a child Ravya. Rav Papa said to Abbaye: Rather, from now on, as it is written: "The first face was the face of a cherub, the second face was the face of a man, the third face was the face of a lion, and the fourth face was the face of an eagle," meaning the face of a cherub is the face of a man? Both large and small alike.

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״שֵׁשׁ כְּנָפַיִם שֵׁשׁ כְּנָפַיִם לְאֶחָד״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״וְאַרְבָּעָה פָנִים לְאֶחָת וְאַרְבַּע כְּנָפַיִם לְאַחַת לָהֶם״? לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים. כִּבְיָכוֹל, שֶׁנִּתְמַעֲטוּ כַּנְפֵי הַחַיּוֹת.
human_translation: One verse states: “Each one had six wings; and another verse states: “And every one had four faces, and every one of them had four wings” not difficult, here, to the time when the Temple is standing, there, to the time when the Temple is not standing, it is as if the wings of the animals were diminished
llm_translation: It is written: "One says: 'Six wings, six wings to one,'" and it is written: "And four faces to one and four wings to one of them"? It is not difficult: here when the Temple stood, here when the Temple does not stand. As it could be explained, that the wings of the living creatures diminished.

hebrew_text: הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ אִימַּעוּט? אָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: אוֹתָן שֶׁאוֹמְרוֹת שִׁירָה בָּהֶן. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וּבִשְׁתַּיִם יְעוֹפֵף וְקָרָא זֶה אֶל זֶה וְאָמַר״, וּכְתִיב: ״הֲתָעִיף עֵינֶיךָ בּוֹ וְאֵינֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: Which of were diminished? Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: Those with which they recite song. it is written here: “And with two it flew yeofef And one called to the other and said” and it is written: “Will you set hata’if ] your eyes upon it? It is gone”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Hei minnayehu imma'ut? Amar Rav Chananel amar Rav: otan she'omrot shirah bahen. Ketiv hacha: 'uvish'tayim ye'ofef ve'kara zeh el zeh ve'amar,' u'ketiv: 'hata'if einekha bo ve'einenno.'" English translation: "Should they be considered as having diminished? Rav Chananel said in the name of Rav: Those that contain a song. It is written here: 'And with two he flies and calls to one another and says,' and it is written: 'Do you scrutinize him, though he is not?'"

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: אוֹתָן שֶׁמְּכַסּוֹת בָּהֶן רַגְלֵיהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרַגְלֵיהֶם רֶגֶל יְשָׁרָה״, וְאִי לָאו דְּאִימַּעוּט — מְנָא הֲוָה יָדַע? דִּלְמָא דְּאִיגַּלַּאי וְחַזְיָא לֵיהּ. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, ״וּדְמוּת פְּנֵיהֶם פְּנֵי אָדָם״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאִימַּעוּט?! אֶלָּא דְּאִיגַּלַּאי וְחַזְיָא לֵיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי — דְּאִיגַּלַּאי וְחַזְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say those with which they cover their feet, for it is stated: “And their feet were straight feet” Now if had not been diminished, how would he know perhaps they were revealed, see them. Because if you do not say so, “And the likeness of their faces, they had the face of a man” so too that these were diminished Rather, that they were revealed and he saw them. Here too, they were revealed and he saw them.
llm_translation: The sages said: Those who cover their feet with them, as it is said: "And their feet were straight feet." And if not that they are covered - how would he know? Perhaps he would uncover and see. If you would say so, "And the likeness of their faces was the face of a man," would he also uncover?! Rather, he would uncover and see. Here too - he would uncover and see.

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא אַפֵּיהּ — אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְגַלּוֹיֵי קַמֵּיהּ רַבֵּיהּ. כַּרְעֵיהּ — לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְגַלּוֹיֵי קַמֵּיהּ רַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, his face it is proper conduct to reveal before his Master, his feet, not proper conduct to reveal before his Master.
llm_translation: So, what is the question?! Regarding its face - a path of the land for revealing before his teacher. Regarding its legs - is it not a path of the land for revealing before his teacher.

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״אֶלֶף אַלְפִין יְשַׁמְּשׁוּנֵּיהּ וְרִבּוֹ רִבְבָן קָדָמוֹהִי יְקוּמוּן״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״הֲיֵשׁ מִסְפָּר לִגְדוּדָיו״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, כִּבְיָכוֹל שֶׁנִּתְמַעֲטָה פָּמַלְיָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה.
human_translation: One verse states: “A thousand thousands ministered to Him, and ten thousand times ten thousand stood before him” and another verse states: “Is there a number to His troops?” not difficult, here, to the time when the Temple is standing; there, to the time when the Temple is not standing, it is as though the heavenly entourage [ pamalya ] were diminished.
llm_translation: It is written: "One says, 'A thousand thousands serve Him, and ten thousand myriads stand before Him,'" and it is written: "Is there a number to His troops?"! It is not difficult: here, when the Temple stood, here, when the Temple does not stand, as it is possible that the heavenly retinue has diminished.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן דּוֹסַאי: ״אֶלֶף אַלְפִין יְשַׁמְּשׁוּנֵּיהּ״ — מִסְפַּר גְּדוּד אֶחָד, ״וְלִגְדוּדָיו אֵין מִסְפָּר״. וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: ״אֶלֶף אַלְפִין יְשַׁמְּשׁוּנֵּיהּ״, לִנְהַר דִּינוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נְהַר דִּינוּר נָגֵד וְנָפֵק מִן קֳדָמוֹהִי אֶלֶף אַלְפִין יְשַׁמְּשׁוּנֵּיהּ וְרִבּוֹ רִבְבָן קָדָמוֹהִי יְקוּמוּן״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says in the name of Abba Yosei ben Dosai: “A thousand thousands ministered to Him” number a single troop, “And to his troops, there is no number”. And Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: “a thousand thousands ministered to Him,” to the River Dinur, as it is stated: “A fiery [ dinur ] river issued and came forth from before him; a thousand thousands ministered to it, and a myriad myriads stand before it”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says in the name of Abba Yosei ben Dosai: "A thousand thousands serve Him" - this is one unit of troops, "and his troops have no number." And Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: "A thousand thousands serve Him," to the river Dinur, as it is stated: "A river of fire was flowing and coming out before Him; a thousand thousands served Him, and ten thousand times ten thousand stood before Him."

hebrew_text: מֵהֵיכָן נָפֵיק? מִזֵּיעָתָן שֶׁל חַיּוֹת. וּלְהֵיכָן שָׁפֵיךְ? אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב: עַל רֹאשׁ רְשָׁעִים בְּגֵיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנֵּה סַעֲרַת ה׳ חֵמָה יָצְאָה וְסַעַר מִתְחוֹלֵל עַל רֹאשׁ רְשָׁעִים יָחוּל״. וְרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: עַל אֲשֶׁר קוּמְּטוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר קוּמְּטוּ וְלֹא עֵת נָהָר יוּצַק יְסוֹדָם״. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הֶחָסִיד: אֵלּוּ תְּשַׁע מֵאוֹת וְשִׁבְעִים וְאַרְבַּע דּוֹרוֹת שֶׁקּוּמְּטוּ לְהִיבָּרְאוֹת
human_translation: From where does flow? From the perspiration of the divine creatures. And where does flow to? Rav Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said: Upon the heads of the wicked in Gehenna, as it is stated: “Behold, a storm of the Lord has gone forth in fury, a whirling storm; it shall whirl upon the head of the wicked” And Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: over those who were snatched away, as it is stated: “Who were snatched away before their time, whose foundation was poured out as a stream” It is taught Rabbi Shimon HeḤasid said These those nine hundred and seventy-four generations that were snatched away; been created
llm_translation: From where does it emanate? From the sweat of animals. And to where does it flow? Rav Zutra bar Toviya said in the name of Rav: "Upon the heads of the wicked in Gehinnom," as it is said: "Behold, the storm of the Lord, fury has gone forth, a whirling storm shall rest upon the head of the wicked." And Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: "Because they were arrogant," as it is said: "When they are arrogant, and it is not the time, their foundation is poured out like a river." It was taught: Rabbi Shimon the Pious said: These are the 974 generations that were arrogant to be created.

hebrew_text: קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, וְלֹא נִבְרְאוּ. עָמַד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּשְׁתָלָן בְּכׇל דּוֹר וָדוֹר, וְהֵן הֵן עַזֵּי פָנִים שֶׁבַּדּוֹר.
human_translation: before the creation of the world, but they were not created. The Holy One, Blessed be He, acted by planting them in each and every generation, and they are the insolent ones of the generation,
llm_translation: Before the world was created, and they were not created. The Holy One, blessed be He, stood and planted them in every generation, and they are the brazen-faced ones of the generation.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר קוּמְּטוּ״ — לִבְרָכָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב. אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁמְּקַמְּטִין עַצְמָן עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְגַלֶּה לָהֶם סוֹד לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נָהָר יוּצַק יְסוֹדָם״.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said “Who were snatched [ kumtu ]” is written for a blessing, These are Torah scholars, who shrivel [ mekamtin ], themselves over the words of Torah in this world. The Holy One, Blessed be He, reveals a secret to them in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “Whose foundation [ yesodam ] was poured out as a stream”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "Asher kumtu" — for blessing it is written. These are the students of the sages who gather themselves over the words of Torah in this world, the Holy One, blessed be He, reveals to them the secret of the world to come, as it is said: "A river pours forth their foundation."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב: בַּר אַרְיָא! תָּא אֵימָא לָךְ מִילְּתָא מֵהָנֵי מִילֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא דַּהֲוָה אָמַר אֲבוּךְ: כֹּל יוֹמָא וְיוֹמָא נִבְרָאִין מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת מִנְּהַר דִּינוּר, וְאָמְרִי שִׁירָה וּבָטְלִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲדָשִׁים לַבְּקָרִים רַבָּה אֱמוּנָתֶךָ״. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל דִּיבּוּר וְדִיבּוּר שֶׁיּוֹצֵא מִפִּי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִבְרָא מִמֶּנּוּ מַלְאָךְ אֶחָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּדְבַר ה׳ שָׁמַיִם נַעֲשׂוּ וּבְרוּחַ פִּיו כׇּל צְבָאָם״.
human_translation: Shmuel said to Ḥiyya bar Rav: Son of great ones, come and I will tell you something of the great things that your father would say: Each and every day, ministering angels are created from the River Dinur, and they recite song and cease as it is stated: “They are new every morning; great is Your faithfulness” And disagrees with of Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: each and every word that emerges from the mouth of the Holy One, Blessed be He, an angel is created, as it is stated: “By the word of the Lord the heavens were made, and by the breath of His mouth all their hosts”
llm_translation: Shmuel said to Hiyya bar Rav: "Bar Arya! Come, I will say to you a matter from the matters of the upper world that your father used to say: Every day, the ministering angels are created from the River Dinur, and they say a song and become silent, as it is stated: 'New every morning, great is Your faithfulness.' And the opinion of Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani differs, for Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Every utterance that comes out from the mouth of the Holy One, blessed be He, creates from it one angel, as it is stated: 'By the word of the Lord the heavens were made, and by the breath of His mouth all their host.'"

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״לְבוּשֵׁיהּ כִּתְלַג חִיוָּר וּשְׂעַר רֵישֵׁיהּ כַּעֲמַר נְקֵא״. וּכְתִיב: ״קְוֻצּוֹתָיו תַּלְתַּלִּים שְׁחוֹרוֹת כָּעוֹרֵב״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּישִׁיבָה, כָּאן בַּמִּלְחָמָה. דְּאָמַר מָר: אֵין לְךָ נָאֶה בִּישִׁיבָה אֶלָּא זָקֵן, וְאֵין לְךָ נָאֶה בַּמִּלְחָמָה אֶלָּא בָּחוּר.
human_translation: One verse states: “His raiment was as white snow, and the hair of his head like pure wool” and it is written: “His locks are curled, black as a raven” not difficult. Here in the academy, there at war, for the Master said: There is no finer in an academy than an old man, and there is no finer than a youth.
llm_translation: It is written: "Her garments are white as snow, her hair is like pure wool." And it is written: "His locks are curled, black as a raven!" There is no contradiction: here it refers to sitting, here it refers to war. For the Master said: You are only fit for sitting if you are old, and you are only fit for war if you are young.

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״כׇּרְסְיֵהּ שְׁבִיבִין דִּינוּר״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״עַד דִּי כׇרְסָוָן רְמִיו וְעַתִּיק יוֹמִין יְתִיב״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: אֶחָד לוֹ וְאֶחָד לְדָוִד. כִּדְתַנְיָא: אֶחָד לוֹ וְאֶחָד לְדָוִד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: עֲקִיבָא, עַד מָתַי אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה שְׁכִינָה חוֹל?! אֶלָּא: אֶחָד לְדִין וְאֶחָד לִצְדָקָה.
human_translation: One verse states: “His throne was fiery flames” and verse states: “Till thrones were placed, and one who was ancient of days sat,” not difficult. One for Him and one for David, as it is taught One for Him and one for David; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yosei HaGelili said to him: Akiva, how long shall you make the Divine Presence profane, Rather, One for judgment and one for righteousness.
llm_translation: It is written: "A handful of flour for a dinar," and it is written: "Until his throne was established and the Ancient of Days took His seat!" There is no difficulty: one for Him and one for David. As it was taught: one for Him and one for David, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said to him: Akiva, until when will you make the Divine Presence profane?! Rather: one for judgment and one for righteousness.

hebrew_text: קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, אוֹ לָא קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: אֶחָד לְדִין וְאֶחָד לִצְדָקָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: עֲקִיבָא, מָה לְךָ אֵצֶל הַגָּדָה! כְּלָךְ מִדַּבְּרוֹתֶיךָ אֵצֶל נְגָעִים וְאֹהָלוֹת. אֶלָּא: אֶחָד לְכִסֵּא וְאֶחָד לִשְׁרַפְרַף. כִּסֵּא — לֵישֵׁב עָלָיו, שְׁרַפְרַף — לַהֲדוֹם רַגְלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשָּׁמַיִם כִּסְאִי וְהָאָרֶץ הֲדוֹם רַגְלָי״.
human_translation: accept from him, or did he not accept from him? Come hear One for judgment and one for righteousness; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said to him: Akiva, what are you doing with aggada ? Take [ kelakh ] your words to plagues and tents. Rather, One for a seat and one for a small seat. seat to sit on, small seat for His footstool, as it is stated: “The heavens are My seat, and the earth My footstool”
llm_translation: Received from her, or did she not receive from her? Come and hear: One for judgment and one for righteousness, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said to him: Akiva, what do you have to do with aggadah? Your words should be about plagues and tents. Rather: One for a throne and one for a footstool. Throne - to sit on it, footstool - to place his feet on it, as it is said: "The heavens are My throne and the earth is My footstool."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה קְלָלוֹת קִילֵּל יְשַׁעְיָה אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא נִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתּוֹ עַד שֶׁאָמַר לָהֶם הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה: ״יִרְהֲבוּ הַנַּעַר בַּזָּקֵן וְהַנִּקְלֶה בַּנִּכְבָּד״.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: Isaiah cursed Israel with eighteen curses, and his mind was not calmed, until he said to them the following verse: “The child shall behave insolently against the aged, and the base against the honorable”
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: "Isaiah cursed Israel with eighteen curses, and his mind did not settle until he said to them this verse: 'The youth will insult the elder, and the base will insult the honorable.'"

hebrew_text: שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה קְלָלוֹת, מַאי נִינְהוּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי הִנֵּה הָאָדוֹן ה׳ צְבָאוֹת מֵסִיר מִירוּשָׁלִַם וּמִיהוּדָה מַשְׁעֵן וּמַשְׁעֵנָה כֹּל מִשְׁעַן לֶחֶם וְכֹל מִשְׁעַן מָיִם גִּבּוֹר וְאִישׁ מִלְחָמָה שׁוֹפֵט וְנָבִיא וְקוֹסֵם וְזָקֵן. שַׂר חֲמִשִּׁים וּנְשׂוּא פָנִים וְיוֹעֵץ וַחֲכַם חֲרָשִׁים וּנְבוֹן לָחַשׁ. וְנָתַתִּי נְעָרִים שָׂרֵיהֶם וְתַעֲלוּלִים יִמְשְׁלוּ בָם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: What are these eighteen curses? As it is written: “For behold, the Master, the Lord of hosts, shall take away from Jerusalem and from Judah support and staff, every support of bread, and every support of water; the mighty man, and the man of war; the judge, and the prophet, and the diviner, and the elder; the captain of fifty, and the man of favor, and the counselor, and the cunning charmer, and the skillful enchanter. And I will make children their princes, and babes shall rule over them”
llm_translation: Eighteen curses, what are they? As it is written: "For behold, the Lord, the God of hosts, is taking away from Jerusalem and from Judah support and support, all support of bread and all support of water, mighty man and man of war, judge and prophet, and diviner and elder, captain of fifty and dignitary, counselor and skillful magician, and expert in charms. And I will make boys their princes, and capricious children shall rule over them, etc."

hebrew_text: ״מַשְׁעֵן״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מִקְרָא. ״מַשְׁעֵנָה״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעְלֵי מִשְׁנָה, כְּגוֹן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא וַחֲבֵירָיו. פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב פָּפָּא וְרַבָּנַן, חַד אָמַר: שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת סִדְרֵי מִשְׁנָה, וְחַד אָמַר: שְׁבַע מֵאוֹת סִדְרֵי מִשְׁנָה.
human_translation: “Support”; these are masters of the Bible. “Staff”; these are masters of Mishna, such as Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima and his colleagues. Rav Pappa and the Rabbis disagreed with regard to this. One said: six hundred orders of Mishna, and one said: seven hundred orders of Mishna,
llm_translation: "Support" - these are the people of the Scripture. "Supporting beam" - these are the people of the Mishnah, such as Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema and his colleagues. Rav Papa and the Rabbis disputed it: one said: six hundred orders of the Mishnah, and one said: seven hundred orders of the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: ״כֹּל מִשְׁעַן לֶחֶם״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי תַלְמוּד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְכוּ לַחֲמוּ בְלַחֲמִי וּשְׁתוּ בְּיַיִן מָסָכְתִּי״. ״וְכֹל מִשְׁעַן מָיִם״ — אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי אַגָּדָה, שֶׁמּוֹשְׁכִין לִבּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כַּמַּיִם בְּאַגָּדָה. ״גִּבּוֹר״ — זֶה בַּעַל שְׁמוּעוֹת. ״וְאִישׁ מִלְחָמָה״ — זֶה שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לִישָּׂא וְלִיתֵּן בְּמִלְחַמְתָּהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה. ״שׁוֹפֵט״ — זֶה דַּיָּין שֶׁדָּן דִּין אֱמֶת לַאֲמִיתּוֹ. ״נָבִיא״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ. ״קוֹסֵם״ — זֶה מֶלֶךְ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קֶסֶם עַל שִׂפְתֵי מֶלֶךְ״. ״זָקֵן״ — זֶה שֶׁרָאוּי לִישִׁיבָה.
human_translation: “Every support of bread”; these are masters of Talmud, as it is stated: “Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine that I have mingled” “And every support of water”; these are the masters of aggada , who draw people’s hearts like water by aggada . “The mighty man”; this is the master of halakhic tradition, “And the man of war”; this is one who knows how to engage in the discourse of Torah, in the war of Torah. “A judge”; this is a judge who judges a true judgment truthfully. “A prophet”; as it literally indicates. “A diviner”; this is a king. For it is stated: “A divine sentence is on the lips of the king” “An elder”; this is one fit for an academy.
llm_translation: "Every support of bread" - these are the scholars of the Talmud, as it is said: "Come, eat of my bread and drink of the wine I have mixed." "And every support of water" - these are the scholars of Aggadah, who draw the heart of a person like water in a jug. "A hero" - this is one who is knowledgeable in traditions. "And a man of war" - this is one who knows how to engage and give in the war of Torah. "A judge" - this is a judge who judges truthfully. "A prophet" - as the term implies. "A soothsayer" - this is a king, as it is said: "An oracle upon the lips of the king." "An elder" - this is one who is fitting for a seat of learning.

hebrew_text: ״שַׂר חֲמִשִּׁים״ — אַל תִּקְרֵי ״שַׂר חֲמִשִּׁים״, אֶלָּא ״שַׂר חוּמָּשִׁין״. זֶה שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לִישָּׂא וְלִיתֵּן בַּחֲמִשָּׁה חוּמְשֵׁי תוֹרָה. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״שַׂר חֲמִשִּׁים״ — כִּדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מִכָּאן שֶׁאֵין מַעֲמִידִין מְתוּרְגְּמָן עַל הַצִּבּוּר פָּחוֹת מֵחֲמִשִּׁים שָׁנָה. ״וּנְשׂוּא פָּנִים״ — זֶה שֶׁנּוֹשְׂאִין פָּנִים לְדוֹרוֹ בַּעֲבוּרוֹ. לְמַעְלָה, כְּגוֹן רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא. לְמַטָּה, כְּגוֹן רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ בֵּי קֵיסָר.
human_translation: “A captain of fifty,” do not read “ sar ḥamishim ,” rather “ sar ḥumashin ”; this is one who knows how to engage in discourse the five books of [ ḥamisha ḥumshei ] the Torah. Alternatively, “a captain of fifty” in Rabbi Abbahu, for Rabbi Abbahu said: From here that one may not appoint a disseminator over the public less than fifty years “And the man of favor”; this is for whose sake favor is shown to his generation. above, such as Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa, below, for example: Rabbi Abbahu, in the house of emperor.
llm_translation: "Chief of Fifty" — do not read "Chief of Fifty," rather "Chief of One-Fifth." This refers to one who knows how to give and take in the five fifths of the Torah. Another explanation: "Chief of Fifty" — like Rabbi Abbahu said. For Rabbi Abbahu said: From here we learn that one does not appoint a translator for the congregation who is less than fifty years old. "And 'Lifting of Faces'" — this refers to one who uplifts the countenance of his generation for its sake. Above, like Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa. Below, like Rabbi Abbahu of the house of Caesar.

hebrew_text: ״יוֹעֵץ״ — שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לְעַבֵּר שָׁנִים וְלִקְבּוֹעַ חֳדָשִׁים. ״וְחָכָם״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד הַמַּחְכִּים אֶת רַבּוֹתָיו. ״חֲרָשִׁים״ — בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁפּוֹתֵחַ בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה הַכֹּל נַעֲשִׂין כְּחֵרְשִׁין. ״וְנָבוֹן״ — זֶה הַמֵּבִין דָּבָר מִתּוֹךְ דָּבָר. ״לָחַשׁ״ — זֶה שֶׁרָאוּי לִמְסוֹר לוֹ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בְּלַחַשׁ.
human_translation: “The counselor”; who knows how to intercalate years and determine months, “The cunning”; this is a student who makes his rabbis wise “Charmer [ ḥarashim ]”; that when he begins speaking matters of Torah, all are as though deaf [ ḥershin ], “The skillful”; this is one who understands something from something else “Enchanter [ laḥash ]”; this who is worthy of having words of the Torah that were given in whispers [ laḥash ], transmitted to him.
llm_translation: "Yoetz" - one who knows how to intercalate years and establish new months. "Chacham" - this refers to a student who outwits his teachers. "Charashim" - at the time when one opens with words of Torah, everyone should act like charashim. "V'navon" - this is one who understands one thing from another. "Lachash" - this is one who is fit to be entrusted with Torah teachings that were given in a whisper.

hebrew_text: ״וְנָתַתִּי נְעָרִים שָׂרֵיהֶם״. מַאי ״וְנָתַתִּי נְעָרִים שָׂרֵיהֶם״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁמְּנוֹעָרִין מִן הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: “And I will make children their princes” What is “And I will make children [ ne’arim ] their princes”? Rabbi Elazar said: These are people who are devoid [ meno’arin ] of mitzvot;
llm_translation: "And I will give youths as their leaders." What is "And I will give youths as their leaders"? Rabbi Elazar said: These are human beings who are young in the performance of commandments.

hebrew_text: ״וְתַעֲלוּלִים יִמְשְׁלוּ בָּם״ — אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: תַּעֲלֵי בְּנֵי תַעֲלֵי. וְלֹא נִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתּוֹ, עַד שֶׁאָמַר לָהֶם: ״יִרְהֲבוּ הַנַּעַר בַּזָּקֵן וְהַנִּקְלֶה בַּנִּכְבָּד״ — אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁמְּנוֹעָרִין מִן הַמִּצְוֹת, יִרְהֲבוּ בְּמֵי שֶׁמְּמוּלָּא בְּמִצְוֹת כְּרִמּוֹן. ״וְהַנִּקְלֶה בַּנִּכְבָּד״ — יָבֹא מִי שֶׁחֲמוּרוֹת דּוֹמוֹת עָלָיו כְּקַלּוֹת, וְיִרְהֲבוּ בְּמִי שֶׁקַּלּוֹת דּוֹמוֹת עָלָיו כַּחֲמוּרוֹת.
human_translation: “And babes [ ta’alulim ] shall rule over them”; Rav Pappa bar Ya’akov said: foxes [ ta’alei ], sons of foxes. And mind was not calmed until he said to them: “The child shall behave insolently against the aged, and the base against the honorable” these are people who are devoid of mitzvot, will behave insolently toward one who is as filled with mitzvot as a pomegranate. “And the base [ nikleh ] against the honorable [ nikhbad ]”; one for whom major [ kaved ] are like minor ones [ kalot ] in his mind will come and behave insolently with one for whom minor are like major ones in his mind.
llm_translation: "And they shall make sport of them" — Rav Papa son of Yaakov said: The children of the frivolous will be frivolous. And his mind did not settle until he said to them: "Let the youth mock the elder, and the base one mock the honorable" — these are people who from their youth are negligent in fulfilling commandments, let them mock those who are meticulous in fulfilling commandments like a pomegranate. "And the base one mock the honorable" — let one whose burdens are light be compared to one whose burdens are heavy, and let them mock those whose burdens are light.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת כִּשְׁלוֹנָהּ שֶׁל יְרוּשָׁלָיִם — לֹא פָּסְקוּ מֵהֶם בַּעֲלֵי אֲמָנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יִתְפֹּשׂ אִישׁ בְּאָחִיו בֵּית אָבִיו שִׂמְלָה לְךָ קָצִין תִּהְיֶה לָנוּ״. דְּבָרִים שֶׁבְּנֵי אָדָם מִתְכַּסִּין כְּשִׂמְלָה, יֶשְׁנָן תַּחַת יָדֶךָ.
human_translation: Rav Ketina said: Even at the time of Jerusalem’s downfall, trustworthy men did not cease to exist as it is stated: “For a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, You have a cloak, be our ruler” Things that people covered as with a cloak, are under your hand,
llm_translation: Rav Katina said: Even at the time of the stumbling of Jerusalem, the owners of craftsmanship did not cease from them, as it is stated: "For if a man finds his brother within the house of his father, a garment for you to be a judge for us." Matters that people cover like a garment, are under your control.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַמַּכְשֵׁלָה הַזֹּאת״. מַאי ״וְהַמַּכְשֵׁלָה הַזֹּאת״ — דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין בְּנֵי אָדָם עוֹמְדִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִכְשָׁל בָּהֶן — ״יֶשְׁנָן תַּחַת יָדֶךָ״. ״יִשָּׂא בַיּוֹם הַהוּא לֵאמֹר לֹא אֶהְיֶה חוֹבֵשׁ וּבְבֵיתִי אֵין לֶחֶם וְאֵין שִׂמְלָה לֹא תְשִׂימוּנִי קְצִין עָם״. ״יִשָּׂא״ — אֵין יִשָּׂא אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן שְׁבוּעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תִשָּׂא אֶת שֵׁם ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״. ״לֹא אֶהְיֶה חוֹבֵשׁ״ — לֹא הָיִיתִי מֵחוֹבְשֵׁי בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. ״וּבְבֵיתִי אֵין לֶחֶם וְאֵין שִׂמְלָה״ — שֶׁאֵין בְּיָדִי לֹא מִקְרָא וְלֹא מִשְׁנָה וְלֹא גְּמָרָא.
human_translation: What is “And this stumbling block” Things that people cannot grasp unless they have stumbled over them, are under your hand. Although “shall swear that day, saying: I will not be a healer, for in my house there is neither bread nor a cloak; you shall not make me ruler of a people” “Shall swear [ yissa ],” yissa is none than an expression of an oath, as it is stated: “You shall not take [ tissa ] the name of the Lord your God “I will not be a healer [ ḥovesh ]” I was never of those who sit [ meḥovshei ] in the study hall; “for in my house there is neither bread nor a cloak,” as I possess neither Bible, nor Mishna, nor Gemara.
llm_translation: "And this stumbling block." What is "And this stumbling block" - things that people do not stumble upon unless they stumble in them - "they are under your control." "He shall lift up on that day, saying, 'I will not be a healer, and in my house there is no bread or garment; do not make me a ruler of the people.'" "He shall lift up" - it is only a language of an oath, as it is stated: "You shall not lift up the name of the Lord your God." "I will not be a healer" - I was not among the healers of the study hall. "And in my house there is no bread or garment" - that I do not have in my possession neither Scripture, nor Mishnah, nor Gemara.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִי אָמַר לְהוּ גְּמִירְנָא — אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אֵימָא לַן! הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר גְּמַר וּשְׁכַח. מַאי ״לֹא אֶהְיֶה חוֹבֵשׁ״ — לֹא אֶהְיֶה חוֹבֵשׁ כְּלָל.
human_translation: But perhaps it is different there, for if he had said: I have learned, they would have said to him: Tell us, he would have said he learned and forgot, What is “I will not be a healer,” I will not be a healer at all,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And perhaps it is different there, for if he said to them, "We have learned" - they would say to him, "Say it to us!" He would have to say "We have learned and forgotten." What is "I will not be a burden"? - I will not be a burden at all. English translation: And perhaps it is different there, for if he said to them, "We have learned" - they would say to him, "Say it to us!" He would have to say "We have learned and forgotten." What is "I will not be a burden"? - I will not be a burden at all.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: לֹא חָרְבָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם עַד שֶׁפָּסְקוּ מִמֶּנָּה בַּעֲלֵי אֲמָנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוֹטְטוּ בְּחוּצוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִַם וּרְאוּ נָא וּדְעוּ וּבַקְשׁוּ בִרְחוֹבוֹתֶיהָ אִם תִּמְצְאוּ אִישׁ אִם יֵשׁ עוֹשֶׂה מִשְׁפָּט מְבַקֵּשׁ אֱמוּנָה וְאֶסְלַח לָהּ״! לָא קַשְׁיָא:
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rava say: Jerusalem was not destroyed until trustworthy men ceased to exist in it, as it is stated: “Run to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now and know, and seek in its broad places, if you can find a man, if there is any that acts justly, that seeks truth, and I will pardon her” not difficult:
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rava say: Jerusalem was not destroyed until the faithful ceased from it, as it is stated: "Roam through the streets of Jerusalem, and look now and take note; search its squares. If you can find a single person, if there is even one who does justice, who seeks the truth, then I will forgive the city." It is not difficult.

hebrew_text: הָא בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה, הָא בְּמַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן. בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה — הֲווֹ, בְּמַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן — לָא הֲווֹ.
human_translation: This to words of Torah, that to commerce. With regard to words of Torah, they were with regard to commerce, they were not.
llm_translation: This is regarding matters of Torah, this is regarding business transactions. Regarding matters of Torah - yes, regarding business transactions - no.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁהָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל הַחֲמוֹר, וְהָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲרָךְ מְחַמֵּר אַחֲרָיו. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, שְׁנֵה לִי פֶּרֶק אֶחָד בְּמַעֲשֵׂה מֶרְכָּבָה. אָמַר לוֹ, לֹא כָּךְ שָׁנִיתִי לָכֶם: וְלֹא בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה בְּיָחִיד אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה חָכָם מֵבִין מִדַּעְתּוֹ? אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, תַּרְשֵׁינִי לוֹמַר לְפָנֶיךָ דָּבָר אֶחָד שֶׁלִּמַּדְתַּנִי. אָמַר לוֹ: אֱמוֹר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: An incident involving Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, who was riding on a donkey and was traveling along the way, and Rabbi Elazar ben Arakh, was riding a donkey behind him. said to him: My teacher, teach me one chapter in the Design of the Chariot. He said to him: I not taught you: And one may not to an individual, unless he is a Sage who understands on his own accord? said to him: My teacher, allow me to say before you one thing that you taught me. He said to him: Speak.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai who was riding on a donkey, and he was walking on the road, and Rabbi Elazar ben Arach was following him. He said to him: Rabbi, teach me one chapter in the matter of the chariot. He said to him, I did not teach you this way: not in the chariot individually unless he was wise and understood from his own knowledge? He said to him: Rabbi, permit me to say one thing before you that you taught me. He said to him: Speak.
