hebrew_text: מִיָּד יָרַד רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי מֵעַל הַחֲמוֹר, וְנִתְעַטֵּף, וְיָשַׁב עַל הָאֶבֶן תַּחַת הַזַּיִת. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, מִפְּנֵי מָה יָרַדְתָּ מֵעַל הַחֲמוֹר? אָמַר: אֶפְשָׁר אַתָּה דּוֹרֵשׁ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה מֶרְכָּבָה, וּשְׁכִינָה עִמָּנוּ, וּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת מְלַוִּין אוֹתָנוּ, וַאֲנִי אֶרְכַּב עַל הַחֲמוֹר?! מִיָּד פָּתַח רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲרָךְ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה הַמֶּרְכָּבָה וְדָרַשׁ. וְיָרְדָה אֵשׁ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם, וְסִיבְּבָה כׇּל הָאִילָנוֹת שֶׁבַּשָּׂדֶה, פָּתְחוּ כּוּלָּן וְאָמְרוּ שִׁירָה.
human_translation: Immediately, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai alighted from the donkey, and wrapped and sat on a stone under an olive tree. said to him: My teacher, for what reason did you alight from the donkey? He said: possible that you are expounding the Design of the Chariot, and the Divine Presence is with us, and the ministering angels are accompanying us, that I should ride on a donkey? Immediately, Rabbi Elazar ben Arakh began the Design of the Chariot and expounded, and fire descended from heaven and encircled all the trees in the field, and all began reciting song.
llm_translation: Immediately Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai descended from the donkey, and wrapped himself, and sat on the stone under the olive tree. He said to him: Rabbi, why did you descend from the donkey? He said: Perhaps you are interpreting the matter of the chariot, and the Divine Presence is with us, and the ministering angels accompany us, and I should ride on the donkey?! Immediately Rabbi Elazar ben Arach opened with the matter of the chariot and expounded. Fire came down from heaven, and encircled all the trees in the field, they all opened and sang praises.

hebrew_text: מָה שִׁירָה אָמְרוּ — ״הַלְלוּ אֶת ה׳ מִן הָאָרֶץ תַּנִּינִים וְכׇל תְּהוֹמוֹת ... עֵץ פְּרִי וְכׇל אֲרָזִים ... הַלְלוּיָהּ״. נַעֲנָה מַלְאָךְ מִן הָאֵשׁ, וְאָמַר: הֵן הֵן מַעֲשֵׂה הַמֶּרְכָּבָה. עָמַד רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וּנְשָׁקוֹ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, וְאָמַר: בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּתַן בֵּן לְאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לְהָבִין וְלַחְקוֹר וְלִדְרוֹשׁ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה מֶרְכָּבָה. יֵשׁ נָאֶה דּוֹרֵשׁ וְאֵין נָאֶה מְקַיֵּים, נָאֶה מְקַיֵּים וְאֵין נָאֶה דּוֹרֵשׁ. אַתָּה נָאֶה דּוֹרֵשׁ וְנָאֶה מְקַיֵּים. אַשְׁרֶיךָ אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, שֶׁאֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲרָךְ יָצָא מֵחֲלָצֶיךָ.
human_translation: What song did they recite? “Praise the Lord from the earth, sea monsters and all depths…fruit trees and all cedars…praise the Lord” An angel responded from the fire, saying: This is the very Design of the Chariot, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai stood and kissed on his head, and said: Blessed be God, Lord of Israel, who gave our father Abraham a son who knows to understand, investigate, and expound the Design of the Chariot. There are some who expound well but do not fulfill well, who fulfill well but do not expound well, you expound well and fulfill well. Happy are you, our father Abraham, that Elazar ben Arakh came from your loins.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What song did they say? 'Praise the Lord from the earth, sea monsters and all depths... Fruit tree and all cedars... Hallelujah.' An angel answered from the fire, and said: 'This is the work of the chariot.' Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai stood up and kissed his head, and said: 'Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, who gave a son to our father Abraham, who knows to understand, investigate, and inquire into the work of the chariot. Some are fit to expound but not to fulfill, some are fit to fulfill but not to expound. You are fit to expound and to fulfill. Blessed are you, our father Abraham, that Elazar ben Arach came forth from your loins."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁנֶּאֶמְרוּ הַדְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הָיָה הוּא וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַכֹּהֵן מְהַלְּכִים בַּדֶּרֶךְ. אָמְרוּ: אַף אָנוּ נִדְרוֹשׁ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה מֶרְכָּבָה. פָּתַח רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְדָרַשׁ. וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם תְּקוּפַת תַּמּוּז הָיָה. נִתְקַשְּׁרוּ שָׁמַיִם בְּעָבִים וְנִרְאֶה כְּמִין קֶשֶׁת בֶּעָנָן, וְהָיוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת מִתְקַבְּצִין וּבָאִין לִשְׁמוֹעַ, כִּבְנֵי אָדָם שֶׁמִּתְקַבְּצִין וּבָאִין לִרְאוֹת בְּמַזְמוּטֵי חָתָן וְכַלָּה.
human_translation: And when matters, were recounted before Rabbi Yehoshua, he was walking along the way with Rabbi Yosei the Priest. They said: We too shall expound the Design of the Chariot. Rabbi Yehoshua began expounding. And that was the day of the summer solstice, heavens became filled with clouds, and there was the appearance of a kind of rainbow in a cloud. And ministering angels gathered and came to listen, like people gathering and coming to see the rejoicing of a bridegroom and bride.
llm_translation: When they said these things before Rabbi Yehoshua, he and Rabbi Yosei the Priest were walking on the road. They said: We too should expound on the matter of the Merkavah. Rabbi Yehoshua began and expounded. And that day was the summer solstice. The heavens were intertwined with clouds and appeared like a rainbow in the cloud, and the ministering angels would assemble and come to listen, like people who assemble and come to see the adornments of a bridegroom and bride.

hebrew_text: הָלָךְ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַכֹּהֵן וְסִיפֵּר דְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, וְאָמַר: אַשְׁרֵיכֶם וְאַשְׁרֵי יוֹלַדְתְּכֶם, אַשְׁרֵי עֵינַי שֶׁכָּךְ רָאוּ. וְאַף אֲנִי וְאַתֶּם, בַּחֲלוֹמִי מְסוּבִּין הַיְינוּ עַל הַר סִינַי, וְנִתְּנָה עָלֵינוּ בַּת קוֹל מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם: עֲלוּ לְכָאן, עֲלוּ לְכָאן! טְרַקְלִין גְּדוֹלִים וּמַצָּעוֹת נָאוֹת מוּצָּעוֹת לָכֶם, אַתֶּם, וְתַלְמִידֵיכֶם, וְתַלְמִידֵי תַלְמִידֵיכֶם מְזוּמָּנִין לְכַת שְׁלִישִׁית.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Priest went and recited matters before Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, said Happy are you, and happy are who gave birth to you; happy are my eyes that saw this, As for you and I, in my dream we were seated at Mount Sinai, and a Divine Voice came to us from heaven: Ascend here, ascend here, large halls teraklin and pleasant couches are made up for you. You, your students, and the students of your students are invited to third group,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Priest went and related matters before Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, and he said: "Fortunate are you, and fortunate is your mother who bore you. Fortunate are my eyes that have seen this. And I too, along with you, were lying in a dream, encircling Mount Sinai, and a heavenly voice came upon us, saying: 'Ascend here, ascend here! Beautiful steps and pleasant couches are prepared for you, you, and your students, and the students of your students, who are ready to enter the third part.'"

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשָׁה הַרְצָאוֹת הֵן, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִרְצָה דְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִרְצָה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן חֲכִינַאי הִרְצָה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וְאִילּוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲרָךְ לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב! דְּאַרְצִי וְאַרְצוֹ קַמֵּיהּ — קָחָשֵׁיב, דְּאַרְצִי וְלָא אַרְצוֹ קַמֵּיהּ — לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב. וְהָא חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן חֲכִינַאי דְּלָא אַרְצוֹ קַמֵּיהּ, וְקָא חָשֵׁיב! דְּאַרְצִי מִיהָא קַמֵּיהּ מַאן דְּאַרְצִי.
human_translation: Is that so? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: There are three lectures. Rabbi Yehoshua lectured matters before Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai; Rabbi Akiva lectured before Rabbi Yehoshua; Ḥananya ben Ḥakhinai lectured before Rabbi Akiva. However, Rabbi Elazar ben Arakh was not included who lectured and were lectured to were included; who lectured and were not lectured to were not included. But wasn’t Ḥananya ben Ḥakhinai, who was not lectured to, and he is included? actually lectured before one who lectured
llm_translation: I?! And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: There are three who were pleasing, Rabbi Yehoshua pleased Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, Rabbi Akiva pleased Rabbi Yehoshua, and Chananya ben Chakinai pleased Rabbi Akiva. But Rabbi Elazar ben Arach was not considered pleasing! If his reasoning and his teacher's reasoning are consistent - he is considered pleasing, but if his reasoning and his teacher's reasoning are not consistent - he is not considered pleasing. Yet Chananya ben Chakinai, whose reasoning was not consistent with his teacher's, was considered pleasing! Because his reasoning was consistent with someone else's reasoning.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבָּעָה נִכְנְסוּ בַּפַּרְדֵּס, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: בֶּן עַזַּאי, וּבֶן זוֹמָא, אַחֵר, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אֲמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּשֶׁאַתֶּם מַגִּיעִין אֵצֶל אַבְנֵי שַׁיִשׁ טָהוֹר, אַל תֹּאמְרוּ ״מַיִם מַיִם״, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״דּוֹבֵר שְׁקָרִים לֹא יִכּוֹן לְנֶגֶד עֵינָי״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Four entered the orchard [ pardes ], and they are as follows: Ben Azzai; and ben Zoma; Aḥer , and Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Akiva, said to them: When, you reach pure marble stones, do not say: Water, water, because it is stated: “He who speaks falsehood shall not be established before My eyes”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Four entered the orchard, and they are: Ben Azzai, Ben Zoma, Acher, and Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Akiva said to them: When you reach the pure marble stones, do not say, "Water, water," for it is said: "A speaker of lies will not be established before My eyes."

hebrew_text: בֶּן עַזַּאי הֵצִיץ וָמֵת, עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״יָקָר בְּעֵינֵי ה׳ הַמָּוְתָה לַחֲסִידָיו״. בֶּן זוֹמָא הֵצִיץ וְנִפְגַּע, וְעָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״דְּבַשׁ מָצָאתָ אֱכוֹל דַּיֶּיךָּ פֶּן תִּשְׂבָּעֶנּוּ וַהֲקֵאתוֹ״. אַחֵר קִיצֵּץ בִּנְטִיעוֹת. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא יָצָא בְּשָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: Ben Azzai glimpsed and died. And with regard to him the verse states: “Precious in the eyes of the Lord is the death of His pious ones” Ben Zoma glimpsed and was harmed, And with regard to him the verse states: “Have you found honey? Eat as much as is sufficient for you, lest you become full from it and vomit it” Aḥer chopped down the shoots Rabbi Akiva came out safely.
llm_translation: Ben Azzai gazed and died, concerning him the Scripture says: "Precious in the eyes of the Lord is the death of His pious ones." Ben Zoma gazed and was harmed, and concerning him the Scripture says: "You have found honey, eat enough for you, lest you be satiated with it and vomit it." Another one cut down saplings. Rabbi Akiva went out in peace.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת בֶּן זוֹמָא: מַהוּ לְסָרוֹסֵי כַּלְבָּא? אָמַר לָהֶם: ״וּבְאַרְצְכֶם לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ״, כֹּל שֶׁבְּאַרְצְכֶם לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ. שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת בֶּן זוֹמָא: בְּתוּלָה שֶׁעִיבְּרָה, מַהוּ לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל? מִי חָיְישִׁינַן לְדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: They asked ben Zoma: What is castrating a dog? He said to them: shall you do so in your land” any that is in your land, you shall not do They asked ben Zoma: to be a virgin who became pregnant, what is A High Priest Are we concerned for Shmuel? Shmuel says:
llm_translation: They asked Ben Zoma: What about the offspring of a dog? He said to them: "And in your land, you shall not do," anything that you shall not do in your land. They asked Ben Zoma: Regarding a virgin who transgressed, what about the High Priest? Who are we concerned about? We are concerned about the opinion of Shmuel, for Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲנִי לִבְעוֹל כַּמָּה בְּעִילוֹת בְּלֹא דָּם. אוֹ דִלְמָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל לָא שְׁכִיחָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּשְׁמוּאֵל לָא שְׁכִיחַ, וְחָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא בְּאַמְבָּטִי עִיבְּרָה.
human_translation: I can engage in intercourse several times without blood. Or, perhaps Shmuel is not common He said to them: Shmuel is not common, and we are concerned that she may have conceived in a bath.
llm_translation: I am able to have intercourse how many times without blood. Or perhaps is it that Shmuel is not common? He said to them: Shmuel is not common, and we are concerned lest she may have ruptured an artery.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע שֶׁאֵינוֹ יוֹרֶה כְּחֵץ — אֵינָהּ מַזְרַעַת! מֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי יוֹרֶה כְּחֵץ הֲוָה.
human_translation: Didn’t Shmuel say: Any semen that is not shot like an arrow cannot fertilize? initially, it was shot as an arrow, also
llm_translation: And Samuel said: Any emission of seed that does not shoot forth like an arrow - does not impregnate! From the outset, it was indeed shooting forth like an arrow.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה שֶׁהָיָה עוֹמֵד עַל גַּב מַעֲלָה בְּהַר הַבַּיִת, וְרָאָהוּ בֶּן זוֹמָא וְלֹא עָמַד מִלְּפָנָיו. אָמַר לוֹ: מֵאַיִן וּלְאַיִן בֶּן זוֹמָא? אָמַר לוֹ: צוֹפֶה הָיִיתִי בֵּין מַיִם הָעֶלְיוֹנִים לְמַיִם הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים, וְאֵין בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה אֶלָּא שָׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת בִּלְבַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרוּחַ אֱלֹהִים מְרַחֶפֶת עַל פְּנֵי הַמָּיִם״ — כְּיוֹנָה שֶׁמְּרַחֶפֶת עַל בָּנֶיהָ וְאֵינָהּ נוֹגַעַת. אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְתַלְמִידָיו: עֲדַיִין בֶּן זוֹמָא מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: the Sages taught: There was once an incident with regard to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya, who was standing on a step on the Temple Mount, and ben Zoma saw him and did not stand before him said to him: From where and where are you going, ben Zoma, He said to him: I was looking upon between the upper waters and the lower waters, as there is only a mere three fingers between them, as it is stated: “And the spirit of God hovered over the face of the waters” like a dove hovering over its young without touching Rabbi Yehoshua said to his students Ben Zoma is still outside;
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah who was standing on the top step of the Temple Mount, and Ben Zoma saw him and did not stand before him. He said to him: From where and to where, Ben Zoma? He said to him: I was observing between the upper waters and the lower waters, and there is nothing between them except three fingerbreadths, as it is stated: "And the spirit of God hovered over the face of the waters" - like a dove that hovers over its young and does not touch them. Rabbi Yehoshua said to his students: Ben Zoma is still outside.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי ״וְרוּחַ אֱלֹהִים מְרַחֶפֶת עַל פְּנֵי הַמָּיִם״ אֵימַת הָוֵי — בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן, הַבְדָּלָה — בְּיוֹם שֵׁנִי הוּא דַּהֲוַאי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וִיהִי מַבְדִּיל בֵּין מַיִם לָמָיִם״. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: כִּמְלֹא נִימָא. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: כִּי גוּדָּא דְגַמְלָא. מָר זוּטְרָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: כִּתְרֵי גְלִימֵי דִּפְרִיסִי אַהֲדָדֵי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: כִּתְרֵי כָסֵי דִּסְחִיפִי אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Now, “And the spirit of God hovered over the face of the waters,” when was On the first day, the division occurred on the second day, as it is written: “And let it divide the waters from the waters” And how much, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Like the thickness of a thread; and the Rabbis said: Like the boards of a bridge. Mar Zutra, and some say Rav Asi, said: Like two robes spread one over the other, And some said: Like two cups placed one upon the other.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "From when is 'and the spirit of God hovered over the surface of the waters'? — On the first day, separation — on the second day, for it is written: 'And let there be a separation between the waters and the waters.' And how much? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Like a hair's breadth. And the Rabbis say: Like the thickness of a thread of a weaver. Mar Zutra, and some say Rav Assi said: Like two hairs of a comb that are interwoven. And some say: Like two baskets that are interwoven."

hebrew_text: אַחֵר קִיצֵּץ בִּנְטִיעוֹת, עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״אַל תִּתֵּן אֶת פִּיךָ לַחֲטִיא אֶת בְּשָׂרֶךָ״. מַאי הִיא? חֲזָא מֶיטַטְרוֹן דְּאִתְיְהִבָא לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא לְמֵיתַב לְמִיכְתַּב זַכְווֹתָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲמַר: גְּמִירִי דִּלְמַעְלָה לָא הָוֵי לֹא יְשִׁיבָה וְלֹא תַּחֲרוּת, וְלֹא עוֹרֶף וְלֹא עִיפּוּי. שֶׁמָּא, חַס וְשָׁלוֹם, שְׁתֵּי רְשׁוּיוֹת הֵן.
human_translation: Aḥer chopped down the saplings, With regard to him, the verse states: “Do not let your mouth bring your flesh into guilt” What was He saw Mitatron, who was granted permission to sit and write the merits Israel. He said: a tradition above there is no sitting; no competition; no back before Him, and no lethargy. he said: Perhaps, Heaven forbid, there are two authorities,
llm_translation: Another cut in plantings, upon him the Scripture says: "Do not give your mouth to sin against your flesh." What is it? See Metatron, to whom permission was given to sit and record the merits of Israel, said: I have learned that above there is no sitting, no competition, no turning away, and no delay. Perhaps, God forbid, there are two authorities.

hebrew_text: אַפְּקוּהּ לְמֶיטַטְרוֹן ומַחְיוּהּ שִׁיתִּין פּוּלְסֵי דְנוּרָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא כִּי חֲזִיתֵיהּ לָא קַמְתְּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ? אִיתְיְהִיבָא לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא לְמִימְחַק זַכְווֹתָא דְאַחֵר. יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים״ — חוּץ מֵאַחֵר.
human_translation: They removed Mitatron and smote him sixty rods [ pulsei ] of fire, They said What is the reason when you saw you did not stand before him? was granted permission to erase the merits of Aḥer A Divine Voice went forth saying: “Return, rebellious children” apart from Aḥer .
llm_translation: They brought him before Metatron and they gave him sixty lashes of fire. They said to him: "Why, when you saw her, did you not rise from your place?" They gave him permission to erase the merits of another. A heavenly voice came forth and said: "Return, rebellious children" - except for one.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: הוֹאִיל וְאִיטְּרִיד הָהוּא גַּבְרָא מֵהָהוּא עָלְמָא, לִיפּוֹק לִיתְהֲנֵי בְּהַאי עָלְמָא. נְפַק אַחֵר לְתַרְבּוּת רָעָה. נְפַק, אַשְׁכַּח זוֹנָה תַּבְעַהּ, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: וְלָאו אֱלִישָׁע בֶּן אֲבוּיָה אַתְּ? עֲקַר פּוּגְלָא מִמֵּישְׁרָא בְּשַׁבָּת וִיהַב לַהּ, אָמְרָה: אַחֵר הוּא.
human_translation: said: Since that man, has been banished from that world, let him go out and enjoy this world. Aḥer went astray. He went found a prostitute solicited her She said to him: And you not Elisha ben Avuya? He uprooted a radish from a patch on Shabbat and gave it to her, said: He is other
llm_translation: He said: Since that man from that world has come to this world, let him go and enjoy himself in this world. Another one went out to engage in evil conduct. He went out, found a prostitute, and she said to him: Aren't you Elisha ben Avuyah? He uprooted a radish from its place on Shabbat and gave it to her, she said: It is another one.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל אַחֵר אֶת רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּצָא לְתַרְבּוּת רָעָה, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״גַּם אֶת זֶה לְעוּמַּת זֶה עָשָׂה הָאֱלֹהִים״? אָמַר לוֹ: כׇּל מַה שֶּׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, בָּרָא כְּנֶגְדּוֹ. בָּרָא הָרִים — בָּרָא גְּבָעוֹת, בָּרָא יַמִּים — בָּרָא נְהָרוֹת.
human_translation: Aḥer asked Rabbi Meir after he had gone astray. He said to him: What is which is written: “God has made even the one as well as the other” said to him: Everything that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created, He created corresponding to it. He created mountains, He created hills; He created seas, He created rivers.
llm_translation: He asked Rabbi Meir after he had gone out to adopt an evil way, he said to him: What is the meaning of what is written: "Also this, opposite that, God made"? He said to him: Everything that the Holy One, blessed be He, created, He created corresponding to it. He created mountains - He created hills, He created seas - He created rivers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבְּךָ לֹא אָמַר כָּךְ, אֶלָּא: בָּרָא צַדִּיקִים בָּרָא רְשָׁעִים, בָּרָא גַּן עֵדֶן בָּרָא גֵּיהִנָּם. כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁנֵי חֲלָקִים, אֶחָד בְּגַן עֵדֶן וְאֶחָד בְּגֵיהִנָּם. זָכָה צַדִּיק — נָטַל חֶלְקוֹ וְחֵלֶק חֲבֵרוֹ בְּגַן עֵדֶן, נִתְחַיֵּיב רָשָׁע — נָטַל חֶלְקוֹ וְחֵלֶק חֲבֵרוֹ בְּגֵיהִנָּם.
human_translation: said to him: Rabbi Akiva, your teacher, did not say so, but He created the righteous, He created the wicked; He created the Garden of Eden, He created Gehenna. Each and every has two portions, one in the Garden of Eden and one in Gehenna. merits righteous, he takes his portion and the portion of his colleague in the Garden of Eden; culpable wicked, he takes his portion and the portion of his colleague in Gehenna.
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi Akiva, your teacher did not say so, but rather: He created righteous, He created wicked, He created the Garden of Eden, He created Gehinnom. Each and every individual has two portions, one in the Garden of Eden and one in Gehinnom. If the righteous merit, he takes his portion and the portion of his fellow in the Garden of Eden; if the wicked become liable, he takes his portion and the portion of his fellow in Gehinnom.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — גַּבֵּי צַדִּיקִים כְּתִיב: ״לָכֵן בְּאַרְצָם מִשְׁנֶה יִירָשׁוּ״, גַּבֵּי רְשָׁעִים כְּתִיב: ״וּמִשְׁנֶה שִׁבָּרוֹן שׇׁבְרֵם״.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said: What is the verse With regard to the righteous, it is stated: “Therefore in their land they shall possess double” with regard to the wicked, it is stated: “And destroy them with double destruction”
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said: What is the verse? Regarding the righteous it is written: "Therefore they shall inherit a double portion in their land," regarding the wicked it is written: "And a double portion of destruction is their portion."

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל אַחֵר אֶת רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּצָא לְתַרְבּוּת רָעָה, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יַעַרְכֶנָּה זָהָב וּזְכוֹכִית וּתְמוּרָתָהּ כְּלִי פָז״? אָמַר לוֹ: אֵלּוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, שֶׁקָּשִׁין לִקְנוֹתָן כִּכְלֵי זָהָב וּכְלֵי פָז, וְנוֹחִין לְאַבְּדָן כִּכְלֵי זְכוּכִית. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבָּךְ לֹא אָמַר כָּךְ, אֶלָּא: מָה כְּלֵי זָהָב וּכְלֵי זְכוּכִית, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרוּ — יֵשׁ לָהֶם תַּקָּנָה, אַף תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁסָּרַח — יֵשׁ לוֹ תַּקָּנָה. אָמַר לוֹ: אַף אַתָּה חֲזוֹר בָּךְ! אָמַר לוֹ: כְּבָר שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד: ״שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים״ — חוּץ מֵאַחֵר.
human_translation: Aḥer asked Rabbi Meir after he had gone astray. What is which is written: “Gold and glass cannot equal it; neither shall its exchange be vessels of fine gold” He said to him: words of Torah, which are as difficult to acquire as gilded vessels and vessels of fine gold but are as easy to lose as glass vessels. said to him: Rabbi Akiva, your teacher, did not say so, but Just as golden vessels and glass vessels have a remedy even when they have broken, so too a Torah scholar, although he has transgressed, has a remedy. said to him: you too, return He said to him: I have already heard behind the curtain, “Return, rebellious children,” apart from Aḥer .
llm_translation: He asked another student Rabbi Meir after he went out to a bad society, what is the meaning of what is written: "It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire" (Job 28:16)? He said to him: These are the words of Torah, which are difficult to acquire like vessels of gold and vessels of fine gold, and easy to lose like vessels of glass. He said to him: Your teacher Rabbi Akiva did not say this, but rather: Just as vessels of gold and vessels of glass, even though they are broken, they still have a remedy, so too a Torah scholar, even though he has gone astray, he still has a remedy. He said to him: You too, repent! He said to him: I have already heard from behind the curtain: "Return, O backsliding children" (Jeremiah 3:14) — except for one.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַחֵר שֶׁהָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל הַסּוּס בְּשַׁבָּת, וְהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְהַלֵּךְ אַחֲרָיו לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה מִפִּיו, אָמַר לוֹ: מֵאִיר, חֲזוֹר לְאַחֲרֶיךָ, שֶׁכְּבָר שִׁיעַרְתִּי בְּעִקְבֵי סוּסִי עַד כָּאן תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת. אָמַר לוֹ: אַף אַתָּה חֲזוֹר בָּךְ. אָמַר לוֹ: וְלֹא כְּבָר אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ כְּבָר שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד: ״שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים״ — חוּץ מֵאַחֵר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: There was once an incident involving Aḥer , who was riding on a horse on Shabbat, and Rabbi Meir was walking behind him to learn Torah from him. said to him: Meir, turn back, for I have already estimated according to the steps of my horse the Shabbat boundary ends here, said to him: You, too, return He said to him: But have I not already told you I have already heard behind the curtain: “Return, rebellious children,” apart from Aḥer ?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving another person who was riding on a horse on Shabbat, and Rabbi Meir was walking behind him to learn Torah from him. He said to him: Meir, turn back, for I have already estimated the Shabbat boundary by the hooves of my horse up to here. He said to him: You too, turn back. He said to him: And have I not already told you that I have heard from behind the curtain: "Return, wayward sons" — except for another.

hebrew_text: תַּקְפֵיהּ עַיְּילֵיהּ לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא: פְּסוֹק לִי פְּסוּקָךְ. אָמַר לוֹ: ״אֵין שָׁלוֹם אָמַר ה׳ לָרְשָׁעִים״. עַיְּילֵיהּ לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא: פְּסוֹק לִי פְּסוּקָךְ. אָמַר לוֹ: ״כִּי אִם תְּכַבְּסִי בַּנֶּתֶר וְתַרְבִּי לָךְ בּוֹרִית נִכְתָּם עֲוֹנֵךְ לְפָנַי״. עַיְּילֵיהּ לְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ
human_translation: took hold of him brought him to the study hall. said to a child, Recite your verse to me. He recited to him: “There is no peace, said the Lord, concerning the wicked” He brought him to another study hall. said to a child: Recite your verse to me. He recited to him: “For though you wash with niter, and take for you much soap, yet your iniquity is marked before Me” He brought him to another study hall. said to
llm_translation: He carried him to the study hall, he said to him, to the child: "Recite to me your verse." He said to him: "There is no peace, says the Lord, for the wicked." He carried him to another synagogue, he said to him, to the child: "Recite to me your verse." He said to him: "Though you wash yourself with lye and use much soap, the stain of your guilt is still before Me." He carried him to another synagogue, he said to him

hebrew_text: לְיָנוֹקָא: פְּסוֹק לִי פְּסוּקָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״וְאַתְּ שָׁדוּד מַה תַּעֲשִׂי כִּי תִלְבְּשִׁי שָׁנִי כִּי תַעְדִּי עֲדִי זָהָב כִּי תִקְרְעִי בַפּוּךְ עֵינַיִךְ לַשָּׁוְא תִּתְיַפִּי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: a child: Recite your verse to me. He recited to him: “And you, spoiled one, what are you doing, that you clothe yourself with scarlet, that you deck yourself with ornaments of gold, that you enlarge your eyes with paint? In vain you make yourself fair”
llm_translation: To Yanuka: Divide for me your verse. He said to him: "And you, desolate one, what will you do, that you dress in scarlet, that you adorn yourself with ornaments of gold, that you enlarge your eyes with paint? In vain you make yourself beautiful..."

hebrew_text: עַיְּילֵיהּ לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי, עַד דְּעַיְּילֵיהּ לִתְלֵיסַר בֵּי כְנִישָׁתָא, כּוּלְּהוּ פְּסַקוּ לֵיהּ כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא. לְבָתְרָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּסוֹק לִי פְּסוּקָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״וְלָרָשָׁע אָמַר אֱלֹהִים מַה לְּךָ לְסַפֵּר חֻקָּי וְגוֹ׳״. הָהוּא יָנוֹקָא הֲוָה מְגַמְגֵּם בְּלִישָּׁנֵיהּ, אִשְׁתְּמַע כְּמָה דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״וְלֶאֱלִישָׁע אָמַר אֱלֹהִים״, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: סַכִּינָא הֲוָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וְקַרְעֵיהּ וְשַׁדַּרֵיהּ לִתְלֵיסַר בֵּי כְנִישָׁתֵי. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אֲמַר: אִי הֲוַאי בִּידִי סַכִּינָא, הֲוָה קָרַעְנָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: He brought him to another synagogue, until he had brought him into thirteen synagogues, all recited to him similar At the last one, he said to him: Recite your verse to me. He recited to him: “And to the wicked [ velerasha ] God says, what is it for you to declare My statutes” That child had a stutter, it sounded as though he were saying to him: Vele’elisha , God says. Some say had a knife, and he tore apart and sent him to thirteen synagogues. And others say said: Had I a knife, I would have torn him apart.
llm_translation: He would go to the last synagogue until he reached the thirteenth synagogue, and they all would break bread with him because of this quality. Afterwards, he said to him: "Divide your portion for me." He said to him: "And to the wicked God said, 'Why do you recount My statutes...'" That young man would mumble in his tongue, and he would listen to what he said to him: "And to Elisha God said." Some say: There was a knife in his hand, and he would cut and send pieces to the thirteenth synagogues. And some say, he said: If this knife were in my hand, I would cut him.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּאַחֵר, אָמְרִי: לָא מֵידָן לִידַיְּינֵיהּ, וְלָא לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי לֵיתֵי. לָא מֵידָן לִידַיְּינֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם דַּעֲסַק בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְלָא לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי לֵיתֵי — מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲטָא. אֲמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מוּטָב דְּלִידַיְּינֵיהּ וְלֵיתֵי לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי. מָתַי אָמוּת, וְאַעֲלֶה עָשָׁן מִקִּבְרוֹ. כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְלֵיק קוּטְרָא מִקִּבְרֵיהּ דְּאַחֵר.
human_translation: When passed away, declared he should not be judged, nor brought into the World-to-Come. He should not be judged because he occupied with Torah, And he should not be brought into the World-to-Come because he sinned. Rabbi Meir said: It is better that he be judged and be brought into the World-to-Come. When I die and I will cause smoke to rise up from his grave, When Rabbi Meir passed away, smoke rose up from grave of Aḥer ,
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabbi Meir departed, they said: It did not go to Gehenna, nor did it come to the world to come. It did not go to Gehenna - because he engaged in Torah study, and did not come to the world to come - because he sinned. Rabbi Meir said: It is better that I should be with my colleagues and not come to the world to come. When I die, I will ascend as smoke from my grave. When the soul of Rabbi Meir departed, a pillar of smoke ascended from his grave.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גְּבוּרְתָּא לְמִיקְלֵי רַבֵּיהּ? חַד הֲוָה בֵּינַנָא וְלָא מָצֵינַן לְאַצּוֹלֵיהּ? אִינְקְטֵיהּ בְּיָד, מַאן מַרְמֵי לֵיהּ מִן. אָמַר: מָתַי אָמוּת, וַאֲכַבֶּה עָשָׁן מִקִּבְרוֹ. כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן פְּסַק קוּטְרָא מִקִּבְרֵיהּ דְּאַחֵר. פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ הַהוּא סַפְדָנָא: אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר הַפֶּתַח לֹא עָמַד לְפָנֶיךָ, רַבֵּינוּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a mighty to burn his teacher? was one among us and we cannot save him? If we hold him by the hand, who will remove him who? said: When I die I will have smoke extinguished from his grave, when Rabbi Yoḥanan passed away, smoke ceased from grave of Aḥer . A certain eulogizer Even the guard at the entrance could not stand before you, our rabbi.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Is the strength of the students greater than that of their teacher? There was one student among us, and we could not find a way to match him. He took it in his hand, who can remove it from him? He said: "When will I die, and extinguish the smoke from his grave." When the soul of Rabbi Yochanan found rest, a pillar of smoke ceased from his grave. That eulogizer opened with the words: "Even if the gatekeeper did not stand before you, our teacher!"

hebrew_text: בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל אַחֵר אָתְיָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, פַּרְנְסֵנִי. אָמַר לָהּ: בַּת מִי אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לוֹ: בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל אַחֵר אֲנִי. אָמַר לָהּ: עֲדַיִין יֵשׁ מִזַּרְעוֹ בָּעוֹלָם?! וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״לֹא נִין לוֹ וְלֹא נֶכֶד בְּעַמּוֹ וְאֵין שָׂרִיד בִּמְגוּרָיו״! אָמְרָה לוֹ: זְכוֹר לְתוֹרָתוֹ, וְאַל תִּזְכּוֹר מַעֲשָׂיו. מִיָּד יָרְדָה אֵשׁ וְסִכְסְכָה סַפְסָלוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי. בָּכָה וְאָמַר רַבִּי: וּמָה לַמִּתְגַּנִּין בָּהּ — כָּךְ, לַמִּשְׁתַּבְּחִין בָּהּ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה!
human_translation: The daughter of Aḥer came before Rabbi said to him: Rabbi, provide me with sustenance, He said to her: Whose daughter are you? She said to him: I am the daughter of Aḥer . He said to her, Is there still of his seed in the world? But isn’t it stated: “He shall have neither son nor grandson among his people or any remaining in his dwellings” She said to him: Remember his Torah, and do not remember his deeds. Immediately, fire descended and licked Rabbi bench. Rabbi wept and said: If those who treat with contempt such how much more so for those who treat it with honor.
llm_translation: The daughter of another came before Rabbi, she said to him: Rabbi, provide for me. He said to her: Whose daughter are you? She said to him: I am the daughter of another. He said to her: Is there still seed from his lineage in the world?! But isn't it written: "He has neither son nor grandson among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings"! She said to him: Remember his Torah, and do not remember his deeds. Immediately, fire descended and consumed the bench of Rabbi. He wept and said: If this is the punishment for those who are negligent in it — how much more so for those who are diligent in it!

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הֵיכִי גְּמַר תּוֹרָה מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּאַחֵר? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי שִׂפְתֵי כֹהֵן יִשְׁמְרוּ דַעַת וְתוֹרָה יְבַקְשׁוּ מִפִּיהוּ כִּי מַלְאַךְ ה׳ צְבָאוֹת הוּא״. אִם דּוֹמֶה הָרַב לְמַלְאַךְ ה׳ צְבָאוֹת — יְבַקְּשׁוּ תּוֹרָה מִפִּיהוּ, וְאִם לָאו — אַל יְבַקְּשׁוּ תּוֹרָה מִפִּיהוּ!
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, how could he learn Torah from mouth of Aḥer ? But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is which is written: “For the priest’s lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek Torah from his mouth; for he is an angel of the Lord of hosts” If the rabbi is similar to an angel of the Lord of hosts, they should seek Torah from his mouth; but if not, they should not seek Torah from his mouth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, how does he complete Torah from his fellow's mouth? And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is the meaning of what is written: "For the lips of a priest should guard knowledge, and Torah they should seek from his mouth, for he is an angel of the Lord of Hosts"? If the teacher is like an angel of the Lord of Hosts, they should seek Torah from his mouth, but if not, they should not seek Torah from his mouth!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר — קְרָא אַשְׁכַּח וּדְרַשׁ: ״הַט אׇזְנְךָ וּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים וְלִבְּךָ תָּשִׁית לְדַעְתִּי״, ״לְדַעְתָּם״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״לְדַעְתִּי״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Meir found a verse and interpreted it homiletically: “Incline your ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply your heart to My knowledge” It does not state “to their knowledge,” but “to My knowledge.” the Sages,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Meir found a verse and expounded: "Incline your ear and hear the words of the sages, and apply your heart to my knowledge." It does not say "to their knowledge," but rather "to my knowledge."

hebrew_text: רַב חֲנִינָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״שִׁמְעִי בַת וּרְאִי וְהַטִּי אׇזְנֵךְ וְשִׁכְחִי עַמֵּךְ וּבֵית אָבִיךְ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina said from here: “Listen, daughter and consider, and incline your ear; forget also your own people and your father’s house”
llm_translation: Rav Chanina said from here: "Hear, O daughter, and see, and incline your ear, and forget your people and your father's house."

hebrew_text: קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי? לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּגָדוֹל, הָא בְּקָטָן.
human_translation: the verses contradict each other, not difficult. This to an adult; that to a minor,
llm_translation: The verses of Ahadadei are difficult? Not difficult: here in the case of the adult, here in the case of the minor.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אֲמַר, אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲכַל תַּחְלָא, וּשְׁדָא שִׁיחְלָא לְבָרָא. דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶל גִּנַּת אֱגוֹז יָרַדְתִּי לִרְאוֹת בְּאִבֵּי הַנָּחַל וְגוֹ׳״, לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים לֶאֱגוֹז — לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אֱגוֹז זֶה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמְּלוּכְלָךְ בְּטִיט וּבְצוֹאָה — אֵין מַה שֶּׁבְּתוֹכוֹ נִמְאָס; אַף תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁסָּרַח — אֵין תּוֹרָתוֹ נִמְאֶסֶת.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: In the West, say: Rabbi Meir ate a half-ripe date and threw the peel away. Rava taught: What is which is written: “I went down into the garden of nuts, to look at the green plants of the valley” Why are Torah scholars compared to nuts? To tell you: Just as this nut, despite being soiled with mud and excrement, its content is not made repulsive, so too a Torah scholar, although he has sinned, his Torah is not made repulsive.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said, they say in the West: Rabbi Meir ate carobs, and the hair of his head turned white. Rava expounded: What is the meaning of what is written, "I went down to the walnut grove to see the blossoms of the valley, etc."? Why are the disciples of the wise compared to a walnut? To tell you: Just as this walnut, even though it is coated with mud and filth, its contents are not repulsive; so too, a scholar, even though he may have defects, his Torah is not repulsive.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא לְאֵלִיָּהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי קָא עָבֵיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָאָמַר שְׁמַעְתָּא מִפּוּמַּיְיהוּ דְּכוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, וּמִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר לָא קָאָמַר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא גָמַר שְׁמַעְתָּא מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּאַחֵר. אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר רִמּוֹן מָצָא, תּוֹכוֹ אָכַל, קְלִיפָּתוֹ זָרַק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא קָאָמַר, מֵאִיר בְּנִי אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָדָם מִצְטַעֵר, שְׁכִינָה מָה לָשׁוֹן אוֹמֶרֶת: קַלַּנִי מֵרֹאשִׁי, קַלַּנִי מִזְּרוֹעִי. אִם כָּךְ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִצְטַעֵר עַל דָּמָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים — קַל וָחוֹמֶר עַל דָּמָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים שֶׁנִּשְׁפַּךְ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Sheila found Elijah said to What is the Holy One, Blessed be He, doing? said to him: He is stating halakhot transmitted by all of the Sages, but in the name of Rabbi Meir He will not speak. He said to him: Why? Because he learned halakhot from the mouth of Aḥer . He said to him: Why Rabbi Meir found a pomegranate ate its contents throwing away its peel. He said to him: Now is saying: My son, Meir, says: When a person suffers, how does the Divine Presence express itself? Woe is Me from My head, woe is Me from My arm, If the Holy One, Blessed be He, suffers such over the blood of the wicked, how much more so over the blood of the righteous that is spilled.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Sheilah found Elijah. He said to him: What is the Holy One, blessed be He, doing? He said to him: He is saying the Shema from the mouths of all the Rabbis, but not from the mouth of Rabbi Meir. He said to him: Why? Because he learned the Shema from the mouth of another. He said to him: Why? Rabbi Meir found a pomegranate, ate its inside, and threw away its peel. He said to him: Now he says, Meir my son says: When a person is in distress, what does the Divine Presence say? "Remove Me from My head, remove Me from My arm." If so, if the Holy One, blessed be He, is distressed over the blood of the wicked - all the more so over the blood of the righteous that is spilled.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה דִּתְלֵי בְּעִיבְרָא דְּדַשָּׁא וְקָא בָכֵי. אָמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁינָּנָא! מַאי קָא בָכֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי זוּטְרָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ בְּרַבָּנַן: ״אַיֵּה סוֹפֵר אַיֵּה שׁוֹקֵל אַיֵּה סוֹפֵר אֶת הַמִּגְדָּלִים״. ״אַיֵּה סוֹפֵר״ — שֶׁהָיוּ סוֹפְרִים כׇּל אוֹתִיּוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה. ״אַיֵּה שׁוֹקֵל״ — שֶׁהָיוּ שׁוֹקְלִים קַלִּין וַחֲמוּרִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה. ״אַיֵּה סוֹפֵר אֶת הַמִּגְדָּלִים״ — שֶׁהָיוּ שׁוֹנִין שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת הֲלָכוֹת בְּמִגְדָּל הַפּוֹרֵחַ בָּאֲוִיר.
human_translation: Shmuel found Rav Yehuda leaning on the bar of the door, crying. He said to him: Long-toothed one [ shinnana ], what are you crying He said to him: Is a small that which is written with regard to Sages “Where is he who counted, where is he who weighed? Where is he who counted the towers?” “Where is he who counted”; for they would count all the letters of the Torah. “Where is he who weighed”; for they would weigh minor and major of the Torah. “Where is he who counted the towers”; for they would teach three hundred halakhot involving closet floating in the air.
llm_translation: He found Samuel to Rabbi Yehudah sitting in the bathhouse of Dashai and crying. He said to him: "Shinana! Why are you crying?" He said to him: "Who is Zutra? What is written about him among the Rabbis: 'Where is the scribe? Where is the weigher? Where is the scribe who counts the towers?' 'Where is the scribe' - they were scribes of all the letters in the Torah. 'Where is the weigher' - they would weigh the light and heavy matters in the Torah. 'Where is the scribe who counts the towers' - they would enumerate three hundred laws in the tower that soars in the air."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: תְּלָת מְאָה בַּעְיֵי בְּעוֹ דּוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל בְּמִגְדָּל הַפּוֹרֵחַ בָּאֲוִיר. וּתְנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים וְאַרְבָּעָה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. אֲנַן מָה תִּהְוֵי עֲלַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁינָּנָא! טִינָא הָיְתָה בְּלִבָּם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ami said: Doeg asked Ahithophel three hundred questions with regard to a closet floating in the air, And we learned Three kings and four commoners have no portion in the World-to-Come, we, what will be of us? He said to him: Long-toothed one, there was mud [ tina ] in their hearts,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ammi said: Three hundred questions Doeg and Ahitophel asked in the tower that blooms in the air. And we learned: Three kings and four commoners have no share in the World to Come. What will become of us? He said to them: A tooth! A fig was in their heart.

hebrew_text: אַחֵר מַאי — זֶמֶר יְווֹנִי לָא פְּסַק מִפּוּמֵּיהּ. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל אַחֵר: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהָיָה עוֹמֵד מִבֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, הַרְבֵּה סִפְרֵי מִינִין נוֹשְׁרִין מֵחֵיקוֹ.
human_translation: Aḥer , what Greek tunes never ceased from his mouth. they said about Aḥer : When he would stand in the study hall, many heretical books, fall from his lap.
llm_translation: Other what? - A Greek song did not cease from his mouth. They said about him: about Other: At the time when he was standing outside the study hall, many heretical books were falling out of his lap.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל נִימוֹס הַגַּרְדִּי אֶת רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כֹּל עֲמַר דְּנָחֵית לְיוֹרָה סָלֵיק? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֹּל מַאן דַּהֲוָה נְקֵי אַגַּב אִימֵּיהּ — סָלֵיק, כֹּל דְּלָא הֲוָה נְקֵי אַגַּב אִימֵּיהּ — לָא סָלֵיק.
human_translation: Nimos HaGardi, asked Rabbi Meir: all wool that enters the cauldron emerge colored? He said to him: Whoever was clean when with his mother, emerge all not clean when with their mother not emerge
llm_translation: Nimos the Gardi asked Rabbi Meir: "Does every 'omer that is fit for the Omer offering ascend?" He said to him: "Every one who is clean in relation to his mother — ascends, but anyone who is not clean in relation to his mother — does not ascend."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עָלָה בְּשָׁלוֹם וְיָרַד בְּשָׁלוֹם, וְעָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״מׇשְׁכֵנִי אַחֲרֶיךָ נָרוּצָה״. וְאַף רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בִּקְּשׁוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לְדוֹחְפוֹ, אָמַר לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: הַנִּיחוּ לְזָקֵן זֶה, שֶׁרָאוּי לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְבוֹדִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva ascended in safety and descended safely. With regard to him, the verse states: “Draw me, we will run after you; And even Rabbi Akiva, the ministering angels sought to push The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to them: Leave this Elder, for he is fit to serve My glory.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva ascended in peace and descended in peace, and upon him the Scripture says: "Draw me after you, let us run!" (Song of Songs 1:4). Even Rabbi Akiva sought to push him away, the ministering angels. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to them: Leave this elder, for he is worthy to make use of My honor.

hebrew_text: מַאי דְּרַשׁ? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״וְאָתָא מֵרִבְבוֹת קֹדֶשׁ״ — אוֹת הוּא בָּרְבָבָה שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: What expound Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “And He came [ ve’ata ] from the holy myriads” He, is unique [ ot ] among His myriads
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the verse? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "And He came from myriads of holy ones" - this refers to His legion of angels.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: ״דָּגוּל מֵרְבָבָה״ — דּוּגְמָא הוּא בָּרְבָבָה שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu said: “Preeminent above a myriad” He is exemplary among His myriad.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: "Dagul Merbavah" - it is a pattern in his multitudes.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״ה׳ צְבָאוֹת שְׁמוֹ״ — אָדוֹן הוּא בַּצָּבָא שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said: “The Lord of hosts is His name” He is the Master in His host.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "The Lord of Hosts is His name" - He is the master of His own host.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״לֹא בָרוּחַ ה׳ וְאַחַר הָרוּחַ רַעַשׁ לֹא בָרַעַשׁ ה׳. וְאַחַר הָרַעַשׁ אֵשׁ לֹא בָאֵשׁ ה׳ וְאַחַר הָאֵשׁ קוֹל דְּמָמָה דַקָּה״, ״וְהִנֵּה ה׳ עוֹבֵר״.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥiyya bar Abba Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “But the Lord was not in the wind. And after the wind, an earthquake; the Lord was not in the earthquake. And after the earthquake, fire; the Lord was not in the fire. And after the fire, a still, small voice,” “And behold, the Lord passed by”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: "Not in the wind, the Lord, and after the wind an earthquake; not in the earthquake, the Lord. And after the earthquake, a fire; not in the fire, the Lord. And after the fire, a still, small voice." "And behold, the Lord passed by."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בַּשֵּׁדִים: שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה כִּבְנֵי אָדָם. שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת — יֵשׁ לָהֶם כְּנָפַיִם כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, וְטָסִין מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, וְיוֹדְעִין מַה שֶּׁעָתִיד לִהְיוֹת כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Six were said with regard to demons: three like ministering angels, and three like humans. three like ministering angels: They have wings like ministering angels; and they fly from one end of the world to the other like ministering angels; and they know what will be in the future like ministering angels.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Six things were said regarding demons: Three like ministering angels, and three like human beings. Three like ministering angels - they have wings like ministering angels, and they fly from one end of the world to the other like ministering angels, and they know what is destined to happen like ministering angels.

hebrew_text: יוֹדְעִין סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא, שׁוֹמְעִין מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד, כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת.
human_translation: Should it enter your mind that they know Rather, they hear from behind the curtain like ministering angels.
llm_translation: Do you know the height of your knowledge?! Rather, we hear from behind the curtain, like the ministering angels.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁלֹשָׁה כִּבְנֵי אָדָם — אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין כִּבְנֵי אָדָם, פָּרִין וְרָבִין כִּבְנֵי אָדָם, וּמֵתִים כִּבְנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: And three to humans: They eat and drink like humans; they multiply like humans; and they die like humans.
llm_translation: Three like sons of man — eat and drink like sons of man, bear offspring like sons of man, and die like sons of man.

hebrew_text: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בִּבְנֵי אָדָם: שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, שְׁלֹשָׁה כִּבְהֵמָה. שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת — יֵשׁ לָהֶם דַּעַת כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, וּמְהַלְּכִין בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, וּמְסַפְּרִים בִּלְשׁוֹן הַקֹּדֶשׁ כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת. שְׁלֹשָׁה כִּבְהֵמָה — אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין כִּבְהֵמָה, וּפָרִין וְרָבִין כִּבְהֵמָה, וּמוֹצִיאִין רְעִי כִּבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: Six were said with regard to humans: three like ministering angels, three like animals. three like ministering angels: They have intelligence like ministering angels; and they walk upright like ministering angels; and they speak in the holy tongue like ministering angels. three like animals: They eat and drink like animals; and they multiply like animals; and they emit excrement like animals.
llm_translation: Six things were said regarding human beings: three like ministering angels, three like animals. Three like ministering angels - they have understanding like ministering angels, and walk upright like ministering angels, and speak in the holy language like ministering angels. Three like animals - they eat and drink like animals, and procreate and multiply like animals, and emit waste like animals.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בְּאַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים רָתוּי לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם כּוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא מָה לְמַעְלָה מָה לְמַטָּה מָה לְאָחוֹר — לְחַיֵּי. אֶלָּא לְפָנִים — מָה דַּהֲוָה הֲוָה?
human_translation: Whoever looks at four things, it would have been better for him had he never entered the world: Granted, what is above, what is below, what is after. fine, But before what has happened has happened.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Whoever looks at four things, it would have been better for him if he had not come into the world. But, granted that one looks above, below, behind, what is in front - what has been, has been? English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מָשָׁל לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁאָמַר לַעֲבָדָיו: בְּנוּ לִי פַּלְטֵירִין גְּדוֹלִין עַל הָאַשְׁפָּה. הָלְכוּ וּבָנוּ לוֹ, אֵין רְצוֹנוֹ שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ לְהַזְכִּיר שֵׁם אַשְׁפָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar both say: a parable a flesh-and-blood king who said to his servants: Build for me large palaces on a garbage dump. They went and built for him. the king does not desire mention the garbage dump.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: A parable to a king of flesh and blood who said to his servants: Build for me a palace on the garbage heap. They went and built it for him, it is not the desire of a king to mention the name of garbage.

hebrew_text: כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא חָס עַל כְּבוֹד קוֹנוֹ, רָתוּי לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לְעוֹלָם. מַאי הִיא? רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: זֶה הַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בַּקֶּשֶׁת. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: זֶה הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה בַּסֵּתֶר. מִסְתַּכֵּל בַּקֶּשֶׁת, דִּכְתִיב: ״כְּמַרְאֵה הַקֶּשֶׁת אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בֶעָנָן בְּיוֹם הַגֶּשֶׁם כֵּן מַרְאֵה הַנֹּגַהּ סָבִיב הוּא מַרְאֵה דְּמוּת כְּבוֹד ה׳״.
human_translation: Whoever has no concern for the honor of his Maker deserves to have never come to the world. What is Rabbi Abba said: This is who looks at a rainbow. Rav Yosef said: This is who commits a transgression in private. Looking at a rainbow as it is written: “As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of rain so was the appearance of the brightness round about. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the Lord”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Whoever does not have mercy on the honor of his Creator, it is fitting for him not to have come into the world. What is it? Rabbi Abba said: This is one who gazes at the rainbow. Rav Yosef said: This is one who commits a sin in secret. Gazing at the rainbow, as it is written: "Like the appearance of the rainbow in the clouds on a rainy day, so was the appearance of the surrounding radiance. That was the appearance of the semblance of the glory of the Lord."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: זֶה הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה בַּסֵּתֶר, כִּדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה בַּסֵּתֶר, כְּאִילּוּ דּוֹחֵק רַגְלֵי שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ הַשָּׁמַיִם כִּסְאִי וְהָאָרֶץ הֲדוֹם רַגְלָי״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is who commits a transgression in private, in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Whoever commits a transgression in private, it is as though he pushed the feet of the Divine Presence, as it is stated: “Thus said the Lord: The heavens are My seat, and the earth My footstool”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is the one who commits a transgression in secret, as Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who commits a transgression in secret, it is as though he pushes away the feet of the Divine Presence, as it is stated: "So says the Lord: The heavens are My throne, and the earth is My footstool."

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעָא הַזָּקֵן: אִם רוֹאֶה אָדָם שֶׁיִּצְרוֹ מִתְגַּבֵּר עָלָיו — יֵלֵךְ לְמָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ, וְיִלְבַּשׁ שְׁחוֹרִין וְיִתְעַטֵּף שְׁחוֹרִין, וְיַעֲשֶׂה מַה שֶּׁלִּבּוֹ חָפֵץ, וְאַל יְחַלֵּל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּמָצֵי כָּיֵיף לֵיהּ לְיִצְרֵיהּ, הָא — דְּלָא מָצֵי כָּיֵיף לְיִצְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Ela the Elder say: If a person sees that his inclination is overcoming him, he should go to a place where he is unknown, and wear black, and wrap himself in black, and do what his heart desires, but let him not desecrate the Name of Heaven in public. not difficult. This when one is capable of overcoming his inclination That when one is incapable of overcoming his inclination.
llm_translation: I?! And didn't Rabbi Ilai the Elder say: If a person sees that his inclination is overpowering him - let him go to a place where he is not recognized, and let him wear black garments and wrap himself in black, and let him do whatever his heart desires, and not desecrate the name of Heaven openly! It is not difficult: this one - who finds it pleasurable to his inclination, this one - who does not find it pleasurable to his inclination.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי נַחְמָנִי מְתוּרְגְּמָנֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כׇּל הַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים עֵינָיו כֵּהוֹת: בַּקֶּשֶׁת, וּבַנָּשִׂיא, וּבַכֹּהֲנִים. בַּקֶּשֶׁת — דִּכְתִיב: ״כְּמַרְאֵה הַקֶּשֶׁת אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בֶעָנָן בְּיוֹם הַגֶּשֶׁם הוּא מַרְאֵה דְּמוּת כְּבוֹד ה׳״. בַּנָּשִׂיא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַתָּ מֵהוֹדְךָ עָלָיו״. הַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בַּכֹּהֲנִים בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹמְדִין עַל דּוּכָנָן וּמְבָרְכִין אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּשֵּׁם הַמְפוֹרָשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Naḥmani, the disseminator Reish Lakish, interpreted homiletically: Whoever looks at three things, his eyes will grow dim: at a rainbow, at a Nasi , and at the priests. At a rainbow, as it is written: “As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud on the day of rain, this was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the Lord” At a Nasi , as it is written: “And you shall put of your splendor upon him” who looks at the priests when the Temple is standing, as they would stand on their platform and bless Israel with the ineffable name,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Nachmani, expounded the interpretation of Reish Lakish: Anyone who gazes at three things, his eyes grow dim: at a rainbow, at a prince, and at the priests. At a rainbow — as it is written: "Like the appearance of the rainbow in the clouds on a rainy day, so was the appearance of the surrounding radiance; it was the appearance of the glory of the Lord." At a prince — as it is written: "And you shall place your majesty upon him." One who gazes at the priests when the Temple stood, as they stood on their platform and blessed the people in the explicit name.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי נַחְמָנִי מְתוּרְגְּמָנֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל תַּאֲמִינוּ בְרֵעַ אַל תִּבְטְחוּ בְּאַלּוּף״ — אִם יֹאמַר לְךָ יֵצֶר הָרָע, חֲטוֹא וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מוֹחֵל אַל תַּאֲמֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תַּאֲמִינוּ בְרֵעַ״, וְאֵין ״רַע״ אֶלָּא יֵצֶר הָרַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כִּי יֵצֶר לֵב הָאָדָם רַע״,
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Naḥmani, the disseminator Reish Lakish, interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “Trust not in a companion, do not put your confidence in an intimate friend” If the evil inclination says to you: Sin, and the Holy One, Blessed be He, will forgive, do not trust since it is stated: “Trust not in a companion [ rei’a ].” And rei’a is referring to none other the evil [ ra ] inclination, as it is stated: “For the inclination of the heart of man is evil [ ra ]”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Nachmani, expounded his interpreter's exposition of Reish Lakish: What is the meaning of what is written: "Do not trust in a friend, do not rely on a leader"? — If the evil inclination says to you, sin and the Holy One, blessed be He, will forgive, do not believe, as it is stated: "Do not trust in a friend," and "friend" refers only to the evil inclination, as it is said: "For the inclination of man's heart is evil."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין ״אַלּוּף״ אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַלּוּף נְעוּרַי אָתָּה״. שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר מִי מֵעִיד בִּי? אַבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ וְקוֹרוֹת בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם הֵם מְעִידִין בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אֶבֶן מִקִּיר תִּזְעָק וְכָפִיס מֵעֵץ יַעֲנֶנָּה״,
human_translation: And “intimate friend” is referring to none other the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “You are the intimate friend of my youth” Lest you say: who will testify against me? The stones of the house and the beams of the house of person testify against him, as it is stated: “For the stone shall cry out of the wall, and the beam out of the timber shall answer it”
llm_translation: "And there is no 'aluf' except the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: 'Aluf ne'urai attah.' Perhaps you will say, who testifies for me? The stones of his house and the beams of his house of a person testify for him, as it is stated: 'For a stone will cry out from the wall, and a beam will answer it from the wood.'"

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נִשְׁמָתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מְעִידָה בּוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״מִשֹּׁכֶבֶת חֵיקֶךָ שְׁמוֹר פִּתְחֵי פִיךָ״, (אִי זוֹ הִיא דָּבָר שֶׁשּׁוֹכֶבֶת) [אֵי זֶה הוּא דָּבָר שֶׁשָּׁרוּי] בְּחֵיקוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זוֹ נְשָׁמָה. רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת הַמְלַוִּין אוֹתוֹ, הֵן מְעִידִין בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי מַלְאָכָיו יְצַוֶּה לָּךְ לִשְׁמָרְךָ בְּכׇל דְּרָכֶיךָ״. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵבָרָיו שֶׁל אָדָם מְעִידִין בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתֶּם עֵדַי נְאֻם ה' וַאֲנִי אֵל״.
human_translation: And the Sages say: A person’s soul testify against him, as it is stated: “Guard the doors of your mouth from she who lies in your bosom” What thing lies in a person’s bosom? You must say it is soul. Rabbi Zerika said: two ministering angels who accompany him, they testify against him, as it is stated: “For He will command His angels over you, to guard you in all your ways” And the Sages say: A person’s limbs testify against him, as it is stated: “Therefore you are My witnesses, says the Lord, and I am God”
llm_translation: The sages say: The soul of a person testifies about him, as it is said, "While she is lying in your bosom, guard the openings of your mouth." (Where is this matter that is lying) Where is this matter that is suspended in the bosom of a person - one should say: This is the soul. Rabbi Zerika says: The two ministering angels who accompany him, they testify about him, as it is said, "For He will command His angels concerning you, to guard you in all your ways." And the sages say: The limbs of a person testify about him, as it is said, "But you are My witnesses, says the Lord, and I am God."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יוֹסֵי בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לִסְמוֹךְ, יוֹסֵף בֶּן יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר לִסְמוֹךְ. יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן פְּרַחְיָה אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לִסְמוֹךְ, נִיתַּאי הַאַרְבֵּלִי אוֹמֵר לִסְמוֹךְ. יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לִסְמוֹךְ, שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח אוֹמֵר לִסְמוֹךְ. שְׁמַעְיָה אוֹמֵר לִסְמוֹךְ, אַבְטַלְיוֹן אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לִסְמוֹךְ. הִלֵּל וּמְנַחֵם לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ. יָצָא מְנַחֵם, נִכְנַס שַׁמַּאי. שַׁמַּאי אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לִסְמוֹךְ, הִלֵּל אוֹמֵר לִסְמוֹךְ.
human_translation: Yosei ben Yo’ezer says not to place Yosef ben Yoḥanan, says to place Yehoshua ben Peraḥya says not to place Nitai HaArbeli says to place Yehuda ben Tabbai says not to place Shimon ben Shataḥ says to place Shemaya says to place Avtalyon says not to place Hillel and Menaḥem did not disagree Menaḥem departed Shammai entered Shammai says not to place Hillel says to place
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Yosei ben Yoezer says, "Do not rely on the principle of semuch." Yosef ben Yochanan says, "Rely on semuch." Yehoshua ben Perachiah says, "Do not rely on semuch." Nittai the Arbelite says, "Rely on semuch." Yehuda ben Tabbai says, "Do not rely on semuch." Shimon ben Shetach says, "Rely on semuch." Shemayah says, "Rely on semuch." Avtalyon says, "Do not rely on semuch." Hillel and Menachem did not disagree. Menachem left, and Shammai entered. Shammai says, "Do not rely on semuch." Hillel says, "Rely on semuch."

hebrew_text: הָרִאשׁוֹנִים הָיוּ נְשִׂיאִים, וּשְׁנִיִּים לָהֶם אֲבוֹת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: The first served as Nasi , and their counterparts deputy Nasi .
llm_translation: The first ones were presidents, and second to them were the fathers of the court.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה מִזּוּגוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא לִסְמוֹךְ, וּשְׁנַיִם מִזּוּגוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ לִסְמוֹךְ — (הָרִאשׁוֹנִים) הָיוּ נְשִׂיאִים, וּשְׁנִיִּים לָהֶם אֲבוֹת בֵּית דִּין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי — אַב בֵּית דִּין, וְשִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח — נָשִׂיא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Three of the first pairs who say not to place hands and two of the last pairs who say to place hands served as Nasi , and their counterparts deputy Nasi ; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say Yehuda ben Tabbai deputy Nasi and Shimon ben Shataḥ Nasi .
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The first three pairs said not to lean, and the last two pairs said to lean - the first ones were princes, and the last ones were fathers of the court, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: Judah ben Tabai - a father of the court, and Simeon ben Shatah - a prince.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי: אֶרְאֶה בְּנֶחָמָה אִם לֹא הָרַגְתִּי עֵד זוֹמֵם, לְהוֹצִיא מִלִּבָּן שֶׁל צַדּוּקִין. שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: אֵין עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיֵּהָרֵג הַנִּידּוֹן.
human_translation: Who is the tanna that which the Sages taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabbai said: I will see the consolation if I did not kill a conspiring witness. to counter the views of the Sadducees, who would say: Conspiring witnesses are not executed unless the sentenced one has been executed.
llm_translation: The Tanna who taught this is the Rabbis: Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabai said: I will see with consolation if I did not kill a conspiring witness, to remove from the hearts of the Sadducees. For they used to say: Conspiring witnesses are not executed until the defendant is executed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: אֶרְאֶה בְּנֶחָמָה אִם לֹא שָׁפַכְתָּ דָּם נָקִי, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיִּזּוֹמּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם, וְאֵין לוֹקִין עַד שֶׁיִּזּוֹמּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם, וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּמִין מָמוֹן עַד שֶׁיִּזּוֹמּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Shimon ben Shataḥ said to him: I will see the consolation if you did not shed innocent blood, as the Sages said: Conspiring witnesses are not executed unless they are both found to be conspirators; And they are not flogged unless they are both found to be conspirators. And they do not pay money unless they are both found to be conspirators.
llm_translation: Shimon ben Shatach said to him: I will see with consolation if you did not spill innocent blood, for the sages have said: Witnesses who conspire are not executed until both of them are conspired, and they are not flogged until both of them are conspired, and they are not made to pay money until both of them are conspired.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד קִבֵּל עָלָיו יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח.
human_translation: Yehuda ben Tabbai immediately accepted upon himself not to rule law unless he was in the presence of Shimon ben Shataḥ,
llm_translation: Immediately Judah ben Tabbai accepted upon himself that he does not teach halakha except in the presence of Shimon ben Shatach.

hebrew_text: כׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי הָיָה מִשְׁתַּטֵּחַ עַל קִבְרוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ הָרוּג, וְהָיָה קוֹלוֹ נִשְׁמָע. כִּסְבוּרִין הָעָם לוֹמַר שֶׁקּוֹלוֹ שֶׁל הָרוּג הוּא. אָמַר לָהֶם: קוֹלִי הוּא. תֵּדְעוּ, שֶׁלְּמָחָר הוּא מֵת, וְאֵין קוֹלוֹ נִשְׁמָע.
human_translation: All of Yehuda ben Tabbai’s days, he would prostrate himself on the grave of that executed and his voice was heard The people thought that it was the voice of that executed said to them: It is my voice, you know for tomorrow, he will die, and his voice will no be heard.
llm_translation: All his days, Yehudah ben Tabai would spread out on the grave of that slain one, and his voice was heard. The people thought that it was the voice of the slain one. He said to them: "It is my voice." Know that tomorrow he will die, and his voice will not be heard.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְדִלְמָא פַּיּוֹסֵי פַּיְּיסֵיהּ, אוֹ בְּדִינָא תַּבְעֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: perhaps appeased Or, prosecuted him by the law
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: "And perhaps he will appease him, or he seeks judgment."

hebrew_text: מַנִּי הָא? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח אַב בֵּית דִּין, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי נָשִׂיא — הַיְינוּ דְּקָא מוֹרֵי הֲלָכָה בִּפְנֵי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: יְהוּדָה בֶּן טָבַאי אַב בֵּית דִּין, שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח נָשִׂיא — אַב בֵּית דִּין בִּפְנֵי נָשִׂיא מִי מוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה?
human_translation: Whose this Granted, if you say with Rabbi Meir, said Shimon ben Shataḥ was deputy Nasi Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabbai was Nasi , that he issued a halakhic ruling in the presence of Shimon ben Shataḥ But if you say the Sages, who said: Yehuda ben Tabbai deputy Nasi Shimon ben Shataḥ Nasi , May deputy Nasi issue a halakhic ruling in the presence of Nasi ?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mani ha? Iy amarta bishlama, Rabbi Meir de'amar Shimon ben Shatach av beit din, Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabai nasi — hainu deka morei halakha bifnei Shimon ben Shatach. Ella iy amarta Rabbanan de'amri: Yehuda ben Tabai av beit din, Shimon ben Shatach nasi — av beit din bifnei nasi mi moreh halakha?" English translation: "What is the conclusion? If you say in accordance, Rabbi Meir who said Shimon ben Shatach is the head of the court, Rabbi Yehuda ben Tabai is the president — that is who teaches the law in the presence of Shimon ben Shatach. But if you say the sages who say: Yehuda ben Tabai is the head of the court, Shimon ben Shatach is the president — the head of the court in the presence of the president, who teaches the law?"

hebrew_text: לָא, מַאי ״קִבֵּל עָלָיו״ דְּקָאָמַר — לְאִצְטְרוֹפֵי, דַּאֲפִילּוּ אִצְטְרוֹפֵי נָמֵי לָא מִצְטְרֵיפְנָא.
human_translation: No; what accepting upon himself He spoke to joining Even joining I will also not join
llm_translation: Not, what "accepted upon him" that he is saying - for mixtures, that even mixtures also not we mix.

hebrew_text: יָצָא מְנַחֵם וְנִכְנַס שַׁמַּאי כּוּ׳. לְהֵיכָן יָצָא? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: יָצָא לְתַרְבּוּת רָעָה. רָבָא אָמַר: יָצָא לַעֲבוֹדַת הַמֶּלֶךְ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: יָצָא מְנַחֵם לַעֲבוֹדַת הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְיָצְאוּ עִמּוֹ שְׁמוֹנִים זוּגוֹת תַּלְמִידִים לְבוּשִׁין סִירִיקוֹן.
human_translation: Menaḥem departed and Shammai entered. To where did depart? Abaye said: He departed and went astray. Rava said: He departed for the king’s service. This is also taught Menaḥem departed for the king’s service, and eighty pairs of students dressed in silk robes left with him
llm_translation: Menaḥem went out, and Shammai entered. Where did Menaḥem go out to? Abbaye said: He went out for evil behavior. Rava said: He went out for the service of the king. It was taught similarly: Menaḥem went out for the service of the king, and with him went eighty pairs of disciples dressed in silk garments.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם אַל תְּהֵא שְׁבוּת קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי סְמִיכָה אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת, וְנֶחְלְקוּ בָּהּ גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A rabbinic decree [ shevut ] should never be taken lightly in your eyes, since placing hands is prohibited only as a rabbinic decree the greatest of each generation disputed it.
llm_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Always do not have a light oath in your eyes, for leaning is only due to an oath, and the great ones of the generation disagreed about it.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? שְׁבוּת מִצְוָה אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: is obvious. necessary for him a rabbinic decree related to a mitzva.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita? Shevut mitzvah itztricha lei."

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִמַּאן דְּאָמַר בִּסְמִיכָה גּוּפַהּ פְּלִיגִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן בִּשְׁבוּת הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי.
human_translation: This too is obvious. to exclude of the one who said they disagree with regard to the actual placing hands, He teaches us it is a rabbinic decree of their dispute,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Ha namei peshita! Le'apoqei mimman de'amar bisemikha gufah p'ligi, ka mashma lan bishvut hu difligi." English translation: "This is also obvious! To go out from the one who said regarding leaning, they disagree in its essence, it is evident to us in the case of disagreement."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ סְמִיכָה בְּכׇל כֹּחוֹ בָּעֵינַן, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ לָא בָּעֵינַן בְּכׇל כֹּחוֹ — מַאי קָא עָבֵיד? לִיסְמוֹךְ!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: learn from here, placing hands we also require with all his strength. For if it enters your mind we do not require all his strength, what does one violate Let him place
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: Hear from it, we require leaning with all his strength, for if it enters your mind that we do not require leaning with all his strength — what is he doing? To lean!

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״דַּבֵּר אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל ... וְסָמַךְ״, בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכִין, וְאֵין בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמְרִים: בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכוֹת רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection “Speak to the children of [ benei ] Israel” “And he shall place the sons of Israel place but the daughters of Israel do not place Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yishmael say: It is optional for the daughters of Israel to place
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: "Speak to the children of Israel ... and lean," the sons of Israel lean, but the daughters of Israel do not lean. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yishmael say: The daughters of Israel may lean voluntarily.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, סָח לִי אַבָּא אֶלְעָזָר: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיָה לָנוּ עֵגֶל שֶׁל זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים, וַהֲבֵיאנוּהוּ לְעֶזְרַת נָשִׁים, וְסָמְכוּ עָלָיו נָשִׁים. לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּמִיכָה בְּנָשִׁים, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי לַעֲשׂוֹת נַחַת רוּחַ לַנָּשִׁים. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ סְמִיכָה בְּכׇל כֹּחוֹ בָּעֵינַן — מִשּׁוּם נַחַת רוּחַ דְּנָשִׁים עָבְדִינַן עֲבוֹדָה בְּקָדָשִׁים? אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לָא בָּעֵינַן בְּכׇל כֹּחוֹ!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: Abba Elazar related to me On one occasion, we had a calf for a peace-offering, and we brought it to the Women’s Courtyard, and women placed on it. not because there placing hands in women, but in order to please the women, if it enters your mind we require with all one’s strength, we perform work with consecrated in order to please women? Rather, isn’t it conclude from this we do not require with all one’s strength?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said, my father-in-law Abba Elazar told me: Once we had a calf for peace offerings, and we brought it to the women's courtyard, and the women leaned on it. Not because women lean, but in order to give pleasure to the women. And if you think we need it with all its strength because of the pleasure of the women, do we perform the service in the Holy Temple for the pleasure of women? No, we do not need it with all its strength!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ בָּעֵינַן בְּכׇל כֹּחוֹ — דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אַקְפּוֹ יְדַיְיכוּ. אִי הָכִי, לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּמִיכָה בְּנָשִׁים, תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּאֵינָהּ לִסְמִיכָה כְּלָל!
human_translation: Actually, I say to you we do require with all one’s strength, by saying to them: Ease your hands If so, Not because there place hands in women, Let him derive it is not placing hands at all.
llm_translation: Forever say to you in all his strength - for he said to them: "Hold my hands." If so, not because she is leaning on women, let him go out that she is not for leaning at all!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר. חֲדָא — דְּלֵיתָא לִסְמִיכָה כְּלָל, וְעוֹד — כְּדֵי לַעֲשׂוֹת נַחַת רוּחַ לַנָּשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: He stated one and another. One that it is not placing hands at all, and another in order to please the women.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: One and furthermore he said. One - that there is no need for proximity at all, and furthermore - in order to bring contentment to women.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ — צְדָדִין אֲסוּרִין, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ צְדָדִין מוּתָּרִין, לִסְמוֹךְ לִצְדָדִין. אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ צְדָדִין אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Learn from this sides are prohibited, for if it enters your mind sides are permitted, to place on the sides, Rather, not conclude from this sides are prohibited?
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Hear from it - sides are forbidden, for if it were to enter your mind that sides are permitted, to rely on sides. Rather, no, hear from it - sides are forbidden.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא צְדָדִין מוּתָּרִין, כָּל דְּבַהֲדֵי גַּבַּהּ — כְּגַבַּהּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even you say that sides are permitted anything that is near back considered as its back.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Even if you say that side dishes are permitted, anything that is alongside the main dish - is like the main dish in terms of payment.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים, וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶם, אֲבָל לֹא עוֹלוֹת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים וְעוֹלוֹת, וְסוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may bring peace-offerings but one may not place on them, However, not burnt-offerings And Beit Hillel say: One may bring peace-offerings and burnt-offerings, and one places hands on them.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One brings peace offerings, but does not lean on them, but not burnt offerings. And Beit Hillel say: One brings peace offerings and burnt offerings, and leans on them.

hebrew_text: עֲצֶרֶת שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יוֹם טְבוֹחַ אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵין יוֹם טְבוֹחַ אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת. וּמוֹדִים שֶׁאִם חָלָה לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, שֶׁיּוֹם טְבוֹחַ אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: the festival of Shavuot occurs on the eve of Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: The day of slaughter after Shabbat, And Beit Hillel say: The day of slaughter is not after Shabbat. But concede that if occurs on Shabbat, the day of slaughter after Shabbat.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Atzeret that falls on Erev Shabbat, Beit Shammai says: the day of slaughter is after Shabbat. And Beit Hillel says: there is no day of slaughter after Shabbat. And they agree that if it falls on Shabbat, the day of slaughter is after Shabbat."

hebrew_text: אֵין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מִתְלַבֵּשׁ בְּכֵלָיו, וּמוּתָּרִין בְּהֶסְפֵּד וּבְתַעֲנִית, שֶׁלֹּא לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי הָאוֹמְרִין: עֲצֶרֶת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: the High Priest would not dress in his garments And all were permitted to eulogize and fast not to uphold the opinion of who would say: Shavuot after Shabbat.
llm_translation: A priestly garments not wear high priest, and permitted in eulogy and fast, not to fulfill words of saying: assembly after Sabbath.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מִנַּיִין לָעֲצֶרֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין, כָּל שִׁבְעָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת וּבְחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת וּבְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת״, מַקִּישׁ חַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת לְחַג הַמַּצּוֹת: מָה חַג הַמַּצּוֹת יֵשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין כָּל שִׁבְעָה — אַף חַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת יֵשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין כָּל שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya said: From where that Shavuot can be redressed, all seven As it is stated: on the festival of Passover, and on the festival of Shavuot , and on the festival of Sukkot ” the festival of Shavuot to the festival of Passover by analogy: Just as one can redress the failure to bring the offering on the festival of Passover on all seven so too, on the festival of Shavuot , one can redress the failure to bring the offering for all seven,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara. Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: From where do we derive that Shavuot has accompanying offerings? From the fact that it is mentioned together with Pesach and Sukkot in the verse, 'On the Festival of Matzot, and on the Festival of Weeks, and on the Festival of Sukkot.' It compares the Festival of Weeks to the Festival of Matzot: Just as the Festival of Matzot has accompanying offerings for seven days, so too the Festival of Weeks has accompanying offerings for seven days."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: מַקִּישׁ לְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת, מָה חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת יֵשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין כָּל שְׁמוֹנָה — אַף חַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת יֵשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין כָּל שְׁמוֹנָה! שְׁמִינִי רֶגֶל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: But perhaps say to the festival of Sukkot by analogy: Just as the Festival of Sukkot can be redressed for all eight so too can the festival of Shavuot be redressed for all eight Eighth is an independent pilgrimage Festival
llm_translation: And why not? It draws an analogy to the Festival of Sukkot. Just as the Festival of Sukkot has eight days of payment, so too the Festival of Weeks has eight days of payment! The eighth day is a festival in its own right.

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמְרִי[נַן] שְׁמִינִי רֶגֶל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא — הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן פָּזֵ״ר קֶשֶׁ״ב. אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן תַּשְׁלוּמִין — תַּשְׁלוּמִין דְּרִאשׁוֹן הוּא. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁלֹּא חָג בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג — חוֹגֵג אֶת כָּל הָרֶגֶל, וְיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן.
human_translation: say that they said that Eighth is an independent pilgrimage Festival, this applies only to the issue of peh , zayin , reish , kuf , shin , beit , Eighth But with regard to the redress it redress for the first as we learned One who did not celebrate on the first day of the Festival can celebrate throughout the pilgrimage Festival and the last day
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eimor d'amrinan shemini regel bifnei atzmo hu — hanei milei le'inyan pazer kesheb. Aval le'inyan tashlumin — tashlumin d'rishon hu. Ditan: Mi she'lo chag b'yom tov harishon shel chag — chogeg et kol harel, v'yom tov ha'acharon." English translation: "Say we, the eighth day a festival by itself is — these words for the matter of scattering silver. But for the matter of payments — the payments of the first is. For we learned: One who did not celebrate on the first day of the festival — he celebrates the entire festival, and the last day of the festival."

hebrew_text: תָּפַשְׂתָּ מְרוּבֶּה לֹא תָּפַשְׂתָּ, תָּפַשְׂתָּ מוּעָט תָּפַשְׂתָּ.
