human_translation: If you grasped many, you did not grasp anything; if you grasped few, you grasped something.
llm_translation: You have taken the majority, you have not taken; you have taken a minority, you have taken.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא כַּתְבֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת? לְאַקּוֹשֵׁי לְחַג הַמַּצּוֹת: מָה חַג הַמַּצּוֹת טָעוּן לִינָה — אַף חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת טָעוּן לִינָה.
human_translation: But for what halakha did the Merciful One write the festival of Sukkot to analogy to the festival of Passover, Just as the festival of Passover requires lodging so too the festival of Sukkot requires lodging
llm_translation: Rather, for what purpose did the Merciful One write the commandment of dwelling in booths for the Festival of Sukkot? To include those who are obligated for the Festival of Matzot to dwell in booths: just as the Festival of Matzot requires lodging — so too the Festival of Sukkot requires lodging.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָלַן?
human_translation: And there, from where do we
llm_translation: And there, who is the tanna?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וּפָנִיתָ בַבֹּקֶר וְהָלַכְתָּ לְאֹהָלֶיךָ״.
human_translation: as it is written “And you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents”
llm_translation: It is written: "And you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: עֲצֶרֶת שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יוֹם טְבוֹחַ אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵין לָהּ יוֹם טְבוֹחַ. מַאי לָאו, אֵין לָהּ יוֹם טְבוֹחַ כְּלָל? לָא, שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה יוֹם טְבוֹחַ.
human_translation: We learned the festival of Shavuot occurs on the eve of Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: The day of slaughter is after Shabbat; and Beit Hillel say: It does not have a day of slaughter. What, is it not it does not have a day of slaughter at all; No, it does not require a day of slaughter.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If Shavuot falls out on Erev Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: the day after Shabbat is the festival of slaughtering, and Beit Hillel say: it does not have a festival of slaughtering. What is the reason that it does not have a festival of slaughtering at all? Because it does not require a festival of slaughtering.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — דִּמְקָרְבִינַן בְּיוֹמֵיהּ, הָא אִיפְּלִיגוּ בַּהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא! דִּתְנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶם, אֲבָל לֹא עוֹלוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים וְעוֹלוֹת וְסוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And what does this teach us; that are sacrificed on their day? But they have disputed this once, as we learned Beit Shammai say: One may bring peace-offerings but one may not place hands on them. However, not burnt-offerings and Beit Hillel say: One may bring peace-offerings and burnt-offerings, and one places hands on them.
llm_translation: And what does this teach us? That we bring peace offerings during his days, but they disagreed on it once! For we learned: Beit Shammai says: They bring peace offerings but do not lean on them, but not burnt offerings, and Beit Hillel says: They bring peace offerings and burnt offerings and lean on them.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא: בְּהָא קָא אָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, מִשּׁוּם דְּאֶפְשָׁר לִמְחַר. אֲבָל הָכָא, אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לְהוּ לְבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: necessary, for had taught us this with regard to this that Beit Shammai state because possible on the following day, but there, you say they agree with Beit Hillel
llm_translation: The matter is, for if we would hear in this: in this they say in the school of Shammai, because it is possible for tomorrow. But here, say they should admit to the school of Hillel.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא: בְּהָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר לִמְחַר, אֲבָל בְּהָא — אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had it taught us that with regard to that that Beit Hillel state because not possible on the following day, but here, you say they agree with Beit Shammai. necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear in this: in this it is saying Beit Hillel, because it is not possible to delay, but in this — say they agree with Beit Shammai, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁלֹּא חָג שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַפֶּסַח, וּשְׁמוֹנַת יְמֵי הֶחָג, וְיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל עֲצֶרֶת, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹגֵג. מַאי לָאו: יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁל עֲצֶרֶת! לֹא, יוֹם טְבוֹחַ. אִי הָכִי, נִיפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ דְּחַד יוֹם טְבוֹחַ! אֵימָא: יְמֵי טְבוֹחַ.
human_translation: Come hear One who did not celebrate the seven days of Passover, or the eight days of the festival or the first day of Shavuot may no longer celebrate Does not the Festival day of Shavuot No, day of slaughter, If so, let us resolve from here, that one day of slaughter Say Days of slaughter.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who did not celebrate the seven days of Passover, and the eight days of Sukkot, and the first day of Shavuot, he does not repeat. What is the reason? Is it not the first day of Shavuot! No, it is the day of slaughtering. If so, he is exempt from the day of slaughtering! Say: the days of slaughtering.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה מְנֵה יָמִים וְקַדֵּשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, מְנֵה יָמִים וְקַדֵּשׁ עֲצֶרֶת. מָה חֹדֶשׁ — לִמְנוּיָיו, אַף עֲצֶרֶת — לִמְנוּיֶיהָ. מַאי לָאו: גָּמַר מֵחֹדֶשׁ, מָה חֹדֶשׁ — יוֹם אֶחָד, אַף עֲצֶרֶת — יוֹם אֶחָד!
human_translation: Come hear as Rabba bar Shmuel taught Torah said count days, as it is stated: and sanctify month count days and sanctify the festival of Shavuot as it is stated: “You shall count fifty days” ( ). Just as month is for by which it is counted, so too, Shavuot Does not we learn from month? just as a month, one day, so too Shavuot one day,
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabba bar Shmuel taught: The Torah said, "Count days and sanctify the month, count days and sanctify the festival." Just as for the month - for its counting, so too for the festival - for its counting. What is the reason? Just as for the month, it is one day, so too for the festival - it is one day!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! אַטּוּ עֲצֶרֶת, יוֹמֵי מָנֵינַן שָׁבוּעֵי לָא מָנֵינַן? וְהָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִצְוָה לְמִימְנֵי יוֹמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״תִּסְפְּרוּ חֲמִשִּׁים יוֹם״, וּמִצְוָה לְמִימְנֵי שָׁבוּעֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁבְעָה שָׁבוּעוֹת תִּסְפָּר לָךְ״. וְעוֹד: ״חַג שָׁבוּעוֹת״, כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rava said: And you understand Is that to say Shavuot we count days we do not count weeks? Didn’t Abaye say: a mitzva to count days, as it is written: you shall count fifty days” and a mitzva to count weeks, as it is written: “Seven weeks you shall count for yourself, and further, it is written: “The festival of weeks [ shavuot ]”
llm_translation: Rava said: And is it possible to think so?! If for the Festival of Shavuot, we count weeks, do we not count days as well? And Abaye said: It is a mitzvah to count the days, as it is written: "You shall count fifty days," and it is a mitzvah to count the weeks, as it is written: "You shall count seven weeks for yourself." And furthermore: "The Festival of Weeks," is written.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב תָּנָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּקְרָאתֶם וּבְקֻצְרְכֶם״. אֵיזֶהוּ חַג שֶׁאַתָּה קוֹרֵא וְקוֹצֵר בּוֹ — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה חַג עֲצֶרֶת.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, taught The verse states “And you shall make a proclamation “And when you reap Which is the Festival on which you make a proclamation and reap, You must say it is the festival of Shavuot .
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov taught: It is stated in the verse, "And you shall call it a gathering." Which festival do you call and also gather on it? One should say, this is the festival of Shavuot.

hebrew_text: אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב — קְצִירָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִי שְׁרֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו לְתַשְׁלוּמִין.
human_translation: When If we say to the Festival day permitted to reap on a Festival? Rather, is it not to redress?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When? If you say on a festival - harvesting on a festival, who is permitted? Rather, not for compensation. English translation: When? If you say on a festival - harvesting on a festival, who is permitted? Rather, not for compensation.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיתְּמַר דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, אִצְטְרִיךְ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. דְּאִי מִדְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מָה תַּשְׁלוּמִין שֶׁל חַג הַמַּצּוֹת אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, אַף תַּשְׁלוּמֵי עֲצֶרֶת נָמֵי אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. וְאִי מִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב,
human_translation: And even though that Rabbi Elazar Rabbi Oshaya said, was stated, necessary Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov for if that Rabbi Elazar Rabbi Oshaya said, I would say Just as the redress for the festival of Passover it is prohibited to perform work so too the redress for Shavuot it is also prohibited to perform work. taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov if from Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov,
llm_translation: And even though it was said that Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said, it is necessary that Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said. For if it was Rabbi Elazar who said, Rabbi Oshaya - I would have thought: Just as the payments of the Festival of Matzot prohibit work, so too the payments of Shavuot also prohibit work. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov teaches us. And if it was Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov who said,

hebrew_text: לָא יָדַעְנָא כַּמָּה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא.
human_translation: I would not know how many teaches us, that Rabbi Elazar Rabbi Oshaya said,
llm_translation: We do not know how much. It was heard to us that Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״וְחַג הַקָּצִיר״, אֵיזֶהוּ חַג שֶׁאַתָּה חוֹגֵג וְקוֹצֵר בּוֹ — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה עֲצֶרֶת. אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב — קְצִירָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִי שְׁרֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו לְתַשְׁלוּמִין.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said, “And the Festival of harvest” On which Festival do you celebrate and harvest? You must say it is Shavuot . When If we say on the Festival day is harvesting permitted on a Festival? Rather, is not redress?
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "And the Feast of Harvest," which festival do you celebrate and reap on it - say this is Shavuot. When? If you say on a festival day - reaping on a festival day is permitted? Rather, it is not for payment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״חַג הָאָסִיף״: אֵי זֶהוּ חַג שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אֲסִיפָה — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת, אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מְלָאכָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִי שְׁרֵי? אֶלָּא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. חוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד מִי שְׁרֵי? אֶלָּא — חַג הַבָּא בִּזְמַן אֲסִיפָה, הָכָא נָמֵי — חַג הַבָּא בִּזְמַן קְצִירָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said However, if that is so, “the Festival of gathering” which Festival is there gathering? You must say it is the festival of Sukkot . When If we say on the Festival day is labor permitted on a Festival? Rather, to the intermediate Festival days. the intermediate Festival days, is it permitted? Rather, Festival that occurs during the time of gathering. Here too: a Festival that occurs during the time of
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rather, from now on, "Chag Ha'asif": What is the festival that includes an ingathering? One should say this is the Festival of Sukkot. When? If you say on a festival day - is work permitted on a festival day? Rather, on its weekday of the pilgrimage festival. Is work permitted on its weekday of the pilgrimage festival? Rather - the festival that comes at the time of ingathering. Here too - the festival that comes at the time of harvest.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ דְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: it may be inferred that both hold the performance of labor the intermediate Festival days is prohibited
llm_translation: From the general principle of both, it seems reasonable to them that the weekday of the festival is prohibited in the performance of labor.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֶת חַג הַמַּצּוֹת תִּשְׁמוֹר שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״ — לִימֵּד עַל חוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד שֶׁאָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה רִאשׁוֹן וּשְׁבִיעִי שֶׁאֵין קְדוּשָּׁה לִפְנֵיהֶן וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶן — אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, חוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד שֶׁיֵּשׁ קְדוּשָּׁה לִפְנֵיהֶן וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶן — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּהֵא אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught: “You shall observe the festival of Passover seven days” teaches that the performance of labor is prohibited during the intermediate Festival days, the statement of Rabbi Yoshiyya. Rabbi Yonatan says: is not necessary, an a fortiori If the performance of labor first and seventh which are not preceded and followed by sanctity is prohibited, is it not right that the intermediate Festival days, which are preceded and followed by sanctity, the performance of labor should be prohibited?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the sources for these matters? For the Rabbis taught: "You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread" - this teaches regarding the weekday of the festival that work is prohibited, the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah. Rabbi Yonatan says: It is not necessary, a fortiori: Just as the first and seventh days, which do not have sanctity before them or after them, prohibit work, the weekday of the festival, which has sanctity before it and after it, is not a reason for work to be prohibited.

hebrew_text: שֵׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְרֵאשִׁית יוֹכִיחוּ, שֶׁיֵּשׁ קְדוּשָּׁה לִפְנֵיהֶן וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶן, וּמוּתָּרִין בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה! מָה לְשֵׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן קׇרְבַּן מוּסַף, תֹּאמַר בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ קׇרְבַּן מוּסַף. רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ קׇרְבַּן מוּסַף, וּמוּתָּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה! מָה לְרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁאֵין קָרוּי ״מִקְרָא קֹדֶשׁ״, תֹּאמַר בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד שֶׁקָּרוּי ״מִקְרָא קֹדֶשׁ״, הוֹאִיל וְקָרוּי ״מִקְרָא קֹדֶשׁ״ — דִּין הוּא שֶׁאָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: six days of Creation, shall prove since are preceded and followed by sanctity and yet the performance of labor on them is permitted. What six days of Creation on which there is no additional offering; you say with regard to the intermediate Festival days, on which there is an additional offering, The New Moon shall prove since it has an additional offering, and the performance of labor is permitted on it. What the New Moon is not called “a holy convocation”; you say with regard to the intermediate Festival days, which called “a holy convocation”? Since called “a holy convocation” it is logical that the performance of labor should be prohibited on them.
llm_translation: The six days of Creation prove that there is sanctity before them and after them, and it is permitted to perform labor! What about the six days of Creation that do not have an additional offering (korban musaf)? You would say regarding a weekday of a festival that has an additional offering. Rosh Chodesh proves that it has an additional offering, and it is permitted to perform labor! What about Rosh Chodesh that is not called "a holy convocation"? You would say regarding a weekday of a festival that is called "a holy convocation," since it is called "a holy convocation" — it is a law that it is prohibited to perform labor.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״כׇּל מְלֶאכֶת עֲבוֹדָה לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ״ — לִימֵּד עַל חוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד שֶׁאָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אֵלֶּה מוֹעֲדֵי ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. בַּמָּה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר? אִם בָּרִאשׁוֹן — הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״שַׁבָּתוֹן״, אִם בַּשְּׁבִיעִי — הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״שַׁבָּתוֹן״. הָא אֵין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁאָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: It is taught another “You shall do no kind of laborious work” teaches that the performance of labor is prohibited during the intermediate Festival days; the statement of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Rabbi Akiva says: is not necessary, since it is stated “These are the appointed Festivals of the Lord, With regard to what is the verse speaking? If to first it has already stated “a solemn rest” if to seventh, it has already stated “a solemn rest” Therefore, the verse can be speaking only of the intermediate Festival days, teaching you that the performance of labor is prohibited on them.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "You shall not perform any labor" — this teaches regarding the weekday of the festival, that it is prohibited to engage in labor, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, for he himself says: "These are the appointed times of the Lord, etc." In what context is the verse speaking? If it is referring to the first day — it has already been stated "a Sabbath," if it is referring to the seventh day — it has already been stated "a Sabbath." Rather, the verse is speaking specifically about the weekday of the festival, to teach you that it is prohibited to engage in labor.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים תֹּאכַל מַצּוֹת וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי עֲצֶרֶת לַה׳״, מָה שְׁבִיעִי עָצוּר — אַף שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים עֲצוּרִין. אִי: מָה שְׁבִיעִי עָצוּר בְּכׇל מְלָאכָה — אַף שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים עֲצוּרִין בְּכׇל מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: It is taught another “Six days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a solemn assembly for the Lord If just as the seventh is precluded so are six days precluded, If so, Just as the seventh day is precluded from the performance of all labor, so too the six days are precluded from the performance of all labor,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Six days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day shall be a solemn rest to the Lord." Just as the seventh day is a day of rest, so too the six days are days of rest. If you say: Just as the seventh day is restricted from all labor, so too the six days are restricted from all labor.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי עֲצֶרֶת״, הַשְּׁבִיעִי עָצוּר בְּכׇל מְלָאכָה, וְאֵין שִׁשָּׁה יָמִים עֲצוּרִין בְּכׇל מְלָאכָה. הָא לֹא מְסָרָן הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לַחֲכָמִים, לוֹמַר לָךְ אֵי זֶה יוֹם אָסוּר וְאֵי זֶה יוֹם מוּתָּר, אֵי זוֹ מְלָאכָה אֲסוּרָה וְאֵי זוֹ מְלָאכָה מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: The verse states: “And on the seventh day there shall be a solemn assembly,” the seventh is precluded from the performance of all labor, but six days are not precluded from the performance of all labor the verse has therefore entrusted the to the Sages exclusively, to tell you which day is prohibited and which day is permitted, which labor is prohibited and which labor is permitted.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And on the seventh day is a solemn rest." The seventh day prohibits all work, and there are not six days that prohibit all work. The verse was not given to the Sages except to say to you, which day is forbidden and which day is permitted, which work is prohibited and which work is permitted.

hebrew_text: וּמוּתָּרִין בְּהֶסְפֵּד וְתַעֲנִית, שֶׁלֹּא לְקַיֵּים אֶת דִּבְרֵי הָאוֹמְרִין עֲצֶרֶת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת. וְהָאִיתְּמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה וּמֵת אֲלֶכְּסָא בְּלוֹד, וְנִכְנְסוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל לְסוֹפְדוֹ, וְלֹא הִנִּיחָם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיּוֹם טוֹב שֶׁל עֲצֶרֶת הָיָה.
human_translation: All were permitted to eulogize and fast not to uphold the opinion of who would say: Shavuot after Shabbat. But wasn’t it stated: An incident Alexa died in Lod, and all of Israel gathered to eulogize him, but Rabbi Tarfon would not allow them because it was the Festival day of Shavuot ?
llm_translation: And permitted in mourning and fasting, not to fulfill the words of those who say to observe a gathering after the Sabbath. And it was told: The incident of Aliksa in Lod, and all of Israel entered to eulogize him, and Rabbi Tarfon did not stop them, because it was the festival day of the gathering.

hebrew_text: יוֹם טוֹב סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אִי בְּיוֹם טוֹב, מִי קָאָתוּ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיּוֹם טְבוֹחַ הָיָה! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, כָּאן בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Can it enter your mind a Festival day? If it had been a Festival day, would they have come? Rather, say because it was the Festival day of slaughter. not difficult, here, to a Festival that occurs after Shabbat, There, to a Festival that occurs on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Good day, has your mind ascended? If on a festival day, who has come? Rather say: because it was a day of slaughter! Not difficult: here on a festival day that happens to be after the Sabbath, here on a festival day that happens to be on the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נוֹטְלִין לַיָּדַיִם לַחוּלִּין וְלַמַּעֲשֵׂר וְלַתְּרוּמָה, וְלַקּוֹדֶשׁ — מַטְבִּילִין. וְלַחַטָּאת — אִם נִטְמְאוּ יָדָיו, נִטְמָא גּוּפוֹ.
human_translation: One must wash his hands non-sacred and for tithes and for teruma ; but for sacrificial one must immerse purification And with purification if one’s hands were rendered impure his body is rendered impure,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may wash hands for common meals, tithes, and terumah, and for holy items - one must immerse. For sin offerings - if his hands became impure, his body becomes impure.

hebrew_text: טָבַל לַחוּלִּין, הוּחְזַק לַחוּלִּין — אָסוּר לַמַּעֲשֵׂר. טָבַל לַמַּעֲשֵׂר, הוּחְזַק לַמַּעֲשֵׂר — אָסוּר לַתְּרוּמָה. טָבַל לַתְּרוּמָה, הוּחְזַק לַתְּרוּמָה — אָסוּר לַקּוֹדֶשׁ. טָבַל לַקּוֹדֶשׁ, הוּחְזַק לַקּוֹדֶשׁ — אָסוּר לַחַטָּאת. טָבַל לֶחָמוּר — מוּתָּר לַקַּל. טָבַל וְלֹא הוּחְזַק — כְּאִילּוּ לֹא טָבַל.
human_translation: one immersed for non-sacred assumes a presumptive status for non-sacred it is prohibited for him tithes, immersed to tithes, he assumes a presumptive status for tithes, prohibited from teruma . immersed for teruma , he assumes a presumptive status for teruma , prohibited from sacrificial immersed for sacrificial he assumes a presumptive status for sacrificial prohibited from purification immersed to a stringent is permitted to a lenient immersed without assume a presumptive status as though he has not immersed
llm_translation: He immersed for common use, he is established for common use - forbidden for tithe. He immersed for tithe, he is established for tithe - forbidden for heave offering. He immersed for heave offering, he is established for heave offering - forbidden for holy. He immersed for holy, he is established for holy - forbidden for sin offering. He immersed for stringent - permitted for lenient. He immersed but was not established - as if he did not immerse.

hebrew_text: בִּגְדֵי עַם הָאָרֶץ, מִדְרָס לִפְרוּשִׁין. בִּגְדֵי פְרוּשִׁין, מִדְרָס לְאוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה. בִּגְדֵי אוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה, מִדְרָס לַקּוֹדֶשׁ. בִּגְדֵי קוֹדֶשׁ, מִדְרָס לַחַטָּאת.
human_translation: The garments of an am ha’aretz , are treading for individuals who are scrupulous with regard to impurity [ perushin ]. The garments of perushin treading for who eat teruma ; the garments of who eat teruma treading for sacrificial the garments of sacrificial treading for purification
llm_translation: Garments of the common people, a spread for the Pharisees. Garments of the Pharisees, a spread for those who eat Terumah. Garments of those who eat Terumah, a spread for the holy. Garments of the holy, a spread for the sin-offering.

hebrew_text: יוֹסֵף בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר הָיָה חָסִיד שֶׁבַּכְּהוּנָּה, וְהָיְתָה מִטְפַּחְתּוֹ מִדְרָס לַקּוֹדֶשׁ. יוֹחָנָן בֶּן גּוּדְגְּדָא הָיָה אוֹכֵל עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ כׇּל יָמָיו, וְהָיְתָה מִטְפַּחְתּוֹ מִדְרָס לַחַטָּאת.
human_translation: Yosef ben Yo’ezer was the most pious of the priesthood and his cloth was treading for sacrificial Yoḥanan ben Gudgeda would eat ritual purity for sacrificial all his days, and his cloth was treading for purification
llm_translation: Joseph son of Yoezer was a pious one in the priesthood, and his plate was for the incense. Yochanan son of Gudgada would eat his portion of the holy offerings all his days, and his plate was for the sin offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ חוּלִּין וּמַעֲשֵׂר מִי בָּעוּ נְטִילַת יָדַיִם?
human_translation: Do non-sacred and tithes require washing the hands?
llm_translation: Gemara: "Gemar chulin u'ma'aser mi bau netilat yadayim?"

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: הַתְּרוּמָה וְהַבִּיכּוּרִים חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִיתָה וָחוֹמֶשׁ, וַאֲסוּרִ[ין] לְזָרִים, וְהֵן נִכְסֵי כֹהֵן. וְעוֹלִין בְּאֶחָד וּמֵאָה, וּטְעוּנִין נְטִילַת יָדַיִם וְהֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בִּתְרוּמָה וּבִיכּוּרִים, מָה שֶׁאֵין כֵּן בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בַּחוּלִּין.
human_translation: raises a contradiction teruma and first fruits, one is liable to death for them, a fifth; and they are prohibited to non-priests; and they are the property of the priest. And they are nullified in one hundred and one and they require washing of the hands and the setting of the sun These to teruma and first fruits, but not to tithes. And all the more so to non-sacred
llm_translation: And ask: The terumah and the firstfruits are liable for them death and a fifth, and forbidden to non-priests, and they are the property of the priest. And they ascend by one and a hundred, and require washing of the hands and the mixing of the sun. These are in terumah and firstfruits, which is not the case with tithes, and certainly not with common things.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא מַעֲשֵׂר אַמַּעֲשֵׂר, קַשְׁיָא חוּלִּין אַחוּלִּין!
human_translation: difficult: tithes tithes difficult non-sacred non-sacred
llm_translation: A difficult tithe, tithe; a difficult mundane, mundane!

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מַעֲשֵׂר אַמַּעֲשֵׂר לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְהָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Granted, tithes, tithes, not difficult, This with Rabbi Meir, while that the Rabbis.
llm_translation: In peace, tithing is not difficult: this is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, and this is the opinion of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הַטָּעוּן בִּיאַת מַיִם מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים — מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ, וּפוֹסֵל אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה, וּמוּתָּר לַחוּלִּין וּלְמַעֲשֵׂר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִים בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. אֶלָּא חוּלִּין אַחוּלִּין קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: As we learned Anything that requires immersion in water by rabbinic law renders sacrificial impure. and invalidates teruma , And is permitted for non-sacred and for tithes, the statement of Rabbi Meir. But the Rabbis prohibit in tithes, However, non-sacred non-sacred difficult.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Anyone who is in need of water according to the words of the Sages - he renders the holy impure, disqualifies the terumah, and it is permitted for common use and for tithing, the words of Rabbi Meir. But the Sages prohibit it for tithing. Rather, common use is indeed difficult!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּאֲכִילָה, כָּאן בִּנְגִיעָה.
human_translation: not difficult. Here to eating, There with touching
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in eating, here in touching.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אֶלָּא בַּאֲכִילָה דְמַעֲשֵׂר, אֲבָל בִּנְגִיעָה דְמַעֲשֵׂר וּבַאֲכִילָה דְחוּלִּין לָא פְּלִיגִי? אֶלָּא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בַּאֲכִילָה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּאֲכִילָה דְנַהֲמָא, כָּאן בַּאֲכִילָה דְפֵירֵי. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כׇּל הַנּוֹטֵל יָדָיו לְפֵירוֹת — הֲרֵי זֶה מִגַּסֵּי הָרוּחַ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi strongly objects to this: The Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Meir only with regard to eating tithes, but with regard to touching tithes and eating non-sacred they do not disagree Rather, this and that to eating, and not difficult: Here with eating bread, there, to eating non-sacred fruit, for Rav Naḥman said: Anyone who washes his hands for fruit is of the haughty of spirit
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rav Shimi bar Ashei strongly objects to her: Until here, the Rabbis do not argue with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Meir except in the consumption of Maaser. But in the touching of Maaser and in the consumption of regular food, do the Rabbis not argue? Rather, both in the consumption of Maaser, and it is not difficult: here in the consumption of Nahama, here in the consumption of fruits. For Rav Nachman said: Anyone who takes his hands to his fruits - this is considered haughty.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַנּוֹטֵל יָדָיו, נִתְכַּוֵּון — יָדָיו טְהוֹרוֹת, לֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון — יָדָיו טְמֵאוֹת. וְכֵן הַמַּטְבִּיל יָדָיו, נִתְכַּוֵּון — יָדָיו טְהוֹרוֹת, לֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון — יָדָיו טְמֵאוֹת. וְהָתַנְיָא: בֵּין נִתְכַּוֵּון בֵּין לֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון — יָדָיו טְהוֹרוֹת! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לְחוּלִּין,
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who washes his hands, he intended his hands are pure; if he did not intend his hands are impure. Similarly, one who immerses his hands he intended his hands are pure; if he did not intend, his hands are impure. But isn’t it taught his hands are pure whether he did or did not intend Rav Naḥman said: not difficult, there to non-sacred
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: One who washes his hands, with intent - his hands are pure; without intent - his hands are impure. Similarly, one who immerses his hands, with intent - his hands are pure; without intent - his hands are impure. And it was taught: Whether with intent or without intent - his hands are pure! Rav Nachman said, it is not difficult: here we are dealing with ordinary matters.

hebrew_text: כָּאן לְמַעֲשֵׂר. וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּחוּלִּין לָא בָּעוּ כַּוּוֹנָה — דִּתְנַן: גַּל שֶׁנִּתְלַשׁ וּבוֹ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, וְנָפַל עַל הָאָדָם וְעַל הַכֵּלִים — טְהוֹרִין. קָתָנֵי אָדָם דּוּמְיָא דְּכֵלִים, מָה כֵּלִים דְּלָא מְכַוְּונִי — אַף אָדָם דְּלָא מְכַוֵּין.
human_translation: here, to tithes, And from where do you say that non-sacred does not require intention As we learned a wave containing forty se’a became detached and fell on a person or on vessels, they are ritually pure. teaches that a person is similar to vessels: Just as vessels do not intend so too, a person in he does not intend
llm_translation: Here for tithing. And how do we know that mundane matters do not require intent? As we learned: A barrel that was unplugged and contained forty se'ah, and it fell on a person and on vessels - they are pure. The Mishnah teaches: A person is similar to vessels. Just as vessels that do not require intent - so too a person who does not intend.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא בְּיוֹשֵׁב וּמְצַפֶּה אֵימָתַי יִתָּלֵשׁ הַגַּל עָסְקִינַן, וְכֵלִים דּוּמְיָא דְּאָדָם, מָה אָדָם דְּבַר כַּוּוֹנָה — אַף כֵּלִים דִּמְכַוֵּין לְהוּ.
human_translation: And from where Perhaps we are dealing with is sitting and awaiting when a wave will detach Vessels are similar a person: Just as a person capable of intention so too vessels where one intends on their behalf
llm_translation: And from where? Perhaps when one is sitting and waiting, when will the wave detach, we are dealing with, and vessels similar to a person, just as a person with intent — so too vessels that are intended for them.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא בְּיוֹשֵׁב וּמְצַפֶּה, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?
human_translation: And if you would say to is sitting and awaiting, what of stating
llm_translation: And if you will say, "In the case of one who sits and waits, what is there to say?"

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: לִיגְזוֹר דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְמִיטְבַּל בְּחַרְדָּלִית שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים, אִי נָמֵי נִגְזוֹר רָאשִׁין אַטּוּ כִּיפִּין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: it might enter your mind to say that it should be decreed lest one come to immerse in a flow of rainwater Alternatively, it should be decreed the edges due to arcs teaches us that we do not decree.
llm_translation: I will translate the Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Talmudic text: "Salka d'atach ameina: liggzor dilmah atei l'mitbal b'chardalit shel g'shamim, ei namei nigzor rashein atu kippin, ka mashma lan d'la gazrinan." English translation: "It has been raised in your mind: perhaps one will come to immerse in a mustard bath of rainwater, or perhaps one will come to shave the head or the temples, it is implied to us that we do not decree."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּלָא מַטְבִּילִין בְּכִיפִּין, דְּתַנְיָא: מַטְבִּילִין בְּרָאשִׁין, וְאֵין מַטְבִּילִין בְּכִיפִּין, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַטְבִּילִין בָּאֲוִיר.
human_translation: And from where do you say that one may not immerse in the arcs? As it is taught One may immerse in the edges but one may not immerse in arcs, because one may not immerse in air.
llm_translation: And who says that we do not immerse with hats, as it was taught: we immerse with heads, but we do not immerse with hats, because we do not immerse in the air.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: פֵּירוֹת שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לְתוֹךְ אַמַּת הַמַּיִם, וּפָשַׁט מִי שֶׁיָּדָיו טְמֵאוֹת וּנְטָלָן — יָדָיו טְהוֹרוֹת, וּפֵירוֹת אֵינָן בְּ״כִי יוּתַּן״.
human_translation: Rather, from that which we learned If fruit fell into a water channel, and one whose hands were ritually impure extended his hands and lifted them up his hands are ritually pure, and fruits are not in “if be put
llm_translation: Rather, from that which we learned: fruits that fell into a cubit of water, and one whose hands are impure reached and took them - his hands are pure, and the fruits are not considered as "given."

hebrew_text: וְאִם בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיּוּדְחוּ יָדָיו — יָדָיו טְהוֹרוֹת, וְהַפֵּירוֹת הֲרֵי הֵן בְּ״כִי יוּתַּן״.
human_translation: And if in order to wash his hands, his hands are ritually pure, and the fruit is in “if be put
llm_translation: If because his hands were pushed away - his hands are pure, and the fruits, behold they are considered as "Kedushat Yadayim."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרַב נַחְמָן: הַטּוֹבֵל לְחוּלִּין וְהוּחְזַק לְחוּלִּין — אָסוּר לְמַעֲשֵׂר. הוּחְזַק — אִין, לֹא הוּחְזַק — לָא!
human_translation: Rabba raised an objection to Rav Naḥman One who immersed for non-sacred and assumes a presumptive status for non-sacred is prohibited tithes. The Gemara infers: If one assuming a presumptive status yes, if he did not assuming that presumptive status, no, he does not
llm_translation: Rabah raised an objection to Rav Nachman: One who immerses for ordinary items and is assumed to be immersing for ordinary items — it is prohibited for tithing. If he is assumed, no; if he is not assumed, yes!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּחְזַק לְחוּלִּין — אָסוּר לְמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: This is what is saying: Even though he assumes a presumptive status for non-sacred he is prohibited from tithes.
llm_translation: So it is stated: Even though it is established for secular use - it is forbidden for tithing.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: טָבַל וְלֹא הוּחְזַק — כְּאִילּוּ לֹא טָבַל, מַאי לָאו — כְּאִילּוּ לֹא טָבַל כְּלָל?
human_translation: He, raised an objection to him immersed without assume a presumptive status of ritual purity, as if he has not immersed. What, is it not as if he had not immersed at all?
llm_translation: He raised an objection: If one immersed but was not firmly established - it is as though he did not immerse at all. What is the reason? - It is as though he did not immerse at all in any way.

hebrew_text: לֹא, כְּאִילּוּ לֹא טָבַל לְמַעֲשֵׂר, אֲבָל טָבַל לְחוּלִּין. הוּא סָבַר דַּחוֹיֵי קָא מְדַחֵי לֵיהּ. נְפַק דָּק וְאַשְׁכַּח דְּתַנְיָא: טָבַל וְלֹא הוּחְזַק — אָסוּר לַמַּעֲשֵׂר וּמוּתָּר לַחוּלִּין.
human_translation: No, as if he has not immersed for tithes, but he is immersed for non-sacred He, thought was refuting his went examined and found that was taught immersed and assume a presumptive status is prohibited from tithes, but is permitted to non-sacred
llm_translation: Not as if he did not immerse for tithes, but he immersed for common use. He thought that he was rejecting it. A fine point emerged, and it was found in a teaching: If one immersed but was not established - it is forbidden for tithes and permitted for common use.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: טָבַל וְעָלָה — מַחְזִיק עַצְמוֹ לְכֹל מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: immersed and ascended he may assume a presumptive status for whatever he wishes.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "He dipped and ascended - he sustains himself for everything he desires."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: עוֹדֵהוּ רַגְלוֹ אַחַת בַּמַּיִם, הוּחְזַק לְדָבָר קַל — מַחְזִיק עַצְמוֹ לְדָבָר חָמוּר, עָלָה — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ מַחְזִיק.
human_translation: raises an objection and one of his feet is still in the water, if he assume presumptive status for a minor matter, he may assume presumptive status for a major matter. ascended, he may no longer assume a presumptive status
llm_translation: Challenger: He still has one foot in the water, if he can hold on to a light matter - he can hold on to a serious matter, if he fails - he cannot hold on again.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו — אֵינוֹ מַחְזִיק כְּלָל!
human_translation: What, is it not he may not assume a presumptive status at all,
llm_translation: What is "lav" - it does not hold at all!

hebrew_text: לֹא: עוֹדֵהוּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּחְזַק — מַחְזִיק, עָלָה, אִם לֹא הוּחְזַק — מַחְזִיק, וְאִם הוּחְזַק — אֵינוֹ מַחְזִיק.
human_translation: No, he is still he assume a presumptive status he may assume a presumptive status ascended, if he did not assume a presumptive status he may assume a presumptive status but if he did assume a presumptive status he may not assume a presumptive status
llm_translation: Not: Odehu, af al pi shehuchzaq - machzik, alah, im lo huchzaq - machzik, ve'im huchzaq - einu machzik.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא עוֹדֵהוּ רַגְלוֹ אַחַת בַּמַּיִם? אָמַר רַבִּי פְּדָת: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דִּתְנַן: מִקְוֶה שֶׁנִּמְדַּד וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה מְכֻוּוֹנוֹת, וְיָרְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְטָבְלוּ זֶה אַחַר זֶה — הָרִאשׁוֹן טָהוֹר, וְהַשֵּׁנִי טָמֵא. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִם הָיוּ רַגְלָיו שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן נוֹגְעוֹת בַּמַּיִם — אַף הַשֵּׁנִי טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Who taught whose foot is still in the water Rabbi Pedat said: It is Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned a ritual bath that was measured and contain exactly forty se’a and two descended and immersed one after the other, the first one is ritually pure, but the second is ritually impure. Rabbi Yehuda said: If the feet of the first one were touching the water, the second is also ritually pure.
llm_translation: Who taught that he still has one foot in the water? Rabbi Pedat said: It is Rabbi Yehuda. As we learned: A mikveh that was measured and contains forty se'ah of drawn water, and two people descended and immersed, one after the other - the first one is pure, and the second one is impure. Rabbi Yehuda said: If the feet of the first one touched the water - the second one is also pure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּמַעֲלוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן, אֲבָל מִטּוּמְאָה לְטׇהֳרָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אַף הַשֵּׁנִי טָמֵא. וְהַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי פְּדָת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: dispute to higher standards of ritual purity by the Sages, However, from ritual impurity to purity, everyone agrees the second is impure. And this is of Rabbi Pedat
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Dispute regarding the degrees of the Sages, but from impurity to purity — the words of all, even the second is impure. And this is the opinion of Rabbi Pedat.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מַחְלוֹקֶת מִטּוּמְאָה לְטׇהֳרָה, אֲבָל בְּמַעֲלוֹת דְּרַבָּנַן — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אַף הַשֵּׁנִי טָהוֹר. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי פְּדָת.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: dispute from ritual impurity to purity, but with regard to higher standards of ritual purity by the Sages, everyone agrees even the second is ritually pure And disagrees of Rabbi Pedat,
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Dispute regarding impurity to purity, but in matters of Rabbinic prohibitions - everyone agrees the second is pure. And this is in disagreement with Rabbi Pedat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא, בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מַהוּ לְהַטְבִּיל מְחָטִין וְצִינּוֹרִיּוֹת בְּרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן?
human_translation: Ulla said: I asked Rabbi Yoḥanan: According to Rabbi Yehuda, what is immersing needles and knitting needles, on the head of the first
llm_translation: Ulla said, "They asked a question of Rabbi Yochanan: According to Rabbi Yehuda, what is the ruling regarding immersing needles and their tubes in the head of the first vessel?"

hebrew_text: גּוּד אַחֵית אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, גּוּד אַסֵּיק לֵית לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: גּוּד אַסֵּיק נָמֵי אִית לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda accept lowering the partition, he does not accept raising the partition, Or, perhaps he also accepts raising the partition,
llm_translation: "Gud Achit had to Rabbi Yehuda, Gud Asik did not have to him, or perhaps: Gud Asik also had to him?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: שָׁלֹשׁ גְּמָמִיּוֹת בַּנַּחַל, הָעֶלְיוֹנָה, הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה וְהָאֶמְצָעִית; הָעֶלְיוֹנָה וְהַתַּחְתּוֹנָה שֶׁל עֶשְׂרִים עֶשְׂרִים סְאָה, וְהָאֶמְצָעִית שֶׁל אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, וְחַרְדָּלִית שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים עוֹבֶרֶת בֵּינֵיהֶן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מֵאִיר הָיָה אוֹמֵר: מַטְבִּיל בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: said to him: You learned three depressions in a stream that an upper one, a lower one, and a middle one; the upper and lower ones twenty se’a each, while the middle one forty se’a , and a flow of rain runs between them, Rabbi Yehuda says: Meir, would say: immerse in the upper one.
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should teach it: three pools in the valley, the upper one, the lower one, and the middle one; the upper and lower ones are each twenty se'ah, and the middle one is forty se'ah, and a stream of rainwater passes between them. Rabbi Yehuda says: Meir used to say: One should immerse in the upper one."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says:
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says:

hebrew_text: מֵאִיר הָיָה אוֹמֵר: מַטְבִּיל בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה, וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: בַּתַּחְתּוֹנָה וְלֹא בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי תַּנְיָא — תַּנְיָא.
human_translation: Meir would say: immerse in the upper one, and I say: In the lower one but not in the upper one. said to him: If this is taught, it is taught,
llm_translation: Meir would say: One should immerse in the upper chamber, and I say: in the lower chamber and not in the upper chamber! He said to him: If it is taught - let it be taught.

hebrew_text: הַטּוֹבֵל לַחוּלִּין וְהוּחְזַק לַחוּלִּין כּוּ׳. מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין — רַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּשָׁנֵי לְהוּ בֵּין חוּלִּין לְמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: One who immersed for non-sacred assuming a presumptive status for non-sacred it is prohibited for him tithes. Whose the mishna? It is the Rabbis, who differentiate between non-sacred and tithes,
llm_translation: The one who immerses for common items and is established for common items, it is taught in a Baraita - it is the Rabbis, who taught to distinguish between common items and tithes.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בִּגְדֵי עַם הָאָרֶץ, מִדְרָס לִפְרוּשִׁין. בִּגְדֵי פְרוּשִׁין, מִדְרָס לְאוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה.
human_translation: say the latter clause the garments of an am ha’aretz , are treading for perushin , The garments of perushin , treading for teruma .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: Bigdei am ha'aretz, midras lifrushin. Bigdei perushin, midras le'ochlei terumah." English translation: "Say the latter clause: The garments of the common people serve as bedding for the priests. The garments of the priests serve as bedding for those who eat terumah."

hebrew_text: אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: חוּלִּין וּמַעֲשֵׂר כַּהֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר?! אִין, רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: we have arrived at Rabbi Meir, who said: Non-sacred and tithes are similar to one another, the earlier clause the Rabbis and the latter clause Rabbi Meir? Yes; the earlier clause the Rabbis and the latter clause Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rabbi Meir came, saying: Challah and Ma'aser are like each other. The beginning is the Rabbis' opinion, and the end is Rabbi Meir's opinion?! No, the beginning is the Rabbis' opinion, and the end is Rabbi Meir's opinion."

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא מַתְנֵי לַהּ בְּסֵיפָא חָמֵשׁ מַעֲלוֹת, וּמוֹקֵי לַהּ כּוּלָּהּ כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Adda would teach five levels in the latter clause and he establishes entire in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Adda teaches her in the latter part: five steps, and he establishes for her the entire matter like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ — כְּקוֹדֶשׁ דָּמוּ. מִמַּאי —
human_translation: Rav Mari said: learn from non-sacred that was prepared according to ritual purity for sacrificial like sacrificial From where
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: Hear from it, mundane items that were done in purity of the holy — like the holiness of their blood. From where —

hebrew_text: מִדְּלָא קָתָנֵי בְּהוּ מַעֲלָה.
human_translation: from that it is not taught in their regard a higher standard
llm_translation: From where does it teach in it "ma'alah."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הַאי דְּלָא קָתָנֵי בְּהוּ מַעֲלָה, דְּאִי דָּמוּ לִתְרוּמָה — הָא תָּנֵי תְּרוּמָה, וְאִי דָּמוּ לְחוּלִּין — הָא תָּנֵי לְחוּלִּין. דִּתְנַן: חוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּחוּלִּין, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הֵן כִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: But perhaps this that a higher standard is not taught with regard to those as, if they are similar to teruma , teruma has taught; and if they are similar to non-sacred non-sacred produce has taught. As we learned Non-sacred prepared according to the purity for sacrificial are like non-sacred Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: They are like teruma ,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And perhaps this, that it does not teach with them Ma'alah, for if they are similar to Terumah — it teaches Terumah, and if they are similar to common property — it teaches common property. As we learned: common property that was made in the manner of holy property — they are like common property, Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok says: they are like Terumah."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִסֵּיפָא: יוֹסֵי בֶּן יוֹעֶזֶר הָיָה חָסִיד שֶׁבַּכְּהוּנָּה, וְהָיְתָה מִטְפַּחְתּוֹ מִדְרָס לַקּוֹדֶשׁ. יוֹחָנָן בֶּן גּוּדְגְּדָא הָיָה אוֹכֵל עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ כׇּל יָמָיו, וְהָיְתָה מִטְפַּחְתּוֹ מִדְרָס לַחַטָּאת.
human_translation: Rather, the last clause Yosei ben Yo’ezer was the most pious of the priesthood, and his cloth was treading for sacrificial Yoḥanan ben Gudgeda would eat according to the purity for sacrificial all his days, and his cloth was treading for purification
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from the latter part: Yosei ben Yoezer was a pious one of the priesthood, and his handbreadth was from the floor to the Holy. Yochanan ben Gudgeda would eat his whole life in purity of the Holy, and his handbreadth was from the floor to the sin offering.

hebrew_text: לַחַטָּאת אִין, לַקּוֹדֶשׁ לָא. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: חוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת קוֹדֶשׁ כְּקוֹדֶשׁ דָּמוּ.
human_translation: For purifying yes, for sacrificial no, Apparently, he maintains non-sacred prepared according to purity for sacrificial like sacrificial
llm_translation: For the sin offering, no; for the holy, yes. This implies that he holds: Secular items that were made with the purity of the holy are considered as holy as their blood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: נָפְלָה מַעְפׇּרְתּוֹ הֵימֶנּוּ, אָמַר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״תְּנָהּ לִי״ וּנְתָנָהּ לוֹ — טְמֵאָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן עַמְרָם: נִתְחַלְּפוּ לוֹ כֵּלִים שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בְּכֵלִים שֶׁל חוֹל וּלְבָשָׁן — נִטְמְאוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan ben Elazar said: the shawl of fell off of him, he said to another Give it to me, and he gave it to him, impure. Rabbi Yonatan ben Amram says: one’s Shabbat clothes were switched for his weekday clothes and he wore them, they are impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan ben Elazar said: If his dust fell from him, he said to his friend, "Give it to me," and he gave it to him - it is impure. Rabbi Yonatan ben Amram said: If Shabbat vessels were exchanged with weekday vessels and worn - they become impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים חֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁנִּתְחַלְּפוּ לָהֶן כְּלֵיהֶן בְּבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְטִימְּאָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok said: an incident involving two women who were wives of ḥaverim , whose clothes were switched in the bathhouse; and the incident came before Rabbi Akiva and he declared impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok said: A story about two women friends who exchanged their utensils in the bathhouse, and the matter came before Rabbi Akiva and Timaan.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הוֹשִׁיט יָדוֹ לַסַּל לִיטּוֹל פַּת חִטִּין וְעָלְתָה בְּיָדוֹ פַּת שְׂעוֹרִים, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּנִטְמֵאת?
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya strongly objects to this: However, if that is so, inserted his hand into a basket to take a loaf of wheat and a loaf of barley bread came up in his hand in that case, too, is rendered impure?
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rabbi Oshaya: Rather from now, he extends his hand to the basket to take a loaf of wheat bread, and it ascends in his hand as a loaf of barley bread, is it indeed that it becomes impure?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי — וְהָתַנְיָא: הַמְשַׁמֵּר אֶת הֶחָבִית בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁל יַיִן וְנִמְצֵאת שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן — טְהוֹרָה מִלְּטַמֵּא! וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וַאֲסוּרָה מִלֶּאֱכוֹל. אַמַּאי?
human_translation: And if you would say, indeed, but isn’t it taught One who is minding a barrel on the assumption of wine and is found of oil, it is ritually pure transmit impurity? But according to your reasoning, say the latter clause And it is prohibited to be eaten, Why
llm_translation: And if you will say so, it is stated in a Baraita: One who guards a barrel presuming it to contain wine, and it is found to contain oil - it remains pure! And according to your reasoning, let us say the latter part: And it is forbidden to eat. Why is this so?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, בְּאוֹמֵר: שְׁמַרְתִּיהָ מִדָּבָר הַמְטַמְּאָהּ וְלֹא מִדָּבָר הַפּוֹסְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: to one who says: I guarded it from things that render it impure but not from things that invalidate it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said, in the name of the one who says: "I have kept it from the impure thing, and not from the disqualifying thing."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא נְטִירוּתָא לְפַלְגָא? אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: הוֹשִׁיט יָדוֹ בְּסַל, וְהַסַּל עַל כְּתֵיפוֹ, וְהַמַּגְרֵיפָה בְּתוֹךְ הַסַּל, וְהָיָה בְּלִבּוֹ עַל הַסַּל וְלֹא הָיָה בְּלִבּוֹ עַל הַמַּגְרֵיפָה — הַסַּל טָהוֹר וְהַמַּגְרֵיפָה טְמֵאָה.
human_translation: And is there guarding by half Yes, as it is taught If one inserted his hand into a basket and the basket on his shoulder, and a shovel in the basket, and his mind was on the basket but his mind was not on the shovel, the basket is pure and the shovel is impure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is there a leftover for half? No, and it was taught: He extended his hand into a basket, and the basket was on his shoulder, and the sickle was inside the basket, and his heart was on the basket and not on the sickle - the basket is pure and the sickle is impure.

hebrew_text: הַסַּל טָהוֹר? תְּטַמֵּא הַמַּגְרֵיפָה לַסַּל! אֵין כְּלִי מְטַמֵּא כְּלִי. וְלִיטָּמֵא מַה שֶּׁבַּסַּל! אָמַר רָבִינָא, בְּאוֹמֵר: שְׁמַרְתִּיו מִדָּבָר שֶׁמְּטַמְּאוֹ וְלֹא מִדָּבָר הַפּוֹסְלוֹ.
human_translation: the basket pure? Let the shovel render the basket ritually impure, a vessel cannot render vessel impure. And let it render impure that is inside the basket, Ravina said: to one who says: I guarded from things that render it ritually impure, but not from things that invalidate it,
llm_translation: The basket is pure? The basket makes the scraper impure! A vessel does not make another vessel impure. And what makes the contents of the basket impure! Ravina said, by saying: I guarded it from something that can make it impure, but not from something that can disqualify it.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא?
human_translation: in any case difficult.
llm_translation: From all places, a question?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד מוֹתֵיב רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שֶׁבָּאת לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, בֶּגֶד זֶה אֲרַגְתִּיו בְּטׇהֳרָה, וְלֹא הָיָה בְּלִבִּי לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ בְּטׇהֳרָה. וּמִתּוֹךְ בְּדִיקוֹת שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בּוֹדְקָהּ, אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, נִדָּה מָשְׁכָה עִמִּי בַּחֶבֶל. אֲמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כַּמָּה גְּדוֹלִים דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: בְּלִבּוֹ לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ — טָהוֹר, אֵין בְּלִבּוֹ לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ — טָמֵא.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Avuh raised a further objection: an incident involving a certain woman who came before Rabbi Yishmael and said to him: Rabbi, I wove this garment in a ritually pure state, but my mind was not on it to guard its purity. And during the interrogations that Rabbi Yishmael conducted with her, she say to him: Rabbi, a menstruating woman pulled the rope with me Rabbi Yishmael said: How great are the words of the Sages when they said: one’s mind on guarding it, it is pure; if one’s mind is not on guarding it, it is impure.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabba bar Avuh placed a challenge: There was an incident with a certain woman who came before Rabbi Yishmael, and she said to him: "Rabbi, this garment I wove with purity, but it was not in my heart to guard it with purity." And as Rabbi Yishmael was examining it closely, she said to him: "Rabbi, impurity clung to me with a thread." Rabbi Yishmael said: "How great are the words of the sages, for they used to say: If it is in his heart to guard it - it is pure; if it is not in his heart to guard it - it is impure."

hebrew_text: שׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שֶׁבָּאת לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, מַפָּה זוֹ אֲרַגְתִּיהָ בְּטָהֳרָה, וְלֹא הָיָה בְּלִבִּי לְשׁוֹמְרָהּ. וּמִתּוֹךְ בְּדִיקוֹת שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בּוֹדְקָהּ, אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, נִימָא נִפְסְקָה לִי וּקְשַׁרְתִּיהָ בַּפֶּה.
human_translation: another incident involving a certain woman who came before Rabbi Yishmael said to him: Rabbi, I wove this cloth in purity, but my mind was not on it to guard it And during the interrogations that Rabbi Yishmael conducted with her, she said to him: Rabbi, a thread mine snapped and I tied it with my mouth.
llm_translation: The incident occurred with a certain woman who came before Rabbi Yishmael. She said to him: "Rabbi, I wove this cloth with purity, but I did not have in mind to keep it." And as Rabbi Yishmael was examining it, she said to him: "Rabbi, let it be decided for me, and I will bind it in my mouth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כַּמָּה גְּדוֹלִים דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: בְּלִבּוֹ לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ — טָהוֹר, אֵין בְּלִבּוֹ לְשׁוֹמְרוֹ — טָמֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said: How great are the words of the Sages when they said: one’s mind is on guarding it, it is pure; if one’s mind is not on guarding it, it is impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said: How great are the words of the sages, who used to say: If it is in his heart to keep it - he is pure, if it is not in his heart to keep it - he is impure.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק, כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת: חֲבֶרְתִּי אֵשֶׁת עַם הָאָרֶץ, וּמַסְּחָה דַּעְתַּהּ מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok each of them says My colleague is the wife of an am ha’aretz , And she diverts her mind from
llm_translation: In truth, to Rabbi Elazar son of Zadok, each and every one says: "My companion is a woman of the land, and her understanding is from her."

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן עַמְרָם נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּכֵלִים דְּשַׁבָּת עָבֵיד לְהוּ שִׁימּוּר טְפֵי — מַסַּח דַּעְתֵּיהּ מִינַּיְיהוּ. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, נַעֲבֵיד לְהוּ שִׁימּוּר בִּידֵיהּ דְּחַבְרֵיהּ?
human_translation: according to Rabbi Yonatan ben Amram also since he is more protective of Shabbat clothes, he will divert his mind from But according to Rabbi Yonatan ben Elazar, Let him guard in the other person’s hands;
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yonatan ben Amram Nami, since all vessels of Shabbat he would perform for them guarding of drops — his mind would be distracted from them. Rather, to Rabbi Yonatan ben Elazar, should we perform for him guarding in the hands of his colleagues?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲזָקָה, אֵין אָדָם מְשַׁמֵּר מַה שֶּׁבְּיַד חֲבֵרוֹ. וְלֹא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a presumption a person does not guard that which is in another’s hand. And not
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Strong, a person does not guard what is in the hand of his friend. And not?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ חֲמָרָיו וּפוֹעֲלָיו טְעוּנִין טְהָרוֹת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִפְלִיג מֵהֶן יוֹתֵר מִמִּיל — טַהֲרוֹתָיו טְהוֹרוֹת. וְאִם אָמַר לָהֶם: ״לְכוּ וַאֲנִי אָבוֹא אַחֲרֵיכֶם״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּתְעַלְּמוּ עֵינָיו מֵהֶן — טַהֲרוֹתָיו טְמֵאוֹת.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one whose donkey drivers and workers, were bearing pure he distanced himself from them more than a mil , his pure are pure. But if he said to them: Go, and I will follow behind you, once they are no longer within his eyesight, his pure are impure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: If his donkeys and workers are ritually pure, even though he separated from them more than a mil - his ritual purities remain pure. But if he said to them, "Go ahead and I will follow you," once his eyes are hidden from them - his ritual purities become impure.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: רֵישָׁא בִּמְטַהֵר חֲמָרָיו וּפוֹעֲלָיו לְכָךְ.
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause, Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: The first clause to one who purifies his donkey drivers and workers for this
llm_translation: What is the difference between the beginning and the end? Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said: The beginning is about purifying his donkey and his utensils, therefore.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, סֵיפָא נָמֵי! אֵין עַם הָאָרֶץ מַקְפִּיד עַל מַגַּע חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: If so, the latter clause also An am ha’aretz is not particular about the contact of his colleague,
llm_translation: If so, the latter clause is also true! An am ha'aretz does not take care regarding touching his fellow.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי! בְּבָא לָהֶם דֶּרֶךְ עֲקַלָּתוֹן.
human_translation: If so, the first also when he comes across them a circuitous path.
llm_translation: If so, the beginning is also! When it comes to them, it is a winding path.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, סֵיפָא נָמֵי! כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ ״לְכוּ וַאֲנִי אָבוֹא אַחֲרֵיכֶם״ — מִיסְמָךְ סָמְכָא דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: If so, the latter clause, too, Since he said to them: Go and I will follow behind you, they rely
llm_translation: If so, the latter clause also! Since he said to them, "Go, and I will come after you" - he relied on their reliance.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין
llm_translation: We will return to you, "we do not inquire."

hebrew_text: חוֹמֶר בַּקֹּדֶשׁ מִבִּתְרוּמָה, שֶׁמַּטְבִּילִין כֵּלִים בְּתוֹךְ כֵּלִים לִתְרוּמָה, אֲבָל לֹא לַקֹּדֶשׁ. אֲחוֹרַיִים וָתוֹךְ וּבֵית הַצְּבִיטָה בִּתְרוּמָה, אֲבָל לֹא בַּקֹּדֶשׁ.
human_translation: stringency with regard to sacrificial than with regard to teruma , that one may immerse vessels inside vessels for teruma ; but not for sacrificial the back and inside and place for gripping to teruma , but not to sacrificial
llm_translation: Material in the holy from the tithe, that one may immerse vessels within vessels for the tithe, but not for the holy. Behind, and inside, and the chamber of inspection for the tithe, but not for the holy.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת הַמִּדְרָס, נוֹשֵׂא אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה, אֲבָל לֹא אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ. בִּגְדֵי אוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה, מִדְרָס לַקֹּדֶשׁ.
human_translation: one who carries an object trodden may carry teruma but not sacrificial The garments of those who eat teruma with regard to sacrificial
llm_translation: The one who carries the platform, carries the contribution, but not the holy. The garments of those who eat the contribution, the platform is for the holy.

hebrew_text: לֹא כְּמִדַּת הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִדַּת הַתְּרוּמָה. שֶׁבַּקֹּדֶשׁ: מַתִּיר וּמְנַגֵּב וּמַטְבִּיל, וְאַחַר כָּךְ קוֹשֵׁר. וּבִתְרוּמָה: קוֹשֵׁר, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַטְבִּיל.
human_translation: The characteristics of teruma are not like the characteristics of sacrificial as in sacrificial he must untie and dry And he may immerse and afterward he may tie But with regard to teruma he may, tie and then immerse
llm_translation: Not like the measure of the Holy is the measure of the Terumah. In the Holy: one unties and separates and immerses, and afterwards ties. And in the Terumah: one ties, and afterwards immerses.

hebrew_text: כֵּלִים הַנִּגְמָרִים בְּטָהֳרָה, צְרִיכִין טְבִילָה לַקֹּדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לִתְרוּמָה. הַכְּלִי מְצָרֵף מַה שֶּׁבְּתוֹכוֹ לַקֹּדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לִתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Vessels completed in purity require immersion for sacrificial s, but not for teruma . A vessel combines that is in it to sacrificial but not to teruma ,
llm_translation: Vessels that are completed in purity, require immersion for holy use, but not for terumah. A vessel that contains something holy within it, requires immersion for holy use, but not for terumah.

hebrew_text: הָרְבִיעִי בַּקֹּדֶשׁ פָּסוּל, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי בִתְרוּמָה. וּבִתְרוּמָה, אִם נִטְמֵאת אַחַת מִיָּדָיו — חֲבֶירְתָּהּ טְהוֹרָה, וּבַקֹּדֶשׁ — מַטְבִּיל שְׁתֵּיהֶן, שֶׁהַיָּד מְטַמֵּא אֶת חֲבֶירְתָּהּ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ אֲבָל לֹא בִתְרוּמָה. אוֹכְלִין אוֹכָלִים נְגוּבִין בְּיָדַיִם מְסוֹאָבוֹת בִתְרוּמָה, אֲבָל לֹא בַּקֹּדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Sacrificial that is impure with fourth-degree is disqualified, Teruma is disqualified when it is impure with third-degree And with regard to teruma , if one of one’s hands became impure its counterpart, pure. But with regard to sacrificial he must immerse them both, as one hand renders its counterpart impure with regard to sacrificial but not with regard to teruma . One may eat dry foods, with impure hands when teruma , but not sacrificial
llm_translation: The fourth degree of impurity in the Holy offerings is disqualified, and the third degree of impurity in the Terumah offerings. And in the Terumah offerings, if one of his hands became impure, his fellow hand is pure, and in the Holy offerings, he immerses both of them, for one hand renders impure its fellow in the Holy offerings but not in the Terumah offerings. One may eat peeled produce with hands that are moist with Terumah, but not with the Holy offerings.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹנֵן וּמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים צְרִיכִין טְבִילָה לַקֹּדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לִתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: An acute mourner [ onen ], and one who is lacking atonement, require immersion to sacrificial However, not for teruma .
llm_translation: The mourner and the one lacking atonements require immersion for holiness, but not for terumah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אִילָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכְּבֵידוֹ שֶׁל כְּלִי חוֹצֵץ.
human_translation: With regard to sacrificial what is the reason not Rabbi Ila said: Because the weight of the vessel causes an interposition
llm_translation: Gemara: In the Holy of Holies, what is the reason for not entering? Rabbi Ila said: Because of the weight of the Kli Chotetz.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּסֵיפָא מִשּׁוּם חֲצִיצָה, רֵישָׁא לָאו מִשּׁוּם חֲצִיצָה! דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְלֹא כְּמִדַּת הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִדַּת הַתְּרוּמָה, שֶׁבַּקֹּדֶשׁ מַתִּיר וּמְנַגֵּיב וּמַטְבִּיל וְאַחַר כָּךְ קוֹשֵׁר, וּבַתְּרוּמָה קוֹשֵׁר וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַטְבִּיל!
human_translation: But is it not so that since the latter clause with regard to interposition, the first clause not with regard to interposition, As it teaches in the latter part The characteristics of teruma are not like the characteristics of sacrificial as in sacrificial he must untie and dry and he may immerse and afterward he may tie but with regard to teruma he may tie and then immerse
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection from the latter clause due to the issue of interposition, but the initial clause is not due to the issue of interposition! For it was taught in the latter clause: "And not like the measure of the Holy things is the measure of the heave-offering, for in the Holy things one unties, waves, immerses, and then ties, whereas in the heave-offering one ties and then immerses!"

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא מִשּׁוּם חֲצִיצָה, וּצְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן רֵישָׁא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּלְקֹדֶשׁ לָא — מִשּׁוּם כְּבֵידוֹ שֶׁל כְּלִי דְּאִיכָּא, אֲבָל סֵיפָא, דְּלֵיכָּא כְּבֵידוֹ שֶׁל כְּלִי — אֵימָא לְקֹדֶשׁ נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי חֲצִיצָה. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן סֵיפָא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּלְקֹדֶשׁ לָא, מִשּׁוּם
human_translation: the first clause and the latter clause due to interposition, and necessary For had taught us the first clause, I would have said this is the reason not for sacrificial Because there is the weight of vessel But the latter clause, where there is no weight of a vessel I will say it is not for sacrificial either. And had it taught us the latter clause I would have said this is the reason one may not for sacrificial Because
llm_translation: Beginning and end due to a partition, and it is necessary: for if we were to hear the beginning, I would say that the reason for the prohibition of transferring between domains is not because of the weight of the vessel, but rather because of the weight of the vessel that exists. But the end, where there is no weight of the vessel, I might say that it is not considered a partition for sacred purposes. And if we were to hear the end, I would say: the reason for the prohibition of transferring between domains is not because of

hebrew_text: דְּקִיטְרָא בְּמַיָּא אִהַדּוֹקֵי מִיהַדַּק, אֲבָל רֵישָׁא, דְּמַיָּא אַקְפּוֹיֵי מַקְפּוּ לֵיהּ לְמָנָא — לָא הָוְיָא חֲצִיצָה, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: that knots tighten in water, but the first clause where water causes the vessel to float it is not interposition. necessary
llm_translation: The incense in water, if it is crushed from being crushed, but the beginning, if water is poured on it, it is not considered a barrier, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אִילָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אִילָא אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: עֶשֶׂר מַעֲלוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן, חָמֵשׁ רִאשׁוֹנוֹת — בֵּין לַקֹּדֶשׁ, בֵּין לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקֹּדֶשׁ, אַחֲרוֹנוֹת — לַקֹּדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקֹּדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ila to his reasoning as Rabbi Ila said Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa said: They taught ten stringencies here first five both to the sacrificial to non-sacred that was prepared according to purity of sacrificial last to sacrificial but not to non-sacred that was prepared according to purity of sacrificial
llm_translation: Rabbi Ila according to his reasoning, as Rabbi Ila said, Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: Ten elevations they taught here, five initial ones — whether for the holy, or for the mundane that were done in the manner of the holy, and the latter ones — for the holy, but not for the mundane that were done in the manner of the holy.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא: חֲמֵשׁ קַמָּיָיתָא, דְּאִית לְהוּ דְּרָרָא דְטוּמְאָה מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן בֵּין לְקֹדֶשׁ בֵּין לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקֹּדֶשׁ, בָּתְרָיָיתָא, דְּלֵית לְהוּ דְּרָרָא דְטוּמְאָה מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן לְקֹדֶשׁ, לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקֹּדֶשׁ — לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: What is the reason first five which have a connection to impurity by Torah law the Sages decreed these both for sacrificial and for non-sacred prepared according to purity of sacrificial last which do not have a connection to impurity by Torah law, the Sages decreed these for sacrificial with regard to non-sacred made according to purity of sacrificial the Sages did not decree for
llm_translation: What is the reason? Five cubits, for it has the freedom of impurity from the Torah - the Rabbis decreed upon them, whether for matters of sanctity or for secular purposes, that were done in the manner of sanctity, they decreed upon them. But for matters that do not have the freedom of impurity from the Torah - the Rabbis did not decree upon them for matters of sanctity or for secular purposes.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מִדְּסֵיפָא הָוֵי מִשּׁוּם חֲצִיצָה, רֵישָׁא לָאו מִשּׁוּם חֲצִיצָה. וְרֵישָׁא, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁלֹּא יַטְבִּיל מְחָטִין וְצִינּוֹרוֹת בִּכְלִי שֶׁאֵין בְּפִיו כִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הַנּוֹד. כְּדִתְנַן: עֵירוּב מִקְווֹאוֹת, כִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הַנּוֹד, כְּעוֹבְיָהּ
human_translation: Rava said since the latter clause is due to the first clause is not due to interposition, And the first clause this is the reasoning: a decree that one not immerse needles and hooks, inside a vessel whose mouth the tube of a wineskin. as we learned The joining of ritual baths as the tube of a wineskin, thickness
llm_translation: Rava said: From the conclusion, it is considered a partition, but from the beginning, it is not considered a partition. And the beginning, that is the reason: a decree that one should not immerse reeds and pipes in a vessel that does not have a mouth like the reed mat of Nod. As we learned: its thickness is like the reed mat of Nod, like its thickness.

hebrew_text: וְכַחֲלָלָהּ, בִּשְׁתֵּי אֶצְבָּעוֹת חוֹזְרוֹת לִמְקוֹמָן.
human_translation: and its space, which is equivalent to two fingers going around in their place,
llm_translation: And as for its hollow, in two fingers it returns to its place.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּהָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן: שֵׁשׁ רִאשׁוֹנוֹת — בֵּין לַקּוֹדֶשׁ, בֵּין לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ. אַחֲרוֹנוֹת — לַקּוֹדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: holds in accordance with this that Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: They taught eleven stringencies here first six both to sacrificial to non-sacred that was prepared according to purity of sacrificial last to sacrificial but not to non-sacred that was prepared according to purity of sacrificial
llm_translation: He thought like that which Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Ten levels they enumerated here: six former ones — whether for the holy, or for the mundane, that were done in the purity of the holy. Latter ones — for the holy, but not for the mundane, that were done in the purity of the holy.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין דְּרָבָא לִדְרַבִּי אִילָא?
human_translation: What is there between of Rava, and of Rabbi Ila,
llm_translation: What is the difference between Rava and Rabbi Ila?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ סַל וְגַרְגוּתְנִי שֶׁמִּילְּאָן כֵּלִים וְהִטְבִּילָן. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם חֲצִיצָה — אִיכָּא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַטְבִּיל מְחָטִין וְצִינּוֹרִיּוֹת בִּכְלִי שֶׁאֵין בְּפִיו כִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הַנּוֹד — סַל וְגַרְגוּתְנִי שֶׁאֵין בְּפִיהֶן כִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הַנּוֹד, לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: The between them a basket or bin [ gargutni ] that one has filled vessels and immersed them According to the one who said due to interposition, there is according to the one who said due to decree lest one immerse needles and hooks inside a vessel whose mouth does not have the tube of a wineskin, there are no baskets and bins whose mouth does not have the tube of a wineskin,
llm_translation: There is a difference between them: a basket and a winepress that were filled and immersed. According to the one who says it is due to the issue of interposition - there is. According to the one who says it is due to the decree lest one immerse needles and tubes in a vessel that does not have an opening like the hole of a needle - a basket and a winepress that do not have an opening like the hole of a needle, there is not.

hebrew_text: רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: סַל וְגַרְגוּתְנִי שֶׁמִּילְּאָן כֵּלִים וְהִטְבִּילָן — טְהוֹרִין.
human_translation: And Rava follows his reasoning, as Rava said: A basket or bin that one has filled vessels and immersed them they are pure
llm_translation: Rava according to his reasoning, for Rava said: If a basket and a winepress were filled with utensils and they were immersed - they are pure.

hebrew_text: וּמִקְוֶה שֶׁחֲלָקוֹ בְּסַל וְגַרְגוּתְנִי — הַטּוֹבֵל שָׁם לֹא עָלְתָה לוֹ טְבִילָה. דְּהָא אַרְעָא כּוּלַּהּ חַלְחוֹלֵי מְחַלְחֲלָא, וּבָעֵינַן דְּאִיכָּא אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: And a ritual bath that one divided by a basket or bin, one immerses there, his immersion is ineffective for him. for the earth is entirely porous, and we require that there be forty se’a in one place.
llm_translation: "And a mikveh that his portion is in a basket and a winepress - one who immerses there, immersion has not taken place for him. For the entire ground is full of holes that are filled with water, and we require that there be forty se'ah in one place."

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּכְלִי טָהוֹר, אֲבָל בִּכְלִי טָמֵא, מִיגּוֹ דְּסָלְקָא טְבִילָה לְכוּלֵּיהּ גּוּפֵיהּ דְּמָנָא, סָלְקָא לְהוּ נָמֵי לְכֵלִים דְּאִית בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And this applies in a pure vessel, But in an impure vessel, since the immersion is effective for the whole of the vessel, it is also effective for vessels that are inside of it.
llm_translation: These are the matters in a pure vessel, but in an impure vessel, because it has emerged from immersion for all its body, it emerges for them for vessels that are within it.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: כֵּלִים שֶׁמִּילְּאָן כֵּלִים וְהִטְבִּילָן — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ טְהוֹרִין. וְאִם לֹא טָבַל, מַיִם הַמְעוֹרָבִים — עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מְעוֹרָבִין כִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הַנּוֹד. מַאי קָאָמַר וְאִם לֹא טָבַל? הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְאִם אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַטְבִּילוֹ, וּמַיִם הַמְעוֹרָבִין עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ מְעוֹרָבִין כִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הַנּוֹד.
human_translation: as we learned vessels that one filled with vessels and immersed them they are pure, And if he did not immerse, the joining of waters until they are joined like the tube of a wineskin. What is saying And if he did not immerse? This is what is saying: And if he has no need to immerse and water joined until is joined as the tube of a wineskin.
llm_translation: We have learned: vessels that were filled and immersed - these are pure. And if one did not immerse them, mixed water - until they become mixed like the foam of the Nod. What is it saying "And if one did not immerse"? It is saying: and if it does not require immersion, and mixed water until they become mixed like the foam of the Nod.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרָבָא וּדְרַבִּי אִילָא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: סַל וְגַרְגוּתְנִי שֶׁמִּילְּאָן כֵּלִים וְהִטְבִּילָן בֵּין לַקּוֹדֶשׁ בֵּין לַתְּרוּמָה, טְהוֹרִין. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: לַתְּרוּמָה אֲבָל לֹא לַקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: And this Rava and Rabbi Ila is tanna’im . As it is taught a basket or a bin that one filled vessels and immersed them, whether for sacrificial or for teruma , they are pure. Abba Shaul says: for teruma but not for sacrificial
llm_translation: This is what Rava and Rabbi Ila taught. As it was taught: If a basket and a winepress are vessels of the Gentiles, and they immersed them, whether for sacred use or for terumah, they are pure. Abba Shaul says: for terumah, but not for sacred use.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי! לְמַאן קָאָמְרִינַן — חֲבֵרִים, חֲבֵרִים מִידָּע יָדְעִי.
human_translation: If so, not teruma either. For whom do we say ḥaverim , ḥaverim know well,
llm_translation: Thus, it is said, "Terumah is significant!" To whom are we saying this? To colleagues, colleagues who are knowledgeable.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קוֹדֶשׁ נָמֵי! חָזֵי לֵיהּ עַם הָאָרֶץ וְאָזֵיל מַטְבִּיל.
human_translation: If so, sacrificial too, common person am ha’aretz see and go and immerse
llm_translation: If so, holy bread! See him, a people of the land, and I will go immerse.

hebrew_text: תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי, חָזֵי לֵיהּ עַם הָאָרֶץ וְאָזֵיל מַטְבִּיל! לָא מְקַבְּלִינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: teruma as well. an am ha’aretz see and go and immerse We do not accept from
llm_translation: Tractate: Trumah Text: The Gemara asks: If one sees an ignoramus who is meticulous in the mitzvah of immersion in a mikveh, should we accept testimony from him? (

hebrew_text: קוֹדֶשׁ נָמֵי, לָא נְקַבֵּיל מִינַּיְיהוּ! הָוְיָא לֵיהּ אֵיבָה.
human_translation: we should likewise not accept sacrificial from will have antagonism
llm_translation: "Holy bread, I do not accept from them! Let there be enmity."

hebrew_text: תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי, הָוְיָא לֵיהּ אֵיבָה! לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ, דְּאָזֵיל יָהֵיב לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן עַם הָאָרֶץ חַבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: teruma he will also have antagonism does not care as go give to an am ha’aretz priest his friend
llm_translation: Truma namei, havya lei evah! La ikpat lei, de'azil yahev lei lekohen am haaretz chavrei.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן תַּנָּא דְּחָיֵישׁ לְאֵיבָה — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִפְּנֵי מָה הַכֹּל נֶאֱמָנִין עַל טׇהֳרַת יַיִן וָשֶׁמֶן כׇּל יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הוֹלֵךְ וּבוֹנֶה בָּמָה לְעַצְמוֹ, וְשׂוֹרֵף פָּרָה אֲדוּמָּה לְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: And who is the tanna that is concerned for antagonism It is Rabbi Yosei, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei said: For what all trusted with regard to the purity of wine and oil throughout the year? so that each and every individual should not go off and build a altar for himself and burn a red heifer for himself.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is the Tanna that is concerned about enmity? — It is Rabbi Yosei. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei said: Why is everyone trusted regarding the purity of wine and oil throughout the year? In order that each and every one should not go and build an altar for himself, and offer a red heifer for himself." English translation: "And who is the Tanna that is concerned about enmity? — It is Rabbi Yosei. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei said: Why is everyone trusted regarding the purity of wine and oil throughout the year? In order that each and every one should not go and build an altar for himself, and offer a red heifer for himself."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּמַאן מְקַבְּלִינַן הָאִידָּנָא סָהֲדוּתָא מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ — כְּמַאן כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: In accordance with whose do we accept testimony nowadays from an am ha’aretz , In accordance with whom In accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
