llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In whose testimony do we accept the testimony of an am ha'aretz? Like the testimony of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וְנֵיחוּשׁ לִשְׁאֵלָה.
human_translation: But let us be concerned about borrowing
llm_translation: And Neichush to ask.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: כְּלִי חֶרֶס מַצִּיל עַל הַכֹּל, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מַצִּיל אֶלָּא עַל אוֹכָלִים וְעַל הַמַּשְׁקִים וְעַל כְּלֵי חֶרֶס.
human_translation: As we learned An earthenware vessel shields the statement of Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai say: It shields only food, drink, and earthenware vessels,
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: An earthenware vessel saves (from ritual impurity) in all cases, the words of Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai say: It only saves (from ritual impurity) with regard to food, drink, and earthenware vessels.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה? אָמְרוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא עַל גַּבֵּי עַם הָאָרֶץ, וְאֵין כְּלִי טָמֵא חוֹצֵץ. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל: וַהֲלֹא טִיהַרְתֶּם אוֹכָלִין וּמַשְׁקִין שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ! אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: כְּשֶׁטִּיהַרְנוּ אוֹכָלִין וּמַשְׁקִין שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ —
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: For what Beit Shammai said Because is impure on account of an am ha’aretz . And an impure vessel does not serve as a barrier Beit Hillel said to them: But didn’t you declare the food and drink inside pure? Beit Shammai said to them: When we declared the food and drink inside it to be pure,
llm_translation: They said to the House of Hillel in response to the House of Shammai: Why? The House of Shammai said: Because he is impure upon the common people, and an impure vessel does not nullify. The House of Hillel said to them: But have you not purified the food and drink within it? The House of Shammai said to them: When we have purified, the food and drink within it—

hebrew_text: לְעַצְמוֹ טִהַרְנוּ.
human_translation: we declared pure for himself,
llm_translation: "To its bone we have purified."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל נְטַהֵר אֶת הַכְּלִי, שֶׁטׇּהֳרָתוֹ לְךָ וָלוֹ?
human_translation: But can we purify a vessel whose purity for you and for him?
llm_translation: But he purifies the vessel, for its purification is for you and for him?

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: בּוֹשַׁנִי מִדִּבְרֵיכֶם, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי! אֶפְשָׁר אִשָּׁה לָשָׁה בַּעֲרֵיבָה — אִשָּׁה וַעֲרֵיבָה טְמֵאִין שִׁבְעָה, וּבָצֵק טָהוֹר? לוֹגִין מָלֵא מַשְׁקִין — לוֹגִין טָמֵא טוּמְאַת שִׁבְעָה, וּמַשְׁקִין טְהוֹרִין?!
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehoshua said: I am ashamed of your words, Beit Shammai, possible a woman kneading in a bowl, woman and the bowl are impure seven while dough is pure? a pitcher [ login ] full of liquid pitcher impure with impurity of seven while the liquids pure?
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua said, "Ashamed of your words, House of Shammai! Is it possible for a woman to have her period in the evening - the woman and the evening are both impure for seven days, but the dough is pure? A log full of liquids - the log is impure with the impurity of seven, but the liquids are pure?!"

hebrew_text: נִטְפַּל לוֹ תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד מִתַּלְמִידֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, אָמַר לוֹ: אוֹמַר לְךָ טַעְמָן שֶׁל בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. אָמַר לוֹ: אֱמוֹר. אָמַר לוֹ: כְּלִי טָמֵא — חוֹצֵץ אוֹ אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ? אָמַר לוֹ: אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ. כְּלִי שֶׁל עַם הָאָרֶץ — טָמֵא אוֹ טָהוֹר? אָמַר לוֹ: טָמֵא. וְאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״טָמֵא״, כְּלוּם מַשְׁגִּיחַ עָלֶיךָ? וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״טָמֵא״, אוֹמֵר לְךָ: ״שֶׁלִּי טָהוֹר וְשֶׁלְּךָ טָמֵא״.
human_translation: one student from among the students of Beit Shammai approached him said to him: I will tell you Beit Shammai’s reasoning. He said to him: Speak. He said to him: Does an impure vessel serve as a barrier or does it not serve as a barrier? said to him: It does not serve as a barrier. is a vessel of an am ha’aretz pure or impure? He said to him: Impure. And if you tell him is impure, will he pay attention to you at all? What is more, if you say to him impure, he will say to you: my is pure and yours is impure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one student from the students of Beit Shammai encountered him, he said to him: Tell me the reasoning of Beit Shammai. He said to him: Say. He said to him: Is a utensil that is impure - does it nullify or not? He said to him: It does not nullify. A utensil of an am ha'aretz - is it impure or pure? He said to him: It is impure. And if you say to him "impure," does he not pay attention to you? And not only that, but if you say to him "impure," he says to you: "Mine is pure and yours is impure."

hebrew_text: וְזֶהוּ טַעְמָן שֶׁל בֵּית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: And that is Beit Shammai’s reasoning:
llm_translation: And this is their reason of Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד הָלַךְ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְנִשְׁתַּטַּח עַל קִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, אָמַר: נַעֲנֵיתִי לָכֶם עַצְמוֹת בֵּית שַׁמַּאי! וּמָה סְתוּמוֹת שֶׁלָּכֶם כָּךְ, מְפוֹרָשׁוֹת — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. אָמְרוּ: כׇּל יָמָיו הוּשְׁחֲרוּ שִׁינָּיו מִפְּנֵי תַּעֲנִיּוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua immediately went and prostrated himself on the graves of Beit Shammai, said: I humble myself before you, bones of Beit Shammai. If such found in your unexplained, all the more so in your explained. said Throughout his days his teeth darkened because of his fasts
llm_translation: Immediately Rabbi Yehoshua went and prostrated himself upon the graves of Beit Shammai, saying: "I am appeased by you, bones of Beit Shammai! And your hidden teachings, so explicit — how much more so. They said: All his days, his teeth were blackened due to his fasts."

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת ״לְךָ וָלוֹ״, אַלְמָא שָׁאֲלִינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ! כִּי שָׁיְילִינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ מַטְבְּלִינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: In any event, teaches for you and for him. Apparently, we may borrow from For when we borrow from them we immerse them
llm_translation: The text states: "It teaches from there 'to you and to him,' implying that we inquire from them! When we inquire from them, we immerse for them."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נַיהְדְּרוּ לְהוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: כִּי שָׁאֲלִינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ מַטְבְּלִינַן לְהוּ! טְמֵא מֵת בָּעֵי הַזָּאָה שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי, וּמָנָא לְשִׁבְעָה יוֹמֵי לָא מוֹשְׁלִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: If so, let Beit Hillel respond to Beit Shammai. When we borrow from them we immerse them, And that which becomes impure by a corpse requires sprinkling third and seventh and people do not lend vessels for seven days.
llm_translation: Thus, they responded to Beit Hillel from Beit Shammai: "When we ask them, they immerse for them! A person who is ritually impure due to contact with a corpse requires sprinkling on the third and seventh days, and if he does not count seven days, people do not have authority."

hebrew_text: וְאַטְּבִילָה לָא מְהֵימְנִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: נֶאֱמָנִין עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ עַל טׇהֳרַת טְבִילַת טְמֵא מֵת!
human_translation: But are not trusted with regard to immersion? Isn’t it taught Amei ha’aretz are trusted with regard to the purification of immersion of that which has become impure by a corpse?
llm_translation: "And is immersion not trusted? And it was taught: The common people of the land are trusted regarding the purity of immersion of one who is impure due to contact with a corpse!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּגוּפוֹ, הָא בְּכֵלָיו. רָבָא אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּכֵלָיו, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאָמַר ״מֵעוֹלָם לֹא הִטְבַּלְתִּי כְּלִי בְּתוֹךְ כְּלִי״, וְהָא דְּאָמַר ״הִטְבַּלְתִּי, אֲבָל לֹא הִטְבַּלְתִּי בִּכְלִי שֶׁאֵין בְּפִיו כִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הַנּוֹד״.
human_translation: Abaye said not difficult. This to his body, this with his vessels. Rava said this and that, to vessels and it is not difficult. This who said: I never immersed one vessel inside another, And this who said: I have immersed but I did not immerse with a vessel whose mouth does not have the tube of a wineskin.
llm_translation: Abaye said, not difficult: here in his body, here in his vessels. Rava said: both in his vessels, and not difficult: this one who said, "I have never immersed a vessel within a vessel," and this one who said, "I have immersed, but I have not immersed in a vessel that does not have a rim like a weaver's shuttle."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: נֶאֱמָן עַם הָאָרֶץ לוֹמַר פֵּירוֹת לֹא הוּכְשְׁרוּ, אֲבָל אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן לוֹמַר פֵּירוֹת הוּכְשְׁרוּ אֲבָל לֹא נִטְמְאוּ.
human_translation: And so it was taught An am ha’aretz is trusted to say produce has not been made susceptible but he is not trusted to say produce has been made susceptible but has not become impure.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: A trustworthy Am Ha'aretz is believed to say that fruits were not tithed, but he is not believed to say that the fruits were tithed but not rendered impure.

hebrew_text: וְאַגּוּפוֹ מִי מְהֵימַן? וְהָתַנְיָא: חָבֵר שֶׁבָּא לְהַזּוֹת — מַזִּין עָלָיו מִיָּד, עַם הָאָרֶץ שֶׁבָּא לְהַזּוֹת — אֵין מַזִּין עָלָיו עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה בְּפָנֵינוּ שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי!
human_translation: And is trusted his body, Isn’t it taught a ḥaver who comes to be sprinkled they may sprinkle upon him immediately. But an am ha’aretz who comes they may not sprinkle upon him until he performs in our presence third and seventh
llm_translation: "And his body, who is trustworthy? And it was taught: A colleague who comes to sprinkle — one sprinkles upon him immediately, an am ha'aretz who comes to sprinkle — one does not sprinkle upon him until he performs in our presence the third and seventh."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִתּוֹךְ חוֹמֶר שֶׁהֶחְמַרְתָּ עָלָיו בִּתְחִילָּתוֹ, הֵקַלְתָּ עָלָיו בְּסוֹפוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said, Because of the stringency that you applied to in his beginning, you be lenient with him in his end,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: From the midst of the donkey that you burdened upon it in its beginning, you lightened upon it in its end.

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹרַיִם וָתוֹךְ. מַאי אֲחוֹרַיִם וָתוֹךְ?
human_translation: the back and inside What is The back and inside?
llm_translation: Achorayim vatoch. Ma'ai achorayim vatoch? Behind and inside. What is behind and inside?

hebrew_text: כְּדִתְנַן: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא אֲחוֹרָיו בְּמַשְׁקִין — אֲחוֹרָיו טְמֵאִין, תּוֹכוֹ, אוֹגְנוֹ, אׇזְנוֹ, וְיָדָיו — טְהוֹרִין. נִטְמָא תּוֹכוֹ — כּוּלּוֹ טָמֵא.
human_translation: As we learned A vessel whose back was defiled by liquid. Its back is impure, its inside, its rim, its ear-shaped handles, and its handles are pure. its inside was defiled, it is all impure.
llm_translation: As we have learned: A vessel that became impure on its inner surface with liquids - its inner surface is impure, but its interior, rim, handle, and its outer surface - are pure. If its interior became impure - the entire vessel is impure.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הַצְּבִיטָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי בֵּית הַצְּבִיטָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מָקוֹם שֶׁצּוֹבְטוֹ, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּצְבׇּט לָהּ קָלִי״. רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָקוֹם שֶׁנְּקִיֵּי הַדַּעַת צוֹבְעִין.
human_translation: And its place for gripping. What is Place for gripping [ beit hatzevita ]? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: place he pass [ tzovet ] And similarly it states: “And he pinched [ vayitzbat ] some parched corn for her” Rabbi Asi Rabbi Yoḥanan said: place that fastidious people dipping.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the house of the dyer, etc. What is the house of the dyer? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A place where they dye. And so it says: 'And he dyed a cloak for her.' Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A place where clear-minded individuals dye." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב בִּיבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים אֵין לָהֶם אֲחוֹרַיִם וָתוֹךְ, אֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְאֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי הַגְּבוּל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קׇדְשֵׁי הַגְּבוּל מַאי נִינְהוּ — תְּרוּמָה, וְהָתְנַן: אֲחוֹרַיִם וָתוֹךְ וּבֵית הַצְּבִיטָה לִתְרוּמָה!
human_translation: Rav Beivai taught before Rav Naḥman: No vessels have the back and inside, whether consecrated of the Temple or consecrated of outlying areas, said to him: What are these consecrated of outlying areas teruma , didn’t we learn the back and inside and its place for gripping to teruma ?
llm_translation: It was taught by Rav Beivi before Rav Nachman: All vessels have no backs or insides, whether they are holy vessels of the Temple or holy vessels of the border. He said to him: What are the holy vessels of the border? — It is the Terumah. And we learned: backs and insides and the chamber of inspection are for Terumah!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ קָאָמְרַתְּ.
human_translation: Perhaps you are speaking of non-sacred prepared according to the purity of sacrificial
llm_translation: Perhaps for mundane matters that were done in the manner of holiness she is saying.

hebrew_text: אַדְכַּרְתַּן מִילְּתָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן; שֵׁשׁ רִאשׁוֹנוֹת — בֵּין לַקּוֹדֶשׁ, בֵּין לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ, אַחֲרוֹנוֹת — לַקּוֹדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל טׇהֳרַת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: You have reminded me Rabba bar Avuh said They taught eleven stringencies here first six both to sacrificial and to non-sacred prepared according to the purity of sacrificial the last apply to sacrificial s but not to non-sacred prepared according to the purity of sacrificial
llm_translation: I will remember the matter that Rabba bar Avuh said: Eleven steps were established here; the first six — whether for the holy or for the mundane, that were done in the manner of the holy; the last five — for the holy, but not for the mundane that were done in the manner of the holy.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת הַמִּדְרָס — נוֹשֵׂא אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה, אֲבָל לֹא אֶת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ. קוֹדֶשׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מַעֲבִיר חָבִית שֶׁל יֵין קוֹדֶשׁ מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם,
human_translation: One who carries an object trodden carry teruma but not sacrificial sacrificial what is the reason not due to an incident that occurred. As Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: an incident involving someone who was transferring a barrel of sacrificial wine from one place to another,
llm_translation: The one who carries the midras - he carries the terumah, but not the kodesh. Kodesh, what is the reason why not? Because of an incident that occurred. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: There was an incident with someone who was transferring a barrel of holy wine from one place to another,

hebrew_text: וְנִפְסְקָה רְצוּעָה שֶׁל סַנְדָּלוֹ, וּנְטָלָהּ וְהִנִּיחָהּ עַל פִּי חָבִית, וְנָפְלָה לַאֲוִיר הֶחָבִית, וְנִטְמֵאת. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמְרוּ: הַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת הַמִּדְרָס — נוֹשֵׂא אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה, אֲבָל לֹא אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ.
human_translation: and the strap of his sandal, broke off, and he picked up and placed it on the mouth of barrel, and fell into the airspace of the barrel, rendering impure. At that time said one who carries an object that is impure by having been trodden may carry teruma but not sacrificial
llm_translation: And a strap of his sandal broke, and he removed it and placed it on the mouth of a barrel, and it fell into the air space of the barrel, and became impure. At that moment they said: One who carries the lintel - carries the heave offering, but not the holy.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי! הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לֹא אָסְרוּ אֶלָּא בַּיַּרְדֵּן וּבִסְפִינָה, וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: If so, teruma also, whose is this It is Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya, who said They prohibited only in the Jordan and in a boat, similar to the incident that occurred,
llm_translation: So it is, "Terumah is pleasant!" Here, it is taught — Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya said: They only prohibited immersion in the Jordan River and in a boat, as in the incident that occurred.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם מֵי חַטָּאת וְאֵפֶר חַטָּאת וְיַעֲבִירֵם בַּיַּרְדֵּן וּבִסְפִינָה, וְלֹא יַעֲמוֹד בְּצַד זֶה וְיִזְרְקֵם לְצַד אַחֵר, וְלֹא יְשִׁיטֵם עַל פְּנֵי הַמַּיִם, וְלֹא יִרְכַּב עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה, וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי חֲבֵירוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיוּ רַגְלָיו נוֹגְעוֹת בַּקַּרְקַע. אֲבָל מַעֲבִירָן עַל גַּבֵּי הַגֶּשֶׁר וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ; אֶחָד הַיַּרְדֵּן וְאֶחָד שְׁאָר הַנְּהָרוֹת. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָסְרוּ אֶלָּא בַּיַּרְדֵּן וּבִסְפִינָה, וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: What is that As it is taught A person may not carry the water of purification and the ashes of purification and transport them across the Jordan and on a boat. Nor may he stand on one side and throw them to the other side. Nor may he float them Nor may he riding on an animal or on his friend unless his feet are touching the ground But he may transfer them over a bridge without concern both the Jordan and other rivers. Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya says: prohibited only in the Jordan and in a boat, and like the incident that occurred.
llm_translation: What is it? For it was taught: A person should not carry the waters of the sin-offering and the ashes of the sin-offering and pass them over the Jordan and on a ship, and not stand on one side and throw them to the other side, and not pour them on the surface of the water, and not ride on the back of an animal, and not on the back of his fellow, unless his feet are touching the ground. But he may pass them over a bridge and need not be concerned; whether it is the Jordan or any other river. Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya says: They only prohibited carrying them over the Jordan and on a ship, as was the case.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה? דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מַעֲבִיר מֵי חַטָּאת וְאֵפֶר חַטָּאת בַּיַּרְדֵּן וּבִסְפִינָה וְנִמְצָא כְּזַיִת מֵת תָּחוּב בְּקַרְקָעִיתָהּ שֶׁל סְפִינָה. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמְרוּ: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם מֵי חַטָּאת וְאֵפֶר חַטָּאת וְיַעֲבִירֵם בַּיַּרְדֵּן בִּסְפִינָה.
human_translation: What incident that occurred? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: an incident involving a person who was transferring water of purification and ashes of purification in the Jordan, and on a boat, and an olive-bulk corpse was discovered stuck in the floor of the boat, At that time said: A person may not carry water of purification and ashes of purification and transport them across the Jordan, on a boat.
llm_translation: What was the incident that occurred? For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: There was an incident involving a certain man who was transporting the waters of purification and the ashes of the purification offering across the Jordan in a boat, and he was found to be like an olive, dead, lying in the bottom of the boat. At that moment they said: A person should not transport the waters of purification and the ashes of the purification offering and pass them across the Jordan in a boat.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: סַנְדָּל טָמֵא, סַנְדָּל טָהוֹר מַהוּ? חָבִית פְּתוּחָה, חָבִית סְתוּמָה מַהוּ? עָבַר וְנָשָׂא מַהוּ?
human_translation: dilemmas were raised before impure sandal. a pure sandal, what is an open barrel, a closed barrel, what is transgressed and carried what is
llm_translation: He asked them: A contaminated sandal, a pure sandal, what is it? An open barrel, a sealed barrel, what is it? He passed by and carried, what is it?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אִילָא אָמַר: אִם עָבַר וְנָשָׂא — טָמֵא. רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: עָבַר וְנָשָׂא — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ila said: If one transgressed and carried it is impure. Rabbi Zeira said: he transgressed and carried it is pure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ila said: If he passed and carried - impure. Rabbi Zeira said: If he passed and carried - pure.

hebrew_text: כֵּלִים הַנִּגְמָרִים בְּטָהֳרָה כּוּ׳. דְּגַמְרִינְהוּ מַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּגַמְרִינְהוּ חָבֵר, לְמָה לְהוּ טְבִילָה?
human_translation: Vessels that were completed in purity Who completed If we say that a ḥaver , completed them, why they immersion,
llm_translation: Finished vessels in purity, like. Who finished them? If you say their fellow, why immerse them?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּגַמְרִינְהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ — נִגְמָרִין בְּטׇהֳרָה קָרֵי לְהוּ? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לְעוֹלָם דְּגַמְרִינְהוּ חָבֵר, וּמִשּׁוּם צִינּוֹרָא דְּעַם הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Rather, that an am ha’aretz completed them. call these completed in purity? Rabba bar Sheila said Rav Mattana said Shmuel said: Actually, that a ḥaver completed, due to spittle of an am ha’aretz
llm_translation: Rather, when they have completed it with an 'am ha'aretz, is it called completion in purity? Rabba bar Sheilah said in the name of Rav Matnah who said in the name of Shmuel: One should always complete it with a colleague, and not with an 'am ha'aretz because of the 'am ha'aretz's ignorance.

hebrew_text: דִּנְפַל אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיגְמְרֵיהּ — הָא לָאו מָנָא הוּא. אֶלָּא בָּתַר דְּגַמְרֵיהּ — מִיזְהָר זְהִיר בֵּהּו! לְעוֹלָם מִקַּמֵּיהּ דְּגַמְרֵיהּ, וְדִלְמָא בְּעִידָּנָא דְּגַמְרֵיהּ עֲדַיִין לַחָה הִיא.
human_translation: When did fall If we say before he completed that it is not a vessel, Rather, after he completed it. he is careful about it. Actually, before he completed it, and perhaps at the moment when he completed was still moist,
llm_translation: When did it fall? If you say before he completed it - that is not so. Rather, after he completed it - be cautious with it! Always before he completed it, and perhaps at the time he completed it, it is still hot.

hebrew_text: טְבִילָה אִין, הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ לָא.
human_translation: Immersion, yes, the setting of the sun not,
llm_translation: Immersion no, the mixing of the sun is not.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּתְנַן: שְׁפוֹפֶרֶת שֶׁחֲתָכָהּ לְחַטָּאת, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִטְבּוֹל מִיָּד. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יְטַמֵּא וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִטְבּוֹל. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: דְּחַתְכַהּ מַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּחַתְכַהּ חָבֵר — לְמָה לִי טְבִילָה? וְאֶלָּא דְּחַתְכַהּ עַם הָאָרֶץ, בְּהָא לֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ יְטַמֵּא וְיִטְבּוֹל? הָא (טָמֵא וְקָאֵי)!
human_translation: the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. As we learned a tube which one cut for purification, Rabbi Eliezer says: He should immerse immediately; Rabbi Yehoshua says: He should render impure and after that immerse And we discussed Who cut If we say a ḥaver cut it, why do I immersion? Rather, cut it. in that case, would Rabbi Yehoshua say he should render impure and immerse Isn’t it already impure,
llm_translation: Mishnah: that not like Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned: a shofar that was cut for a sin-offering, Rabbi Eliezer says: it should be immersed immediately. Rabbi Yehoshua says: it should become impure and then be immersed. And we ask: who cut it? If you say that a colleague cut it - why do I need immersion? Rather, if an unlearned person cut it, in this case should we say that Rabbi Yehoshua says it should become impure and then be immersed? He is already impure and standing!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לְעוֹלָם דְּחַתְכַהּ חָבֵר, וּמִשּׁוּם צִינּוֹרָא דְּעַם הָאָרֶץ. דִּנְפַל אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיחְתְּכַהּ — הָא לָאו מָנָא הוּא, וְאֶלָּא בָּתַר דְּחַתְכַהּ — מִיזְהָר זְהִיר בַּהּ! לְעוֹלָם מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיחְתְּכַהּ, דִּלְמָא בְּעִידָּנָא דְּחַתְכַהּ עֲדַיִין לַחָה הִיא.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Sheila said Rav Mattana said Shmuel said: Actually, that a ḥaver cut it, and because spittle of an am ha’aretz When did fall If we say before he cut that it is not a vessel Rather, after he completed it. he is careful about it Actually before he cut it, and perhaps at the moment when he cut was still moist,
llm_translation: And Rabba bar Sheilah said in the name of Rav Matna who said in the name of Shmuel: Always cut it with a friend, and because of the ignorance of the common people. When should one be cautious? If you say before he cut it - that is not a concern, but rather after he cut it - be very cautious with it! Always before he cut it, for perhaps at the time he cut it, it is still moist.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הַיְינוּ דְּאִיכָּא הֶיכֵּירָא לְצַדּוּקִין.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehoshua it is that there is recognition to Sadducees,
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Yehoshua, that is to say, there was recognition for the Sadducees.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: מְטַמְּאִין הָיוּ אֶת הַכֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה, לְהוֹצִיא מִלִּבָּן שֶׁל צַדּוּקִין. שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: בִּמְעוֹרְבֵי שֶׁמֶשׁ הָיְתָה נַעֲשֵׂית.
human_translation: As we learned They would render impure the priest who burns the heifer, in order to counter the opinion of Sadducees, who used to say: was performed by those who had experienced sunset
llm_translation: We learned: They would make impure the priest who burned the cow, to remove from the hearts of the Sadducees. For they used to say: "It was made from the mixed sun."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּעָלְמָא בָּעֵינַן הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ, הַיְינוּ דְּאִיכָּא הֶיכֵּירָא לְצַדּוּקִין. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּעָלְמָא לָא בָּעֵינַן הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ — מַאי הֶיכֵּירָא לְצַדּוּקִין אִיכָּא?
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Eliezer, granted, if you say generally, the setting of the sun is required it is that there is recognition to Sadducees, But if you say generally the setting of the sun is not required what recognition to Sadducees is there
llm_translation: Rather, for Rabbi Eliezer, if you say "in general, we require the evening sun," that is because there is recognition for the Sadducees. But if you say "in general, we do not require the evening sun," what recognition is there for the Sadducees?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: Rav said:
llm_translation: Said Rav:

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂאוּהָ כִּטְמֵא שֶׁרֶץ.
human_translation: they treated as rendered impure creeping animal.
llm_translation: Do it like the impure creeping thing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לֹא תְּטַמֵּא אָדָם, אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: חוֹתְכָהּ וּמַטְבִּילָהּ — טָעוּן טְבִילָה! וְאֶלָּא: עֲשָׂאוּהָ כִּטְמֵא מֵת. אִי הָכִי תִּיבְעֵי הַזָּאַת שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי,
human_translation: However, if so, it should not render a person impure, Why, is it taught cuts and immerses requires immersion But rather, they treated it as made impure by a corpse, If that is so, should require the sprinkling third and seventh
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, a person shall not become impure. Why is it taught: "He cuts it and immerses it" - it requires immersion! But rather: They made it like one who is impure due to contact with a corpse. If so, this should be the third and seventh immersion.

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: חוֹתְכָהּ וּמַטְבִּילָהּ — טָעוּן טְבִילָה. טְבִילָה אִין, הַזָּאַת שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי לָא! אֶלָּא: עֲשָׂאוּהָ כִּטְמֵא מֵת בִּשְׁבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ,
human_translation: Why, is it taught cuts and immerses it requires immersion, immersion yes, sprinkling of the third and the seventh no. Rather, they treated it as made impure by a corpse in its seventh
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Why is it taught: If one cuts it and immerses it - it requires immersion. If it does not require immersion, this is the third and seventh day! Rather, they made it like one who is impure with the seventh day, his impurity.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא חִידְּשׁוּ דָּבָר בַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught never made any innovations with regard to the heifer
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: They never innovated anything regarding the cow.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֶׁלֹּא אָמְרוּ קוּרְדּוֹם מְטַמֵּא מוֹשָׁב. כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְהַיּוֹשֵׁב עַל הַכְּלִי״. יָכוֹל כָּפָה סְאָה וְיָשַׁב עָלֶיהָ, תַּרְקַב וְיָשַׁב עָלֶיהָ — יְהֵא טָמֵא,
human_translation: Abaye said: they did not say a spade can become impure as a seat. as it is taught “And he who sits on any object might turned over a se’a and sat on it, a tarkav , and sat on it, should be impure
llm_translation: Abaye said: They did not say that a Kurdum renders a seat unclean. As it was taught: "And the one who sits on the vessel." If one covered a se'ah and sat on it, or covered it with a cloth and sat on it - it shall be unclean.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַיּוֹשֵׁב עַל הַכְּלִי אֲשֶׁר יֵשֵׁב עָלָיו ... יִטְמָא״ — מִי שֶׁמְיוּחָד לִישִׁיבָה, יָצָא זֶה, שֶׁאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: עֲמוֹד וְנַעֲשֶׂה מְלַאכְתֵּנוּ.
human_translation: the verse states: “And he who sits on any object whereon sits…and be unclean that is designated for sitting, excluding such which we would say to Stand up, so we can do our work.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And the one who sits on the vessel that he sits on... shall be unclean" — one who is designated for sitting, this one has left, for they say to him: "Stand and let us do our work."

hebrew_text: הַכְּלִי מְצָרֵף מַה שֶּׁבְּתוֹכוֹ לַקֹּדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לַתְּרוּמָה. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כַּף אַחַת עֲשָׂרָה זָהָב מְלֵאָה קְטֹרֶת״, הַכָּתוּב עֲשָׂאוֹ לְכׇל מַה שֶּׁבַּכַּף — אַחַת.
human_translation: A vessel combines to sacrificial but not to teruma . From where are these matters Rabbi Ḥanin said: The verse states “One golden pan of ten shekels, full of incense” the verse treats everything inside the pan one
llm_translation: The vessel of smelting what is inside for the Holy, but not for the heave-offering. Whence these words? Rabbi Chanin said, as the verse states: "A single golden spoon full of incense," the Scripture made it for everything that is in the spoon - one.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב כָּהֲנָא: הוֹסִיף רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הַסֹּלֶת, וְהַקְּטֹרֶת, וְהַלְּבוֹנָה, וְהַגֶּחָלִים, שֶׁאִם נָגַע טְבוּל יוֹם בְּמִקְצָתוֹ — פָּסַל אֶת כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana raised an objection Rabbi Akiva added fine flour, incense, frankincense, and coals, that if one who immersed himself that day touched part all of are disqualified,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Akiva added the fine flour, the incense, the frankincense, and the coals, that if a tevul yom touched part of it - he invalidates the entire offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא. מִמַּאי, מִדְּקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: הֵעִיד רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן בְּתֵירָא עַל אֵפֶר חַטָּאת שֶׁנָּגַע הַטָּמֵא בְּמִקְצָתוֹ — שֶׁטִּימֵּא אֶת כּוּלּוֹ, וְקָתָנֵי: הוֹסִיף רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא!
human_translation: Isn’t this by rabbinic law? From where From that it teaches the first clause Rabbi Shimon ben Beteira testified with regard to ashes of purification that an impure touched part of it, it renders all of it impure. And it is taught Rabbi Akiva added,
llm_translation: And this that the Rabbis said, from where? From the fact that it is taught in the beginning: Rabbi Shimon ben Betzira testified concerning the ashes of the sin-offering that touched the impure person in part - that he renders the entire impure. And it is taught: Rabbi Akiva added!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא:
human_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Bar Kappara:
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish in the name of Bar Kappara:

hebrew_text: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לִשְׁיָרֵי מִנְחָה. דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, צָרִיךְ לִכְלִי — הַכְּלִי מְצָרְפוֹ, שֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ לִכְלִי — אֵין כְּלִי מְצָרְפוֹ.
human_translation: it is necessary only for the remainders of the meal-offering, by Torah law requires a vessel the vessel combine it that does not require a vessel, vessel does not combine it.
llm_translation: Not needed except for the remnants of the meal offering. According to the Torah, it requires a vessel - if the vessel is connected, then it requires a vessel; if the vessel is not connected, then it does not require a vessel.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן וּגְזַרוּ דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְלִי — כְּלִי מְצָרְפוֹ.
human_translation: And the Sages came and decreed that even if does not require a vessel, vessel combines it.
llm_translation: The sages came and decreed that even though it does not require a vessel - a vessel is necessary.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח סֹלֶת, קְטוֹרֶת וּלְבוֹנָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: כְּגוֹן שֶׁצְּבָרָן עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְטְבֻלָא. דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, יֵשׁ לוֹ תּוֹךְ — מְצָרֵף, אֵין לוֹ תּוֹךְ — אֵינוֹ מְצָרֵף, וַאֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן וְתַקִּינוּ דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאֵין לוֹ תּוֹךְ — מְצָרֵף.
human_translation: works out well flour, incense and frankincense, what is there to say? Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: For example, if he piled them up on a leather board [ kartavla ], By Torah law has an inside combines one that does not have an inside does not combine. And the Sages came and decreed that even if it does not have an inside it combines
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Regarding fine flour, incense, and frankincense, what can be said? Rav Nahman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: For example, when they are piled on a shovel. According to the Torah, if it has a hollow space - it combines; if it does not have a hollow space - it does not combine. And the Rabbis came and instituted that even if it does not have a hollow space - it combines."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי חָנִין אַדְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מֵעֵדוּתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נִשְׁנֵית מִשְׁנָה זוֹ.
human_translation: And of Rabbi Ḥanin’s, disagrees with of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba. For Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said This mishna was taught based on Rabbi Akiva’s testimony.
llm_translation: And the dispute of Rabbi Chaninah with Rabbi Chiya bar Abba. For Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The testimony of Rabbi Akiva was repeated from this Mishnah.

hebrew_text: הָרְבִיעִי בַּקֹּדֶשׁ פָּסוּל. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִנַּיִן לָרְבִיעִי בַּקֹּדֶשׁ שֶׁהוּא פָּסוּל — וְדִין הוּא: וּמָה מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים שֶׁמּוּתָּר בַּתְּרוּמָה — פָּסוּל בַּקֹּדֶשׁ, שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁפָּסוּל בַּתְּרוּמָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה רְבִיעִי לַקֹּדֶשׁ? וְלָמַדְנוּ שְׁלִישִׁי לַקֹּדֶשׁ מִן הַתּוֹרָה, וּרְבִיעִי בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: The fourth degree with regard to sacrificial disqualified. It is taught Rabbi Yosei said: From where to the fourth degree with regard to sacrificial is disqualified? It is a logical derivation, If one who is lacking atonement, who is permitted to teruma , disqualified with regard to sacrificial third which is disqualified teruma , is it not right that it should engender a fourth sacrificial we have learned third to sacrificial food from the Torah, and fourth from a fortiori
llm_translation: The fourth animal in the Holy Temple is disqualified. It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: From where do we know that the fourth animal in the Holy Temple is disqualified? It is a logical deduction: Just as an animal that lacks atonement is permitted in Terumah but disqualified in the Holy Temple, the third animal that is disqualified in Terumah - is it not logical that the fourth animal should be considered for the Holy Temple? And we have learned that the third animal is designated for the Holy Temple from the Torah, and the fourth animal by a fortiori reasoning.

hebrew_text: שְׁלִישִׁי לַקֹּדֶשׁ מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל״, מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דִּנְגַע בְּשֵׁנִי, וְקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל״. רְבִיעִי מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: third for sacrificial from the Torah. From where As it is written: “And the meat that touches any impure thing shall not be eaten” Is it not we are not dealing if it touched second And the Merciful One states “It shall not be eaten,” fourth by an a fortiori inference – as we said
llm_translation: Third for holiness from the Torah, from where? As it is written: "And the flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten." Who are we dealing with that touches a second time, and the Merciful One says, "shall not be eaten." Fourth from a fortiori reasoning - this that we said.

hebrew_text: וּבַתְּרוּמָה אִם נִטְמֵאת כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי: בְּחִיבּוּרִין שָׁנוּ, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בְּחִיבּוּרִין — לֹא.
human_translation: And with regard to teruma , if became impure Rav Sheizevi said: they taught when in contact But not in contact no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And in the case of Terumah if it became impure, so they said. Rav Sheizbi said: They taught in regards to mixtures, but not in regards to non-mixtures - no."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: יָד נְגוּבָה מְטַמָּא חֲבֶירְתָּהּ לְטַמֵּא לַקֹּדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לַתְּרוּמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לִפְסוֹל, אֲבָל לֹא לְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to a dry hand renders its counterpart, impure, to render impure to sacrificial but not to teruma . the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: disqualify but not render impure
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye said: A perforated hand defiles its counterpart to defile the holy things, but not for terumah, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: To disqualify, but not to defile.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא שֶׁלֹּא בְּחִיבּוּרִין — הַיְינוּ רְבוּתַיהּ דִּנְגוּבָה. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּחִיבּוּרִין — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בְּחִיבּוּרִין — לָא, מַאי רְבוּתָה דִּנְגוּבָה?
human_translation: Granted, if you say when it is not in contact this the noteworthiness of a dry But if you say in contact yes, when it is not in contact, no, what is the noteworthiness dry
llm_translation: If you say it is not in the joints - that is its saturation of the cavity. But if you say it is in the joints - yes, if not in the joints - no, what is the saturation of the cavity?

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא יָדוֹ,
human_translation: It was also stated Reish Lakish said: They taught only his hand,
llm_translation: It was stated similarly, Reish Lakish said: They only taught "his hand,"

hebrew_text: אֲבָל יַד חֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֶחָד יָדוֹ וְאֶחָד יַד חֲבֵירוֹ, בְּאוֹתָהּ הַיָּד. לִפְסוֹל, אֲבָל לֹא לְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: but not the hand of another. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: whether it is his hand or the hand of another, by the same hand to disqualify but not to render impure.
llm_translation: But the hand of his friend - no. And Rabbi Yochanan said: One his hand and one the hand of his friend, with the same hand. To disqualify, but not to render impure.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: שֶׁהַיָּד מְטַמְּאָה חֲבֶירְתָּהּ לַקֹּדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לַתְּרוּמָה. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, לְאֵתוֹיֵי יַד חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: From where From that it teaches a latter clause For one renders its counterpart, impure to sacrificial but not to teruma . Why do I need this as well? It was taught in the first clause Rather, not conclude from to include the hand of another
llm_translation: From what? - from the fact that it teaches in the latter clause: that the hand renders its fellow impure to holiness, but not to terumah. Why do I need it? - the first clause teaches it to him! Rather, not to learn from it, to exclude the hand of his fellow.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲדַר בֵּיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָה אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֶחָד יָדוֹ וְאֶחָד יַד חֲבֵירוֹ, בְּאוֹתָהּ הַיָּד, לִפְסוֹל אֲבָל לֹא לְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, too, retracted Rabbi Yona said Rabbi Ami said Reish Lakish said: whether it is his hand or the hand of another, by the same hand to disqualify but not to render impure.
llm_translation: And also Reish Lakish returned to it, as Rabbi Yonah said in the name of Rabbi Ammi who said Reish Lakish: One hand his and one hand of his fellow, with that hand, to disqualify but not to render impure.

hebrew_text: וְלִפְסוֹל אֲבָל לֹא לְטַמֵּא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הַפּוֹסֵל בִּתְרוּמָה — מְטַמֵּא יָדַיִם לִהְיוֹת שְׁנִיּוֹת, וְיָד מְטַמֵּא חֲבֶירְתָּהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יָדַיִם שְׁנִיּוֹת הֵן, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שֵׁנִי בַּחוּלִּין.
human_translation: And to disqualify but not to render impure, is tanna’im . As we learned Anything that disqualifies teruma renders the hands impure second And a hand renders its counterpart, impure; the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua. But the Rabbis say: Hands are second and second cannot impart with regard to non-sacred
llm_translation: And to disqualify, but not to render impure, it is a teaching. For we learned: Anyone who disqualifies with regard to terumah — he renders his hands impure to be secondary, and one hand renders its fellow impure, the words of Rabbi Yehoshua. And the sages say: The hands are considered secondary, and one secondary hand does not render another secondary hand impure in ordinary matters.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: שֵׁנִי הוּא דְּלָא עָבֵיד, הָא שְׁלִישִׁי עָבֵיד.
human_translation: What, is it not it is second that does not impart but third does impart
llm_translation: What is the reason that he does not do? Behold, the third one does.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לָא שֵׁנִי עָבֵיד וְלָא שְׁלִישִׁי.
human_translation: Perhaps not impart either the second or the third
llm_translation: Perhaps not two, he does, and not a third.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: יָד נְגוּבָה מְטַמָּא אֶת חֲבֶירְתָּהּ לְטַמֵּא בַּקֹּדֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לַתְּרוּמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אוֹתָהּ יָד לִפְסוֹל, אֲבָל לֹא לְטַמֵּא.
human_translation: Rather, like tanna’im , as it is taught a dry hand renders its counterpart, impure to render impure to sacrificial but not to teruma . the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: The hand disqualify but not render impure
llm_translation: Rather, as those scholars taught, as it was taught: A severed hand renders impure its counterpart to impart impurity in the Holy things, but not for Terumah, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: That hand disqualifies, but does not impart impurity.

hebrew_text: אוֹכְלִין אוֹכָלִים נְגוּבִין בְּיָדַיִם מְסוֹאָבוֹת כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס: וְכִי יֵשׁ נְגוּבָה לַקֹּדֶשׁ? וַהֲלֹא חִיבַּת הַקֹּדֶשׁ מַכְשַׁרְתָּן.
human_translation: One may eat dry foods, with impure hands It is taught Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus said: Now, is there dry to sacrificial Is it not so that the reverence to sacrificial renders it fit
llm_translation: "Eating, one may eat with hands that are soiled. It was taught: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus said: Is there any requirement for cleanliness in matters of holiness? Surely the obligation of holiness renders them fit."

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, כְּגוֹן שֶׁתָּחַב לוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו, אוֹ שֶׁתָּחַב הוּא לְעַצְמוֹ בְּכוּשׁ וּבְכַרְכֵּר, וּבִיקֵּשׁ לֶאֱכוֹל צְנוֹן וּבָצָל שֶׁל חוּלִּין עִמָּהֶן.
human_translation: No, necessary which, for example, his friend inserted into his mouth, or, which he inserted into his own by a spindle or whorl, And wishes to eat a non-sacred radish or onion along with them.
llm_translation: Not necessary, such as when his friend forced into his mouth, or he himself forced into his mouth with a spoon and a pitcher, and he sought to eat turnip and onion of non-sacred food with them.

hebrew_text: לְקֹדֶשׁ גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, לִתְרוּמָה לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: regarding sacrificial food the Sages enacted a decree against but in teruma the Sages did not enact a decree against it.
llm_translation: To sanctify, the Sages decreed upon it; for terumah, the Sages did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹנֵן וּמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא — כֵּיוָן דְּעַד הָאִידָּנָא הֲווֹ אֲסִירִי, אַצְרְכִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן טְבִילָה.
human_translation: An acute mourner and one who is lacking atonement What is the reason Since until now it was prohibited them the Sages required them immersion
llm_translation: Mourner and one lacking atonements, thus. What reason? Since until now they were prohibited, the Rabbis required immersion.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חוֹמֶר בַּתְּרוּמָה, שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה נֶאֱמָנִין עַל טׇהֳרַת יַיִן וָשֶׁמֶן כׇּל יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, וּבִשְׁעַת הַגִּיתּוֹת וְהַבַּדִּים — אַף עַל הַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: stringencies to teruma In Judea are trusted with regard to the purity of wine and oil all the days of the year. And during the period of the winepress and olive press, even with regard to teruma ,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: With regard to Terumah, the people of Judah are trusted concerning the purity of wine and oil all the days of the year, and during the times of the winepresses and the vats — even regarding Terumah.

hebrew_text: עָבְרוּ הַגִּיתּוֹת וְהַבַּדִּים, וְהֵבִיאוּ לוֹ חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה — לֹא יְקַבְּלֶנָּה מִמֶּנּוּ, אֲבָל מַנִּיחָהּ לַגַּת הַבָּאָה. וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ הִפְרַשְׁתִּי לְתוֹכָהּ רְבִיעִית קֹדֶשׁ — נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: the winepress and olive press have passed, brought to him, barrel of teruma wine, he may not accept it from them, But may leave it for the following winepress And if said to I separated into a quarter of sacrificial he is trusted
llm_translation: The winepresses and the vats passed by, and they brought to him a barrel of wine of terumah - he shall not accept it from them, but he leaves it for the vat that is coming. And if he said to him, "I have designated a quarter-log of it as holy" - he is believed.

hebrew_text: כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן
human_translation: jugs of wine and jugs of oil
llm_translation: The measure of wine and the measure of oil.

hebrew_text: הַמְדוּמָּעוֹת — נֶאֱמָנִין עֲלֵיהֶם בִּשְׁעַת הַגִּיתּוֹת וְהַבַּדִּים, וְקוֹדֶם לַגִּיתּוֹת שִׁבְעִים יוֹם.
human_translation: that are mingled, are trusted with regard to them during the period of the winepress and the olive press, and seventy days before the winepress,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Hamdu'ma'ot - ne'emanin aleihem bish'at hagitot vehabadim, ve'kodem lagitot shiv'im yom." Translation: "Suspected items - are trusted upon them at the time of the winepressing and the vat, and before the winepressing seventy days."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּיהוּדָה אִין, וּבַגָּלִיל לָא, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: In Judea, yes, but in the Galilee, no. What is the reason
llm_translation: Gemara: "Gemar b'Yehuda ein, u'baGalil la, mai ta'ama?" Translation: "It is complete in Judea, but not in the Galilee, what is the reason?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרְצוּעָה שֶׁל כּוּתִים מַפְסֶקֶת בֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: because a strip by Samaritans [ Kutim ] separates between
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Because of the sharpness of the Kutim, it separates between them.

hebrew_text: וְנֵיתֵיב בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל? הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֹהֶל זָרוּק — לָאו שְׁמֵיהּ אֹהֶל. דְּתַנְיָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְאֶרֶץ הָעַמִּים בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל, רַבִּי מְטַמֵּא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְטַהֵר.
human_translation: And let place in a box, a chest, or a closet, whose is this It is Rabbi who said: A thrown tent, is not called a tent, As it is taught one who enters a land of non-Jewish nations in a box, a chest, or a closet, Rabbi declares impure, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, declares pure.
llm_translation: And he sits in a box and a tower? This is what he teaches - Rabbi Hiya, for he said: A thrown tent - its name is not a tent. As it was taught: One who enters the land of the nations in a box and a tower, Rabbi declares impure, and Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda declares pure.

hebrew_text: וְלַיְיתוּהּ בִּכְלִי חֶרֶס הַמּוּקָּף צָמִיד פָּתִיל! אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, שׁוֹנִין: אֵין הַקֹּדֶשׁ נִיצּוֹל בְּצָמִיד פָּתִיל.
human_translation: And let them bring in an earthenware vessel sealed a tightly bound cover, Rabbi Eliezer said: taught Sacrificial not spared by a tightly bound cover.
llm_translation: "And they shall bring it in a clay vessel surrounded by a braided cord! Rabbi Eliezer said, we learn: The holiness is not removed by a braided cord."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין חַטָּאת נִיצֹּלֶת בְּצָמִיד פָּתִיל. מַאי לָאו: הָא קֹדֶשׁ נִיצּוֹל! לָא: הָא מַיִם שֶׁאֵינָן מְקוּדָּשִׁים נִיצּוֹלִין בְּצָמִיד פָּתִיל.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught purification is not spared by a tightly bound cover? What, is it not this sacrificial is spared No, this: Water that has not been consecrated is spared by a tightly bound cover,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: The sin-offering is not disqualified by a twisted wick. What is the reason? Is it not because the sacred items are disqualified! No, it is because non-sacred water is disqualified by a twisted wick.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא: חַבְרַיָּיא מְדַכַּן בְּגָלִילָא! מַנִּיחִין, לִכְשֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וִיטַהֲרֶנָּה.
human_translation: But didn’t Ulla say: Ḥaverim purify in the Galilee, leave and when Elijah comes purifies
llm_translation: And he said, Ulla: Havrayya medakkan begalila! We leave it, when Elijah comes and purifies it.

hebrew_text: וּבִשְׁעַת הַגִּיתּוֹת נֶאֱמָנִין אַף עַל הַתְּרוּמָה. וּרְמִינְהִי: הַגּוֹמֵר זֵיתָיו — יְשַׁיֵּיר קוּפָּה אַחַת וְיִתְּנֶנָּה לְעָנִי כֹּהֵן!
human_translation: And during the period of the winepress are trusted even with regard to teruma . And raises a contradiction who finishes his olives should leave over one sack and give it to a poor priest
llm_translation: And at the time of the olive harvest, they are trusted even regarding the terumah. And ask: One who finishes his olives - should leave one basket and give it to a poor priest!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּחָרְפֵי, הָא בְּאַפְלֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: כְּגוֹן מַאי? כְּאוֹתָן שֶׁל בֵּית אָבִיךָ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: not difficult. This to early, that to later, Rav Adda bar Ahava said to him: what for example? as those of your father’s house.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, it is not difficult: here in the light, here in the darkness. Rav Adda bar Ahava said to him: For example, what? Like those of your father's household.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: בְּגָלִילָא שָׁנוּ. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: עֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן וְהַגָּלִיל — הֲרֵי הֵן כִּיהוּדָה, נֶאֱמָנִין עַל הַיַּיִן בִּשְׁעַת הַיַּיִן וְעַל הַשֶּׁמֶן בִּשְׁעַת הַשֶּׁמֶן, אֲבָל לֹא עַל הַיַּיִן בִּשְׁעַת הַשֶּׁמֶן וְלֹא עַל הַשֶּׁמֶן בִּשְׁעַת הַיַּיִן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said was taught regard to the Galilee, Abaye raised an objection to him Transjordan and the Galilee are like Judea, they are trusted with regard to wine during the period of wine and with regard to oil during the period of oil However, not with regard to wine during the period of oil nor with regard to oil during the period of wine
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: In Galilee they have taught. Abaye raised an objection: Beyond the Jordan and in Galilee — they are like Judah, trustworthy regarding wine at the time of wine and regarding oil at the time of oil, but not regarding wine at the time of oil and not regarding oil at the time of wine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rather, it is clear as we answered initially,
llm_translation: Rather, Mechavvarta as we say from the outset.

hebrew_text: עָבְרוּ הַגִּיתּוֹת וְהַבַּדִּים וְהֵבִיאוּ לוֹ חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן — לֹא יְקַבְּלֶנָּה הֵימֶנּוּ, אֲבָל מַנִּיחָהּ לַגַּת הַבָּאָה. בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עָבַר וְקִיבְּלָהּ, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּנִּיחֶנָּה לַגַּת הַבָּאָה? אֲמַר לְהוּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ:
human_translation: the winepress and olive press have passed, brought to barrel of teruma wine, he may not accept it from them. But may leave it for the following winepress They raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: violated and did accept what is that he should leave it for the following winepress He said to him: You learned it
llm_translation: The baskets and the barrels passed by and brought him a barrel of wine - he should not accept it from them, but should leave it for the next vat. They asked Rav Sheshet: If he accepted it, what should he do with it? He said to them: Give it to him.

hebrew_text: חָבֵר וְעַם הָאָרֶץ שֶׁיָּרְשׁוּ אֶת אֲבִיהֶם עַם הָאָרֶץ, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: טוֹל אַתָּה חִטִּין שֶׁבְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי, וַאֲנִי חִטִּין שֶׁבְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי.
human_translation: a ḥaver and an am ha’aretz , who inherited their father, an am ha’aretz , can say to You take wheat that is in such and such a place and I wheat that is in such and such a place.
llm_translation: A scholar and an am ha'aretz who inherited from their father, an am ha'aretz, can say to him: "Take you the wheat that is in such and such a place, and I will take the wheat that is in such and such a place."

hebrew_text: טוֹל אַתָּה יַיִן שֶׁבְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי, וַאֲנִי יַיִן שֶׁבְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי.
human_translation: You take wine that is in such and such a place and I wine that is in such and such a place.
llm_translation: Take you wine that is in a certain place, and I wine that is in a certain place.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: טוֹל אַתָּה לַח וַאֲנִי יָבֵשׁ, טוֹל אַתָּה חִטִּין וַאֲנִי שְׂעוֹרִים.
human_translation: But may not say to You take wet and I dry You take wheat, and I barley.
llm_translation: However, one should not say to him: "You take the moist grain and I will take the dry grain, you take the wheat and I will take the barley."

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: אוֹתוֹ חָבֵר שׂוֹרֵף הַלַּח, וּמַנִּיחַ אֶת הַיָּבֵשׁ.
human_translation: And it is taught with regard to that ḥaver must burn the wet but he may leave the dry
llm_translation: And he taught about it: that same colleague burns the pitch, and places the dry wood.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? יַנִּיחֶנָּה לַגַּת הַבָּאָה! בַּדָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ גַּת. וְיַנִּיחֶנּוּ לָרֶגֶל! בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִשְׁתַּמֵּר לָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: Why Let him leave it over until the following winepress to something that does not have a winepress, And let him leave it for the pilgrimage Festival, to something that would not last until the pilgrimage Festival,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why? Let him place it in the pit that is coming! In a matter that has no pit. And let him place it at the foot! In a matter that does not last for the foot.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר הִפְרַשְׁתִּי לְתוֹכָהּ רְבִיעִית קֹדֶשׁ — נֶאֱמָן. תְּנַן הָתָם: מוֹדִין בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל שֶׁבּוֹדְקִין לְעוֹשֵׂי פֶסַח, וְאֵין בּוֹדְקִין לְאוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה.
human_translation: And if says I separated into a quarter of sacrificial he is deemed credible. We learned elsewhere Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that one may examine for those performing the paschal but one may not examine for those who eat teruma .
llm_translation: "And if he said, 'I have designated the fourth part of it as holy' - he is believed. We learned there: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that we inspect those who are preparing the Passover offering, but we do not inspect those who are eating terumah."

hebrew_text: מַאי בּוֹדְקִין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְנַפֵּחַ אָדָם בֵּית הַפְּרָס וְהוֹלֵךְ.
human_translation: What is One may examine? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: A person may blow a beit haperas and walk
llm_translation: What is "bodekin"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A person sweeps the house and goes.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא אָמַר: בֵּית הַפְּרָס שֶׁנִּדַּשׁ — טָהוֹר לְעוֹשֵׂי פֶסַח. לֹא הֶעֱמִידוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹם כָּרֵת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said in the name of Ulla: A beit haperas that has been trodden is pure for those who perform the paschal did not uphold their words in a place karet ;
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, whose name was Ulah, said: A Beit HaPeras that was sanctified is pure for those who make the Passover offering. Their words were not established in a place of excision.

hebrew_text: לְאוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה הֶעֱמִידוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶן בִּמְקוֹם מִיתָה.
human_translation: to those who eat teruma did uphold their words in a place death
llm_translation: For the eaters of terumah, they established their words in a place of death.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בָּדַק לְפִסְחוֹ, מַהוּ שֶׁיֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָתוֹ? עוּלָּא אָמַר: בָּדַק לְפִסְחוֹ — מוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָתוֹ. רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא אָמַר: בָּדַק לְפִסְחוֹ — אָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָתוֹ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one examined a for his paschal what is that he eat his teruma Ulla said: examined for his paschal he is permitted to eat his teruma , Rabba bar Ulla said: examined for his paschal is prohibited to eat his teruma .
llm_translation: He asked them: If one examined his Paschal lamb, what may he eat with his terumah? Ulla said: If he examined his Paschal lamb - he is permitted to eat with his terumah. Rabbah bar Ulla said: If he examined his Paschal lamb - he is forbidden to eat with his terumah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא: לָא תִּפְלוֹג עֲלֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא, דִּתְנַן כְּווֹתֵיהּ: וְאִם אָמַר הִפְרַשְׁתִּי לְתוֹכָהּ רְבִיעִית קֹדֶשׁ — נֶאֱמָן, אַלְמָא: מִדִּמְהֵימַן אַקֹּדֶשׁ מְהֵימַן נָמֵי אַתְּרוּמָה, הָכָא נָמֵי: מִדִּמְהֵימַן אַפֶּסַח, מְהֵימַן נָמֵי אַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: A certain older man said to Do not argue with Ulla, as we learned in accordance with his And if says I separated into a quarter- sacrificial he is deemed credible. Apparently, then, once is deemed credible sacrificial he is also deemed credible teruma Here too, once he is deemed credible paschal he is also deemed credible with regard to teruma .
llm_translation: He said to him, that elder: Do not argue with regard to the Omer offering, as we learned in its context: "And if one says, 'I have separated the fourth part of it as holy' - he is believed." This implies: Just as he is believed regarding the Omer offering, so too he is believed regarding Terumah. Here too, he is believed regarding the Paschal lamb, he is believed regarding Terumah.

hebrew_text: כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן כּוּ׳. תָּנָא: אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין לֹא עַל הַקַּנְקַנִּים וְלֹא עַל הַתְּרוּמָה. קַנְקַנִּים דְּמַאי? אִי קַנְקַנִּים דְּקֹדֶשׁ — מִיגּוֹ דִּמְהֵימַן אַקֹּדֶשׁ, מְהֵימַן נָמֵי אַקַּנְקַנִּים! אֶלָּא קַנְקַנִּים דִּתְרוּמָה — פְּשִׁיטָא, הַשְׁתָּא אַתְּרוּמָה לָא מְהֵימַן, אַקַּנְקַנִּים מְהֵימַן?
human_translation: jugs of wine and jugs of oil taught are not deemed credible, neither with regard to flasks nor with regard to teruma . Flasks of what? If flasks of sacrificial since is deemed credible sacrificial deemed credible flasks as well. Rather, flasks of teruma . is obvious: Now, is not deemed credible teruma deemed credible flasks
llm_translation: As much as wine and as much as oil. It was taught: We are not trusted neither with regard to the kanakin nor with regard to the terumah. What are the kanakin? If they are kanakin of the holy things — from the fact that I am trusted with regard to the holy things, I am trusted with regard to the kanakin! Rather, they are kanakin of terumah — it is obvious, now, if terumah is not trusted, are the kanakin trusted?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּרֵיקָנִים דְּקֹדֶשׁ וּבִשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, וּבִמְלֵאִין דִּתְרוּמָה וּבִשְׁעַת הַגִּיתּוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, to empty sacrificial during the rest of the days of the year, and to full of teruma during the period of the winepress,
llm_translation: Rather, in the emptying of the Holy and in the rest of the days of the year, and in the fullness of the Terumah, and at the time of the winepressings.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן הַמְדוּמָּעוֹת. מַאי לָאו, מְדוּמָּעוֹת דִּתְרוּמָה. אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מְדוּמָּעוֹת דְּקֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: We learned jugs of wine and jugs of oil that are mingled [ meduma ], What, is it not so that mingled of teruma In the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya they say mingled with sacrificial
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: The measure for wine and the measure for oil are similar. What is meant by "similar"? Similar to the measures of terumah. The House of Rabbi Hiyya said: Similar to the measures of the holy things.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא דִּימּוּעַ לְקֹדֶשׁ? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי אִלְעַאי: בִּמְטַהֵר אֶת טִבְלוֹ לִיטּוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ נְסָכִים.
human_translation: And does apply to sacrificial the school of Rabbi Elai they say with regard to one who is keeping his tevel , in purity, to take libations from it.
llm_translation: "And is there anyone who is disqualified for the priesthood? The House of Rabbi Elai said: When he purifies his immersion, he should remove libations from it."

hebrew_text: קוֹדֶם לַגִּיתּוֹת שִׁבְעִים יוֹם. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: דִּינָא הוּא דְּעִילָּוֵי אֲרִיסָא לְמִיטְרַח אַגּוּלְפֵי שִׁבְעִים יוֹמִין מִקַּמֵּי מַעְצַרְתָּא.
human_translation: seventy days before the winepress. Abaye said: learn from here, the law is that a tenant must make the effort flasks seventy days before the winepress,
llm_translation: Before the threshing floors seventy days. Abaye said, hear from it: it is a law that the tenant farmer must plow the fields seventy days before the festival.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִן הַמּוֹדִיעִים וְלִפְנִים נֶאֱמָנִין עַל כְּלֵי חֶרֶס. מִן הַמּוֹדִיעִים וְלַחוּץ — אֵין נֶאֱמָנִין. כֵּיצַד? הַקַּדָּר שֶׁהוּא מוֹכֵר הַקְּדֵרוֹת, נִכְנַס לִפְנִים מִן הַמּוֹדִיעִים, הוּא הַקַּדָּר וְהֵן הַקְּדֵרוֹת וְהֵן הַלּוֹקְחִין — נֶאֱמָן, יָצָא — אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: From Modi’im and inward are deemed credible with regard to earthenware vessels From Modi’im and outward, they are not deemed credible. How so? A potter who sells pots, entered within Modi’im the potter, and the pots, and the customers he is deemed credible. left he is no deemed credible.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: From those who are inside and trusted, one can be trusted regarding earthenware vessels. From those who are inside but outside, they cannot be trusted. How so? If a potter who sells pots enters among those who are inside, he is trusted - he is the potter, they are the pots, and they are the buyers. If he leaves, he is not trusted.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מוֹדִיעִים — פְּעָמִים כְּלִפְנִים, פְּעָמִים כְּלַחוּץ. כֵּיצַד? קַדָּר יוֹצֵא וְחָבֵר נִכְנָס — כְּלִפְנִים. שְׁנֵיהֶן נִכְנָסִין
human_translation: taught Modi’im there are times like inside there are times like outside How so? a potter is leaving and a ḥaver is entering like inside, both are entering
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: Modiyim - pe'amim k'lipnim, pe'amim k'lachutz. Keitzad? Kadar yotzei v'chaver nichnas - k'lipnim. Shneihem nichnasin." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught: They inform - sometimes inside, sometimes outside. How so? One pot goes out and another pot comes in - inside. Both of them go in."

hebrew_text: אוֹ שְׁנֵיהֶן יוֹצְאִין — כְּלַחוּץ.
human_translation: or both are leaving like outside
llm_translation: Or both of them go out - like outside.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הַקַּדָּר שֶׁמָּכַר אֶת הַקְּדֵירוֹת וְנִכְנַס לִפְנִים מִן הַמּוֹדִיעִים. טַעְמָא דְּלִפְנִים מִן הַמּוֹדִיעִים, הָא מוֹדִיעִים גּוּפַהּ — לָא מְהֵימַן. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: יָצָא — אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. הָא מוֹדִיעִים גּוּפָהּ — נֶאֱמָן. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כָּאן בְּקַדָּר יוֹצֵא וְחָבֵר נִכְנָס, כָּאן בְּשֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶן יוֹצְאִין אוֹ שְׁנֵיהֶן נִכְנָסִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: We, too, learn A potter who was selling pots and entered within the Modi’im the reason that inside Modi’im thus Modi’im itself he is not deemed credible. say the latter clause left he is not deemed credible, thus Modi’im itself he is deemed credible, Rather, not conclude from Here, to a potter leaving and a ḥaver entering, there, to where they are both leaving or both entering, learn from here
llm_translation: Abaye said, "We also learned: If a potter sells his pots and enters among the informers. The reason he entered among the informers is that the informers themselves — he does not trust. Say the latter part: If he leaves — he is not trusted. The informers themselves — he trusts. Rather, do not infer from this: Here, with a pot, one goes out and another comes in, here, with the six of them, either both go out or both come in. Infer from this."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: נֶאֱמָנִין בִּכְלֵי חֶרֶס הַדַּקִּין לַקּוֹדֶשׁ. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וְהוּא שֶׁנִּיטָּלִין בְּיָדוֹ אַחַת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁאֵין נִיטָּלִין בְּיָדוֹ אַחַת.
human_translation: taught are deemed credible with regard to small earthenware vessels, for sacrificial Reish Lakish said: It is that can be picked up in one hand, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even if they cannot be picked up in one hand,
llm_translation: Mishnah: We are trustworthy with earthenware vessels that are ground for sacred use. Reish Lakish said: And this is when they are taken in one hand. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if they are not taken in one hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא רֵיקָנִין, אֲבָל מְלֵאִין — לֹא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מְלֵאִים, וַאֲפִילּוּ אַפִּיקָרְסוּתוֹ לְתוֹכוֹ. וְאָמַר רָבָא: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּמַשְׁקִין עַצְמָן, שֶׁהֵן טְמֵאִין. וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ, שֶׁהֲרֵי לָגִין מָלֵא מַשְׁקִין — לָגִין טְמֵאִין טוּמְאַת שִׁבְעָה, וּמַשְׁקִין טְהוֹרִין.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said They taught only empty but full not And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even full, and even his garment [ apikarsuto ] is inside And Rava said: And Rabbi Yoḥanan concedes with regard to the liquids themselves that they are impure, And do not be perplexed for pitcher full of liquid pitcher is impure seven impurity, while the liquids pure.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: They only taught regarding empty ones, but regarding full ones — no. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if they are full, and even if a pickaxe is inside it. And Rava said: And Rabbi Yochanan concedes regarding the liquids themselves, that they are impure. And do not wonder, for regarding a winepress full of liquids — the liquids are impure with the impurity of seven, and the liquids themselves are pure.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַגַּבָּאִין שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לְתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, וְכֵן הַגַּנָּבִים שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּ אֶת הַכֵּלִים — נֶאֱמָנִין לוֹמַר: לֹא נָגַעְנוּ. וּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם נֶאֱמָנִין עַל הַקּוֹדֶשׁ, וּבִשְׁעַת הָרֶגֶל אַף עַל הַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: collectors who entered a house and similarly thieves who returned the vessels they are deemed credible when they say: We did not touch And in Jerusalem are deemed credible with regard to sacrificial and during a pilgrimage Festival even with regard to teruma .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The Gabba'im who entered into the house, and similarly the thieves who returned the vessels - they are believed to say: "We did not touch." And in Jerusalem, they are believed regarding the Holy things, and during the pilgrimage festival even regarding the Terumah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהִי: הַגַּבָּאִין שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לְתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת — הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ טָמֵא. לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִיכָּא גּוֹי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, הָא דְּלֵיכָּא גּוֹי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ. דִּתְנַן: אִם יֶשׁ גּוֹי עִמָּהֶן — נֶאֱמָנִין לוֹמַר ״לֹא נִכְנַסְנוּ״, אֲבָל אֵין נֶאֱמָנִים לוֹמַר ״נִכְנַסְנוּ אֲבָל לֹא נָגַעְנוּ״.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction collectors entered a house, the entire house is impure. not difficult, that where there is a gentile with them, this when there is no gentile with them, As we learned If there is a gentile with they are deemed credible to say: We did not enter but they are not deemed credible to say: We entered but did not touch
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara and it was asked: The Gabba'in who entered into the house - the entire house is impure. It is not difficult: where there is a non-Jew among them, where there is no non-Jew among them. As we learned: If there is a non-Jew with them - we trust him to say 'we did not enter,' but we do not trust him to say 'we entered but did not touch.'"

hebrew_text: וְכִי אִיכָּא גּוֹי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ מַאי הָוֵי? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, חַד אָמַר: אֵימַת גּוֹי עֲלֵיהֶן. וְחַד אָמַר: אֵימַת מַלְכוּת עֲלֵיהֶן. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ גּוֹי שֶׁאֵינוֹ חָשׁוּב.
human_translation: And when there is a gentile with them, what of it? Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar One said: The fear of the gentile, is upon them, And one said: The fear of the kingdom, is upon them, What is between them? The between them a gentile who is not important,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is there a non-Jew among them, what is the case? Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar, one said: When is a non-Jew considered with regard to them. And one said: When is a kingdom considered with regard to them. What is the difference between them? There is a non-Jew that is not significant.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הַגַּנָּבִים שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּ אֶת הַכֵּלִים. וּרְמִינְהִי: הַגַּנָּבִים שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לְתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת — אֵינוֹ טָמֵא אֶלָּא מְקוֹם דְּרִיסַת רַגְלֵי הַגַּנָּבִים. אָמַר רַב פִּנְחָס מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כְּשֶׁעָשׂוּ תְּשׁוּבָה. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּ אֶת הַכֵּלִים. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And similarly thieves who returned vessels And raises a contradiction the thieves who entered a house, only the place where the feet of the thieves had trodden is impure. Rav Pinḥas said in the name of Rav: where repented, is also precise, as it teaches: who returned vessels, learn from here
llm_translation: And so too the thieves who returned the vessels. And raise a contradiction: Thieves who entered into the house - he is not impure except the place where the thieves' feet tread. Rav Pinchas said in the name of Rav: When they did repentance. It is precisely stated, that they returned the vessels. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם נֶאֱמָנִין עַל הַקּוֹדֶשׁ. תָּנָא: נֶאֱמָנִין עַל כְּלֵי חֶרֶס גַּסִּין לַקּוֹדֶשׁ. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה — שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין כִּבְשׁוֹנוֹת בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: And in Jerusalem are deemed credible with regard to sacrificial taught They are deemed credible with regard to large earthenware vessels for sacrificial And why so much kilns may not be made in Jerusalem,
llm_translation: In Jerusalem, they are trusted regarding the Holy. It was taught: They are trusted regarding earthenware vessels for the Holy. And why all this? Because they do not make ovens in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: וּבִשְׁעַת הָרֶגֶל אַף עַל הַתְּרוּמָה. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיֵּאָסֵף כׇּל אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶל הָעִיר כְּאִישׁ אֶחָד חֲבֵרִים״, הַכָּתוּב עֲשָׂאָן כּוּלָּן חֲבֵרִים.
human_translation: And during a pilgrimage Festival even with regard to teruma . From where are these matters Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The verse states “And all the men of Israel gathered to the city, like one man, united [ ḥaverim ]” the Torah makes, all of them ḥaverim .
llm_translation: During the pilgrimage festival, even regarding the offering. What is the reasoning? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, as the verse states: "And all the men of Israel gathered to the city as one man, united." The Scripture made them all into companions.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפּוֹתֵחַ אֶת חָבִיתוֹ, וְהַמַּתְחִיל בְּעִיסָּתוֹ עַל גַּב הָרֶגֶל, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יִגְמוֹר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִגְמוֹר.
human_translation: one who opens his barrel and one who starts his dough during the time of the pilgrimage Festival, Rabbi Yehuda says: he may finish But the Rabbis say: He may not finish
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who opens his barrel, and one who begins kneading his dough on top of his foot, Rabbi Yehuda says: he should finish it, but the Sages say: he should not finish it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ יָתֵיב רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אַקִּילְעָא דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, פְּתַח חַד וַאֲמַר: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּנִּיחֶנָּה לְרֶגֶל אַחֵר?
human_translation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa were sitting in the courtyard of Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa. One of them opened and said: What is with regard to him leaving for another, pilgrimage Festival
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Yitzchak Napacha were sitting. Rabbi Yitzchak Napacha opened and said: What should one leave for another foot?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִידַּךְ: יַד הַכֹּל מְמַשְׁמְשִׁין בָּהּ וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ יַנִּיחֶנָּה לְרֶגֶל אַחֵר?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ עַד הָאִידָּנָא לָאו יַד הַכֹּל מְמַשְׁמְשִׁין בָּהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא עַד הָאִידָּנָא, טוּמְאַת עַם הָאָרֶץ בָּרֶגֶל רַחֲמָנָא טַהֲרַהּ, אֶלָּא הַשְׁתָּא טְמֵאָה הִיא.
human_translation: The other said to him: Everyone’s hand has touched it, and you are saying that he may leave it for another pilgrimage Festival He said to him: Is that to say until now, everyone’s hand was not touching it? He said to him: How can be compared? Granted, until now, the Merciful One declares pure the impurity of the am ha’aretz during the Festival, but now is impure.
llm_translation: He said to him: The other one said: The hand of all serves with it, and you say, will you leave it for another foot?! He said to him: Until now, is not the hand of all serving with it? He said to him: Is it so now?! Until now, the impurity of the common people, the Merciful One purifies it with the foot, but now it is impure.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי, דְּתָנֵי חֲדָא: יַנִּיחֶנָּה לְרֶגֶל אַחֵר, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא יַנִּיחֶנָּה לְרֶגֶל אַחֵר. מַאי לָאו תַּנָּאֵי הִיא?
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . For it is taught one He may leave it for another pilgrimage Festival And it was taught in a different He may not leave it for another Festival. What, is it not is tanna’im ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima k'tanna'ei, d'tanei chada: Yanicheinah l'regel acher, v'tanya idach: Lo yanicheinah l'regel acher. Mai lav tanna'ei hi?" English translation: "Say it is taught by some authorities, as one teaches: he may place it for another foot, and it is taught by others: he may not place it for another foot. What is the reason that it is not a teaching?"

hebrew_text: לָא, הָא דְּקָתָנֵי יַנִּיחֶנָּה — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי לֹא יַנִּיחֶנָּה — רַבָּנַן. וְתִסְבְּרָא? הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, יִגְמוֹר קָאָמַר?! אֶלָּא: הָא דְּקָתָנֵי לֹא יַנִּיחֶנָּה — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי יַנִּיחֶנָּה — רַבָּנַן. וּמַאי לֹא יַנִּיחֶנָּה — שֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ לְהַנִּיחָהּ.
human_translation: No, this which teaches he may leave it, Rabbi Yehuda, whereas that which teaches he may not leave it, the Rabbis, And you understand Didn’t Rabbi Yehuda say he may finish Rather, This which teaches he may not leave it, Rabbi Yehuda, whereas that which teaches he may leave it, the Rabbis. And what is He may not leave it that he has no need to leave it
llm_translation: Not so, as it was taught: "He shall leave it" - Rabbi Yehuda, and as it was taught: "He shall not leave it" - the Rabbis. And is it reasonable? Is Rabbi Yehuda contradicting himself?! Rather, as it was taught: "He shall not leave it" - Rabbi Yehuda, and as it was taught: "He shall leave it" - the Rabbis. And what does "He shall not leave it" mean? That there is no need to leave it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִשֶּׁעָבַר הָרֶגֶל — מַעֲבִירִין עַל טׇהֳרַת הָעֲזָרָה. עָבַר הָרֶגֶל לְיוֹם שִׁשִּׁי — לֹא הָיוּ מַעֲבִירִין, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא בְּיוֹם חֲמִישִׁי, שֶׁאֵין הַכֹּהֲנִים פְּנוּיִין.
human_translation: Once the pilgrimage Festival has passed by, pass the Temple courtyard purification, the Festival passed by into a Friday, they would not pass due to the honor of Shabbat, Rabbi Yehuda says: not even on Thursday, the priests are not free
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the festival has passed - they would remove the ashes from the Altar. If the festival passed on Friday - they would not remove the ashes, due to the honor of the Sabbath. Rabbi Yehuda says: Not even on Thursday, for the priests are not available.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: שֶׁאֵין הַכֹּהֲנִים פְּנוּיִין מִלְּהוֹצִיא בַּדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: taught as the priests are not free from removing the ashes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: she'ein ha-kohanim penuyin mi-lehotzi ba-deshen." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught: that the priests are not exempt from removing the ashes."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד מַעֲבִירִין עַל טׇהֳרַת עֲזָרָה? מַטְבִּילִין אֶת הַכֵּלִים שֶׁהָיוּ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְאוֹמְרִין לָהֶם: הִזָּהֲרוּ
human_translation: How do they pass courtyard purification? They immerse the vessels that were in the Temple. And they say to Be careful
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How do we transfer the sanctity of the altar? We immerse the vessels that were in the Temple, and we say to them: Be careful.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא תִּגְּעוּ בַּשֻּׁלְחָן.
human_translation: that you not touch the table
llm_translation: That you not touch the table.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים שֶׁהָיוּ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ יֵשׁ לָהֶם שְׁנִיִּים וּשְׁלִישִׁים, שֶׁאִם נִטְמְאוּ הָרִאשׁוֹנִים — יָבִיאוּ שְׁנִיִּים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן. כׇּל הַכֵּלִים שֶׁהָיוּ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ טְעוּנִין טְבִילָה, חוּץ מִמִּזְבַּח הַזָּהָב וּמִזְבַּח הַנְּחֹשֶׁת מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן כַּקַּרְקַע, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מְצוּפִּין.
human_translation: All the vessels that were in the Temple had second and third so that if the first ones became impure they could bring the second ones in their place. All the vessels that were in the Temple required immersion apart from the golden altar and the bronze altar, because they are like the ground the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: because they are coated.
llm_translation: All the vessels that were in the Temple have two and three, that if the first ones became impure — they shall bring two underneath them. All the vessels that were in the Temple require immersion, except for the golden altar and the copper altar because they are like the ground, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: because they are plated.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: הִזָּהֲרוּ שֶׁמָּא תִּגְּעוּ בַּשּׁוּלְחָן וּבַמְּנוֹרָה. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תָּנֵי מְנוֹרָה? שֻׁלְחָן כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״תָּמִיד״, מְנוֹרָה לָא כְּתִיב בַּהּ ״תָּמִיד״.
human_translation: taught Be careful lest you touch the table, or the candelabrum, And the tanna of our what is the reason he did not teach candelabrum With regard to the table it is written: always” with regard to the candelabrum it is not written “always,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: Hizaharu shema tiga'u bashulchan uvamanorah. Ve'tana didan, mai ta'ama la tanai manorah? Shulchan ketiv beh 'tamid', manorah la ketiv bah 'tamid'." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught: Be careful lest you touch the table and the menorah. And our Mishnah teaches, why does it not mention the menorah? Regarding the table, it is written with it 'continually,' but regarding the menorah, it is not written with it 'continually.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ: כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת הַמְּנוֹרָה נֹכַח הַשֻּׁלְחָן״, כְּמַאן דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״תָּמִיד״ דָּמֵי. וְאִידָּךְ: הָהוּא לִקְבּוֹעַ לָהּ מָקוֹם הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And the other Since it is written: “And and the candelabrum opposite the table” it is as though it is written “always” with regard to And the other That comes to establish a place for
