llm_translation: And the other opinion is: Since it is written: "And the menorah opposite the table," it is like the one written in it "continually." And the other opinion is: That verse is to establish for it a place where it comes.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לִי דִּכְלִי עֵץ הֶעָשׂוּי לְנַחַת הוּא, וְכׇל כְּלִי עֵץ הֶעָשׂוּי לְנַחַת לָא מְטַמֵּא. מַאי טַעְמָא — דּוּמְיָא דְשַׂק בָּעֵינַן: מָה שַׂק מִיטַּלְטֵל מָלֵא וְרֵיקָם — אַף כֹּל מִיטַּלְטֵל מָלֵא וְרֵיקָם!
human_translation: And let us derive it, because it is a wooden vessel designated to rest and any wooden vessel designated to rest cannot become impure. What is the reason we require to be similar to a sack Just as a sack is carried full and empty, so too any carried full and empty
llm_translation: "And it should emerge for me that a wooden vessel made for resting is it, and any wooden vessel made for resting does not render impure. What is the reason? — Because we require similarity to a sack: Just as a sack can be moved when full or empty, so too, all can be moved when full or empty!"

hebrew_text: הַאי נָמֵי מִיטַּלְטֵל מָלֵא וְרֵיקָם הוּא, כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן הַטָּהוֹר״, מִכְּלָל שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא.
human_translation: too is carried full and empty, in accordance with of Reish Lakish. For Reish Lakish said: What is which is written: upon the pure table” by inference that it is impure,
llm_translation: This movable object is full and empty, as Reish Lakish expounded. For Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written: "Upon the pure table"? This implies that it is impure.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? כְּלִי עֵץ הֶעָשׂוּי לְנַחַת הוּא, וְאֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה! אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמַּגְבִּיהִין אוֹתוֹ וּמַרְאִין בּוֹ לְעוֹלֵי רְגָלִים לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים, וְאוֹמְרִים לָהֶם: רְאוּ חִיבַּתְכֶם לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם, סִילּוּקוֹ כְּסִידּוּרוֹ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: נֵס גָּדוֹל נַעֲשָׂה בְּלֶחֶם הַפָּנִים, כְּסִידּוּרוֹ כָּךְ סִילּוּקוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָשׂוּם לֶחֶם חוֹם בְּיוֹם הִלָּקְחוֹ״.
human_translation: And why it is a wooden vessel designated to rest and not susceptible to impurity? Rather, teaches that they lift to display the shewbread to the pilgrims and they say to them: Behold your affection before God, it is removed as it was arranged As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A great miracle was performed with the shewbread: As its arrangement, so was its removal, as it is stated: “To place hot bread on the day when it was taken away”
llm_translation: And why is that? It is a wooden vessel made for resting, and it does not become impure! Rather, it teaches that they would lift it up and show it to the pilgrims of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, and say to them: "See your obligation before the Omnipresent, remove it as it was placed." As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A great miracle occurred with the showbread, as its removal was its arrangement, as it is stated: "To set out hot bread on the day it was taken away."

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לִי מִשּׁוּם צִיפּוּי. דְּהָתְנַן: הַשֻּׁלְחָן וְהַדּוּלְפְּקֵי שֶׁנִּפְחֲתוּ, אוֹ שֶׁחִיפָּן בְּשַׁיִישׁ, וְשִׁיֵּיר בָּהֶם מְקוֹם הַנָּחַת כּוֹסוֹת — טָמֵא. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מָקוֹם הַנָּחַת הַחֲתִיכוֹת.
human_translation: Let us derive due to coating. For didn’t we learn a table and a dulpaki that became broken off, or that one coated with marble, he left on them a place for placing cups, it susceptible to impurity Rabbi Yehuda says: place for placing pieces
llm_translation: And it shall emerge for me from the matter of anticipation. For it was taught: A table and hollowed-out stones that were chipped, or that were plastered with lime, and there remains in them the place for the resting of cups — they are unclean. Rabbi Yehuda says: The place for the resting of the pieces.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: שָׁאנֵי עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים דַּחֲשִׁיבִי וְלָא בָּטְלִי, הָנִיחָא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּכְלֵי אֶכְּסְלָגֵים הַבָּאִין מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, אֲבָל בִּכְלֵי מְסִמֵים — לָא בָּטְלִי, שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּכְלֵי מְסִמֵים נָמֵי בָּטְלִי, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And if you would say acacia wood, is different, as important, and is not nullified this works out well according to Reish Lakish, who said: They taught only with regard to vessels akhselag which comes from overseas, but masmi are not nullified fine, But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said: Even masmi vessels are also nullified what is there to say?
llm_translation: And if you will say: the difference is regarding cedar trees that are considered significant and not nullified, let it go according to Reish Lakish, for he said: They only did not differentiate except with regard to vessels of glassware that come from the land of the sea, but with vessels of earthenware - they are not nullified, that is good. But according to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: Even with vessels of earthenware, they are nullified, what can be said?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כָּאן בְּצִיפּוּי עוֹמֵד, כָּאן בְּצִיפּוּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד — הָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּצִיפּוּי עוֹמֵד, אוֹ בְּצִיפּוּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד? בְּחוֹפֶה אֶת לְבִזְבְּזָיו, אוֹ בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ חוֹפֶה אֶת לְבִזְבְּזָיו?
human_translation: And if you would say here of a fixed coating, there coating not fixed didn’t Reish Lakish inquire of Rabbi Yoḥanan: with a fixed coating or with a coating that is not fixed? with that covers the rim or with one that does not cover its rim?
llm_translation: And if you will say: Here in a case of standing tzippui, here in a case of non-standing tzippui - this, Reish Lakish asked Rabbi Yochanan: In a case of standing tzippui, or in a case of non-standing tzippui? Does one cover his excrement, or does he not cover his excrement?

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁנָא בְּצִיפּוּי עוֹמֵד וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּצִיפּוּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד, לָא שְׁנָא בְּחוֹפֶה אֶת לְבִזְבְּזָיו וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ חוֹפֶה אֶת לְבִזְבְּזָיו. אֶלָּא: שָׁאנֵי שֻׁלְחָן —
human_translation: said to him It is not different it is a fixed coating and it is not different it is a coating that is not fixed; it is not different covers rim and it is not different it does not cover its rim. Rather, table is different
llm_translation: And he said to him: It is not different whether it is a standing tzippui or a non-standing tzippui, it is not different whether he covers his excrement or does not cover his excrement. Rather, it is different regarding the table —

hebrew_text: דְּרַחֲמָנָא קַרְיֵיהּ ״עֵץ״, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַמִּזְבֵּחַ עֵץ שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת גָּבוֹהַּ וְאׇרְכּוֹ שְׁתַּיִם אַמּוֹת וּמִקְצֹעוֹתָיו לוֹ וְאׇרְכּוֹ וְקִירוֹתָיו עֵץ וַיְדַבֵּר אֵלַי זֶה הַשֻּׁלְחָן אֲשֶׁר לִפְנֵי ה׳״.
human_translation: because the Merciful One called it: “Wood,” as it is written “The altar, three cubits high, and its length two cubits, was of wood, and so its corners, its length, and its walls were also of wood, and he said to me: This is the table that is before the Lord”
llm_translation: The Merciful One calls it "wood," as it is written: "The altar is made of wood, three cubits high, and its length two cubits, and its corners, its base, and its walls are made of wood, and He said to me, 'This is the table that is before the Lord.'"

hebrew_text: פָּתַח בְּמִזְבֵּחַ וְסִיֵּים בְּשֻׁלְחָן! רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — מִזְבֵּחַ מְכַפֵּר עַל אָדָם, עַכְשָׁיו — שֻׁלְחָנוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מְכַפֵּר עָלָיו.
human_translation: began with the “altar” and ended with the “table,” Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say When the Temple is standing the altar atones for a person; now a person’s table atones for him,
llm_translation: He began with the altar and concluded with the table! Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish both said: When the Temple stood, the altar atoned for a person; now, a person's table atones for him.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ יֵשׁ לָהֶם שְׁנִיִּים כּוּ׳. מִזְבַּח הַנְּחוֹשֶׁת, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִזְבַּח אֲדָמָה תַּעֲשֶׂה לִּי״. מִזְבַּח הַזָּהָב, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַמְּנוֹרָה וְהַמִּזְבְּחוֹת״ — אִיתַּקּוּשׁ מִזְבְּחוֹת זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: All the vessels that were in the Temple had second etc. The bronze altar as it written “An altar of earth you shall make for Me” The golden altar as it is written: “The candelabrum and the altars” the altars are compared to each other,
llm_translation: All the vessels in the Temple have two designations. The copper altar, as it is written: "An altar of earth you shall make for Me." The golden altar, as it is written: "The menorah and the altars" - the altars are connected to one another.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מְצוּפִּין. אַדְּרַבָּה: כֵּיוָן דִּמְצוּפִּין נִינְהוּ — מִיטַּמְּאוּ! אֵימָא, וַחֲכָמִים: מְטַמְּאִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מְצוּפִּין.
human_translation: and the Rabbis say: because they are coated. On the contrary, since they are coated contract impurity, Say And the Rabbis declare to be susceptible to impurity, because they are coated.
llm_translation: The Sages say: because they are covered. On the contrary: since they are covered, they are impure! I would say, and the Sages: they are impure, because they are covered.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר קָאָמְרִי: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ, מִשּׁוּם דִּמְצוּפִּין —
human_translation: And if you wish, say the Rabbis were saying to Rabbi Eliezer: What is your reasoning because are coated
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The sages to Rabbi Eliezer are saying: What is your opinion, because they are hidden —

hebrew_text: מִיבְטָל בָּטֵיל צִפּוּיָין גַּבַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: their coating is nullified to them,
llm_translation: He ceased, they ceased, the anticipated ones ceased.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים אֵין אוּר שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶן, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִסָּלָמַנְדְּרָא: וּמָה סָלָמַנְדְּרָא שֶׁתּוֹלֶדֶת אֵשׁ הִיא — הַסָּךְ מִדָּמָהּ אֵין אוּר שׁוֹלֶטֶת בּוֹ, תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁכׇּל גּוּפָן אֵשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״הֲלוֹא כֹה דְבָרִי כָּאֵשׁ נְאֻם ה׳״ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Elazar said: fire of Gehenna has no power over Torah scholars. an a fortiori from the salamander [ salamandra ], If a salamander, which is a product of fire, one anoints with its blood, fire has no power over him, all the more so Torah scholars, whose entire bodies are fire, as it is written: “Surely My words are as fire, says the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: The students of the sages, the fire of Gehinnom does not have dominion over them. It is a fortiori from the case of Salmandra: And as for Salmandra, which gives birth to fire — if one pours water on it, the fire does not have dominion over it. The students of the sages, whose entire body is fire, as it is written: "Is not My word like fire, says the Lord" — how much more so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין אוּר שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם שׁוֹלֶטֶת בְּפוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִמִּזְבַּח הַזָּהָב: מָה מִזְבַּח הַזָּהָב שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו אֶלָּא כְּעוֹבִי דִּינַר זָהָב — כַּמָּה שָׁנִים אֵין הָאוּר שׁוֹלֶטֶת בּוֹ, פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁמְּלֵאִין מִצְוֹת כְּרִמּוֹן, דִּכְתִיב: ״כְּפֶלַח הָרִמּוֹן רַקָּתֵךְ״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״רַקָּתֵךְ״, אֶלָּא: רֵקָנִין שֶׁבָּךְ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: fire of Gehenna has no power over the sinners of Israel an a fortiori from the golden altar: If the golden altar, which on it no more than the thickness of a gold dinar, for many years fire has no power over it, all the more so the sinners of Israel, who are filled with good deeds as a pomegranate as it is written: “Your temples [ rakatekh ] are like a pomegranate split open” Do not read rakatekh , rather reikanin shebakh ,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: The fire of Gehinnom does not have dominion over the transgressors of Israel. A fortiori from the golden altar: Just as the golden altar, upon which there is only the thickness of a golden dinar, how many years does the fire not have dominion over it, so too the transgressors of Israel who fulfill mitzvot are like pomegranates, as it is written: "Your temples are like a slice of pomegranate." Do not read it as "your temples," rather as "your empty spaces" - how much more so.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ חוֹמֶר בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת חֲגִיגָה
llm_translation: We will return to you, material in holiness, and we will ascend to it, tractate Chagigah.
